original: @145a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @145a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya manydzu shr'i n'a ma sangg'i ti panytsi k'a /
analyzed: a'arya manydzu shr'i n'a ma sangg'i ti panytsi k'a /
translated: Ārya-mañjuśrī-nāma-saṃgīti-pañjikā

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i dka' 'grel /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i dka' 'grel /
translated: A Commentary on the Meaning of the Names of the Noble Mañjuśrī

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la gus pas phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la gus pas phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I respectfully pay homage to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta.

original: gang zhig rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i gzhi //
analyzed: gang zhig rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i gzhi //
translated: That which is the basis of self, other, and both,

original: gang 'di yin zhes brjod par nus min nyid //
analyzed: gang 'di yin zhes brjod par nus min nyid //
translated: Is itself incapable of being expressed as this is it.

original: 'ga' yis nges par shes rtogs rang bzhin phyir //
analyzed: 'ga' yis nges par shes rtogs rang bzhin phyir //
translated: Because it is the nature that is definitely realized by some,

original: gang de'i ched du de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gang de'i ched du de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: For their sake, I pay homage to that.

original: gang zhig srid pa gsum na zab mo brjod med chen por gyur pa bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: gang zhig srid pa gsum na zab mo brjod med chen por gyur pa bcom ldan 'das //
translated: The Bhagavān, who in the three existences is the great profound inexpressible,

original: bdag nyid gcig pu tshig ni rnam par 'byed par mdzad la gsal ba'i blo ldan pa //
analyzed: bdag nyid gcig pu tshig ni rnam par 'byed par mdzad la gsal ba'i blo ldan pa //
translated: Has a clear mind that distinguishes the single self-nature.

original: de bzhin 'dir yang ring nas goms shing gnas pa'i yid kyi mun pa mun nag dag / gzhom par bya dang bdag gi bsam pa skye med blo la gzung bar bya phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin 'dir yang ring nas goms shing gnas pa'i yid kyi mun pa mun nag dag / gzhom par bya dang bdag gi bsam pa skye med blo la gzung bar bya phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, here, in order to destroy the thick darkness of the mind that has long been habituated and in order to hold the unborn mind in my thought,

original: mtshan ni yang dag brjod pa yi //
analyzed: mtshan ni yang dag brjod pa yi //
translated: I will explain the meaning of the name of Mañjuśrī.

original: don rnams phal cher bsdus byas nas //
analyzed: don rnams phal cher bsdus byas nas //
translated: Having collected most of the meanings,

original: dbu ma la ni dga' ba yis //
analyzed: dbu ma la ni dga' ba yis //
translated: I, who delight in the Madhyamaka,

original: dka' 'grel nyung du 'di ni bri //
analyzed: dka' 'grel nyung du 'di ni bri //
translated: have written this brief commentary.

original: 'dir rigs kyi bu gang la la zhig gis gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mtshan bskal pa'am bskal pa las lhag par brjod la /
analyzed: 'dir rigs kyi bu gang la la zhig gis gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mtshan bskal pa'am bskal pa las lhag par brjod la /
translated: Here, if a son of good family were to recite the names of the Tathāgatas equal to the sands of the Ganges river for an eon or more than an eon,

original: dad pa'i rigs kyi bu gzhan zhig gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo zhes mtshan lan cig bzung na /
analyzed: dad pa'i rigs kyi bu gzhan zhig gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo zhes mtshan lan cig bzung na /
translated: and another son of good family with faith were to hold the name of Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, just once, saying Homage to Mañjuśrī, the youthful one,

original: 'dis ni snga ma las bsod nams ches mang du skyed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni snga ma las bsod nams ches mang du skyed do //
translated: this one would generate merit far greater than the former.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jam dpal ni de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yas pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jam dpal ni de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yas pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because Mañjuśrī has been the spiritual friend of limitless tathāgatas.

original: de yang 'jam dpal gyis sngon gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rim gyis sangs rgyas la gzhag pas sh'akya thub pas rab tu bsngags pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de yang 'jam dpal gyis sngon gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rim gyis sangs rgyas la gzhag pas sh'akya thub pas rab tu bsngags pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Moreover, Mañjuśrī has generated the mind of enlightenment in the presence of the bhagavat buddhas equal to the sands of the Ganges river, and has been praised by Śākyamuni for establishing the buddhas in the perfections of generosity and so forth.

original: la la dag ci 'di don ji lta ba nyid yin nam /
analyzed: la la dag ci 'di don ji lta ba nyid yin nam /
translated: Some will think, “Is this the way things really are?

original: yang na gus pa skyed pa'i phyir bstod par mdzad pa yin zhes rnam par rtog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na gus pa skyed pa'i phyir bstod par mdzad pa yin zhes rnam par rtog par 'gyur te /
translated: Or is it a praise made in order to generate respect?”

original: de bsal ba'i phyir phyag na rdo rjes de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba btab ste de yang dag par brjod @145b ba'i rnam pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir phyag na rdo rjes de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba btab ste de yang dag par brjod @145b ba'i rnam pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: In order to dispel that, Vajrapāṇi supplicated the tathāgatas, and he spoke the words of this praise:

original: de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
analyzed: de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
translated: Then the glorious Vajradhara

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so forth.

original: de lta bu ni re zhig pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni re zhig pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la'o //
translated: Such is the case for the Perfection Vehicle for the time being.

original: sngags kyi tshul la ni sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rgyud chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi le'ur dkyil 'khor pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par brjod pa'i rnam 'grel lo //
analyzed: sngags kyi tshul la ni sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rgyud chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi le'ur dkyil 'khor pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par brjod pa'i rnam 'grel lo //
translated: In the Mantra Vehicle, the differences in the meditative stabilizations of all the mandala deities are taught in the chapter on meditative stabilization in the Great Tantra of the Magical Net.

original: de'i 'og tu skabs rnyed pa dang / rje btsun 'jam dpal gyi ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu skabs rnyed pa dang / rje btsun 'jam dpal gyi ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to teach the essence of all the meditative stabilizations of the venerable Mañjuśrī by way of the Litany of the Names of Mañjuśrī,

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rjes de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba btab pa de gsungs pa ni /🔽de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rjes de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba btab pa de gsungs pa ni / de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
translated: the bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi supplicates the Tathāgata, and he teaches it.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It begins, “Then the glorious Vajradhara…”

original: de la dang po re zhig nyan pa po skye bo 'jug pa'i yan lag tu brjod bya la sogs pa nye bar bstan par bya'o //🔽ta th'a hi /
analyzed: de la dang po re zhig nyan pa po skye bo 'jug pa'i yan lag tu brjod bya la sogs pa nye bar bstan par bya'o //🔽ta th'a hi /
translated: In that regard, first of all, in order to engage the audience, the subject matter and so forth should be presented.

original: de la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan gyi rang bzhin mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i don gyi ngo bo nyid shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin rje btsun gsung gi dbang phyug ni brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan gyi rang bzhin mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i don gyi ngo bo nyid shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin rje btsun gsung gi dbang phyug ni brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: The subject matter is the nature of the qualities of all the buddhas, the meaning of the description of the perfect characteristics, the nature of the utterly pure expanse of reality, the nature of the exalted lord of speech.

original: de ston par byed pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i gzhung ni brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i gzhung ni brjod par bya ste /
translated: The text of the description of the perfect characteristics that teaches that is the subject matter.

original: de dag brjod bya dang rjod byed kyi mtshan nyid ni 'grel pa'o ;
analyzed: de dag brjod bya dang rjod byed kyi mtshan nyid ni 'grel pa'o ;
translated: The definition of those as subject matter and subject is the commentary.

original: / mtshan gyi don gang yang rung ba bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa na bdag nyid rje btsun 'jam dpal gyi gzugs su rdzogs par gyur pa ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: / mtshan gyi don gang yang rung ba bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa na bdag nyid rje btsun 'jam dpal gyi gzugs su rdzogs par gyur pa ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The purpose is that when one has perfected the meditation on any of the meanings of the characteristics, one’s own form becomes perfected as the exalted Mañjuśrī.

original: de grub nas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyis sprul pa'i 'od zer sna tshogs pas 'gro ba ma lus pa'i mi shes pa'i mun pa mun nag sel bar byed pa ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de grub nas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyis sprul pa'i 'od zer sna tshogs pas 'gro ba ma lus pa'i mi shes pa'i mun pa mun nag sel bar byed pa ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa'o //
translated: Having accomplished that, the ultimate purpose is that by means of the non-abiding nirvana itself, the darkness of ignorance of all transmigrating beings is dispelled by the various emanated light rays.

original: de la de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
analyzed: de la de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
translated: In that regard, then the glorious Vajradhara

original: spyan sngar 'dug ste 'di skad gsol //
analyzed: spyan sngar 'dug ste 'di skad gsol //
translated: sat in front and made this request:

original: zhes 'brel te me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes ni /
analyzed: zhes 'brel te me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes ni /
translated: The wisdoms of the mirror-like and so forth

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba dang nam mkha' mdzod dang dri ma med pa dang seng ge rnam par rol pa dang rdo rje lta bu ste /
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba dang nam mkha' mdzod dang dri ma med pa dang seng ge rnam par rol pa dang rdo rje lta bu ste /
translated: are the five samadhis of the Heroic Walk, the Sky Treasury, the Stainless, the Lion's Play, and the Vajra-like.

original: ting nge 'dzin lnga po gcig pa steng dang 'og tu rtse mo lnga pa'i rdo rje lag mthil du bzhag pa bzhin du mngon du mdzad par bstan te de de'i bdag nyid du 'dzin pas rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin lnga po gcig pa steng dang 'og tu rtse mo lnga pa'i rdo rje lag mthil du bzhag pa bzhin du mngon du mdzad par bstan te de de'i bdag nyid du 'dzin pas rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: They are one, like a five-pointed vajra placed in the palm of the hand, with the points above and below. This demonstrates their manifestation. Since they are apprehended as being of that nature, they are Vajradhara.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: sra zhing snying po khong stong med //
analyzed: sra zhing snying po khong stong med //
translated: Hard, with an essence, without hollowness,

original: mi chod mi byed mtshan nyid can //🔽bsreg tu med @146a * //
analyzed: mi chod mi byed mtshan nyid can // bsreg tu med @146a * //
translated: It has the characteristic of being indestructible and indivisible.🔽It is not burned,

original: cing gzhom du med //
analyzed: cing gzhom du med //
translated: and cannot be destroyed.

original: stong pa nyid ni rdo rjer brjod //🔽de bzhin rdo rje rdo rjer brjod //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni rdo rjer brjod // de bzhin rdo rje rdo rjer brjod //
translated: Emptiness is called the vajra.🔽Thus the vajra is called the vajra.

original: de bzhin rdo rje rdo rje zhes //
analyzed: de bzhin rdo rje rdo rje zhes //
translated: Thus the vajra is called the vajra.

original: rab gsungs rdo rje'i mtshan nyid nyon //
analyzed: rab gsungs rdo rje'i mtshan nyid nyon //
translated: Listen to the explanation of the characteristics of the vajra.

original: dag pa'i blo ni zla ba bzhin //
analyzed: dag pa'i blo ni zla ba bzhin //
translated: The pure mind is like the moon.

original: nam mkha' rdo rje zhes brjod bya //
analyzed: nam mkha' rdo rje zhes brjod bya //
translated: It is called the vajra of space.

original: zhes so // de la dag pa'i blo zhes pa ni don dam byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: zhes so // de la dag pa'i blo zhes pa ni don dam byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Here, the pure mind is the ultimate mind of enlightenment.

original: gzugs kyi skur dang chos kyi sku 'grub pa'i rgyu'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ni dpal te de de'i bdag nyid du yod pa gang yin pa de dpal ldan no //🔽shin tu gdug pa'i sems can la //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skur dang chos kyi sku 'grub pa'i rgyu'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ni dpal te de de'i bdag nyid du yod pa gang yin pa de dpal ldan no // shin tu gdug pa'i sems can la //
translated: The glorious accumulations of merit and wisdom that are the cause for attaining the form body and the truth body are the glory. The one who has that as his nature is glorious.🔽One should not apply peace

original: zhi ba nye bar mi sbyar te //
analyzed: zhi ba nye bar mi sbyar te //
translated: to very wicked sentient beings.

original: zhes pas snying rje chen po dang gcig pa nyid kyi gdul dka' ba dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa rnams la gnas pa dang 'bras bu la gnas par bya ba'i phyir rang gi dbang du byed cing 'dul bar byed pa ni gdul dka' ba 'dul ba po'o
analyzed: zhes pas snying rje chen po dang gcig pa nyid kyi gdul dka' ba dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa rnams la gnas pa dang 'bras bu la gnas par bya ba'i phyir rang gi dbang du byed cing 'dul bar byed pa ni gdul dka' ba 'dul ba po'o
translated: The one who tames the difficult to tame, such as Maheśvara, who are identical with great compassion, in order to place them in the state of abiding and the state of the result, and who brings them under his control and tames them, is the tamer of the difficult to tame.

original: // sred med kyi bu la sogs pa yang lha ma yin gdul dka' ba 'dul ba po yin yang de las phul du byung bas na mchog go //
analyzed: // sred med kyi bu la sogs pa yang lha ma yin gdul dka' ba 'dul ba po yin yang de las phul du byung bas na mchog go //
translated: Even Nārāyaṇa and so on are tamers of the difficult to tame asuras, but he is supreme because he is superior to them.

original: de 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i ngang tshul nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: de 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i ngang tshul nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'o //
translated: He is the conqueror of the three worlds because he has the nature of conquering the three worlds.

original: de nyid shin tu dpa' bas na dpa' bo ste mchog ces pa 'dir yang sbyar /
analyzed: de nyid shin tu dpa' bas na dpa' bo ste mchog ces pa 'dir yang sbyar /
translated: He is the hero because he is extremely brave; supreme is to be supplied here.

original: ji lta bu zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is that?

original: gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said, “secret,” and so on.

original: shin tu rnam bar dag pa gnyis su med pa'i snang ba dang dbyer med pa khams gsum pa'i rang bzhin gyi sku dang gsung dang thugs ni gsang par bshad de de'i gsal zhing 'bar ba'i phyir gsang ba'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam bar dag pa gnyis su med pa'i snang ba dang dbyer med pa khams gsum pa'i rang bzhin gyi sku dang gsung dang thugs ni gsang par bshad de de'i gsal zhing 'bar ba'i phyir gsang ba'i rgyal po'o //
translated: The body, speech, and mind natures of the three realms, inseparable from the appearance of the utterly pure non-dual, are explained as the secret, because of its shining and blazing.

original: gsang ba'i rgyal po'i rgyu gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsang ba'i rgyal po'i rgyu gsungs pa /
translated: The cause of the secret king is stated:

original: rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: vajra, etc.

original: rdo rje ni rdo rje'i rigs nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje ni rdo rje'i rigs nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: Vajra is the illustration of the vajra clan,

original: thugs kyi rigs zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: thugs kyi rigs zhes pa'i don to //
translated: meaning the mind clan.

original: de khyab bdag nyid kyi phyir rdo rje dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de khyab bdag nyid kyi phyir rdo rje dbang phyug go //
translated: Because of its being the lord of that, it is the vajra lord.

original: 'dis ni sku dang gsung gi rigs dag las thugs kyi rigs gtso bor mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni sku dang gsung gi rigs dag las thugs kyi rigs gtso bor mngon par brjod do //
translated: By this, the mind clan is expressed as the chief of the body and speech clans.

original: gzhan du gsang ba'i rgyal zhes pa gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po zhes bshad pa de mi 'thad do zhe na lan smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan du gsang ba'i rgyal zhes pa gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po zhes bshad pa de mi 'thad do zhe na lan smras pa /
translated: If it is said that elsewhere the secret king is explained as the yakṣa king, that is not correct.

original: gsang dbang zhes 'chad par 'gyur bar 'di nyid gnod sbyin gyi rigs kyi bdag po nyid du gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang dbang zhes 'chad par 'gyur bar 'di nyid gnod sbyin gyi rigs kyi bdag po nyid du gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The secret consecration is explained as this very [consecration], because it is clear that he is the lord of the Yakṣa clan.

original: rnam rgyal zhes pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: rnam rgyal zhes pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: The Victorious One, etc.,

original: rdo rje rtse mo rab 'phro ba //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse mo rab 'phro ba //
translated: up to the end of the verse, the tip of the vajra extended,

original: zhes pa'i mthar thug pas sgeg pa dang / khro bas 'dul bas 'dul ba'i sems can 'dul ba'i @146b thabs gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa'i mthar thug pas sgeg pa dang / khro bas 'dul bas 'dul ba'i sems can 'dul ba'i @146b thabs gsungs te /
translated: teaches the means of subduing sentient beings to be disciplined by means of the discipline of grace and wrath.

original: rnam rgyas padma dkar po ni chu skyes dkar po'o //
analyzed: rnam rgyas padma dkar po ni chu skyes dkar po'o //
translated: The expanded white lotus is the white water-born [lotus].

original: gang gi spyan de bzhin du yid du 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi spyan de bzhin du yid du 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because his eyes are just as pleasing.

original: padma rgyas 'dra'i zhal mnga' ba ni zhal gyi dkyil 'khor mtha' dag gang gi yin pa de dag bzhin du gsungs so //
analyzed: padma rgyas 'dra'i zhal mnga' ba ni zhal gyi dkyil 'khor mtha' dag gang gi yin pa de dag bzhin du gsungs so //
translated: The face with a fully opened lotus is the one whose entire face is just like that.

original: 'di yang spyan dang zhal rnam par rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yang spyan dang zhal rnam par rgyas pa ste /
translated: This also is the expansion of the eyes and face.

original: yang dag pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs pas nang gi dga' ba brnyes pa mtshon par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs pas nang gi dga' ba brnyes pa mtshon par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as indicating the attainment of inner joy through the realization of the true reality.

original: bya ba mnyam pas rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'khor rnams dang ldan pas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal nas zhes ston par byed pa la /
analyzed: bya ba mnyam pas rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'khor rnams dang ldan pas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal nas zhes ston par byed pa la /
translated: Having bowed to the Bhagavat, who is endowed with a retinue that is in accord with himself, by means of an action that is equal, the one who is the agent of teaching, the one who wields the nature of the vajra, etc.

original: gsor byed pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje 'dzin pas rang gi lag gis gsor byed pa ste /
analyzed: gsor byed pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje 'dzin pas rang gi lag gis gsor byed pa ste /
translated: The one who wields the nature of the vajra with his own hand wields the previously explained natural vajra.

original: gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyi dregs pa gzhom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyi dregs pa gzhom pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to conquer the pride of the beings to be tamed,

original: yang dang yang du gsor byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang du gsor byed pa'o //
translated: he wields it again and again.

original: de ltar rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'khor gyi khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'khor gyi khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: Having thus stated the special retinue that is in accord with himself,

original: khro gnyer zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: khro gnyer zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: he says, wrathful, etc.

original: khro gnyer rim par ldan la sogs //
analyzed: khro gnyer rim par ldan la sogs //
translated: Wrathful, with a frown, etc.

original: sogs pa gang rnams yin na 'dod pa dang dbyug sngon can dang stobs po che dang mi g-yo ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sogs pa gang rnams yin na 'dod pa dang dbyug sngon can dang stobs po che dang mi g-yo ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: What are the etc.? Desire, Nīladaṇḍa, Mahābala, Acalā, etc.

original: de rnams ni mtha' yas pa ste nam mkha' thams cad du khyab pa rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams ni mtha' yas pa ste nam mkha' thams cad du khyab pa rnams so //
translated: They are infinite, pervading the entire sky.

original: sems can la 'tshe ba'i gdug pa 'dul ba la shin tu dpa' ba nyid kyis 'jigs su rung ba dang mi sdug pa'i gzugs 'dzin pas na dpa' zhing 'jigs rung gzugs can dang ngo //
analyzed: sems can la 'tshe ba'i gdug pa 'dul ba la shin tu dpa' ba nyid kyis 'jigs su rung ba dang mi sdug pa'i gzugs 'dzin pas na dpa' zhing 'jigs rung gzugs can dang ngo //
translated: He is terrible and has an ugly form because he is very brave in subduing the wickedness that harms sentient beings.

original: rang gi lag gis gsor byed pa //
analyzed: rang gi lag gis gsor byed pa //
translated: He brandishes with his own hands.

original: zhes par rdo rje zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes par rdo rje zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: The word “vajra” is left out.

original: 'di yang tshig gnyis kyi dbye ba'i dbang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang tshig gnyis kyi dbye ba'i dbang du byed pa'o //
translated: This is also from the point of view of a division into two words.

original: rdo rje rtse mo rab 'phro ba //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse mo rab 'phro ba //
translated: The vajra-tips are extended.

original: zhes pa 'dis ni lag mthil na gnas pa'i rdo rje phreng ba mtha' yas pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis ni lag mthil na gnas pa'i rdo rje phreng ba mtha' yas pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows that the vajra garland that is located in the palm of the hand is infinite.

original: shes rab ni cho sa thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: shes rab ni cho sa thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: Wisdom is the pristine awareness that all phenomena are devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: thabs ni bden pa gnyis rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pas zhugs te mi g-yo bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: thabs ni bden pa gnyis rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pas zhugs te mi g-yo bar byed pa'o //
translated: Means is the entrance into the skill in discerning the two truths and making them stable.

original: snying rje chen po de yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can rnams la rkang gi khong nas madzdza ga t'a sdug bsngal dang de'i rgyu las kun du 'byin par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po de yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can rnams la rkang gi khong nas madzdza ga t'a sdug bsngal dang de'i rgyu las kun du 'byin par 'dod pa'o //
translated: And that great compassion is the bodhisattvas' desire to remove from sentient beings the suffering and its cause from the very marrow of their bones.

original: shes rab kyang yin la thabs kyang yin zhing snying rje chen po yang yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: shes rab kyang yin la thabs kyang yin zhing snying rje chen po yang yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: Wisdom is also a method, and great compassion is also a method, as the words are to be combined.

original: de rnams 'gro ba'i don byed pa'o //🔽yang na thabs ni snying rje chen po'o zhes tshig @147a * //
analyzed: de rnams 'gro ba'i don byed pa'o // yang na thabs ni snying rje chen po'o zhes tshig @147a * //
translated: They are the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.

original: gcig tu bya'o //
analyzed: gcig tu bya'o //
translated: Or else, the method is great compassion, as the words are to be combined.

original: de nyid mchog ste gtso bo'o //🔽dga' pa'i bsam pa ni rgyu'i 'bras bu'i khyad par dmigs pas so //
analyzed: de nyid mchog ste gtso bo'o // dga' pa'i bsam pa ni rgyu'i 'bras bu'i khyad par dmigs pas so //
translated: That is the supreme, the principal one.🔽The thought of joy is from observing the special cause and result.

original: mgu ba'i bsam pa ni rgyu'i 'bras bu'i khyad par nye bar dmigs pas na dga' mgu'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: mgu ba'i bsam pa ni rgyu'i 'bras bu'i khyad par nye bar dmigs pas na dga' mgu'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The thought of satisfaction is from observing the special cause and result.

original: rangs pa ni de gnyi ga rdzogs par mthong ngo //
analyzed: rangs pa ni de gnyi ga rdzogs par mthong ngo //
translated: Delight is from seeing both of those fulfilled.

original: khro bar byed pas khro bo ste /
analyzed: khro bar byed pas khro bo ste /
translated: The angry one is the angry one.

original: khro bo rnams lta bu'i lus dang gzugs ni 'jigs su rung ba'i lus kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: khro bo rnams lta bu'i lus dang gzugs ni 'jigs su rung ba'i lus kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The bodies and forms of the wrathful ones are the forms of bodies that are terrifying.

original: de gang la yod pa ni khro bo'i lus kyi gzugs ldan pa ste gdug pa 'dul bar byed pa'i don du khro bo'i lus kyi gzugs ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa ni khro bo'i lus kyi gzugs ldan pa ste gdug pa 'dul bar byed pa'i don du khro bo'i lus kyi gzugs ldan pa'o //
translated: He who has that is the one who has the form of a wrathful body, who has the form of a wrathful body for the purpose of subduing the wicked.

original: des ni khro bo rnams snying rje chen po'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des ni khro bo rnams snying rje chen po'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: By that, it is intended that the wrathful ones have the intention of great compassion.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That itself is stated:

original: sangs rgyas phrin las byed pa zhes pa ste thabs chen po nyid kyis sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba yang dag bar bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas phrin las byed pa zhes pa ste thabs chen po nyid kyis sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba yang dag bar bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The activity of the buddhas is the accomplishment of the benefit and happiness of sentient beings by means of great skillful means.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mgon no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mgon no //
translated: For that very reason, he is the protector.

original: lus btud rnams dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: lus btud rnams dang lhan cig tu //
translated: Together with those who bow their bodies,

original: mgon po bcom ldan de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: mgon po bcom ldan de bzhin gshegs //
translated: The protector, the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata,

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal te //
translated: Having bowed to the perfect Buddha,

original: thal mo sbyar ba byas gyur nas //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba byas gyur nas //
translated: Having joined palms,

original: 'di skad gsol zhes 'chad par byed pa la spyan sngar 'dug ste zhes pa ni gus pa ma yin pa spang ba'i don du logs dang rgyab tu 'dug pa lta bu ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di skad gsol zhes 'chad par byed pa la spyan sngar 'dug ste zhes pa ni gus pa ma yin pa spang ba'i don du logs dang rgyab tu 'dug pa lta bu ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase sitting in his presence means that one should not sit off to the side or behind him, in order to avoid disrespect.

original: ci zhig gsol zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci zhig gsol zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What did he request? The text says:

original: bdag la sman pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag la sman pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Please heal me, and so on.

original: bdag la sman pa dang bdag gi don du zhes tshig gnyis su drangs te de ni 'di dang phyi ma'i rnam par dag pa'i 'bras bu rdzogs pa'i don du gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag la sman pa dang bdag gi don du zhes tshig gnyis su drangs te de ni 'di dang phyi ma'i rnam par dag pa'i 'bras bu rdzogs pa'i don du gsungs so //
translated: The two phrases please heal me and for my benefit are cited here in order to explain the perfect result of purification in this life and the next.

original: thugs brtse'i phyir ni de ga nyig rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs brtse'i phyir ni de ga nyig rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase out of compassion means in order to perfect that.

original: sgyu 'phrul ni ma rig pas sprul pa'i khams gsum ba'i grong khyer te /
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul ni ma rig pas sprul pa'i khams gsum ba'i grong khyer te /
translated: The magical creation is the city of the three realms of existence, created by ignorance.

original: de nyid dmigs pa med par gcig pa'i phyir de la mngon du phyogs pa'i yang dag pa'i byang chub pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid dmigs pa med par gcig pa'i phyir de la mngon du phyogs pa'i yang dag pa'i byang chub pa ste /
translated: Since that is the same as the non-apprehension of objects, it is the perfect enlightenment that is directed toward that.

original: rnam pa thams cad pa chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi ye shes zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad pa chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi ye shes zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “the pristine wisdom of the emptiness of the nature of all phenomena” is the aspect of all aspects.

original: de nyid ces kyang bdag gis thob par 'gyur ba de ltar bdag la rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mtshan yang dag par brjod pa yang dag par bshad du gsol zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nyid ces kyang bdag gis thob par 'gyur ba de ltar bdag la rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mtshan yang dag par brjod pa yang dag par bshad du gsol zhes sbyar ro //
translated: “May I also attain that,” and “May the Tathāgata explain to me the recitation of the name of the perfect Buddha.”

original: de thob nas don ci zhig byed ce na gsungs pa mi shes zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de thob nas don ci zhig byed ce na gsungs pa mi shes zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Having attained that, what is the purpose? It is said, “the ignorant,” and so on.

original: mi shes 'dam du bying ba ni log pa'i shes pas zil gyis mnan pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes 'dam du bying ba ni log pa'i shes pas zil gyis mnan pa'o //
translated: “Sunk in the mud of ignorance” is overwhelmed by wrong knowledge.🔽Because of the very idea of the untrue and the true, the mind is disturbed by the afflictions.

original: de nyid mi bden @147b pa dang bden pa'i 'du shes nyid kyi phyir nyon mongs pas sems dkrugs pa rnams la phan pa'i phyir ro //🔽phan pa nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid mi bden @147b pa dang bden pa'i 'du shes nyid kyi phyir nyon mongs pas sems dkrugs pa rnams la phan pa'i phyir ro // phan pa nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The purpose is for the sake of benefit.

original: bla med 'bras bu thob bya'i phyir //
analyzed: bla med 'bras bu thob bya'i phyir //
translated: It is said, “For the sake of attaining the unsurpassed result.”

original: zhes pa sems can thams cad kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes 'brel lo //
analyzed: zhes pa sems can thams cad kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes 'brel lo //
translated: The connection is “for the sake of all sentient beings attaining perfect buddhahood.”

original: shes rab dang thabs kyis gzhan la phan pa ni yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyis gzhan la phan pa ni yang dag pa'o //
translated: The benefit to others through wisdom and means is authentic.

original: yang dag pa'i don khong du chud pa'i phyir rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don khong du chud pa'i phyir rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: And because he has realized the authentic meaning, he is the perfect Buddha.

original: de'i rgyu gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i rgyu gsungs pa /
translated: The cause of that is stated:

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la chos thams cad nges par 'byed par byed cing nyon mongs pa dang bdud la sogs pa sel bar byed pas shes rab ni bcom pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la chos thams cad nges par 'byed par byed cing nyon mongs pa dang bdud la sogs pa sel bar byed pas shes rab ni bcom pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One is the destroyer of all afflictions and demons, etc., through wisdom.

original: de de'i bdag nyid du yod pas bcom ldan no //
analyzed: de de'i bdag nyid du yod pas bcom ldan no //
translated: He is the Blessed One because he exists in that nature.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is also said:

original: shes rab nyon mongs gsod byed de //
analyzed: shes rab nyon mongs gsod byed de //
translated: Wisdom kills the afflictions,

original: de phyir shes rab bcom zhes brjod //
analyzed: de phyir shes rab bcom zhes brjod //
translated: and therefore wisdom is called the destroyer.

original: ces so // de nyid 'gro ba rjes su 'chos pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
analyzed: ces so // de nyid 'gro ba rjes su 'chos pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
translated: And because he trains beings, he is the teacher.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba'i bla ma'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba'i bla ma'o //
translated: Therefore, he is the guru of beings.

original: de'i yang rgyu gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i yang rgyu gsungs pa /
translated: The cause of that is stated:

original: dam tshig chen po de nyid mkhyen //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po de nyid mkhyen //
translated: He knows the great commitment, reality,

original: dbang po bsam pa rig pa mchog / ces pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po bsam pa rig pa mchog / ces pa ste /
translated: the supreme awareness of the faculties and thoughts.

original: de la / dkyil 'khor nges pa dus dang brda //
analyzed: de la / dkyil 'khor nges pa dus dang brda //
translated: The commitment is the mandala, the time, and the sign.

original: sngags dang phyag rgya lha rnams dang // grub mtha' rnams la dam tshig ces //
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya lha rnams dang // grub mtha' rnams la dam tshig ces //
translated: and the philosophical systems are called “commitments”

original: rgyal ba rnams kyis bshad pa yin //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyis bshad pa yin //
translated: by the Victorious Ones.

original: zhes pa 'di ni dam tshig thams cad kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa 'di ni dam tshig thams cad kyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: This is the reality of all commitments.

original: dbang po rnams dang bsam pa rnams yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po rnams dang bsam pa rnams yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of knowing the faculties and the intentions,

original: dam tshig chen po'i de nyad mkhyen //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po'i de nyad mkhyen //
translated: he knows the reality of the great commitment.

original: dbang po bsam pa rig pa yang ngo //
analyzed: dbang po bsam pa rig pa yang ngo //
translated: He also knows the faculties and the intentions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mchog de thams cad kyi phyogs 'gro ba rjes su mchod pa'i bla ma zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mchog de thams cad kyi phyogs 'gro ba rjes su mchod pa'i bla ma zhes pa'i don to //
translated: For that very reason, he is the supreme one who goes in all directions, the guru who is to be worshipped.

original: dbang po rnams ni dad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni dad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The faculties are faith and so forth.

original: bsam pa rnams ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa rnams ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The intentions are the desires.

original: su'i mtshan yang dag par brjod ce na gsungs pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: su'i mtshan yang dag par brjod ce na gsungs pa / bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Whose name-mantra is to be recited? It is said:🔽The wisdom body of the Victorious Ones,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes kyi sku ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyi sku nyid de 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes kyi sku ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyi sku nyid de 'jam dpal lo //
translated: The wisdom body of the Victorious Ones, the transcendent conquerors, is Mañjuśrī.

original: de'i rang bzhin yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is its nature.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: bde gshegs shes rab dri ma med //
analyzed: bde gshegs shes rab dri ma med //
translated: The Sugata's wisdom is stainless,

original: rdo rje rnon por de bshad do //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rdo rje rnon por de bshad do // zhes gsungs so //
translated: and is explained as the sharp vajra.

original: de nyid thams cad las 'phags pa'i phyir gtsug tor chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid thams cad las 'phags pa'i phyir gtsug tor chen po'o //
translated: Because it is superior to all others, it is the great uṣṇīṣa.

original: chig gi bdag ni tshig gi dbang phyug ste /🔽khams gsum pa'i sems can thams cad kyi ngag thams cad la rab @148a * //
analyzed: chig gi bdag ni tshig gi dbang phyug ste / khams gsum pa'i sems can thams cad kyi ngag thams cad la rab @148a * //
translated: The lord of speech is the master of speech,🔽who is the lord of all speech of all sentient beings in the three realms,

original: tu 'jug pa'i mnga' bdag ces ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: tu 'jug pa'i mnga' bdag ces ba'i bar ro //
translated: up to the lord of all speech.

original: 'jam pa ni yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'jam pa ni yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: Smooth means pleasing.

original: dpal ni sems can thams cad rjes su 'dzin pa'i zab pa dang rgya che ba'i tshul gyi sku dang gsung dang thugs phun sum tshogs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dpal ni sems can thams cad rjes su 'dzin pa'i zab pa dang rgya che ba'i tshul gyi sku dang gsung dang thugs phun sum tshogs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Glory is the perfection of body, speech, and mind of the profound and vast method of caring for all sentient beings.

original: de ye shes kyang yin la sems dpa' yang yin par zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ye shes kyang yin la sems dpa' yang yin par zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: That is wisdom and also a hero, as the words are combined.

original: rnam par spyad pa na phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir ye shes kho na gang gi sku yin pa de ni ye shes sku'o //
analyzed: rnam par spyad pa na phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir ye shes kho na gang gi sku yin pa de ni ye shes sku'o //
translated: When one practices, it is the body of that which is only intuition, because there is no external object.

original: de phyi rol gyi don du dmigs pa las ma skyes pas rang byung ngo //
analyzed: de phyi rol gyi don du dmigs pa las ma skyes pas rang byung ngo //
translated: It is self-arisen, because it is not born from the apprehension of an external object.

original: lha'i rnam pa phyag rgya chen po ni ye shes kyi sku yin la /
analyzed: lha'i rnam pa phyag rgya chen po ni ye shes kyi sku yin la /
translated: The great seal of the form of the deity is the body of intuition.

original: de'i thugs ka'i mtshan ma'i nang du gnas pa ni ye shes sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni gnyis po'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de'i thugs ka'i mtshan ma'i nang du gnas pa ni ye shes sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni gnyis po'i khyad par ro //
translated: The one abiding within the sign at the heart of that is called the intuition being.

original: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa la ni khyad par med do //
analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa la ni khyad par med do //
translated: There is no difference in the Litany of Names.

original: don zab ces pa la sogs pa la don zab ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don zab ces pa la sogs pa la don zab ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As for profound meaning, etc., the profound meaning is emptiness, etc., because it teaches emptiness, etc.

original: don rgya che ba ni sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rgya chen po'i rang bzhin longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don rgya che ba ni sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rgya chen po'i rang bzhin longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The extensive meaning is the complete enjoyment body, which is the nature of extensive buddha qualities, because it manifests them.

original: don chen ni zab pa dang rgya che ba'i bdag nyid can kun du bzang po'i rang bzhin mngon par rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don chen ni zab pa dang rgya che ba'i bdag nyid can kun du bzang po'i rang bzhin mngon par rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is of great import because it expresses the nature of Samantabhadra, which is profound and extensive.

original: de'i phyir mtshungs med ni mnyam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshungs med ni mnyam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is incomparable because it is unequaled.

original: zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is peaceful because it reveals the path to nirvana.

original: thog mar dge ba ni nyan thos kyi byang chub kyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thog mar dge ba ni nyan thos kyi byang chub kyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is virtuous in the beginning because it is the cause of the enlightenment of the śrāvakas.

original: bar du dge ba ni rang byang chub kyi rgyu'i lam rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar du dge ba ni rang byang chub kyi rgyu'i lam rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is virtuous in the middle because it illuminates the path that is the cause of the enlightenment of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: tha mar dge ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mar dge ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is virtuous in the end because it causes the attainment of perfect enlightenment.

original: yang na thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i dbye bas thog ma bar dang mthar dge'o //
analyzed: yang na thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i dbye bas thog ma bar dang mthar dge'o //
translated: Or, it is virtuous in the beginning, middle, and end because of the divisions of hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad las phul du byung bas mchog go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad las phul du byung bas mchog go //
translated: Therefore, it is supreme because it is the best of all.

original: mtshan mngon par brjod pa chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig la sogs pa'i dbye bas yang dag pa phyin ci ma log par brjod pas na yang dag par brjod pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan mngon par brjod pa chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig la sogs pa'i dbye bas yang dag pa phyin ci ma log par brjod pas na yang dag par brjod pa ste /
translated: Since it is the perfect, unerring expression of the Dharma, the meaning, the etymological definitions, and so forth, it is called the perfect expression.

original: de rab tu gsal bar mdzad du gsol lo //
analyzed: de rab tu gsal bar mdzad du gsol lo //
translated: Please make it very clear!

original: nges par rab tu gsal ba nyid du mdzad par rig par gsungs pa 'das pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nges par rab tu gsal ba nyid du mdzad par rig par gsungs pa 'das pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: In order to make it definitely very clear, it is said the one who is taught by the Tathagatas of the three times...

original: dus gsum pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i yul du gyur pa nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa khyod kyis kyang rtag tu ston par mdzad dgos te /
analyzed: dus gsum pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i yul du gyur pa nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa khyod kyis kyang rtag tu ston par mdzad dgos te /
translated: Since it is the object of the teachings of the Tathagatas of the three times, it is necessary for you, the Tathagata, to always teach it as well.

original: chos ston pas 'gro ba'i don bya @148b ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: chos ston pas 'gro ba'i don bya @148b ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes dgongs so //
translated: The purpose of beings is the result of the Tathagata's teaching of the Dharma, he thinks.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ba' zhig gis gsungs pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa sgyu 'phrul zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ba' zhig gis gsungs pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa sgyu 'phrul zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is not only taught by the Tathagatas alone, he says the one who is taught by the Tathagatas of the three times...

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po de bzhin gshegs pa skyes pa po rnams kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po de bzhin gshegs pa skyes pa po rnams kyis kyang ngo //
translated: The great Vajradhara, the Tathagata, the one who creates, also.

original: 'dir sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rgyud stong phrag bcu drug par yang dag par glur blangs pa de rab tu bshad du gsol zhes 'brel lo //
analyzed: 'dir sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rgyud stong phrag bcu drug par yang dag par glur blangs pa de rab tu bshad du gsol zhes 'brel lo //
translated: Here, in the 16,000 chapter of the Net of Illusion Tantra, the perfect song is requested to be explained.

original: bstan pa'i 'bras bu gsungs pa /
analyzed: bstan pa'i 'bras bu gsungs pa /
translated: The result of the teaching is stated:

original: dgyes bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pa ste bdag kyang zhes ba kyang yig gis ni 'di bdag 'ba' zhig ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgyes bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pa ste bdag kyang zhes ba kyang yig gis ni 'di bdag 'ba' zhig ma yin pa'o //
translated: With pleasure, etc. The word also in I also is not just for myself.

original: dgyes bzhin du zhes pa khro gnyer rim par ldan la sogs pa gsang sngags 'dzin pa dag tu med pa dang thabs cig tu don dang gzhung las gzung bar bgyi zhing ma 'ongs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag kyang ci nas kyang 'dzin du gzhug par bgyi'o
analyzed: dgyes bzhin du zhes pa khro gnyer rim par ldan la sogs pa gsang sngags 'dzin pa dag tu med pa dang thabs cig tu don dang gzhung las gzung bar bgyi zhing ma 'ongs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag kyang ci nas kyang 'dzin du gzhug par bgyi'o
translated: With pleasure means without frowns, etc., and together with the holders of the mantra, the meaning and the text should be grasped, and other future Bodhisattvas should also be caused to grasp it.

original: zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intention.

original: dus kyi khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: dus kyi khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: The special time is stated:

original: des par 'byung gi bar du ni //
analyzed: des par 'byung gi bar du ni //
translated: Until the final nirvana,

original: zhes pa nges par 'byung ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa nges par 'byung ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: This is the ultimate of the means of deliverance.

original: bsam pa brtan pos zhes pa brtson 'grus brtan po nyid la brjod de brtson 'grus brtan po de yang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'dod pa'i bsam pa brtan der brjod do //
analyzed: bsam pa brtan pos zhes pa brtson 'grus brtan po nyid la brjod de brtson 'grus brtan po de yang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'dod pa'i bsam pa brtan der brjod do //
translated: With firm intention, he says, refers to firm effort, and that firm effort is said to be the firm intention to attain nirvana.

original: gzung bar bgyi'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzung bar bgyi'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: I will hold it, he says.

original: ci nas zhes la sogs pa ste yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi gsang ba sku gsung thugs ro gcig tu gyur ba de 'dzin par byed pa la de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: ci nas zhes la sogs pa ste yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi gsang ba sku gsung thugs ro gcig tu gyur ba de 'dzin par byed pa la de ltar bshad do //
translated: In every way, etc. refers to holding the secret of the perfect buddhas, which is the oneness of the enlightened body, speech, and mind.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gsang ba 'dzin par bdag ci nas kyang 'gyur ba de ltar gzung bar bgyi'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gsang ba 'dzin par bdag ci nas kyang 'gyur ba de ltar gzung bar bgyi'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: I will hold it in every way so that I may hold the secret of the perfect buddhas is the thought.

original: de'i phyir rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa de sems can rnams la bshad par bya /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa de sems can rnams la bshad par bya /
translated: Therefore, one should explain to sentient beings that perfection of one’s own aim.

original: de yang bsam pa'i khyad par ji bzhin du ste gang gi bsam pa'i khyad par dbang po rtul po dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas phye ba de rnams kyis rnam par shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang bsam pa'i khyad par ji bzhin du ste gang gi bsam pa'i khyad par dbang po rtul po dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas phye ba de rnams kyis rnam par shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Moreover, it is in accordance with the distinction of thought, that is, for the sake of being cognized by those whose distinction of thought is divided into the categories of dull, middling, and sharp faculties.

original: don ci zhig gi phyir 'chad pa na gsungs pa /
analyzed: don ci zhig gi phyir 'chad pa na gsungs pa /
translated: For what purpose is it explained?🔽It is said:

original: ma lus zhes pa la sogs pa ste nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye bas kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bshad pa la /
analyzed: ma lus zhes pa la sogs pa ste nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye bas kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bshad pa la /
translated: for the sake of completely removing all afflictions, actions, and births.

original: nyon mongs pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Afflictions are those of the śrāvakas and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni rnam par rtog pa nyid nyon mongs pa ste /🔽de rnams ma lus bsal @149a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni rnam par rtog pa nyid nyon mongs pa ste / de rnams ma lus bsal @149a * //
translated: For the bodhisattvas, conceptualization itself is an affliction.

original: ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is for the sake of completely removing those.

original: de sel ba'i rgyu gsungs pa /
analyzed: de sel ba'i rgyu gsungs pa /
translated: The cause of removing those is stated:

original: mi shes pa lus spangs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mi shes pa lus spangs pa'i phyir //
translated: for the sake of abandoning the body of ignorance.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: de spangs pa ni sngon du 'gro ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa spang ba'i phyir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de spangs pa ni sngon du 'gro ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa spang ba'i phyir zhes pa ste /
translated: The abandonment of that is for the sake of abandoning the prior attachment, etc.

original: 'di ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir du zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir du zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means for the sake of abandoning the afflictions together with their predispositions, which is the obscuration of the knowable.

original: de skad du zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de skad du zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The words “thus” and so on are easy to understand.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa btab pa'i de ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa btab pa'i de ma thag tu'o //
translated: “Then” and so on. Immediately after the request.

original: sh'akya thub pas /
analyzed: sh'akya thub pas /
translated: Śākyamuni

original: gsang dbang la ni slar gsungs pa //
analyzed: gsang dbang la ni slar gsungs pa //
translated: said in reply to the secret empowerment.

original: zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes sbyar te /
translated: One should connect this.

original: lha dang mi las phul du byung ba'i phyir rkang gnyis mchog go //
analyzed: lha dang mi las phul du byung ba'i phyir rkang gnyis mchog go //
translated: Because it is superior to gods and humans, it is the best of two-legged beings.

original: ci ltar mdzad nas lan gsungs she na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar mdzad nas lan gsungs she na gsungs pa /
translated: How did he answer? It is said:

original: rkyong mdzad de zhes pa la sogs pa ste rkyong pa ni nges par phyung ba'o //
analyzed: rkyong mdzad de zhes pa la sogs pa ste rkyong pa ni nges par phyung ba'o //
translated: “Stretching out” and so on. Stretching out is definitely bringing out.

original: nyid kyi ljags ni byin gyi rlabs kyis sems can gzhan dang 'brel pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyid kyi ljags ni byin gyi rlabs kyis sems can gzhan dang 'brel pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: One’s own tongue is not connected to other sentient beings by blessing.

original: srid du ring bas na ring ba'o //
analyzed: srid du ring bas na ring ba'o //
translated: Because it is long in length, it is long.

original: zheng dang ldan pas yangs pa ste ring zhing yangs pa nyid kyis dpral ba'i mthar thug pa'i zhal gyi dkyil 'khor rab tu khebs pa che zhing srab pa las zangs kyi kha dog la sogs pa skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dang ldan pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zheng dang ldan pas yangs pa ste ring zhing yangs pa nyid kyis dpral ba'i mthar thug pa'i zhal gyi dkyil 'khor rab tu khebs pa che zhing srab pa las zangs kyi kha dog la sogs pa skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dang ldan pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is broad, being long and broad, completely covering the circle of the face up to the forehead. It is large and thin, and has the color of copper, and so forth.

original: nyid kyi zhal nas te rdzu 'phrul gyis sems sems can gzhan gyi kha nas bstan pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyid kyi zhal nas te rdzu 'phrul gyis sems sems can gzhan gyi kha nas bstan pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: From his own mouth, not from the mouths of other sentient beings by his magical power.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs mang po las nges par 'khrungs pa'i phyir bzang ba ste shin tu 'bar ba zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs mang po las nges par 'khrungs pa'i phyir bzang ba ste shin tu 'bar ba zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is good, born from a great accumulation of merit, meaning it is very bright.

original: de yang ljags kyi khyad par te de yang bskal pa nyung du ma yin pa nas bden par gsung bar goms pa las byung ba las sems can thams cad la mi slu zhing phyin ci ma log pa'i chos ston pa nyid rtogs par bya ba'i don to zhes
analyzed: de yang ljags kyi khyad par te de yang bskal pa nyung du ma yin pa nas bden par gsung bar goms pa las byung ba las sems can thams cad la mi slu zhing phyin ci ma log pa'i chos ston pa nyid rtogs par bya ba'i don to zhes
translated: That is the special tongue, and that is from not a few eons, arisen from the practice of speaking the truth, in order to realize the non-deception of all sentient beings and the teaching of the unmistaken Dharma.

original: bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya'o //
translated: This is what should be explained.

original: nyid kyi ljags brkyang ba 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi 'dzum pa bstan pa yang mdzad par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: nyid kyi ljags brkyang ba 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi 'dzum pa bstan pa yang mdzad par blta bar bya ste /
translated: One should see that not only did he extend his tongue, but he also displayed a smile.🔽What kind of smile?

original: 'dzum pa ji lta bu zhig ce na gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dzum pa ji lta bu zhig ce na gsungs pa /
translated: He says:

original: 'jig rten rnams kyi ngan song gsum //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams kyi ngan song gsum //

original: sbyong bar byed ces pa ste 'jig rten rnams kyi zhes 'brel lo //
analyzed: sbyong bar byed ces pa ste 'jig rten rnams kyi zhes 'brel lo //

analyzed: ngan song gsum ni dmyal ba dang yi dags dang dus 'gro'i skye gnas kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: The three miserable realms are the nature of the realms of hell beings, hungry ghosts, and animals.

original: der 'dzum pa zhal las nges par 'thon pa'i kha dog sna tshogs pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis yang dag par bstan nas dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nye bar zhi zhing rgyun 'chad de @149b lus dang ngag dang sems rnal 'byor du gnas pa thob nas dkon
analyzed: der 'dzum pa zhal las nges par 'thon pa'i kha dog sna tshogs pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis yang dag par bstan nas dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nye bar zhi zhing rgyun 'chad de @149b lus dang ngag dang sems rnal 'byor du gnas pa thob nas dkon
translated: Having displayed them with the light rays of various colors definitely emerging from his face, the sufferings of the hells and so on are completely pacified and interrupted, and having attained the yoga of body, speech, and mind, the worlds are purified.

original: mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis lha dang mi nyid thob par byed pa'i phyir sbyong bar byed pa ste ngan song gsum sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis lha dang mi nyid thob par byed pa'i phyir sbyong bar byed pa ste ngan song gsum sbyong ba'o //
translated: It is a purifier because it purifies the three lower realms by means of the stages of going for refuge to the Three Jewels and so on, and it causes the attainment of god and human rebirths.

original: yang na ngan song gsum gyi rgyu 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams rnam par sbyong bas na ngan song gsum sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: yang na ngan song gsum gyi rgyu 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams rnam par sbyong bas na ngan song gsum sbyong ba'o //
translated: Or else, it is a purifier of the three lower realms because it purifies the causes of the three lower realms, namely, attachment, aversion and delusion.

original: yang 'dzum pa ci lta bur gyur pas she na /
analyzed: yang 'dzum pa ci lta bur gyur pas she na /
translated: Moreover, what kind of smile does he have?

original: 'jig rten gsum po snang bar byed pa ste khams gsum kun snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po snang bar byed pa ste khams gsum kun snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is a smile that illuminates the three worlds, that is, it illuminates the entire three realms.

original: bdud bzhi ni phung po dang nyon mongs pa dang 'chi bdag dang lha'i bu'i bdud ces grags pa rnams te de dag nyid ni dgra rnams so ;
analyzed: bdud bzhi ni phung po dang nyon mongs pa dang 'chi bdag dang lha'i bu'i bdud ces grags pa rnams te de dag nyid ni dgra rnams so ;
translated: The four demons are the aggregates, the defilements, the Lord of Death and the son of heaven, which are well known. They are enemies.

original: / de rnams 'dul bar byed pa ni rang gi yul las spro ba dang byang chub kyi lam la nges par sbyong bar byed pas na bdud bzhi'i dgra rnams 'dul byed ba'o //
analyzed: / de rnams 'dul bar byed pa ni rang gi yul las spro ba dang byang chub kyi lam la nges par sbyong bar byed pas na bdud bzhi'i dgra rnams 'dul byed ba'o //
translated: He is the conqueror of the four demons because he conquers them by means of the path to enlightenment, that is, by means of the path to enlightenment, he causes them to be turned away from their own domain and to be definitely fixed on the path to enlightenment.

original: ci yis lan gsungs she na gsungs pa tshangs pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ci yis lan gsungs she na gsungs pa tshangs pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Brahma's speech, etc.

original: tshangs pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: tshangs pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Brahma is nondual intuition.

original: de'i rgyu dang ldan pa la tshangs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang ldan pa la tshangs pa'o //

original: de'i gsung de ni nges par tshangs pa'i gsung ste /
analyzed: de'i gsung de ni nges par tshangs pa'i gsung ste /
translated: That speech is definitely Brahma's speech.

original: ji ltar yul nye bar gnas pa dag gis thos pa de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na gnas pa dag gis kyang thos te /
analyzed: ji ltar yul nye bar gnas pa dag gis thos pa de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na gnas pa dag gis kyang thos te /
translated: Just as it is heard by those who are nearby, it is also heard by those who are in other world systems.

original: gam na gnas pa dbang po gnod pa med pa rnams kyis thos par ma zad kyi thag ring por gnas la dman cing rna ba mi gsal ba rnams kyis kyang snyan cing yid du 'ong ba la rnam par gsal ba'i don rtogs par byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o
analyzed: gam na gnas pa dbang po gnod pa med pa rnams kyis thos par ma zad kyi thag ring por gnas la dman cing rna ba mi gsal ba rnams kyis kyang snyan cing yid du 'ong ba la rnam par gsal ba'i don rtogs par byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o
translated: Not only is it heard by those who are nearby with unimpaired faculties, but also by those who are far away, with inferior and unclear hearing, it becomes a cause for understanding the meaning of the clear and pleasant words.

original: // de'i rang bzhin gsungs pa /
analyzed: // de'i rang bzhin gsungs pa /
translated: Its nature is stated:

original: 'jig rten gsum po kun bkang nas //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po kun bkang nas //
translated: Filling the three worlds,

original: zhes pa ste snyan pa yid ces pa ni don dang sgra las yid 'phrog par byed pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ste snyan pa yid ces pa ni don dang sgra las yid 'phrog par byed pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of charming is captivating the mind from the point of view of meaning and sound.

original: gsang dbang zhes pa ni gnod sbyin gyi bdag po ste /
analyzed: gsang dbang zhes pa ni gnod sbyin gyi bdag po ste /
translated: The lord of the yakshas is Vajrapani.

analyzed: 'dis gnod sbyin rnams 'dul ba'i don du de lta bu'i rigs su gzung ste rdo rje 'dzin par bstan pa'o //
translated: He is taught to be Vajrapani because he holds the vajra for the purpose of subduing the yakshas.

analyzed: stobs kyi pha rol phyin pa'i mthar son pas lag na rdo rje stobs bo che'o //

original: de ltar yang klu sgrub zhabs kyis smon lam du /
analyzed: de ltar yang klu sgrub zhabs kyis smon lam du /

original: stobs phyag na rdo rje lta bur gyur cig ces so //
analyzed: stobs phyag na rdo rje lta bur gyur cig ces so //
translated: May I be like Vajrapani in power.

original: lan du ci gsungs she na gsungs pa /
analyzed: lan du ci gsungs she na gsungs pa /
translated: What did he say in reply? It is said:

original: legs so zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: legs so zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Excellent! and so forth.

original: kye gsang ba pa'i bdag po dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang gang yin pa khyod ces bya'o //🔽bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par bsags @150a * //
analyzed: kye gsang ba pa'i bdag po dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang gang yin pa khyod ces bya'o // bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par bsags @150a * //

original: pa ni snying rje che dang ldan gyur cing ngo //
analyzed: pa ni snying rje che dang ldan gyur cing ngo //
translated: You are endowed with great compassion because you have perfectly accumulated the collections of merit and wisdom.

original: de ni don chen sdong don dam par gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni don chen sdong don dam par gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the great meaning, the ultimate meaning, that is clarified.

original: klog cing 'don pa la sogs pas sdig pa sel ba'o //
analyzed: klog cing 'don pa la sogs pas sdig pa sel ba'o //
translated: By reading, reciting, and so forth, it removes misdeeds.

original: de'i phyir gcang bar byed pas na dag par byed cing ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcang bar byed pas na dag par byed cing ngo //
translated: Therefore, since it purifies, it is purifying.

original: 'jam dpal ye shes sku yi mtshan //
analyzed: 'jam dpal ye shes sku yi mtshan //
translated: The name of Mañjuśrī, the embodiment of wisdom,

original: yang dag par brjod pa ni phyag na rdo rje khyod 'gro ba la phan pa'i don de'i ched du /
analyzed: yang dag par brjod pa ni phyag na rdo rje khyod 'gro ba la phan pa'i don de'i ched du /
translated: The correct expression is: O Vajrapāṇi, for the sake of benefiting beings,

original: nga las nyan par brtson pa ni //
analyzed: nga las nyan par brtson pa ni //
translated: You are striving to listen from me.

original: legs so legs so zhes rab tu dgos pas gnyis mngon par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: legs so legs so zhes rab tu dgos pas gnyis mngon par brjod pa'o //
translated: Well done, well done! This is the second declaration.

original: de'i don du legs so'i sgra sbyor ba la bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don du legs so'i sgra sbyor ba la bzhi pa'o //
translated: The application of the word well done for that purpose is the fourth.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: For what reason?

original: mngon po rdzogs sangs rgyas kun gyi //
analyzed: mngon po rdzogs sangs rgyas kun gyi //
translated: All the perfect Buddhas of the past,

original: gsang 'dzin ci nas bdag kun gyi //
analyzed: gsang 'dzin ci nas bdag kun gyi //
translated: I, the holder of secrets, will do whatever it takes for all of them.

original: zhes khyod kyis mngon par smras pa de'i phyir 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes khyod kyis mngon par smras pa de'i phyir 'di gsungs te /
translated: Since you have declared this, it is taught:

original: de bzhin du khyod kyis legs par gsung gcig ci nas kyang zung shig / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kun gyi gsang ba ci nas kyang zung shig / sems can rnams la ji lta bar rab tu gsal bar gyis shig / de'i phyir khyod nyon zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyod kyis legs par gsung gcig ci nas kyang zung shig / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kun gyi gsang ba ci nas kyang zung shig / sems can rnams la ji lta bar rab tu gsal bar gyis shig / de'i phyir khyod nyon zhes sbyar te /
translated: Therefore, listen, you should listen.

original: ci ltar nyan zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar nyan zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How should one listen?

original: rtse gcig yid kyis te rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i sems kyis so //🔽bcom ldan de ni legs zhes gsol //
analyzed: rtse gcig yid kyis te rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i sems kyis so // bcom ldan de ni legs zhes gsol //
translated: With a one-pointed mind, with a mind free from distraction.🔽The Blessed One, that is excellent.

original: zhes pa bcom ldan 'das legs so zhes gsol ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa bcom ldan 'das legs so zhes gsol ba ste /
translated: This is the request, “Blessed One, that is excellent.”

original: legs so zhes bya ba gsol ba'o ;
analyzed: legs so zhes bya ba gsol ba'o ;
translated: It is the request, “Excellent!”

original: / gus bas bskul te nyan no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: / gus bas bskul te nyan no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It means that one should listen with respect.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i sems dang dad pa bskyed pas lhag par rtogs par bya bar nus zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i sems dang dad pa bskyed pas lhag par rtogs par bya bar nus zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that one is able to understand it well by generating faith with a mind free from distraction.

original: 'di yang ma 'ongs pa'i gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la bslab pa'i don du gsungs kyi /
analyzed: 'di yang ma 'ongs pa'i gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la bslab pa'i don du gsungs kyi /
translated: This is also stated for the sake of training future disciples.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa la ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems med de zhes ma yin pa mi bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa la ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems med de zhes ma yin pa mi bya'o zhes so //
translated: But it should not be said that the Vajra Holder has no mind that is not in meditative equipoise.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: And so:🔽Sit on a very low seat

original: rab tu dma' ba'i stan la 'dug / dul ba'i dpal ni rnam par bskyed //
analyzed: rab tu dma' ba'i stan la 'dug / dul ba'i dpal ni rnam par bskyed //
translated: and generate the glory of self-discipline.

original: dga' dang tshim pa'i rnam par blta //
analyzed: dga' dang tshim pa'i rnam par blta //
translated: Look with the expression of joy and satisfaction

original: tshig gi bdud rtsi 'thung ba bzhin //
analyzed: tshig gi bdud rtsi 'thung ba bzhin //
translated: as if you are drinking the nectar of his words.

original: zhes bskyed de rtse gcig tu //
analyzed: zhes bskyed de rtse gcig tu //
translated: Thus, generate [faith] and listen one-pointedly.

original: dang zhing dri med yid ldan pas //
analyzed: dang zhing dri med yid ldan pas //
translated: With a mind that is clear and stainless,

original: nad pas sman pa'i tshig bzhin du //
analyzed: nad pas sman pa'i tshig bzhin du //
translated: like a patient listening to the words of a doctor,

original: bkur sti byas te chos mnyan bya //
analyzed: bkur sti byas te chos mnyan bya //
translated: listen to the Dharma with respect.

original: zhes gsungs so //🔽de ltar rjes su bslabs nas ji lta bu zhig ston zhe na de gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // de ltar rjes su bslabs nas ji lta bu zhig ston zhe na de gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Having trained in that way, what is it that is taught? It is said then and so forth.

original: de nas bcom ldan sh'akya thub //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan sh'akya thub //
translated: Then the Bhagavān Śākyamuni,

original: tshig gi bdag pos tshigs bcad gsungs //
analyzed: tshig gi bdag pos tshigs bcad gsungs //
translated: the lord of speech, spoke these verses.

original: zhes 'brel lo //
analyzed: zhes 'brel lo //
translated: This is the connection.

original: sh'akya'i rigs @150b las byung ba'i phyir sh'akya yang 'di yin la sku dang gsung dang thugs thub pa'i brtul zhugs dang ldan pa thub pa yang 'di yin pas de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: sh'akya'i rigs @150b las byung ba'i phyir sh'akya yang 'di yin la sku dang gsung dang thugs thub pa'i brtul zhugs dang ldan pa thub pa yang 'di yin pas de ltar bshad do //
translated: He is a Śākya because he is born into the Śākya family, and he is a Muni because he has the Muni’s vow of body, speech, and mind.

original: mchog gi dbang phyug la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: mchog gi dbang phyug la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: He is the Blessed One because he is endowed with supreme lordship and so forth.🔽Having done what, did he speak?

original: ji zhig mdzad nas gsungs she na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji zhig mdzad nas gsungs she na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: mtha' dag ces pa la sogs pa ste chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i yid kyis sems can gyi khams skyob pa'i phyir stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni gsang sngags te /
analyzed: mtha' dag ces pa la sogs pa ste chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i yid kyis sems can gyi khams skyob pa'i phyir stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni gsang sngags te /
translated: The mantra is the thought of the realm of phenomena, the thought of emptiness and compassion inseparable, the thought of enlightenment, for the sake of protecting the realm of sentient beings.

original: de las byung ba a'a li dang l'a li'i rang bzhin h'um yig la sogs pa yang gsang sngags so //
analyzed: de las byung ba a'a li dang l'a li'i rang bzhin h'um yig la sogs pa yang gsang sngags so //
translated: The mantra is also the arising of that, the syllable hūṃ and so forth, which are of the nature of āli and kāli.

original: mtha' dag ni bya ba dang spyod pa dang rnal 'byor gyi rgyud du gtogs pa la sogs pa bskyed pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: mtha' dag ni bya ba dang spyod pa dang rnal 'byor gyi rgyud du gtogs pa la sogs pa bskyed pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The entire [mantra] is the stage of generation, which is included in the action, conduct, and yoga tantras and so forth.

original: sngags rnams kyi rigs ni rgyud ces chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: sngags rnams kyi rigs ni rgyud ces chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The class of mantras is the continuum, the essence of the dharmadhatu.

original: de dang dbyer mi phyed kyang brjod bya'i chos rnams kyi dbye bas phye ba'i nye bar brtag pa gsungs pa yang mtha' dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dang dbyer mi phyed kyang brjod bya'i chos rnams kyi dbye bas phye ba'i nye bar brtag pa gsungs pa yang mtha' dag ces bya'o //
translated: Although it is inseparable from that, it is distinguished by the distinctions of the phenomena that are expressed, and that is called “entire.”

original: de bstan pa'i dus la sogs pa la khyab pa'i phyir chen po'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa'i dus la sogs pa la khyab pa'i phyir chen po'o //
translated: It is great because it pervades the time of teaching and so forth.

original: gsang sngags rig sngags ni grub pa'i gsang sngags rnams dang de 'dzin par byed pas gsang sngags rig sngags 'chang ba ste gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor rnams so //
analyzed: gsang sngags rig sngags ni grub pa'i gsang sngags rnams dang de 'dzin par byed pas gsang sngags rig sngags 'chang ba ste gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor rnams so //
translated: The mantra and knowledge mantras are the accomplished mantras and the holders of those, that is, the yogas of Yamantaka and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi rigs ni rgyud do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rigs ni rgyud do //
translated: Their class is the continuum.

original: mtha' dag ces pa 'dir yang ste mchog la sbyar bar yang bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' dag ces pa 'dir yang ste mchog la sbyar bar yang bya'o //
translated: “ Entire” is also applied here, and it is also applied to the supreme.

original: rigs gsum zhes pa sku gsung thugs kyi rigs te rigs thams cad yang dag par bsdus par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rigs gsum zhes pa sku gsung thugs kyi rigs te rigs thams cad yang dag par bsdus par gyur pa'o //
translated: The three classes are the classes of body, speech, and mind, which are the complete summary of all classes.

original: 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das pa'i rigs //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das pa'i rigs //
translated: The mundane and supramundane classes.

original: zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i gsang sngags kyi rigs dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gsang sngags kyi rigs so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i gsang sngags kyi rigs dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gsang sngags kyi rigs so //
translated: This is the mundane mantra type and the supramundane mantra type.

original: 'jig rten snang byed rigs ni de gnyi ga'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten snang byed rigs ni de gnyi ga'o //
translated: The type that illuminates the world is both of those.

original: phyag rgya chen po ni spyan ma la sogs pa rigs pa'i rgyal mo rnams so //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ni spyan ma la sogs pa rigs pa'i rgyal mo rnams so //
translated: The great seal is the queen types such as Locanā.

original: de'i rigs ni de las byung ba'i gsang sngags dang / phyag rgya las skyes pa'i rgyu dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rigs ni de las byung ba'i gsang sngags dang / phyag rgya las skyes pa'i rgyu dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: Its type is the mantra that arises from it, related to the cause that arises from the seal.

original: rigs chen gtsug tor ni gtsug tor yi ge gcig pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyi stobs las skyes pa'i lha'i khyad par gzhan dang gzhan no //
analyzed: rigs chen gtsug tor ni gtsug tor yi ge gcig pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyi stobs las skyes pa'i lha'i khyad par gzhan dang gzhan no //
translated: The great type of the uṣṇīṣa is another special deity that arises from the power of the mantra of the one-syllable uṣṇīṣa, etc.

original: rnam par gzigs zhes pa sngags dang phyag rgya la sogs pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa de rnams la nges par rtogs par mdzad do zhes pa'i don to //🔽'di zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur @151a * //
analyzed: rnam par gzigs zhes pa sngags dang phyag rgya la sogs pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa de rnams la nges par rtogs par mdzad do zhes pa'i don to // 'di zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur @151a * //
translated: It is said that “he sees” those who are fortunate in the mantra, seal, etc., and he definitely causes them to realize.

original: ba'i aa yig la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i aa yig la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This refers to the verse that will be explained, beginning with the letter A.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa yod kyang tshigs su bcad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa yod kyang tshigs su bcad ces gsungs so //
translated: although there is a second verse, it is called a verse.
