original: shes rab kyi rang bzhin a'a li gtso bor rtogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi rang bzhin a'a li gtso bor rtogs pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one realizes the nature of wisdom, the principal A Li.

original: don dam par ni shes rab nyid thabs so zhes pas so //
analyzed: don dam par ni shes rab nyid thabs so zhes pas so //
translated: For it is said, In the ultimate sense, wisdom itself is the means.

original: gsang sngags rgyal po drug ldan no //
analyzed: gsang sngags rgyal po drug ldan no //
translated: Endowed with the six kings of mantra.

original: zhes pa ni aom badzra t'ikshna zhes pa la sogs pa gsang sngags rgyal po drug ldan no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni aom badzra t'ikshna zhes pa la sogs pa gsang sngags rgyal po drug ldan no //
translated: This means endowed with the six kings of mantra, such as Oṃ vajra-tīkṣṇa.

original: 'dir rgyal po'i sgra'i tshig la ma yin par don la rton pa nyid kyis rgyal po'i sgra don rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir rgyal po'i sgra'i tshig la ma yin par don la rton pa nyid kyis rgyal po'i sgra don rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the meaning of the word king, relying on the meaning itself, not on the word.

original: tshig la rton pa kha cig rgyal po'i sgra'i so sor sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: tshig la rton pa kha cig rgyal po'i sgra'i so sor sbyor bar byed de /
translated: Some, relying on the word, apply the word king individually.

original: rgyal po rjes su yang dag ldan //
analyzed: rgyal po rjes su yang dag ldan //
translated: Endowed with the king means endowed with the king's retinue.

original: zhes rjes su'i sgra'o zhes rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: zhes rjes su'i sgra'o zhes rtogs par byed do //
translated: Some understand it as endowed with the word 'after'.

original: gnyis su med par 'byung ba zhes pa la gnyis su med pa ni sngags kyi tshul la stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las yang dag par byung ba bde ba chen po'i
analyzed: gnyis su med par 'byung ba zhes pa la gnyis su med pa ni sngags kyi tshul la stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las yang dag par byung ba bde ba chen po'i
translated: The phrase arises non-dually means that in the Mantra system, the essence of the non-dual samadhi of wisdom and means, of emptiness and compassion, is the great bliss that arises from that.

original: rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: It is the essence of that.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la ni bdag dang bdag gi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i yid kyi g-yo ba mtha' dag dang bral ba chos thams cad bdag med pa'i rang bzhin ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang gcig pa'i sems ni der brjod de don
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la ni bdag dang bdag gi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i yid kyi g-yo ba mtha' dag dang bral ba chos thams cad bdag med pa'i rang bzhin ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang gcig pa'i sems ni der brjod de don
translated: In the Perfection system, the mind that is one with the nature body, the nature of all phenomena that is the absence of self, is called non-dual because it is free from all movements of the mind, such as the apprehension of I and mine, the apprehender and the apprehended, and so on.

original: gyi sgo nas aa birbha watya sm'a di ti gnyis su med par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gyi sgo nas aa birbha watya sm'a di ti gnyis su med par 'byung ba'o //
translated: In terms of the object, it is called arises non-dually because it is the non-dual arising of the ultimate and the conventional.

original: de'i phyir skye ba med pa'i chos brjod par bya ba nyid kyis 'di la yod pas mi skye chos can no //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba med pa'i chos brjod par bya ba nyid kyis 'di la yod pas mi skye chos can no //
translated: Therefore, because it exists as the expression of the non-arisen Dharma, it is called the possessor of the Dharma of non-arising.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa de yang lung dang rigs pa las nges par bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa de yang lung dang rigs pa las nges par bya ste /
translated: One should ascertain that all phenomena are not produced by means of scripture and reasoning.

original: de la re zhig lung ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las gsungs te ;
analyzed: de la re zhig lung ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las gsungs te ;
translated: With regard to that, first, the scripture is stated in the Definitive Explanation of the Intention:

original: de yang mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang skye ba ngo bo nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la dgongs nas bas chos thams cad dngos po med pa skye ba med pa /
analyzed: de yang mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang skye ba ngo bo nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la dgongs nas bas chos thams cad dngos po med pa skye ba med pa /
translated: “The Bhagavān, having understood the non-entityness of character, the non-entityness of production, and the ultimate non-entityness, taught that all phenomena are entityless, are not produced,

original: 'gag pa med pa /
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa /
translated: are not ceased,

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
translated: are primordially peaceful,

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs so ;
translated: and are naturally nirvāṇa.”

original: / de la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: / de la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa gang zhe na /
translated: With regard to that, what is the non-entityness of character?

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the imputed character.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar de ni ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar de ni ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: It is because that is a character that is posited by names and signs and is not a character that is an intrinsic nature.

original: phung po dang khams la sogs pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma @151b byas rnams rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid stong pa yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phung po dang khams la sogs pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma @151b byas rnams rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid stong pa yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The conditioned and unconditioned aggregates, elements, etc. are called “natureless in terms of intrinsic identity” because they are empty of intrinsic identity and universal identity.

original: skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is naturelessness in terms of production?

original: chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is the relative identity of things.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni rkyen gzhan gyi stobs kyis 'byung ba yin gyi bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni rkyen gzhan gyi stobs kyis 'byung ba yin gyi bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: Because it occurs by the power of other conditions, not by itself.

original: gang yang rang nyid med pa de nyid med pa de ni skye ba med de /
analyzed: gang yang rang nyid med pa de nyid med pa de ni skye ba med de /
translated: And that which does not exist by itself does not exist at all, and that which does not exist at all is not produced.

original: skye ba med pa la ni ngo bo nyid med pas de'i phyir de ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa la ni ngo bo nyid med pas de'i phyir de ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since there is no intrinsic identity in what is not produced, it is called “natureless in terms of production.

original: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa gang zha na /
analyzed: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa gang zha na /
translated: ” What is naturelessness in terms of the ultimate?

original: chos rnams kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: It is the perfect identity of things.

original: de yang don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: de yang don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: And that is called “natureless in terms of the ultimate.🔽”

original: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos rnams kyi bdag med pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi bdag med pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa ste /
translated: The selflessness of phenomena is the ultimate.

original: de yang ngo bo nyid med pas na don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang ngo bo nyid med pas na don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since that is also essenceless, it is called the ultimate essencelessness.

original: nam mkha'i me tog ji lta ba de lta bu ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog ji lta ba de lta bu ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: Like a sky flower, it is the essencelessness of characteristics.

original: sgyu ma byas pa ji lta bde lta bu ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma byas pa ji lta bde lta bu ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: Like a magical creation, it is the essencelessness of arising.

original: nam mkha' gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid med pa tsam dang thams cad du song ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid med pa tsam dang thams cad du song ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
translated: Like space, the mere essencelessness of form, and like the all-pervading, it is the ultimate essencelessness.

original: chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba dang thams cad du song bas so //
analyzed: chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba dang thams cad du song bas so //
translated: It is distinguished by the selflessness of phenomena and is all-pervading.

original: lung 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi rigs pas kyang skye ba med pa de bstan par bya ste /🔽de yang gang gi rang bzhin yod min pa //
analyzed: lung 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi rigs pas kyang skye ba med pa de bstan par bya ste / de yang gang gi rang bzhin yod min pa //
translated: Not only is it taught in the scriptures, but it can also be demonstrated through reasoning.🔽That which does not have an essence

original: de ni dngos po med pa ste //
analyzed: de ni dngos po med pa ste //
translated: is said to be nonexistent.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dag / yod pa min te ci lta zhig / gang zhig rgyu dang 'bras bu yi //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dag / yod pa min te ci lta zhig / gang zhig rgyu dang 'bras bu yi //
translated: How can there be a cause and effect

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin pa //
translated: If they do not exist?

original: de yi skye ba ji lta bu //
analyzed: de yi skye ba ji lta bu //
translated: How can there be an arising🔽Of that which does not exist?

original: mo gsham bu sogs ji bzhin no //
analyzed: mo gsham bu sogs ji bzhin no //
translated: It is just like the son of a barren woman.

original: de nyid phyir na dngos rnams kyi //
analyzed: de nyid phyir na dngos rnams kyi //
translated: Therefore, the nature of things

original: rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no //🔽gcig dang du ma la sogs kyi //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no // gcig dang du ma la sogs kyi //
translated: Does not exist.🔽Because they do not possess

original: rang bzhin 'ga' yang mi ldan phyir //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'ga' yang mi ldan phyir //
translated: Any nature, such as being singular or manifold.

original: zhes so // de ltar yang 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas /🔽gcig dang du ma nyi tshe dang // nyi tshe ma yin 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: zhes so // de ltar yang 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas / gcig dang du ma nyi tshe dang // nyi tshe ma yin 'ga' yang med //
translated: In the same way, the noble Nāgārjuna says:🔽There is nothing whatsoever that is🔽Either singular or manifold.

original: du ma med cing gcig kyang med //
analyzed: du ma med cing gcig kyang med //
translated: There is neither manifoldness nor singularity.

original: med pa nyid kyang yod ma yin //🔽zhes so // 'o na ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gsungs she na bden te /
analyzed: med pa nyid kyang yod ma yin // zhes so // 'o na ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gsungs she na bden te /
translated: Nonexistence itself does not exist.

original: skye ba med pa nyid rtogs pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar gsungs so //
analyzed: skye ba med pa nyid rtogs pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar gsungs so //
translated: Well then, how is it that the Bhagavān taught dependent origination? It is true that he did teach dependent origination, but he taught that the realization of nonarising is dependent origination.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rten nas skyes dang ma skyes par //
analyzed: rten nas skyes dang ma skyes par //
translated: And arisen from dependence, and not arisen,

original: gsungs pa nam mkha'i de nyid rig / ces so //
analyzed: gsungs pa nam mkha'i de nyid rig / ces so //
translated: The nature of space is known.

original: yang gsungs pa /🔽rten cing 'brel @152a * //
analyzed: yang gsungs pa / rten cing 'brel @152a * //
translated: And again it is said:

original: 'byung gang yin pa //🔽de yi rang bzhin skye med phyir //🔽gang gi rang bzhin skye med pa //
analyzed: 'byung gang yin pa // de yi rang bzhin skye med phyir // gang gi rang bzhin skye med pa //
translated: Whatever is dependently arisen🔽That is explained to be emptiness.

original: de yi skye ba zhes bya ci //🔽dngos po rang las mi skye zhing //
analyzed: de yi skye ba zhes bya ci // dngos po rang las mi skye zhing //
translated: That, being a dependent designation,

original: gzhan dang gnyi ga las kyang min //🔽med dang yod med mi 'grub pa //
analyzed: gzhan dang gnyi ga las kyang min // med dang yod med mi 'grub pa //
translated: Is itself the middle way.

original: de yi 'byung ba gang ci zhig / gsung rab dag las kyang /
analyzed: de yi 'byung ba gang ci zhig / gsung rab dag las kyang /
translated: And also in the scriptures:

original: gang zhig rkyen las skyes pa de ma skyes //
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen las skyes pa de ma skyes //
translated: Whatever is arisen from conditions is not arisen.

original: de la skye ba'i rang bzhin yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la skye ba'i rang bzhin yod ma yin //
translated: It does not have the nature of being arisen.

original: rkyen la rag las gang de stong par bshad //
analyzed: rkyen la rag las gang de stong par bshad //
translated: That which is dependent on conditions is explained to be empty.

original: gang gis stong nyid mthong de bag yod yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gis stong nyid mthong de bag yod yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: One who sees emptiness is heedful.

original: gal te yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: gal te yang 'di skad du /
translated: And if it is said:

original: de bzhin du khas blangs pa'i 'bras bu dang rgyu'i rang bzhin dag la nges par brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du khas blangs pa'i 'bras bu dang rgyu'i rang bzhin dag la nges par brtag par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, the nature of the effect and the cause should be ascertained.

original: de la rgyu'i rang bzhin las re zhig 'bras bu skye bar byed pa na /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rang bzhin las re zhig 'bras bu skye bar byed pa na /
translated: In this regard, when an effect is produced from a cause,

original: ci'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rgyu las sam /
analyzed: ci'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rgyu las sam /
translated: is it produced from a cause that has the nature of an effect?

original: gzhan gyi dngos por gyur pa las sam /🔽gnyi gar gyur pa las sam /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos por gyur pa las sam / gnyi gar gyur pa las sam /
translated: Or is it produced from a cause that has the nature of something else?🔽Or is it produced from both?

original: gnyi ga ma yin par gyur pa las yin zhes rnam par rtog pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin par gyur pa las yin zhes rnam par rtog pa bzhi'o //
translated: Or is it produced from neither?

original: de la re zhig 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rgyu las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rgyu las ni ma yin te /
translated: In this regard, first, it is not produced from a cause that has the nature of an effect,

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ni gang gi phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ni gang gi phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which has the nature of an effect is an effect, and it is the nature of a cause.

original: de'i phyir de lta bu'i rang bzhin du grub pa ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rgyu las de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi 'bras bu mi skye ste 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bu'i rang bzhin du grub pa ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rgyu las de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi 'bras bu mi skye ste 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, an effect that has the nature of an effect is not produced from a cause that has the nature of an effect, because it does not exist as an effect.

original: bdag nyid kyi thob pa'i don gyi bya ba byed pa yang dngos po rnams kyi skye ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi thob pa'i don gyi bya ba byed pa yang dngos po rnams kyi skye ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The activity of the object that is obtained by the self is also the effect of the arising of things.

original: de gnyis ka grub pa'i phyir de las kyang skye na mtha' med par skye bar thal med par thug med du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ka grub pa'i phyir de las kyang skye na mtha' med par skye bar thal med par thug med du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it arose from that, since both of those are established, it would follow that there would be an infinite regress of arising.

original: de la skye ba nyid slar yang de'i bdag nyid du skye ba'i nus pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la skye ba nyid slar yang de'i bdag nyid du skye ba'i nus pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In that regard, arising itself does not have the ability to arise again in that way.

original: de ltar yang zla ba grags pa'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang zla ba grags pa'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, Candrakīrti’s Commentary on the Four Hundred Stanzas says:

original: de phyir phan pa'i dngos po la //
analyzed: de phyir phan pa'i dngos po la //
translated: Therefore, in terms of a thing that is beneficial,

original: yon tan 'ga' yang yod ma yin //🔽slar yang skye ba nyid skye ba //
analyzed: yon tan 'ga' yang yod ma yin // slar yang skye ba nyid skye ba //
translated: there is no quality whatsoever.

original: de ltar rigs pa ma yin nyid //
analyzed: de ltar rigs pa ma yin nyid //
translated: It is not logical for arising itself to arise again.

original: ces so // gzhan las kyang skye ba 'bras bu med de /
analyzed: ces so // gzhan las kyang skye ba 'bras bu med de /
translated: Arising from another is also pointless.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba yang dngos po gnyis la ltos nas bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba yang dngos po gnyis la ltos nas bshad pa yin la /
translated: The so-called other is explained in terms of two things.

original: dngos po gnyis pa 'di ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: dngos po gnyis pa 'di ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: The second thing is the effect.

original: de yang rgyu yod pa'i dus na ni yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de yang rgyu yod pa'i dus na ni yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, it does not exist at the time when the cause exists.

original: de yod pa'i dus su yang rgyu yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yod pa'i dus su yang rgyu yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And when it exists, the cause does not exist.

original: de gang la ltos nas gzhan @152b nyid du don dam par khas len te /🔽ba lang gi rva la ltos pa'am /
analyzed: de gang la ltos nas gzhan @152b nyid du don dam par khas len te / ba lang gi rva la ltos pa'am /
translated: In dependence on what would you accept that it is essentially different in the ultimate sense?

original: ri bong gi rva la ltos nas rta'i rva'i gzhan pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la ltos nas rta'i rva'i gzhan pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The difference of the horse’s horn from the cow’s horn does not exist.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu mig la sogs pas kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu mig la sogs pas kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skyed pa ma yin te /
translated: The eye and so on, which are asserted to be causes, do not give rise to the eye consciousness and so on, which are asserted to be effects,

original: de skyed pa po las gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de skyed pa po las gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are not essentially different from that which gives rise to them.

original: mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa'i ra na dika bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa'i ra na dika bzhin no //
translated: They are not asserted to be causes because they are not asserted to be essentially different, like the horns of a rabbit.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said,

original: rang gi ngo bo ma byung bar //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ma byung bar //
translated: Without having come into existence,

original: gang zhig gang las gzhan du 'dod //🔽ba lang rva'am mi rva las //
analyzed: gang zhig gang las gzhan du 'dod // ba lang rva'am mi rva las //
translated: How could anything be different from anything else?🔽The difference of the horse’s horn

original: rta'i rva bzhin du 'dod ma yin //
analyzed: rta'i rva bzhin du 'dod ma yin //
translated: From the cow’s horn is not asserted.

original: rkyen gzhan gyis kyang don dam par mig la sogs pas mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rkyen gzhan gyis kyang don dam par mig la sogs pas mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, in the ultimate sense, the eye consciousness is not given rise to by the eye and so on, which are other conditions,🔽because they are not essentially different from that which gives rise to it.

original: gzhan du gyur pas ba'i ra na la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pas ba'i ra na la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the case of the word “bārana” and so on.

original: gnyis ka las kyang skye bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: gnyis ka las kyang skye bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is also not logical that things arise from both self and other,

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag phan tshun 'gal bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas gcig tu 'dres pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag phan tshun 'gal bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas gcig tu 'dres pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the characteristics of different and non-different natures are mutually exclusive and cannot be combined into one.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i tshul gyis brjod du med pa'i phyogs kyang rigs pa 'dis nges par dpyad na mi rigs te /
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i tshul gyis brjod du med pa'i phyogs kyang rigs pa 'dis nges par dpyad na mi rigs te /
translated: This reasoning also definitely refutes the position that things are inexpressible in terms of both self and other.

original: de la brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa las 'das pa'i phyir gang de nyid ni 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i gzugs dor ba ste de nyid ni tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de la brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa las 'das pa'i phyir gang de nyid ni 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i gzugs dor ba ste de nyid ni tha dad pa'o //
translated: In that regard, the inexpressible nature is beyond the concepts of different and non-different. Therefore, “that is not this” is the relinquishment of its form, and that is difference.

original: de dgag pa ni tha dad pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: de dgag pa ni tha dad pa ma yin pa /
translated: The negation of that is non-difference.

original: dngos po rnams rnam pa gzhan gang zhig las 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rnam pa gzhan gang zhig las 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: From what other aspect could things arise?

original: rgyu med pa las kyang skye bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las kyang skye bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is also not logical that things arise without a cause.

original: rgyu med pa ni gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir rtag tu yong pa'am med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa ni gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir rtag tu yong pa'am med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were no cause, it would follow that there would be either eternal existence or eternal nonexistence, because there would be no dependence on another.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po rnams ni res 'ga' 'byung ngo zhes pa'i rigs pa las de ltar gsungs so //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po rnams ni res 'ga' 'byung ngo zhes pa'i rigs pa las de ltar gsungs so //
translated: Things that have dependence arise occasionally.

original: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis /
analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis /
translated: The noble Nāgārjuna says:

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from self, not from other,

original: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //🔽dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min // dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: not from both, not without cause,🔽Nowhere do any things

original: skye ba gang yang yod ma yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: skye ba gang yang yod ma yin // zhes gsungs pa de la /
translated: ever have any arising.

original: bdag las zhes pa ni grangs can pa'o //
analyzed: bdag las zhes pa ni grangs can pa'o //
translated: Here, “from self” is the Sāṃkhya.

original: gzhan las zhes bya ba sangs rgyas pa kha cig dang bye brag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan las zhes bya ba sangs rgyas pa kha cig dang bye brag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “From other” is some Buddhists and Vaiśeṣikas, and so on.

original: gnyig las zhes bya ba dang spyod pa dang gcer bu'o //🔽rgyu med par smra ba ni /
analyzed: gnyig las zhes bya ba dang spyod pa dang gcer bu'o // rgyu med par smra ba ni /
translated: “From both” is the Jaina.🔽“Without cause” is the Lokāyata.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa dang rang bzhin rgyur smra'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa dang rang bzhin rgyur smra'o //
translated: “From nature” is the Sāṃkhya.

original: @153a * // ci 'di la dngos po skad cig pa rnams kyi 'bras bu skye ba na ci rgyu 'das pa las skye'am /
analyzed: @153a * // ci 'di la dngos po skad cig pa rnams kyi 'bras bu skye ba na ci rgyu 'das pa las skye'am /
translated: or from a cause that is future, or from a cause that is present?

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba las skyes zhes rnam par brtag pa gsum mo //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba las skyes zhes rnam par brtag pa gsum mo //
translated: The three alternatives are to be investigated.

original: de la re zhig 'das pa las ni ma yin te zhig pa nyid kyis de'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la re zhig 'das pa las ni ma yin te zhig pa nyid kyis de'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this regard, it does not arise from a past cause, because it is already destroyed and therefore not a cause.

original: ma 'ongs ba las kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs ba las kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nor does it arise from a future cause,

original: de ni ma skyes pa nyid kyis yang dag par thob pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma skyes pa nyid kyis yang dag par thob pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not yet arisen and therefore not yet obtained.

original: da ltar ba las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar ba las kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it arise from a present cause,

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin ma grub pa nyid kyis rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin ma grub pa nyid kyis rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of an entity is not yet established and therefore it is not a cause.

original: yang na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gnyi ga ni rang bzhin tha dad ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gnyi ga ni rang bzhin tha dad ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, both the past and the future are not causes because they are different in nature.🔽And again:

original: de yang / phyed kyis grub dang phyed kyis ni //
analyzed: de yang / phyed kyis grub dang phyed kyis ni //
translated: The first half is established; the second half is not established.

original: ma grub da ltar byung bar brjod //
analyzed: ma grub da ltar byung bar brjod //
translated: The present is said to be half established and half not established.

original: de la gang phyed grub pa de ni 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang phyed grub pa de ni 'das pa'o //
translated: In this regard, that which is half established is the past.

original: gang ma grub pa de ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang ma grub pa de ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: That which is not yet established is future.

original: phyogs gnyi ga tha dad par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gnyi ga tha dad par gyur pa'o //
translated: The two parts are distinct.

original: de'i phyir skad cig ma gsum pa yang rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi 'bras bu 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ma gsum pa yang rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi 'bras bu 'byung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, since the third moment is not a cause, the effect of things does not occur.

original: gal te rgyu zhig pa'i dus kyi skad cig ma kho na la 'bras bu 'byung gi sngon dang phyi mar ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu zhig pa'i dus kyi skad cig ma kho na la 'bras bu 'byung gi sngon dang phyi mar ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If the effect occurs at the very moment when the cause is disintegrating, not before and not after,

original: rgyu zhig pa 'di ni ci /
analyzed: rgyu zhig pa 'di ni ci /
translated: what is the cause that is disintegrating?

original: rgyu'i rang bzhin kho na ci gnas su smra'am dngos po nyid skad cig mar skyes pa'i chos zhig pa'am /
analyzed: rgyu'i rang bzhin kho na ci gnas su smra'am dngos po nyid skad cig mar skyes pa'i chos zhig pa'am /
translated: Is it the nature of the cause itself, or is it the thing itself, which is momentary, that is disintegrating?

original: yang na rgyu zhig pa ci /
analyzed: yang na rgyu zhig pa ci /
translated: Or what is the cause that is disintegrating?

original: de la gal te rgyu'i rang bzhin dag yin na ni cig car ba yin pa'i phyir de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de la gal te rgyu'i rang bzhin dag yin na ni cig car ba yin pa'i phyir de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: If it is the nature of the cause itself, then it is simultaneous, and that is unacceptable.

original: des na rgyu zhig pa'i gtan tshigs de ci lta bu zhig /'bras bu dang ldan pa zhig pa yin na ni rang bzhin med pa'i phyir rang de la med pa zhig pa de'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa skye ba zhes bya ba ni med do //
analyzed: des na rgyu zhig pa'i gtan tshigs de ci lta bu zhig /'bras bu dang ldan pa zhig pa yin na ni rang bzhin med pa'i phyir rang de la med pa zhig pa de'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa skye ba zhes bya ba ni med do //
translated: Therefore, what kind of reason is the cessation of a cause? If cessation is associated with an effect, then because it is essenceless, it is nonexistent. How could that which is nonexistent, cessation, be associated with an effect?

original: da ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin la dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin la dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Now, we will analyze the nature of the effect.

original: 'bras bu rnams skye ba na ci /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams skye ba na ci /
translated: When effects arise, do they arise🔽as existent effects,

original: 'bras bu med pa yin skye'am /🔽'on te med pa'am /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa yin skye'am / 'on te med pa'am /
translated: or as nonexistent effects,🔽or as both existent and nonexistent effects,

original: yod med dam /
analyzed: yod med dam /
translated: or as other than existent or nonexistent effects?

original: de las gzhan pa zhig ces rnam par brtag pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa zhig ces rnam par brtag pa bzhi'o //
translated: These are the four alternatives.

original: de la re zhig yod pa ni mi skye ste de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la re zhig yod pa ni mi skye ste de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, an existent effect does not arise because it already exists.

original: de gal te skye na skyes pa yang yang skye'o //
analyzed: de gal te skye na skyes pa yang yang skye'o //
translated: If it arose, then what has arisen would arise again.

original: med pa yang mi skye ste bong bu la rva skyes pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa yang mi skye ste bong bu la rva skyes pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, a nonexistent effect does not arise because it is untenable that a rabbit’s horns arise.

original: gal te de ltar gyur na thams cad rgyu gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir gang zhig gang las skyes pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i nges pa dag med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de ltar gyur na thams cad rgyu gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir gang zhig gang las skyes pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i nges pa dag med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, since everything would be a single cause, there would be no definite cause and effect, such as this being produced from that.

original: des na dngos po rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed pa po so sor @153b nges pa de'i phyir thams cad las thams cad 'byung ngo zhe na /🔽'o na nus pa de rkyen las tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: des na dngos po rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed pa po so sor @153b nges pa de'i phyir thams cad las thams cad 'byung ngo zhe na / 'o na nus pa de rkyen las tha dad pa'am /
translated: Therefore, since the potency of things is individually certain, the producer of the effect is individually certain. Therefore, everything would arise from everything.

original: tha dad ma yin /
analyzed: tha dad ma yin /
translated: But is that potency different from the conditions or not?

original: gal te tha dad yin pa las skye na de'i tshe rkyen ci /
analyzed: gal te tha dad yin pa las skye na de'i tshe rkyen ci /
translated: If it is different, then from what does it arise?

original: de nyid skye na tha dad pa ma yin pa de'i tshe nus pa tsam mam rkyen tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid skye na tha dad pa ma yin pa de'i tshe nus pa tsam mam rkyen tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it arises from that, then it is not different. In that case, it would be mere potency or mere condition.

original: nus pa tsam skyed pa po yin na de kho na skyon yin no ;
analyzed: nus pa tsam skyed pa po yin na de kho na skyon yin no ;
translated: If mere potency is the producer, then that is the fault.

original: /'on te nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rkyen nyid skye ba po zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: /'on te nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rkyen nyid skye ba po zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that the conditions are the producers because they possess potency, that is not so.

original: de ji snyed ldan yang gal rigs /
analyzed: de ji snyed ldan yang gal rigs /
translated: Even if they possess it, it is not logical that they are the cause.

original: rigs pa gzhan gyis so zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pa gzhan gyis so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is logical by other reasoning,

original: gnas skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not a state.

original: de'i phyir nus pa la brtag pa 'dis 'bras bu yod pa mi skye zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir nus pa la brtag pa 'dis 'bras bu yod pa mi skye zhing /
translated: Therefore, due to this analysis of potentiality, an existent effect does not arise,

original: yod med kyi phyogs la gsungs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyi ga las kyang skye ba med do //
analyzed: yod med kyi phyogs la gsungs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyi ga las kyang skye ba med do //
translated: and because the error of arising from both is entailed in the context of the positions of existence and nonexistence, arising from both is also not tenable.

original: yod pa dang med pa dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir gcig tu yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir gcig tu yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Because existence and nonexistence are mutually exclusive, they do not exist as one.

original: yod pa dang med pa rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyogs kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir cha med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyogs kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir cha med pa kho na'o //
translated: And because the position that existence and nonexistence are different in nature is also untenable, they are partless.

original: de skad du yang rkyen brtag pa las /
analyzed: de skad du yang rkyen brtag pa las /
translated: Thus, in the Examination of Conditions it is said:🔽When a phenomenon is not established as existent,

original: gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi grub ba //
analyzed: gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi grub ba //
translated: nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent,

original: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
translated: how could it be established as a cause?

original: de ltar yin na mi rigs so //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar yin na mi rigs so // zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it were, it would be illogical.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i byed pa po du ma dang byed pa po gcig tu smra ba ni /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i byed pa po du ma dang byed pa po gcig tu smra ba ni /
translated: The proponents of multiple agents such as Īśvara and the proponents of a single agent

original: rtag tu rim pa dang cig car dag las zhes pa la sogs pas tshang ma yin pa thams cad rnam par bcom pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtag tu rim pa dang cig car dag las zhes pa la sogs pas tshang ma yin pa thams cad rnam par bcom pa nyid do //
translated: “Always” and so on.

original: tshogs pa tsam kho na'i rim pas 'bras bu skye bar mthong bas de'i phyir gang gi tshe dngos po rnams kyi skye ba la ji lta ji ltar rnam par dpyad pa de lta de ltar brtag mi bzod do //
analyzed: tshogs pa tsam kho na'i rim pas 'bras bu skye bar mthong bas de'i phyir gang gi tshe dngos po rnams kyi skye ba la ji lta ji ltar rnam par dpyad pa de lta de ltar brtag mi bzod do //
translated: Since we see that effects arise in the mere sequence of the assembly, therefore, when the arising of things is analyzed, it is not able to withstand analysis.

original: 'o na mngon sum du rigs pa'i skye ba 'di la gnod pa ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mngon sum du rigs pa'i skye ba 'di la gnod pa ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: But what is the problem with this arising that is seen by direct perception?

original: bden te de lta mod kyi nges pa'i thabs gang zhig yod de /
analyzed: bden te de lta mod kyi nges pa'i thabs gang zhig yod de /
translated: It is true, but even so, what method is there for ascertaining it?

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas bsgrubs nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por brjod par bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas bsgrubs nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por brjod par bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Since it is established by direct perception and inference, the relation of cause and effect should be stated.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yang rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam pa med pa dag bsdus pa nyid du 'dzin par byed pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yang rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam pa med pa dag bsdus pa nyid du 'dzin par byed pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable that direct perception and inference apprehend only what is associated with aspects and what is not associated with aspects, respectively.

original: de la rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la ni re zhig yul byas pa'i snang ba dang bral na don du 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pas 'dis shes so zhes rnam par gzhag pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: de la rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la ni re zhig yul byas pa'i snang ba dang bral na don du 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pas 'dis shes so zhes rnam par gzhag pa mi rigs so //
translated: In the first case, if the object is devoid of the aspect, then since there is no entity that apprehends the object, it is illogical to posit that this consciousness cognizes the object.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la yang rnam pa'i don @154a * //🔽med pa la yang rmi lam la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams la dngos por gyur pas khyab pa med de /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la yang rnam pa'i don @154a * // med pa la yang rmi lam la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams la dngos por gyur pas khyab pa med de /
translated: In the second case, even if the object has an aspect, it is illogical to say that the object is the aspect itself, because the object is not the aspect.🔽In the third case, even if the object is devoid of the aspect, it is illogical to say that the object is the condition of the aspect, because the object is not the condition of the aspect.🔽In the fourth case, even if the object is devoid of the aspect, it is illogical to say that the object is the cause of the aspect, because the object is not the cause of the aspect.🔽In the fifth case, even if the object is devoid of the aspect, it is illogical to say that the object is the basis of the aspect, because the object is not the basis of the aspect.🔽In the sixth case, even if the object is devoid of the aspect, it is illogical to say that the object is the support of the aspect, because the object is not the support of the aspect.🔽In the seventh case, even if the object is devoid of the aspect, it is illogical to say that the object is the possessor of the aspect, because the object is not the possessor of the aspect.🔽In the eighth case, even if the object is devoid of the aspect, it is illogical to say that the object is the possessor of the aspect, because the object is not the possessor of the aspect.

original: ri mi'i rnam pa sbom po dang gcig pa ste rnam par shes pa med par mtshungs pa nyid pas mi rigs so //🔽de skad du /🔽shes pas yul ni 'dzin pa yi //🔽rnam pa med pa'ang mi rigs te //🔽rnam pa tshad ni med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ri mi'i rnam pa sbom po dang gcig pa ste rnam par shes pa med par mtshungs pa nyid pas mi rigs so // de skad du / shes pas yul ni 'dzin pa yi // rnam pa med pa'ang mi rigs te // rnam pa tshad ni med pa'i phyir //
translated: In the ninth case, even if the object is devoid of the aspect, it is illogical to say that the object is the possessor of the aspect, because the object is not the possessor of the aspect.🔽In the tenth case, even if the object is devoid of the aspect, it is illogical to say that the object is the possessor of the aspect, because the object is not the possessor of the aspect.🔽In the eleventh case, even if the object is devoid of the aspect, it is illogical to say that the object is the possessor of the aspect, because the object is not the possessor of the aspect.

original: cig shos kyang ni rigs ma yin //
analyzed: cig shos kyang ni rigs ma yin //
translated: In the twelfth case, even if the object is devoid of the aspect, it is illogical to say that the object is the possessor of the aspect, because the object is not the possessor of the aspect.🔽In the thirteenth case, even if the object is devoid of the aspect, it

original: zhes so // de ltar na shes pas thabs gzhan mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa nyid du gyur dang 'bras bu nyid du grub par thabs gzhan rnam par dpyad pa yang de lta ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes so // de ltar na shes pas thabs gzhan mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa nyid du gyur dang 'bras bu nyid du grub par thabs gzhan rnam par dpyad pa yang de lta ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, knowledge is established as the effect of the other means, perception and inference. The examination of the other means is also like that.

original: de la 'dir tshig gi bdag pos skye ba med pa'i chos brjod byar byed pa nyid kyis 'di la yod pas skye ba med pa'i chos can gyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dir tshig gi bdag pos skye ba med pa'i chos brjod byar byed pa nyid kyis 'di la yod pas skye ba med pa'i chos can gyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: Here, the Lord of Speech, by virtue of being the subject matter of the teaching of non-arisen phenomena, is the one who possesses the teaching of non-arisen phenomena.

original: chos thams cad tshig gi bdag po 'di yis zhes de ltar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad tshig gi bdag po 'di yis zhes de ltar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: All phenomena should be understood in this way, by this Lord of Speech.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi sku can bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi sku can bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: Moreover, the Blessed One is the one who possesses the wisdom-nature body of all the Tathagatas,

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is the nature of all phenomena.

original: de ltar yang dbu ma las gsungs pa /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gang //
analyzed: de ltar yang dbu ma las gsungs pa / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gang //
translated: Thus it is said in the Madhyamaka:🔽What is the nature of the Tathagata?

original: de ni gang 'di'i rang bzhin yin //
analyzed: de ni gang 'di'i rang bzhin yin //
translated: That is the nature of this.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rang bzhin med //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rang bzhin med //
translated: The Tathagata is essenceless.

original: 'gro ba 'di yi rang bzhin med //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di yi rang bzhin med //
translated: This world is essenceless.

original: ces so // bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: ces so // bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gsungs pa /
translated: The Lord also has said:

original: rtag ste skye med chos ni de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rtag ste skye med chos ni de bzhin gshegs //
translated: The Tathagata is permanent, his Dharma is unborn.

original: chos rnams kun kyang bde bar gshegs dang mtshungs //
analyzed: chos rnams kun kyang bde bar gshegs dang mtshungs //
translated: All dharmas are like the Sugata.

original: byis pa'i blo can mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnams //
analyzed: byis pa'i blo can mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnams //
translated: Those who have the mind of a child, who grasps signs,

original: 'jig rten dag na med pa'i chos la spyod //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na med pa'i chos la spyod //
translated: In the world, practices a Dharma that does not exist.

original: ces so // skye ba med pa'i chos can zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: ces so // skye ba med pa'i chos can zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The phrase “having the quality of being unborn” is an illustration.

original: 'gag pa med pa'i chos can zhes kyang thos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa'i chos can zhes kyang thos par 'gyur te /
translated: One should also understand the phrase “having the quality of being unceasing.”

original: skye ba mngon du song ba las 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba mngon du song ba las 'gag pa'o //
translated: It is because they are perceived as being born that they cease.

original: de skad du yang /🔽gang tshe chos rnams thams cad kyi //
analyzed: de skad du yang / gang tshe chos rnams thams cad kyi //
translated: As it is said:🔽When the arising

original: skye ba 'thad par mi 'gyur la //🔽de tshe chos rnams thams cad kyi //
analyzed: skye ba 'thad par mi 'gyur la // de tshe chos rnams thams cad kyi //
translated: Of any phenomenon is not tenable,🔽Then the ceasing

original: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Of any phenomenon is not tenable.

original: zhes so // skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi gnas pa yang don dam par med par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes so // skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi gnas pa yang don dam par med par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Exalted One has stated that the abiding of all things is ultimately non-existent, because of their non-production and non-cessation.

original: chos thams cad mtshan nyid gsum du gnas pa'i phyir de la ma stos pa'i rga shil sogs pa yang med @154b do ;
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan nyid gsum du gnas pa'i phyir de la ma stos pa'i rga shil sogs pa yang med @154b do ;
translated: Since all things abide in the three natures, aging and death, etc. are not independent of them.

original: / de med pa'i phyir 'dus byas la sogs pa thams cad kyang med par gsungs so //
analyzed: / de med pa'i phyir 'dus byas la sogs pa thams cad kyang med par gsungs so //
translated: Since they do not exist, he has stated that all things, such as the conditioned, do not exist.

original: de ltar gyur na skye ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad yod pa 'di ci zhe na bden te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na skye ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad yod pa 'di ci zhe na bden te /
translated: If that is so, how can the conventions of production, etc. exist? They do exist,

original: 'on kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: but they are like illusions, etc.

original: de yang sgyu ma bzhin du dngos po rnams don dam par skye ba med kyang tha snyad du skye ba la sogs pa ji lta ba de ltar thams cad du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sgyu ma bzhin du dngos po rnams don dam par skye ba med kyang tha snyad du skye ba la sogs pa ji lta ba de ltar thams cad du rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as an illusion is not produced, but appears to be produced, so also all things should be understood to be ultimately non-produced, but to appear to be produced conventionally.🔽Thus:

original: de ltar / rmi lam ji bzhin sgyu ma bzhin //
analyzed: de ltar / rmi lam ji bzhin sgyu ma bzhin //
translated: Like a dream, like an illusion,

original: dri za'i grong khyer ji bzhin du //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer ji bzhin du //
translated: like a city of the Gandharvas,

original: de bzhin skye dang de bzhin gnas //
analyzed: de bzhin skye dang de bzhin gnas //
translated: so is production, so is abiding,

original: de bzhin du ni 'jig par brjod //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni 'jig par brjod //
translated: So too, it is said to be destroyed.

original: ces so // gang de ltar yang med par gyur pa de la ni /
analyzed: ces so // gang de ltar yang med par gyur pa de la ni /
translated: And that which is thus non-existent,

original: 'dir gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin dang de las gzhan pa'ang ci yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin dang de las gzhan pa'ang ci yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: here, has no other nature than that of non-duality.

original: des na 'di khong du chud cing rig par srid pa gsum gyi dngos po ma lus pa so sor snang ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na 'di khong du chud cing rig par srid pa gsum gyi dngos po ma lus pa so sor snang ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that one who has understood and realized this, is free from the appearance of all things of the three worlds.

original: de ltar sgyu ma lta bu'i chos kyi de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar sgyu ma lta bu'i chos kyi de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because of the thorough knowledge of the reality of illusion-like phenomena,

original: rgyud dag par gyur pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyang thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis shes rab phul du byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: rgyud dag par gyur pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyang thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis shes rab phul du byung bar gyur te /
translated: even ordinary beings who have purified their continuums, through the stages of hearing, reflection, and meditation, etc., become endowed with the highest wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi 'khor lo bsgom pa la nye bar brtson ba rnams kyi phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi 'khor lo bsgom pa la nye bar brtson ba rnams kyi phyir /
translated: For the sake of those who are intent on the cultivation of the wheel of wisdom,

original: gsang sngags kyi rgyal po drug dang ldan pa'i aa yig la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi rgyal po drug dang ldan pa'i aa yig la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa /
translated: the six kings of mantra, the verses beginning with the letter A, etc., are taught.

original: aa a'a zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: aa a'a zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: A, ā, and so on.

original: thams cad kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi mchog par byed pa'i dbyangs bcu gnyis kyis ni ka yig la sogs pa'i ngo bo sum cu rtsa bzhi gsal bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi mchog par byed pa'i dbyangs bcu gnyis kyis ni ka yig la sogs pa'i ngo bo sum cu rtsa bzhi gsal bar byed pa ste /
translated: The thirty-four entities of the letter ka and so on are clarified by the twelve vowels that are supreme in the bodhicitta of all,

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa nyid yongs su snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa nyid yongs su snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: which is the complete appearance of the non-arising of all phenomena.

original: de rnams dang yang dag par ldan pa'i gsang sngags kyi lha rnams ni shes rab kyi 'khor lor bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams dang yang dag par ldan pa'i gsang sngags kyi lha rnams ni shes rab kyi 'khor lor bsgom par bya ste /
translated: The mantras and deities endowed with those should be meditated on in the wheel of wisdom.

original: thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: The definite meaning is that they are the cause for the arising of the gnosis of nondual method and wisdom.

original: de las dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i nges pa so sor rtogs par bya ba'i don du dbyangs bcu gnyis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de las dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i nges pa so sor rtogs par bya ba'i don du dbyangs bcu gnyis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavān taught the twelve vowels for the purpose of individually understanding the perfections and the stages.

original: de yang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu gnyis la goms pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa na rnam par smin par gyur pa'i sems kyi khyad par bcu gnyis ni sa rnams te lung las bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu gnyis la goms pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa na rnam par smin par gyur pa'i sems kyi khyad par bcu gnyis ni sa rnams te lung las bklag par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, when one has reached the culmination of the practice of the twelve perfections, the twelve special kinds of maturation of mind are the stages, as is to be learned from the scriptures.

original: de la @155a * //
analyzed: de la @155a * //
translated: Therein,

original: aa zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa don dam pa byang chub kyi sems rnam par thar pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin mos pas spyod pa'i sa ste /
analyzed: aa zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa don dam pa byang chub kyi sems rnam par thar pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin mos pas spyod pa'i sa ste /
translated: the syllable a is the stage of action through devoted interest, which is the nature of the mind of liberation, the ultimate mind of enlightenment, which is non-production, etc.

original: byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pa so sor rtogs par byed cing rin chen padma'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang mtshon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pa so sor rtogs par byed cing rin chen padma'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang mtshon par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the realization of the purity of the mind of enlightenment, and it also indicates the perfection of the jewel lotus.

original: a'a zhes bya ba ni chos dang zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa'i mtshan nyid can sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa gsal bar byed cing rab tu dga' ba'i sa mtshon par yang byed do //
analyzed: a'a zhes bya ba ni chos dang zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa'i mtshan nyid can sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa gsal bar byed cing rab tu dga' ba'i sa mtshon par yang byed do //
translated: The syllable ā is the stage of the joyous, which is the perfection of generosity, which has the nature of the gift of Dharma, material gifts, and the gift of protection, and which is brought to the culmination of perfection.

original: ai zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir sdom pa dang chos yang dag par sdud pa dang sems can gyi don byed pa'i mtshan nyid can tshul khrims kyi phra rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa gsal bar byed cing dri ma🔽med pa'i sa mtshon par yang byed do //
analyzed: ai zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir sdom pa dang chos yang dag par sdud pa dang sems can gyi don byed pa'i mtshan nyid can tshul khrims kyi phra rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa gsal bar byed cing dri ma med pa'i sa mtshon par yang byed do //
translated: The letter i indicates the perfection of morality, which is characterized by restraint, the correct gathering of the Dharma, and the benefit of sentient beings, and which is the clear manifestation of the practice of the perfection of morality, and it also indicates the Stainless ground.

original: a'i zhes bya ba ni 'di'i yan lag dang nying lag bcad kyang bzod par byed pas sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa dang gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la bzod pa dang chos la nges par sems pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin
analyzed: a'i zhes bya ba ni 'di'i yan lag dang nying lag bcad kyang bzod par byed pas sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa dang gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la bzod pa dang chos la nges par sems pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin
translated: The letter ai indicates the perfection of patience, which is characterized by the patience of not minding suffering, the patience of accepting harm from others, and the patience of reflecting on the Dharma, and it also indicates the Shining ground.

original: pa lhag par spyod pa gsal bar byed cing 'od byed pa'i sa mtshon par yang byed do //
analyzed: pa lhag par spyod pa gsal bar byed cing 'od byed pa'i sa mtshon par yang byed do //
translated: The letter o indicates the perfection of effort, which is characterized by the effort of great compassion, the effort of gathering virtue, and the effort of benefiting others, and it also indicates the Radiant ground.

original: au zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang mes kyi rigs kyi chos tshogs rab tu sgrub pa dang / sems can gyi don gyis rjes su bcings pa dang / sangs rgyas zhing yongs su sbyong ba ste /
analyzed: au zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang mes kyi rigs kyi chos tshogs rab tu sgrub pa dang / sems can gyi don gyis rjes su bcings pa dang / sangs rgyas zhing yongs su sbyong ba ste /
translated: The syllable u indicates the perfection of effort, which is characterized by enthusiasm for the three kinds of things: the practice of the teachings of the spiritual levels of the bodhisattvas, the benefit of sentient beings, and the purification of the buddhaverse.

original: rnam pa gsum la spro ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa gsal par byed cing 'od 'phro ba can gyi sa mtshon par yang byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum la spro ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa gsal par byed cing 'od 'phro ba can gyi sa mtshon par yang byed do //
translated: It also indicates the Brilliant ground, which is characterized by the practice of the perfection of effort.

original: a'u zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad lhag pa dang chad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: a'u zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad lhag pa dang chad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The syllable ū indicates the perfection of wisdom, which is characterized by the three kinds of things: the nonapprehension of all things, the nonapprehension of the bodhisattva, and the nonapprehension of the perfection of wisdom.🔽It also indicates the Difficult to Conquer ground, which is characterized by the practice of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The syllable ū indicates the perfection of meditative concentration, which is characterized by the three kinds of things: freedom from faults, the state of meditative concentration, and mastery.

original: skyon dang bral ba dang / gnas par byed pa dang / rnam par 'byor pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa gsal par byed cing shin tu sbyang dka' ba'i sa yang mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: skyon dang bral ba dang / gnas par byed pa dang / rnam par 'byor pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa gsal par byed cing shin tu sbyang dka' ba'i sa yang mtshon par byed do //
translated: It also indicates the ground called Very Difficult to Conquer, which is characterized by the practice of the perfection of meditative concentration.

original: ae zhes bya ba ni mtha' gcig tu rnyog pa mtha' dag dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad ni zhi ba'o zhes khyod du chud de /
analyzed: ae zhes bya ba ni mtha' gcig tu rnyog pa mtha' dag dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad ni zhi ba'o zhes khyod du chud de /
translated: The syllable ai means that one should understand that all phenomena are peace, because they are free from all the defilements of the extremes.

original: thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab rnam pa gsum la lhag par spyod pa gsal bar byed cing mngon du gyur pa'i sa yang mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab rnam pa gsum la lhag par spyod pa gsal bar byed cing mngon du gyur pa'i sa yang mtshon par byed do //
translated: It also indicates the stage of Illumination, because it causes one to engage in the three kinds of wisdom that arise from hearing, reflection, and meditation, and it causes one to manifest them.🔽The syllable ai means that one should understand the perfection of means, because it has the three characteristics of eliminating one's own faults, engaging in the welfare of sentient beings, and quickly attaining full enlightenment, due to entering the nonconceptual realm of the buddhas, which is spontaneous and free from extremes.

original: @155b aee zhes bya ba ni mtha' gcig tu lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la 'jug pa'i phyir rang gi skyon spong ba dang / sems can gyi don la 'jug pa dang / myur du mngon par byang chub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid rnam gsum dang ldan pa'i thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa rab tu rtogs par byed cing ring du song ba'i sa yang mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: @155b aee zhes bya ba ni mtha' gcig tu lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la 'jug pa'i phyir rang gi skyon spong ba dang / sems can gyi don la 'jug pa dang / myur du mngon par byang chub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid rnam gsum dang ldan pa'i thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa rab tu rtogs par byed cing ring du song ba'i sa yang mtshon par byed do //
translated: It also indicates the stage of Gone Afar, because it causes one to engage in the perfection of means.

original: ao yig ni rnam par rtog pa'i chu bo las rgal ba nyid kyi tshogs rab tu sgrub pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba ste mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag pa nas mngon par gsal bar byed cing mi g-yo ba'i sa mtshon par yang byed do //
analyzed: ao yig ni rnam par rtog pa'i chu bo las rgal ba nyid kyi tshogs rab tu sgrub pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba ste mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag pa nas mngon par gsal bar byed cing mi g-yo ba'i sa mtshon par yang byed do //
translated: The letter O is the perfection of vow, which has three characteristics: the accomplishment of the collection of the crossing over of the river of conceptual thought, the performance of the aims of sentient beings, and the purification of the buddha-field. It is explained as the practice of the perfection of vow, and it also indicates the stage Immovable.

original: aoo yig ni dpe las 'das pa'i chos can smra ba po nyid kyis las zlog par byed pa dang nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa dang bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba zlog par byed pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa'i stobs kyi pha rol tu
analyzed: aoo yig ni dpe las 'das pa'i chos can smra ba po nyid kyis las zlog par byed pa dang nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa dang bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba zlog par byed pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa'i stobs kyi pha rol tu
translated: The letter O is the perfection of power, which has three characteristics: the reversal of karma by the state of being a speaker who is beyond example, the abandonment of afflictions, and the reversal of demons and opponents.

original: phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa nyid 'chad par byed cing sa legs pa'i blo gros mtshon par yang byed do //
analyzed: phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa nyid 'chad par byed cing sa legs pa'i blo gros mtshon par yang byed do //
translated: It is explained as the practice of the perfection of power, and it also indicates the stage Good Intelligence.

original: aam zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i mthar son pa nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa med pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i thabs la lkog tu ma gyur pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi mthar son pa nyid rnam par 'byed par byed cing chos kyi sprin gyis mtshon par yang byed do ;
analyzed: aam zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i mthar son pa nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa med pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i thabs la lkog tu ma gyur pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi mthar son pa nyid rnam par 'byed par byed cing chos kyi sprin gyis mtshon par yang byed do ;
translated: The syllable aṃ indicates the perfection of wisdom, which is endowed with three aspects: the nonconceptual, the sameness of the conceptual and the nonconceptual, and the unobstructed means for accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings. It is the perfection of wisdom that has reached the highest degree of excellence. It is what distinguishes and characterizes the bodhisattva stage Cloud of Dharma.

original: / aa:zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes snang ba'i ngo bo g-yo ba med cing mi phyed pa gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid can de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje las kyi pha rol tu phyin
analyzed: / aa:zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes snang ba'i ngo bo g-yo ba med cing mi phyed pa gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid can de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje las kyi pha rol tu phyin
translated: The syllable aḥ indicates the perfection of vajra activity, which is the nature of the tathāgatas, the essence of nondual suchness, the indivisible and unmoving essence of the light of the wisdom of omniscience.

original: pa rab kyi mthar son pa lhag par rtogs pa nyid kyis bya ba byas pa'i phyir sems can gyi don gyi bya ba mtha' dag la lhun gyis grub pas gsal bar 'jug pa dang / kun du 'od sangs rgyas kyi sa mtshon par yang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: pa rab kyi mthar son pa lhag par rtogs pa nyid kyis bya ba byas pa'i phyir sems can gyi don gyi bya ba mtha' dag la lhun gyis grub pas gsal bar 'jug pa dang / kun du 'od sangs rgyas kyi sa mtshon par yang byed pa yin no //
translated: The stage of Universal Radiance is also indicated by the syllable of the vowel o, because it is the stage of the bodhisattva who has attained the highest perfection, who is engaged in the activity of the performance of the function of realization, and who is engaged in the activity of the benefit of sentient beings by means of spontaneous accomplishment.

original: pha rol tu phyin ba bcu gnyis rdang sa bcu gnyis po rnams kyang dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu gnyis pos gsal bar byed @156a * //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin ba bcu gnyis rdang sa bcu gnyis po rnams kyang dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu gnyis pos gsal bar byed @156a * //
translated: The twelve perfections and the twelve stages are also indicated by the twelve syllables of the vowels.

original: pa'i shes rab kyi 'khor lor kun nas phyi'i mu khyud thams cad la te /
analyzed: pa'i shes rab kyi 'khor lor kun nas phyi'i mu khyud thams cad la te /
translated: The wheel of wisdom is completely surrounded by all the outer circles.

original: de yang phyi rol du ni ka la sogs pa nas ksha'i mthar thug par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang phyi rol du ni ka la sogs pa nas ksha'i mthar thug par sbyar ro //
translated: And that is applied externally from ka up to kṣa.

original: de la 'khor lo rtsibs drug pa'i lte ba la mu:aom zhes pa yi ge gsum mo //
analyzed: de la 'khor lo rtsibs drug pa'i lte ba la mu:aom zhes pa yi ge gsum mo //
translated: There, in the center of the wheel with six spokes, there are the three syllables muḥ, aḥ, and oṃ.

original: shar la sogs pa'i rtsibs rnams la g-yas skor gyis badzra t'ikshna la sogs pa'i gsang sngas drug sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i rtsibs rnams la g-yas skor gyis badzra t'ikshna la sogs pa'i gsang sngas drug sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: On the spokes beginning with the east, the six secret mantras beginning with vajra-tīkṣṇa are applied in a clockwise direction.

original: thams cad kyang kha dog dkar po lus thams cad snang bar byed pa snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang kha dog dkar po lus thams cad snang bar byed pa snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bsam par bya'o //
translated: All of them are white in color, illuminating the entire body, and should be imagined on a moon disc at the heart.

original: rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i 'khor lo'i lte ba'i dbus su aom /
analyzed: rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i 'khor lo'i lte ba'i dbus su aom /
translated: In the center of the hub of the twelve-spoked wheel, there is OṂ.

original: de nas mdun du h'um /
analyzed: de nas mdun du h'um /
translated: Then, in front, there is HŪṂ.

original: rgyab tu hr'i: g-yas su aam /
analyzed: rgyab tu hr'i: g-yas su aam /
translated: In the back, there is HRĪḤ.🔽On the right, there is AṂ.

original: g-yon du aa:zhes bya'o //
analyzed: g-yon du aa:zhes bya'o //
translated: On the left, there is AḤ.

original: shar la sogs pa'i rtsibs rnams su rim pas /
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i rtsibs rnams su rim pas /
translated: On the spokes beginning with the east, in order,🔽there are the following:

translated: At the beginning of each of the twelve spokes, one should imagine OṂ and at the end, NAMAḤ.

original: 'khor lo de rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i snying po can sa bcu gnyis dang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu gnyis dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis te /

translated: Those wheels are endowed with the essence of the five transcendent ones, the twelve stages, the twelve perfections, and the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad bsags pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes snang ba'i ngo bo de snying gar zla ba'i steng du rnam par bsams la /

translated: The essence of the light of the gnosis of omniscience, which is the accumulation of all the qualities of a buddha, is imagined on a moon at the heart.🔽The collection of white, red, and other lights that arise from that radiate and emerge, illuminating the inside of the body and emerging outside,

analyzed: yang rtsibs brgyad pa'i 'khor lo'i lte ba la /
translated: In the center of the eight-spoked wheel,

original: aa / phyogs rnams su /
analyzed: aa / phyogs rnams su /
translated: a. In the directions,

original: ra / pa /
analyzed: ra / pa /
translated: ra, pa,

original: tsa / na /
analyzed: tsa / na /
translated: ca, na,

original: phyogs bral rnams su /
analyzed: phyogs bral rnams su /
translated: in the intermediate directions,

original: wa / tsa /
analyzed: wa / tsa /
translated: vā, ca,

original: spa / ti /
analyzed: spa / ti /
translated: spa, ti.

original: rtsibs brgyad pa'i 'khor lo drug po de rnams su yi ge yod pa de rnams ni shes rab lha bar bskyed pa'i phyir kha dog dkar por bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsibs brgyad pa'i 'khor lo drug po de rnams su yi ge yod pa de rnams ni shes rab lha bar bskyed pa'i phyir kha dog dkar por bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The letters that are in these six eight-spoked wheels are to be meditated on as white in color, because they are generated as the wisdom deities.

original: // da ni gsol ba btab pa'i de ma thag tu de legs par bstan par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pas mtshan gyi rang gi ngo bo'i don yang dag par brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // da ni gsol ba btab pa'i de ma thag tu de legs par bstan par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pas mtshan gyi rang gi ngo bo'i don yang dag par brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, immediately after the supplication, in order to perfectly express the meaning of the nature of the name, [the Bhagavān] says, I will teach that well.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bden pa gnyis la brten te sgyu ma'i chos kyi nye bar bzung nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bden pa gnyis la brten te sgyu ma'i chos kyi nye bar bzung nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: The Bhagavān, based on the two truths, taught the illusory phenomena,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: as in thus.

original: 'di ltar gyi sgra ni kun du 'byung bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gyi sgra ni kun du 'byung bar ston pa'o //
translated: The word thus indicates occurrence.

original: yang na lan gyi skabs su zhal gyis bzhes pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: yang na lan gyi skabs su zhal gyis bzhes pa gang yin pa de /
translated: Or, in the context of the reply, whatever is accepted,

original: de nges par bstan par bya'i zhes pa ste de ni sgra'i rim pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nges par bstan par bya'i zhes pa ste de ni sgra'i rim pa'i don to //
translated: that is to be taught. That is the meaning of the sequence of words.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: bcom ldan zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Bhagavān and so on.

original: sangs rgyas aa yig las byung zhes pa tshig gi don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas aa yig las byung zhes pa tshig gi don to //
translated: Buddha arisen from the letter A is the meaning of the words.

original: ci nyan thos la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin nam zhes gsungs pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: ci nyan thos la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin nam zhes gsungs pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa ste /
translated: Is it the Buddha of the śrāvakas and so on? is stated as perfect buddha.

original: yang dag par rdzogs sangs rgyas zhes pa'i don to //🔽de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs sangs rgyas zhes pa'i don to // de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of “perfect buddha” is “one who has realized the ultimate reality of all phenomena.”

original: bcom ldan zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan zhes pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān is so called because he has conquered the four māras.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ji ltar rgyal bas dang phyug sangs //🔽thams @157a * //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal bas dang phyug sangs // thams @157a * //
translated: Just as the Victorious One is called “victorious”🔽because he has conquered all,

original: cad 'dul zhing 'joms mdzad pa //
analyzed: cad 'dul zhing 'joms mdzad pa //
translated: and “rich” because he has attained all riches,

original: de bzhin 'dir yang shes bya ste //🔽des na 'di ni bcom ldan brjod //
analyzed: de bzhin 'dir yang shes bya ste // des na 'di ni bcom ldan brjod //
translated: so too is he called “conqueror”🔽because he has conquered all,🔽and “rich” because he has attained all riches.

original: ces so // de la rgyal ba zhes pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces so // de la rgyal ba zhes pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Here, “victorious” means “perfect buddha.”

original: yang na phung po la sogs pa bdud bzhi bcom pa dang ldan pas bcom ldan no //
analyzed: yang na phung po la sogs pa bdud bzhi bcom pa dang ldan pas bcom ldan no //
translated: Alternatively, he is called “Bhagavān” because he possesses the conquest of the four māras, such as the aggregates.

original: na yig phyis pa ni nges pa'i tshig las so //
analyzed: na yig phyis pa ni nges pa'i tshig las so //
translated: The suffix -n is added according to the rules of Sanskrit grammar.

original: dngos po'i de kho na nyid ji ltar gnas pa rtogs pa dang ldan pas sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na nyid ji ltar gnas pa rtogs pa dang ldan pas sangs rgyas so //
translated: He is a “buddha” because he possesses the realization of the ultimate reality of things just as it is.

original: rnam pa thams cad rnam pa med par yang dag par rtogs pa dang ldan pas rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rnam pa med par yang dag par rtogs pa dang ldan pas rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te /
translated: He is a “perfect buddha” because he possesses the realization of all aspects as devoid of aspects.

original: byed pa po nyid kyi phyir ni shshi'i rkyen can no //
analyzed: byed pa po nyid kyi phyir ni shshi'i rkyen can no //
translated: The suffix -n is added because he is the agent.

original: de yang 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas bu dhi la byed pa po nyid la nishth'a rab tu 'gyur bar gsungs te /🔽rtag pa dang ni chad pa bral //
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas bu dhi la byed pa po nyid la nishth'a rab tu 'gyur bar gsungs te / rtag pa dang ni chad pa bral //
translated: The agent is not the same as the action.

original: mtshon bya dang ni mtshan nyid spangs //
analyzed: mtshon bya dang ni mtshan nyid spangs //
translated: The object and the characteristic are abandoned.

original: gtso bos rmi lam sgyu sogs bzhin //
