analyzed: gtso bos rmi lam sgyu sogs bzhin //
translated: The principal one is like a dream, an illusion, and so forth.

original: 'khor ba nges par rtogs pa lags //
analyzed: 'khor ba nges par rtogs pa lags //
translated: Samsara is definitely realized.🔽As for the letter A, it is the door of all phenomena because it is non-arisen.

original: zhes so // aa zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa la sogs pas dngos po'i chos rnams skyes ba med pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sa bon las aa yig mi 'gyur
analyzed: zhes so // aa zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa la sogs pas dngos po'i chos rnams skyes ba med pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sa bon las aa yig mi 'gyur
translated: By such statements, one should understand that the nature of non-dual wisdom, the non-arisen phenomena, is the seed of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ba nyid rdzogs pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu aa yig las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ba nyid rdzogs pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu aa yig las byung ba'o //
translated: Because of the perfection of the immutability of the letter A, it arises from the letter A on the conventional level.

original: don dam par ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi bcom ldan 'das aa yig las ma byung ba nyid du byung bar shes par bya zhing /
analyzed: don dam par ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi bcom ldan 'das aa yig las ma byung ba nyid du byung bar shes par bya zhing /
translated: But ultimately, one should understand that the Bhagavat, who is of the nature of the dharmadhatu, arises from the letter A without arising.

original: des nye bar mtshon nas chos thams cad kyang yig las byung ba'o zhes rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: des nye bar mtshon nas chos thams cad kyang yig las byung ba'o zhes rtogs par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that all phenomena are also produced from letters,

original: de rnams kyang de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyang de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have that as their nature.

original: ji skad du /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gang //
analyzed: ji skad du / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gang //
translated: As it is said:🔽The nature of the Tathāgata

original: 'go ba de yi rang bzhin de //
analyzed: 'go ba de yi rang bzhin de //
translated: is the nature of the sentient being.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: de yi ge du ma las byung yang aa yig gtso bor byas pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yi ge du ma las byung yang aa yig gtso bor byas pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Although that is produced from many letters, it is said that the letter A is primary.

original: aa yig ces pa logs pa ste /
analyzed: aa yig ces pa logs pa ste /
translated: The letter A is supreme.

original: ci ltar yig 'bru kun gyi mchog yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar yig 'bru kun gyi mchog yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Why is it the best of all letters? It is said:

original: yi ge dam pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge dam pa zhes pa ste /
translated: The holy letter.

original: 'di thams cad las phul du byung ba'i phyir dam pa'o //
analyzed: 'di thams cad las phul du byung ba'i phyir dam pa'o //
translated: It is holy because it is the best of all.

original: chos kyi dbyings mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir yi ge'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir yi ge'o //
translated: It is a letter because it is the nature of the unchanging realm of phenomena.

original: 'gyur ba med pa'i mchog chos kyi sku la de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i mchog chos kyi sku la de ltar bshad do //
translated: It is explained in that way in the supreme unchanging dharma body.

original: de las kyang sems can gyi phung po chen po'i don 'byung bas na don chen te /
analyzed: de las kyang sems can gyi phung po chen po'i don 'byung bas na don chen te /
translated: And because the great mass of sentient beings arises from that, it is of great meaning.

original: @157b don chen po yang yin la chos kyi sku bdag por gyur ba nyid kyang yin pas sems can rnams kyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: @157b don chen po yang yin la chos kyi sku bdag por gyur ba nyid kyang yin pas sems can rnams kyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: It is also a great purpose, and it is the very lord of the Dharma Body, and thus it is the perfect benefit of sentient beings.

original: de nyid kyang /
analyzed: de nyid kyang /
translated: And that is also

original: 'gro rnams zhi ba'i las rnams ni //
analyzed: 'gro rnams zhi ba'i las rnams ni //
translated: the pacifying activities for transmigrators,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa mgon po byams pas mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan du rgya cher gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa mgon po byams pas mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan du rgya cher gsungs te /
translated: and so forth, extensively taught by the protector Maitreya in the Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: chos kyi sku yi phrin las ni //
analyzed: chos kyi sku yi phrin las ni //
translated: The activity of the Dharma Body

original: rnam pa nyid shu dun du bzhed //
analyzed: rnam pa nyid shu dun du bzhed //
translated: is accepted as having twenty-seven aspects.

original: ces pa phrin las rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun po de yang rtogs par byas te /
analyzed: ces pa phrin las rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun po de yang rtogs par byas te /
translated: And that activity is of twenty-seven aspects, which should be understood.

original: 'dir ni mngas pa 'jigs pa'i phyir mi bri'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni mngas pa 'jigs pa'i phyir mi bri'o //
translated: But here it is not written because of fear of verbosity.

original: don chen po de gsal bar byed pa'i phyir aa yig kyang don chen po'o //
analyzed: don chen po de gsal bar byed pa'i phyir aa yig kyang don chen po'o //
translated: The letter A is also a great purpose because it illuminates that great purpose.

original: sngags kyi tshul la ni aa yig ces pa mi bskyod pa dang 'od dpag med do //
analyzed: sngags kyi tshul la ni aa yig ces pa mi bskyod pa dang 'od dpag med do //
translated: In the system of mantra, the letter A is Akṣobhya and Amitābha.

original: kha dog kun gyi mchog ces pa la /
analyzed: kha dog kun gyi mchog ces pa la /
translated: Supreme of all colors

original: dkar po dang nag po la sogs pa'i kha dog thams cad kyi mchog ni sna tshogs yin pa'i phyir kha dog kun gyi mchog ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: dkar po dang nag po la sogs pa'i kha dog thams cad kyi mchog ni sna tshogs yin pa'i phyir kha dog kun gyi mchog ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: The supreme of all colors, white, black, and so forth, is the variegated, and so Amoghasiddhi is the supreme of all colors.

original: don chen ni rin chen 'byung ldan te /
analyzed: don chen ni rin chen 'byung ldan te /
translated: Great meaning is Ratnasaṃbhava,

original: sems can thams cad kyi don chen po gang las byung ba'i yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che 'chang ba ni rin chen 'byung ldan yin pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don chen po gang las byung ba'i yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che 'chang ba ni rin chen 'byung ldan yin pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: because he is the holder of the wish-fulfilling jewel that arises from the great meaning of all sentient beings.

original: yi ge dam pa zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: yi ge dam pa zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
translated: The supreme syllable is Vairocana,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku rdo rje'i rang bzhin nyid yi ge med pas na zhes sbyar te sangs rgyas lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku rdo rje'i rang bzhin nyid yi ge med pas na zhes sbyar te sangs rgyas lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: because he is the nature of the vajra body of all tathāgatas, and because he is the nature of the five buddhas.

original: de nyid ces pa sbyar te /
analyzed: de nyid ces pa sbyar te /
translated: The supreme syllable is Vairocana,🔽because he is the nature of the vajra body of all tathāgatas, and because he is the nature of the five buddhas.🔽That itself is the life of living beings,

original: de nyid srog chags rnams kyi srog / de nyid mchog tu mi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: de nyid srog chags rnams kyi srog / de nyid mchog tu mi 'gyur ba //
translated: that itself is the supreme unchanging,

original: de nyid kun la khyab pa po //
analyzed: de nyid kun la khyab pa po //
translated: that itself is all-pervading,

original: de ni lus can kun la gnas //
analyzed: de ni lus can kun la gnas //
translated: that itself is present in all embodied beings.

original: zhes pa'i rigs pas kun la gnas zhes pa'i rigs pas gnyis su med pa'i nges shes kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi srog chen po'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i rigs pas kun la gnas zhes pa'i rigs pas gnyis su med pa'i nges shes kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi srog chen po'o //
translated: By the reasoning of “abiding in all,” the great life-force is the nature of the nondual ascertainment.

original: sngar gsungs pa'i rigs pas gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir aa yig ni skye ba med pa yin la /
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa'i rigs pas gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir aa yig ni skye ba med pa yin la /
translated: By the reasoning stated previously, since [the deity] is primordially unborn, the letter A is nonarising.

original: de las byung ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyang skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyang skye ba med pa'o //
translated: Since [the deity] arises from that, the Bhagavān is also nonarising.

original: de nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na /
translated: Thus:

original: dngos med las byung khyod la 'dud //
analyzed: dngos med las byung khyod la 'dud //
translated: I bow to you, who arise from nonentity.

original: ces pa'o // de ltar skye ba med pa la gnas pa dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba rnams zad cing bral te rnam par rtog pas rnam par dbyer du med pa'i phyir tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa'o // de ltar skye ba med pa la gnas pa dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba rnams zad cing bral te rnam par rtog pas rnam par dbyer du med pa'i phyir tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa'o //
translated: In that way, abiding in nonarising, going and coming cease, and since they are inseparable by means of conceptuality, verbal expression is abandoned.

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: However:

original: sems can bsam pa'i dbang gis na //
analyzed: sems can bsam pa'i dbang gis na //
translated: By the power of sentient beings’ aspirations,

original: de la bdag po yod min yang //🔽ji ltar 'dod pa rtsig pa @158a * //
analyzed: de la bdag po yod min yang // ji ltar 'dod pa rtsig pa @158a * //
translated: though it has no owner,🔽like a wall and so on,

original: sogs // rnam las kyang ni chos ston 'byung //
analyzed: sogs // rnam las kyang ni chos ston 'byung //
translated: the teaching of the dharma arises from the mind.

original: zhes pa'i rig pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i rig pas so //
translated: This is the reasoning.

original: brjod pa kun gyi rgyu'i mchog ste rang bzhin la sogs pa'i tshul lugs mngon par brjod pa rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa yang yin la /
analyzed: brjod pa kun gyi rgyu'i mchog ste rang bzhin la sogs pa'i tshul lugs mngon par brjod pa rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa yang yin la /
translated: It is also the supreme cause of all expressions, since it is the cause of the systems of expressions such as the nature.

original: gtso bor gyur pas mchog kyang yin te rje btsun ni brjod pa kun gyi rgu'i mchog ste 'bras bu'i rang bzhin nyid du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bor gyur pas mchog kyang yin te rje btsun ni brjod pa kun gyi rgu'i mchog ste 'bras bu'i rang bzhin nyid du gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is also supreme because it is the principal one. The Exalted One is the supreme cause of all expressions, since he is the nature of the result.

original: tshig kun zhes pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: tshig kun zhes pa la sogs pa la /
translated: All words and so forth.

original: 'gro ba drug gi sems can dang 'brel pa'i phyir kun kyang yin la gsung rdo rje'i rang bzhin yang yin pa'i tshig ces pa ni tshig kun no //
analyzed: 'gro ba drug gi sems can dang 'brel pa'i phyir kun kyang yin la gsung rdo rje'i rang bzhin yang yin pa'i tshig ces pa ni tshig kun no //
translated: All is so called because it is related to the sentient beings of the six realms, and it is words, since it is the nature of the vajra of speech.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i shes rab kyi snang ba thams cad du 'phro ba'i phyir rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i shes rab kyi snang ba thams cad du 'phro ba'i phyir rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is very clear, since the light of the wisdom that is completely pure by nature radiates everywhere.

original: yang na tshig kun ni lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang srin po la sogs pa'i skad rnams kyis chos yongs su ston pa'i phyir bar byed pas na shin tu gsal ba'i dang tshul dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na tshig kun ni lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang srin po la sogs pa'i skad rnams kyis chos yongs su ston pa'i phyir bar byed pas na shin tu gsal ba'i dang tshul dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Or else, all words are the words of gods, nagas, yakshas, rakshasas, etc. , because they are the means of teaching the Dharma.

original: tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
translated: All words are made clear,🔽because they are endowed with the manner of the clear light.

original: ces tshig gcig tu bya'o //
analyzed: ces tshig gcig tu bya'o //
translated: One should make this one verse.

original: gang srog chen po zhes pa aa yig las byung ba nyid du 'ga' zhig 'chad par byed pa de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang srog chen po zhes pa aa yig las byung ba nyid du 'ga' zhig 'chad par byed pa de ni ma yin te /
translated: Some explain that the great life is just that which arises from the letter A. That is not so.

original: yang dag ces pas gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag ces pas gzhan pa'o //
translated: It is correct because it is different.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das aa yig las byung bar bstan pa de ltar rje btsun la yang thos so zhes so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das aa yig las byung bar bstan pa de ltar rje btsun la yang thos so zhes so //
translated: Because the Bhagavat is taught as arising from the letter A, so also the Lord is heard.

original: da ni nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems kyi yan la gnyid kyis bdag nyid chen por ston par mdzad pa ni mchod pa chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems kyi yan la gnyid kyis bdag nyid chen por ston par mdzad pa ni mchod pa chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the Bhagavat teaches the great self of sleep on the path of the bodhicitta, the great self of the afflictions. The great worship, etc., is as follows.

original: mchod pa'i sgra ni sgo ba'i don to //
analyzed: mchod pa'i sgra ni sgo ba'i don to //
translated: The word worship has the meaning of covering.

original: de yang dga' ston la rang gi 'dod pa bzhin 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de yang dga' ston la rang gi 'dod pa bzhin 'jug pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is the engagement in desire as one wishes.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa 'phel zhing rgyas pa nyid do zhes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa 'phel zhing rgyas pa nyid do zhes pa'i bar ro //
translated: It is the increase and expansion of desire as one wishes.

original: mchod pa chen po gang yin pa de yang 'di yin la 'dod chags chen po yang yin pas na mchod pa chen po 'dod chags che'o //
analyzed: mchod pa chen po gang yin pa de yang 'di yin la 'dod chags chen po yang yin pas na mchod pa chen po 'dod chags che'o //
translated: It is the great worship, and it is great desire, thus it is the great worship of desire.

original: mthar phyin pa'i 'dod chags kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thobs pa nyid ni 'dod chags chen po zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa'i 'dod chags kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thobs pa nyid ni 'dod chags chen po zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of great desire is the attainment of the perfection of desire that has gone to the end.

original: 'o na lha chen po yang 'dod chags chen po yin te /
analyzed: 'o na lha chen po yang 'dod chags chen po yin te /
translated: Now, the great god is also great desire,

original: de'i lha'i lo stong du 'khrig pa chen po bsten pa la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i lha'i lo stong du 'khrig pa chen po bsten pa la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is engaged in great sex for a thousand divine years.

original: des na mngon par rtogs pa 'di ci zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: des na mngon par rtogs pa 'di ci zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, what is this clear realization?

original: sems can thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i gzugs @158b dang bcas pa'i dga' ba las byung nas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i gzugs @158b dang bcas pa'i dga' ba las byung nas /
translated: It is said: “all sentient beings” and so on. All sentient beings arise from the pleasure of form that is the cause of samsara.

original: zag pa med pa rgyun mi 'chad cing phul du byung ba'i mchog tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyis dga' bar byed pas na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa rgyun mi 'chad cing phul du byung ba'i mchog tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyis dga' bar byed pas na /
translated: Since it is the cause of the uninterrupted, supreme, and sublime bliss of the uncontaminated, it delights.

original: sems can thams cad dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: It delights all sentient beings.

original: lha chen po ni de lta bu ma yin te dga' ba skyed pa'i de kho na nyid yongs sum shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha chen po ni de lta bu ma yin te dga' ba skyed pa'i de kho na nyid yongs sum shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great god is not like that, because he does not know the reality of generating bliss.

original: goo r'i gcig pu yang dga' bar byed ma nus zhes pa'o //
analyzed: goo r'i gcig pu yang dga' bar byed ma nus zhes pa'o //
translated: Even Gauri alone cannot generate bliss.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad ston par yang 'gyur te /🔽cig car 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa'i rdul phra rab so sor gnas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i nang du chud pa'i mchod pa chen po'i bkod pa'i rang bzhin spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo'i chu skyes su yang dag par zhugs pa'i rdo rje kun
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad ston par yang 'gyur te / cig car 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa'i rdul phra rab so sor gnas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i nang du chud pa'i mchod pa chen po'i bkod pa'i rang bzhin spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo'i chu skyes su yang dag par zhugs pa'i rdo rje kun
translated: This also teaches the following.🔽The great array of offerings that are included in the maṇḍala wheels of the individual atoms of infinite world systems simultaneously enter the lotus of the goddess such as Lochana, which is the nature of the great array of offerings.

original: du reg pa las skyes pa rgyun mi 'chad cing mchod tu dga' ba'i bde ba chen pos dga' bar byed pas na /
analyzed: du reg pa las skyes pa rgyun mi 'chad cing mchod tu dga' ba'i bde ba chen pos dga' bar byed pas na /
translated: Since the vajra that arises from the union of the two is the cause of the uninterrupted, supreme, and sublime bliss of great delight, it delights.

original: mchod pa chen po 'dod chags che //
analyzed: mchod pa chen po 'dod chags che //
translated: The great offering is great passion.

original: sems can thams cad dga' bar byed //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dga' bar byed //
translated: It delights all sentient beings.🔽The samadhi called “bringing all sentient beings under control” is as follows:

original: ces so // de la sems can thams cad dbang du byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni dang po stong pa nyid bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du ho yig las byung ba'i mda' las grub pa bdag nyid 'dod chags chen po'i gzugs
analyzed: ces so // de la sems can thams cad dbang du byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni dang po stong pa nyid bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du ho yig las byung ba'i mda' las grub pa bdag nyid 'dod chags chen po'i gzugs
translated: Having first meditated on emptiness, one arises as the form of Great Passion,

original: dmar ser sgeg pa'i nyams dang / ldan pa /
analyzed: dmar ser sgeg pa'i nyams dang / ldan pa /
translated: a red-orange figure with a charming expression,

original: rol pa'i stobs kyis gnas pa /
analyzed: rol pa'i stobs kyis gnas pa /
translated: standing in the posture of dance,

original: zhal bzhi pa /
analyzed: zhal bzhi pa /
translated: with four faces,

original: phyag brgyad pa /
analyzed: phyag brgyad pa /
translated: and eight arms.

original: zhal dang po dmar ser /🔽g-yas pa gur gu ma ltar dmar ba /🔽rgyab zhal padma ltar dmar ba /
analyzed: zhal dang po dmar ser / g-yas pa gur gu ma ltar dmar ba / rgyab zhal padma ltar dmar ba /
translated: The first face is red-orange,🔽the right face is red like a parrot,🔽the rear face is red like a lotus,

original: g-yon pa dmar ser /🔽phyag gnyis na mda' dang gzhu bsnams pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa dmar ser / phyag gnyis na mda' dang gzhu bsnams pa /
translated: and the left face is red-orange.🔽Two of the hands hold a bow and arrow,

original: gzhan pa gnyis kyis zhags pa dang lcags kyu 'dzin pa /
analyzed: gzhan pa gnyis kyis zhags pa dang lcags kyu 'dzin pa /
translated: and the other two hold a noose and a goad.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gnyis kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam dang ral gri 'dzin pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gnyis kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam dang ral gri 'dzin pa /
translated: Likewise, the other two hold the Perfection of Wisdom scripture and a sword.

original: yang gzhan gnyis kyis rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: yang gzhan gnyis kyis rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa rnam par bsams la /
translated: Again, the other two hold a vajra and a bell.

original: cod pan gyi rtse bran las byung ba'i 'od zer rnams steng du song ste snang bar byed pas shas cher chags shing las kyis 'dud par yang dag par blta bar bya zhing /
analyzed: cod pan gyi rtse bran las byung ba'i 'od zer rnams steng du song ste snang bar byed pas shas cher chags shing las kyis 'dud par yang dag par blta bar bya zhing /
translated: The light rays that arise from the crest jewels go upward and illuminate the directions.

original: de bzhin du shar dang lho dang nub dang byang dang 'og gi phyogs rnam par gnas pa rnams la zhal dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa dang zhabs kyi 'od zer rnams kyis kun du gang zhing rjes su gang bar byas nas /🔽rang gi dbang @159a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du shar dang lho dang nub dang byang dang 'og gi phyogs rnam par gnas pa rnams la zhal dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa dang zhabs kyi 'od zer rnams kyis kun du gang zhing rjes su gang bar byas nas / rang gi dbang @159a * //
translated: The first, second, third, fourth, and fifth faces and the light rays of the feet fill and pervade the directions of east, south, west, north, and below.

original: du gyur pa las bzhag par yid kyis bsams nas /
analyzed: du gyur pa las bzhag par yid kyis bsams nas /
translated: Imagine that they are placed under one’s control.

original: bar bar du sngags bzlas par byas te de la sangs ni 'di yin no /
analyzed: bar bar du sngags bzlas par byas te de la sangs ni 'di yin no /
translated: Recite the mantra in between.

original: aom ma h'a r'a badzra r'a ga ya sarbba satv'a na ho /
analyzed: aom ma h'a r'a badzra r'a ga ya sarbba satv'a na ho /
translated: Oṃ mahārāgavajra rāgayasर्वसत्त्वान् hoḥ.

original: de las des pa'i sems can thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro zhes nges pa'i blo dang ldan pas rje btsun 'jam dpal gyi 'dod chags chen po'i sku bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de las des pa'i sems can thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro zhes nges pa'i blo dang ldan pas rje btsun 'jam dpal gyi 'dod chags chen po'i sku bsgom par bya'o //
translated: With the mind certain that all sentient beings who are less than that will be brought under control, one should meditate on the form of the venerable Mañjuśrī with great passion.

original: yang na mchod pa zhes pa shes rab dang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na mchod pa zhes pa shes rab dang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Or, “worship” is the nature of the gnosis that is nondual with wisdom.

original: chen por gyur pas na chen po gang yin pa de ni mchod pa chen po'o //
analyzed: chen por gyur pas na chen po gang yin pa de ni mchod pa chen po'o //
translated: That which is great because it is great is the great worship.

original: sems can thams cad kun du zhen pa chen po las mngon par 'byin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi snying rjes kun du chags pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags chen po'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kun du zhen pa chen po las mngon par 'byin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi snying rjes kun du chags pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags chen po'o //
translated: That which is great passion is the passion of compassion, which has the characteristic of bringing forth all sentient beings from great attachment.

original: mchod pa chen po gang 'di yin la 'dod chags chen po yang yin pas de ltar bshad de /
analyzed: mchod pa chen po gang 'di yin la 'dod chags chen po yang yin pas de ltar bshad de /
translated: Since this is the great worship and also great passion, it is explained in that way.

original: 'dod chags chen pos nye bar chags pa snying rje dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi sku zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen pos nye bar chags pa snying rje dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi sku zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Great passion is the nature of compassion and wisdom.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / sems can thams cad dga' bar byed //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sems can thams cad dga' bar byed //
translated: he delights all sentient beings.

original: ces pa nye bar thob po //
analyzed: ces pa nye bar thob po //
translated: This is the proximate state.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: mchod pa chen po zhe sdang che //
analyzed: mchod pa chen po zhe sdang che //
translated: great offering is great hatred.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba bshad par bya zhing khyad par dag kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba bshad par bya zhing khyad par dag kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: and so on, will be explained.

original: zhes sdang che ni khyab 'jug ste /
analyzed: zhes sdang che ni khyab 'jug ste /
translated: Great hatred is Vishnu.

original: de yang zhe sdang gi dbang du gyur pas lha ma yin thams cad gsod par byed byed pas rang gi sems kyi nyon mongs pa med par ni bya mi nus so //
analyzed: de yang zhe sdang gi dbang du gyur pas lha ma yin thams cad gsod par byed byed pas rang gi sems kyi nyon mongs pa med par ni bya mi nus so //
translated: He, being under the power of hatred, kills all the demigods. Therefore, he is not able to eliminate the afflictions of his own mind.

original: rje btsun ni /
analyzed: rje btsun ni /
translated: The Lord

original: mchod pa chen po zhes sdang che ba yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa kun gyi dgra chen po'o //
analyzed: mchod pa chen po zhes sdang che ba yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa kun gyi dgra chen po'o //
translated: is great offering because he is great hatred. Therefore, he is the great enemy of all the afflictions that belong to the mindstreams of others.

original: de la zhe sdang ni snying rje chen po mi bskyod pa'i gzugs can gyi rje btsun rdo rje rnon po yin te /
analyzed: de la zhe sdang ni snying rje chen po mi bskyod pa'i gzugs can gyi rje btsun rdo rje rnon po yin te /
translated: Hatred is the venerable Vajra-Tikshna, the form of the great compassion Acalanatha.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um yig las kyes pa'i rdo rje las byung ba'i sku mdog nag po zhal bzhi phyag brgyad pa /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um yig las kyes pa'i rdo rje las byung ba'i sku mdog nag po zhal bzhi phyag brgyad pa /
translated: He arises from the syllable HUM on a sun mandala, born from a vajra, black, with four faces and eight arms.

original: zhal dang po khro ba dang bcas shing sgeg pa nag po'o //
analyzed: zhal dang po khro ba dang bcas shing sgeg pa nag po'o //
translated: His first face is black, wrathful and passionate.

original: g-yas pa drag po ste zhal gdangs pa ser po'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa drag po ste zhal gdangs pa ser po'o //
translated: His right face is yellow, wrathful and gaping.

original: g-yon pa 'jigs su rang ba ste mche bas ma mchu'i sgros mnan pa sngo bsangs so //
analyzed: g-yon pa 'jigs su rang ba ste mche bas ma mchu'i sgros mnan pa sngo bsangs so //
translated: His left face is dark blue, wrathful and terrifying, with fangs bared and gnashing the lower lip.

original: rgyab zhal dpa' ba ste gdug pa can skrag par byed pa dmar po'o //
analyzed: rgyab zhal dpa' ba ste gdug pa can skrag par byed pa dmar po'o //
translated: His rear face is red, wrathful and heroic, terrifying the wicked.

original: phyag g-yas pa rnams na ral gri dang rdo rje dang mda' dang lcags kyu bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa rnams na ral gri dang rdo rje dang mda' dang lcags kyu bsnams pa /
translated: He holds a sword, vajra, arrow and goad in his right hands.

original: g-yon pa rnams kyis gdug pa @159b sdigs par byed pa dang dril bu dang gzhu dang gzhu dang zhags pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa rnams kyis gdug pa @159b sdigs par byed pa dang dril bu dang gzhu dang gzhu dang zhags pa bsnams pa /
translated: He holds a threatening forefinger, bell, bow and lasso in his left hands.

original: g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas bzhugs pa /
analyzed: g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas bzhugs pa /
translated: He stands in the extended left leg posture.

original: ba spu'i khung bu thams cad nas nges par 'thon pa'i rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i rtse mo rnams kun du 'bar bas khams gsum pa mes bkru ba'i gos bzhin du rnam par sbyangs nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la nges par sbyar bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ba spu'i khung bu thams cad nas nges par 'thon pa'i rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i rtse mo rnams kun du 'bar bas khams gsum pa mes bkru ba'i gos bzhin du rnam par sbyangs nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la nges par sbyar bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the vajra-fire blazing from all the pores of the skin, and the tips of the flames burning the three worlds like a garment in a fire, and then one should definitely apply oneself to the enlightenment of the Buddha.

original: gti mug che ba ni tshangs pa ste /
analyzed: gti mug che ba ni tshangs pa ste /
translated: Brahma is the great delusion.

original: gti mug las skyes pa ste srog chags la 'tsho ba dang ldan pa'i mchod sbyin nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug las skyes pa ste srog chags la 'tsho ba dang ldan pa'i mchod sbyin nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: He is born from delusion, and he teaches the sacrifice that is accompanied by the killing of living beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das gsung gi dbang phyug ni snga ma bzhin du mchod pa chen po gti mug che ba ste ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gsung gi dbang phyug ni snga ma bzhin du mchod pa chen po gti mug che ba ste ;
translated: The Lord Vāgīśa, as before, is the great offering, the great delusion.

original: rnam par dpyad na chos thams cad rang bzhin med par ma rtogs pa'i ngo bo de ltar gyur pa ni gti mug gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gti mug gi blo'o //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na chos thams cad rang bzhin med par ma rtogs pa'i ngo bo de ltar gyur pa ni gti mug gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gti mug gi blo'o //
translated: The nature of delusion is the mind of delusion, because it is the nature of delusion not to understand that all things are essenceless when analyzed.

original: gti mug sel ba ni mi shes pa dang log par shes pa'i gti mug phyin ci log tu zhugs pa'i blo gang yin pa de chos bdag med par khong du chud cing sel bar byed cing zad par byed pas na gti mug blo ste gti mug sel ba'o
analyzed: gti mug sel ba ni mi shes pa dang log par shes pa'i gti mug phyin ci log tu zhugs pa'i blo gang yin pa de chos bdag med par khong du chud cing sel bar byed cing zad par byed pas na gti mug blo ste gti mug sel ba'o
translated: The mind that is ignorance is the mind that is engaged in the error of ignorance, which is non-knowledge and wrong knowledge. Since it is the mind that is ignorance, it is the mind that is ignorance.

original: // gti mug blo zhes klog par gyur ba la khyad par ni chos thams cad rtogs pa ni gti mug blo ste gti mug sel ba nyid do //
analyzed: // gti mug blo zhes klog par gyur ba la khyad par ni chos thams cad rtogs pa ni gti mug blo ste gti mug sel ba nyid do //
translated: The mind that is ignorance is the mind that is ignorance.

original: de yang rnam par snang mdzad chen po zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du aom yig las skyes pa'i 'khor lo las grub pa gser gyi mdog can zhal bzhi phyag brgyad pa /🔽zhal dang po gser mdog / g-yas nag pa /
analyzed: de yang rnam par snang mdzad chen po zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du aom yig las skyes pa'i 'khor lo las grub pa gser gyi mdog can zhal bzhi phyag brgyad pa / zhal dang po gser mdog / g-yas nag pa /
translated: Moreover, he is born from the syllable Om on the moon disc of Great Vairocana, and is created from the wheel, is golden in color, has four faces and eight arms.

original: g-yon ser ba /
analyzed: g-yon ser ba /
translated: The first face is golden, the right face is black,🔽the left face is yellow,

original: rgyab zhal dmar po'o //
analyzed: rgyab zhal dmar po'o //
translated: and the rear face is red.

original: phyag gnyis kyis byang chub mchog gi phyag rgya mdzad pa /
analyzed: phyag gnyis kyis byang chub mchog gi phyag rgya mdzad pa /
translated: He makes the gesture of supreme enlightenment with two hands.

original: g-yas pa rnams kyis rdo rje dang mda' dang ral gri 'dzin pa /
analyzed: g-yas pa rnams kyis rdo rje dang mda' dang ral gri 'dzin pa /
translated: He holds a vajra, arrow, and sword with his right hands.

original: g-yon pa rnams kyis dril bu dang gzhu dang zhags pa 'dzin pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa rnams kyis dril bu dang gzhu dang zhags pa 'dzin pa /
translated: The left hands hold a bell, a bow, and a noose.

original: rdo rje skyil drung gis bzhugs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje skyil drung gis bzhugs pa /
translated: He sits in the vajra posture.

original: ba spu'i bu gnas 'thon pa'i bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer rnams kyi sa sems can thams cad kyi rgyud kyi mi shes pa'i mun pa bsal nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la gzhag par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: ba spu'i bu gnas 'thon pa'i bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer rnams kyi sa sems can thams cad kyi rgyud kyi mi shes pa'i mun pa bsal nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la gzhag par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the rays of light from the Tathāgatas who emerge from the pores of his skin dispel the darkness of ignorance in the mind-streams of all sentient beings and establish them in the enlightenment of the Buddhas.

original: khro ba che ni nyi ma la sogs pa'i gza' rnams dang klu la sogs pa'i sems can rnams la 'khu ba rnams so //
analyzed: khro ba che ni nyi ma la sogs pa'i gza' rnams dang klu la sogs pa'i sems can rnams la 'khu ba rnams so //
translated: The “great wrathful ones” are the planets such as the sun, and the beings such as the nāgas who are hostile.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje'i blo ni snga ma bzhin du zag pa med pa'i mchod pa chen po ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje'i blo ni snga ma bzhin du zag pa med pa'i mchod pa chen po ste /
translated: The Blessed One’s vajra mind is the great untainted offering, as before.

original: snying rje chen po @160a * //
analyzed: snying rje chen po @160a * //
translated: The “great compassion”

original: rnams kyi khro bo'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir khro ba chen po'i sgra'o //
analyzed: rnams kyi khro bo'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir khro ba chen po'i sgra'o //
translated: is the great wrathful one, because of its wrathful nature.

original: de ni sems kyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i khro ba bag chags dang bcas pa drangs nas 'byin cing 'jigs par byed pa'i phyir de nyid kyang 'di yin la 'jigs byed ce na po la sogs pa las phul du byung ba'i phyir chen po'o
analyzed: de ni sems kyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i khro ba bag chags dang bcas pa drangs nas 'byin cing 'jigs par byed pa'i phyir de nyid kyang 'di yin la 'jigs byed ce na po la sogs pa las phul du byung ba'i phyir chen po'o
translated: Since he is superior to Bhairava and so forth, he is Mahabhairava, the “great terrific one.”

original: // khro ba chen po de yang don yod grub pa nyi ma'i steng du h'um yig las skyes pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje las skyes pa zhal bzhi phyag brgyad pa /
analyzed: // khro ba chen po de yang don yod grub pa nyi ma'i steng du h'um yig las skyes pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje las skyes pa zhal bzhi phyag brgyad pa /
translated: That great anger is born from the syllable hum that arises from Amoghasiddhi on the sun, born from a crossed vajra, with four faces and eight arms.

original: zhal dang po mche ba gtsigs pa /
analyzed: zhal dang po mche ba gtsigs pa /
translated: The first face is wrathful, with bared fangs.

original: mdog ljang gu g-yas ser po /
analyzed: mdog ljang gu g-yas ser po /
translated: The right face is yellow.

original: g-yon dkar po /
analyzed: g-yon dkar po /
translated: The left face is white.

original: rgyab dmar po /🔽phyag g-yas pa rnams kyis ral gri dang rdo rje dang mda' dang lcags kyu bsnams pa /
analyzed: rgyab dmar po / phyag g-yas pa rnams kyis ral gri dang rdo rje dang mda' dang lcags kyu bsnams pa /
translated: The rear face is red.🔽The right hands hold a sword, a vajra, an arrow, and a goad.

original: g-yon pa rnams kyis gdug pa sdigs par mdzad pa dang dril bu dang gzhu dang zhags pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa rnams kyis gdug pa sdigs par mdzad pa dang dril bu dang gzhu dang zhags pa bsnams pa /
translated: The left hands make a threatening gesture, hold a bell, a bow, and a noose.

original: g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas bzhugs pa /
analyzed: g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas bzhugs pa /
translated: He stands in the extended-left posture.

original: ba spu'i khung bu thams cad nas phyung ba'i kho bo 'bar ba rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa khro ba bag chags dang bcas pa thams cad bsregs nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la rab tu bzhag par bsam par bya'o
analyzed: ba spu'i khung bu thams cad nas phyung ba'i kho bo 'bar ba rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa khro ba bag chags dang bcas pa thams cad bsregs nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la rab tu bzhag par bsam par bya'o
translated: Imagine that the blazing fire that emerges from all the pores of your body burns up all the afflictions and anger of all sentient beings, together with their habitual tendencies, and that they are all established in the enlightenment of buddhahood.

original: // de bzhin du nga dang nga yi zhes bya ba dang bdag dang bdag gir gang shin tu chags pa'i rang bzhin ni sems can rnams kyi chags pa thams cad do //
analyzed: // de bzhin du nga dang nga yi zhes bya ba dang bdag dang bdag gir gang shin tu chags pa'i rang bzhin ni sems can rnams kyi chags pa thams cad do //
translated: In the same way, the nature of the attachment to “I” and “mine” and “self” and “other” is the attachment of all sentient beings.

original: chags pa bag chags dang bcas pa de thams cad mchod pa chen po chags pa che ba nyid kyis sel bar byed pa ni bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: chags pa bag chags dang bcas pa de thams cad mchod pa chen po chags pa che ba nyid kyis sel bar byed pa ni bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The Bhagavān is the one who removes all that attachment, together with its habitual tendencies, by means of the great attachment of the great offering.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir yang chen po zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir yang chen po zhes sbyar te /
translated: Therefore, here also, the word “great” is applied.

original: de yang 'di ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar 'gyur te /
translated: That is as follows.

original: chags pa chen po ni rin chen 'byung ldan tr'am yig las skyes pa'i rin po cha cha brgya pa las grub pa /
analyzed: chags pa chen po ni rin chen 'byung ldan tr'am yig las skyes pa'i rin po cha cha brgya pa las grub pa /
translated: The great attachment is Ratnasaṃbhava, who is born from the syllable traṃ and is made of a hundred parts of jewels.

original: zhal bzhi phyag brgyad pa zhal gyi dbye ba ser po dang nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po'o //
analyzed: zhal bzhi phyag brgyad pa zhal gyi dbye ba ser po dang nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po'o //
translated: He has four faces and eight arms. The faces are yellow, black, white, and red.

original: g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi phyag rnams na rdo rje dang ral gri dang mda' dang gzhu lcags kyu dang yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal mtshan dang dril bu dang gzhu dang zhags pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi phyag rnams na rdo rje dang ral gri dang mda' dang gzhu lcags kyu dang yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal mtshan dang dril bu dang gzhu dang zhags pa bsnams pa /
translated: In the right and left hands he holds a vajra, sword, arrow, bow, iron hook, wish-fulfilling gem, banner, bell, bow, and lasso.

original: rgyal po'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa /
analyzed: rgyal po'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa /
translated: He sits in the posture of royal poise.

original: ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas nges par 'thon pa'i rin chen 'byung ldan gyi sprin rnams kyis sems can rnams kyi sbam pa rdzogs par mdzad cing rin po che la sogs pa'i char phab @160b pas chags pa'i sdug bsngal zhi bar mdzad de /
analyzed: ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas nges par 'thon pa'i rin chen 'byung ldan gyi sprin rnams kyis sems can rnams kyi sbam pa rdzogs par mdzad cing rin po che la sogs pa'i char phab @160b pas chags pa'i sdug bsngal zhi bar mdzad de /
translated: From all the pores of his skin, clouds of Ratnasaṃbhava come forth and fulfill the wishes of sentient beings, and by showering a rain of jewels, etc., they pacify the suffering of attachment.

original: de rnams sangs rgyas nyid la nges par sbyar bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams sangs rgyas nyid la nges par sbyar bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that they are definitely fixed on buddhahood.

original: 'dis ni 'dod chags dang zhes sdang dang gti mug dang khro ba dang chags pa rnams dmigs pa med pa'i ba rtse ba chen po'i bdag nyid du nye bar bsgyur nas ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid thabs chen po dang
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dod chags dang zhes sdang dang gti mug dang khro ba dang chags pa rnams dmigs pa med pa'i ba rtse ba chen po'i bdag nyid du nye bar bsgyur nas ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid thabs chen po dang
translated: This verse indicates that desire, anger, ignorance, wrath, and attachment are transformed into the nature of the great play of the absence of reference points and become the essence of the five thus-gone ones, who are the nature of the five wisdoms and the great method.🔽

original: ldan pa'i rdo rje 'chang 'jam dpal gyi sku nyid sna tshogs gzugs can don thams cad mdzad pa'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ldan pa'i rdo rje 'chang 'jam dpal gyi sku nyid sna tshogs gzugs can don thams cad mdzad pa'o zhes bstan to //
translated: This teaches that desire, hatred, delusion, anger, and attachment are transformed into the nature of great play without an object, and that Vajradhara Manjushri, who has the nature of the five exalted wisdoms, the essence of the five Tathagatas, and who is endowed with great method, has a body that has various forms and performs all benefits.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason:

original: thabs chen rigs pa rnams la ni //
analyzed: thabs chen rigs pa rnams la ni //
translated: For those who have great method and reasoning,

original: nyon mongs byang chub yan lag 'gyur //
analyzed: nyon mongs byang chub yan lag 'gyur //
translated: Afflictions become branches of enlightenment.

original: 'khor ba'ang zhi ba'i bdag nyid pas //
analyzed: 'khor ba'ang zhi ba'i bdag nyid pas //
translated: Since even samsara has the nature of peace,

original: de phyir bdag nyid bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: de phyir bdag nyid bsam mi khyab //
translated: Therefore, it is inconceivable.

original: ces pa'i gsung las de bzhin gshegs pa nga rgyal gyis sgyu ma lta bur lhag par mos pas 'dod chags la sogs pa bstan pa ni sngags kyi tshul 'gal ba med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ces pa'i gsung las de bzhin gshegs pa nga rgyal gyis sgyu ma lta bur lhag par mos pas 'dod chags la sogs pa bstan pa ni sngags kyi tshul 'gal ba med do zhes bstan to //
translated: From this statement, it teaches that the Tathagata's belief that pride is like an illusion and his teaching of desire and so forth are not contradictory in the Mantra Vehicle.

original: da ni yid kyi chos nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dpal gyi khyad par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni yid kyi chos nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dpal gyi khyad par bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the Bhagavān’s inconceivable glory will be explained by the reality of mind.

original: 'dod pa chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The great desire, etc.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas nyid la 'god pa'i bzhed pa gang la yod pa de 'dod pa chen po ste 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas nyid la 'god pa'i bzhed pa gang la yod pa de 'dod pa chen po ste 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The one who has the desire to establish all sentient beings in buddhahood has great desire, which is the desire.

original: yang na sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis sangs rgyas gyur pa'i phyir 'dod pa yang 'di yin la chen po yang 'di yin pas zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: yang na sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis sangs rgyas gyur pa'i phyir 'dod pa yang 'di yin la chen po yang 'di yin pas zhes sbyar te /
translated: Or, this is the desire and this is the great because all sentient beings are buddhas by virtue of being the nature of the Tathāgata.

original: gzugs la sogs pas 'dod pa chen po lnga gang yin pa de 'dod pa chen po'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pas 'dod pa chen po lnga gang yin pa de 'dod pa chen po'o //
translated: The five great desires such as form are the great desire.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis na bde ba chen po'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis na bde ba chen po'o //
translated: By virtue of that, it is great bliss.

original: yang na gang las sems can rnams las bde ba chen po ste /
analyzed: yang na gang las sems can rnams las bde ba chen po ste /
translated: Or, it is great bliss from which sentient beings arise.

original: ji lta ji ltar sems can rnams rab tu 'gro ba de lta de ltar phyi phyir rab tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir dga' ba chen po'o //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar sems can rnams rab tu 'gro ba de lta de ltar phyi phyir rab tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir dga' ba chen po'o //
translated: As much as sentient beings go, to that extent there is great joy, because of the nature of the joy of the bodhisattva.

original: yang na dga' ba chen po gang yin pa de zhes 'byed pa'i tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na dga' ba chen po gang yin pa de zhes 'byed pa'i tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Or, that which is great joy is so designated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dga' ba dang yid bde ba chen po'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir mgu ba chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dga' ba dang yid bde ba chen po'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir mgu ba chen po'o //
translated: Therefore, because of the nature of the retention of the characteristics of great joy and mental felicity, there is great delight.

original: yang na chen por gyur pa gang yin pa de la de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: yang na chen por gyur pa gang yin pa de la de ltar bshad do //
translated: Or, that which is great is so designated.

original: yang na 'dod pa chen po ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i rnal 'byor gyis lha mo rnams la 'dod par rol pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa chen po ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i rnal 'byor gyis lha mo rnams la 'dod par rol pa'o //
translated: Or, great desire is the enjoyment of desire with the goddesses by means of the yoga of the lord of the mandala.

original: 'di rnams nyid dang lhan cig ae ma @161a * //
analyzed: 'di rnams nyid dang lhan cig ae ma @161a * //
translated: With these very goddesses, there is the great joy of the bodhisattvas.

original: bde ba'i gnas skabs byang chub sems kyi dbang ni bde ba chen po'i tshul gyis bde ba che'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i gnas skabs byang chub sems kyi dbang ni bde ba chen po'i tshul gyis bde ba che'o //
translated: The state of bliss is the great joy of the bodhisattvas, by the method of great bliss, through the consecration of the bodhicitta.

original: aarsh'i da dv'i da tsa /
analyzed: aarsh'i da dv'i da tsa /
translated: Arshadvaidvatsa.

original: rang nyid dga' ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyi phyir de rnams kyang de'i bdag nyid du gyur pas dga' ba chen po'o //
analyzed: rang nyid dga' ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyi phyir de rnams kyang de'i bdag nyid du gyur pas dga' ba chen po'o //
translated: Because of the nature of his own great joy, he is great joy, since he has become the nature of those.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba nyid rgyun mi 'chad cing bar mtshams med pas mgu ba che'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba nyid rgyun mi 'chad cing bar mtshams med pas mgu ba che'o //
translated: He is greatly satisfied, since his joy and bliss are uninterrupted and without a break.

original: da ni sku la sogs pa'i sgo nas khyad par du bya ste /
analyzed: da ni sku la sogs pa'i sgo nas khyad par du bya ste /
translated: Now, he is distinguished in terms of body and so on.

original: gzugs che zhes pa la sogs pa la gzugs med kyang gzugs kyis 'dul ba'i sems can gyi bsam pa'i don du sprul pa mdzad pa'i phyir thams cad las phul du byung ba'i gzugs kyi rnam pa chen po shin tu mdzes pa yin pa de ni gzugs che ba'o
analyzed: gzugs che zhes pa la sogs pa la gzugs med kyang gzugs kyis 'dul ba'i sems can gyi bsam pa'i don du sprul pa mdzad pa'i phyir thams cad las phul du byung ba'i gzugs kyi rnam pa chen po shin tu mdzes pa yin pa de ni gzugs che ba'o
translated: He has a great body, since he has a great, very beautiful form that is superior to all, even though he is formless, because he emanates for the sake of the thoughts of sentient beings who are to be disciplined by form.

original: // mtshan dang dpe byad 'bar ba'i sprul pa ni lha la sogs pa rnams las kyang lus che zhing thams cad du khyab pa'i phyir lus che ba'o //
analyzed: // mtshan dang dpe byad 'bar ba'i sprul pa ni lha la sogs pa rnams las kyang lus che zhing thams cad du khyab pa'i phyir lus che ba'o //
translated: He has a great body, since his emanation, blazing with the major and minor marks, is greater than the bodies of gods and so on and pervades everywhere.

original: kha dog med kyang dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i kha dog gi rang bzhin du snang bar byed pa'i phyir kha dog che ba'o //
analyzed: kha dog med kyang dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i kha dog gi rang bzhin du snang bar byed pa'i phyir kha dog che ba'o //
translated: It is of great color because it appears as the nature of various colors, white, black, red, etc., even though it is without color.

original: thams cad zil gyis gnon cing rgyu las mdzes pa'i sku chen po 'phro bar mdzad pas lus bong che ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad zil gyis gnon cing rgyu las mdzes pa'i sku chen po 'phro bar mdzad pas lus bong che ba'o //
translated: It is of great body because it emits a great body, which surpasses all and is the cause of beauty.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs pa rnams su 'jig rten thams cad dang rjes su mthun pa'i skad dang ming dang brda sna tshogs ston par mdzad pa'i phyir ming che ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs pa rnams su 'jig rten thams cad dang rjes su mthun pa'i skad dang ming dang brda sna tshogs ston par mdzad pa'i phyir ming che ba'o //
translated: It is of great name because it shows various names, sounds, and conventions in accordance with all worlds in the various world-realms.

original: shes rab chen po rgya che zhing yangs pa'i phyir rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab chen po rgya che zhing yangs pa'i phyir rgya che ba'o //
translated: It is vast because its great wisdom is vast and extensive.

original: de nyid 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du khyab pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor chen po yangs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du khyab pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor chen po yangs pa'o //
translated: It is the great vast circle because it pervades all world-realms.

original: yang na shes rab kyi 'khor lor sprul pa sna tshogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gang yin pa de ;
analyzed: yang na shes rab kyi 'khor lor sprul pa sna tshogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gang yin pa de ;
translated: Or else, it is the circle of the wheel of wisdom, which is the circle of emanations.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po yangs pa yin //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po yangs pa yin //
translated: It is the great, vast mandala.

original: zhes pa'o // mtshon cha rnams kyi khyad par ni //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // mtshon cha rnams kyi khyad par ni //
translated: The particularity of the weapons is stated🔽in the line beginning with “the great weapon of wisdom.”🔽The great wisdom that definitely distinguishes all phenomena is itself the weapon, since it removes and destroys the enemies, the afflictions.

original: yang shes rab mtshon chen zhes pa la sogs pa ste chos thams cad nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab chen po de nyid mtshon cha ste nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams sel zhing 'joms par byed pas na shes rab mtshon chen 'chang ba po //🔽mchog ces kyang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang shes rab mtshon chen zhes pa la sogs pa ste chos thams cad nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab chen po de nyid mtshon cha ste nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams sel zhing 'joms par byed pas na shes rab mtshon chen 'chang ba po // mchog ces kyang sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, he is the wielder of the great weapon of wisdom.

original: yang na shes rab kyang yin la mtshon cha yang yin pas shes rab mtshon cha ste /
analyzed: yang na shes rab kyang yin la mtshon cha yang yin pas shes rab mtshon cha ste /
translated: Or, since it is both wisdom and a weapon, it is the weapon of wisdom.

original: de yang chen po yin pas de ltar bshad de /
analyzed: de yang chen po yin pas de ltar bshad de /
translated: And since it is great, it is explained in that way.

original: de 'dzin pas shes rab mtshon chen 'chang ba ste /
analyzed: de 'dzin pas shes rab mtshon chen 'chang ba ste /
translated: Since he holds it, he is the wielder of the great weapon of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam dang @161b ral gri 'dzin pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam dang @161b ral gri 'dzin pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that he holds the book of the perfection of wisdom and a sword.

original: nyon mongs chen po ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs chen po ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
translated: The great afflictions are desire and so forth.

original: 'gro ba zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they overpower the world.

original: de rnams glang po chen po bzhin du 'dul ba'i ched du lcags kyu dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams glang po chen po bzhin du 'dul ba'i ched du lcags kyu dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are similar to hooks in the sense that they tame the great elephants.

original: mchog ces pa gtso bo'o //
analyzed: mchog ces pa gtso bo'o //
translated: The word supreme means chief.

original: yang na lcags kyu dang ldan pas lcags kyu ste lcags kyus nye bar mtshon pa'i zhags pa yang gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na lcags kyu dang ldan pas lcags kyu ste lcags kyus nye bar mtshon pa'i zhags pa yang gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Or, having a hook means with a hook, and the noose should be understood as illustrated by the hook.

original: des ni glegs bam dang ral gri dang lcags kyu dang zhags pa bsnams pa'i rje btsun rdo rje rnon po ni 'dod pa chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byas par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: des ni glegs bam dang ral gri dang lcags kyu dang zhags pa bsnams pa'i rje btsun rdo rje rnon po ni 'dod pa chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byas par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the Venerable Vajra-Tikshna, who holds a scripture, sword, hook, and noose, is distinguished by the special qualities of great desire, etc.

original: khyad par de yang gang yin gsungs pa /
analyzed: khyad par de yang gang yin gsungs pa /
translated: What are those special qualities? He says:

original: grags chen zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: grags chen zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: greatly renowned, etc.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi sde rnams la rab tu grags pa'i ngo bo nyid grangs ji lta ba bzhin du grags chen dang snyan grags chen po'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi sde rnams la rab tu grags pa'i ngo bo nyid grangs ji lta ba bzhin du grags chen dang snyan grags chen po'o //
translated: The nature of being renowned in one's own and others' schools is great renown and great fame, respectively, as the numbers indicate.

original: nang gi ye shes gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir snang ba che'o //
analyzed: nang gi ye shes gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir snang ba che'o //
translated: Because of the nature of illuminating inner wisdom, there is great illumination.

original: phyi rol du 'bar ba dang gsal ba la sogs pa'i cho 'phrul rab tu ston pa'i phyir gsal ba che'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du 'bar ba dang gsal ba la sogs pa'i cho 'phrul rab tu ston pa'i phyir gsal ba che'o //
translated: It is “greatly clear” because it displays the miracles of blazing, shining, and so on externally.

original: sprul ba'i sgo nas khyad par du gyur pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: sprul ba'i sgo nas khyad par du gyur pa gsungs pa /
translated: The verse declares the superiority in terms of emanations.

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po gyur pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po gyur pa la sogs pa la /
translated: “Great illusion” and so on.

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po ni gdul bya'i sems can ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs su sprul ba ste de 'dzin pa'i phyir de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po ni gdul bya'i sems can ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs su sprul ba ste de 'dzin pa'i phyir de ltar bshad do //
translated: “Great illusion” is the emanation of a form that is in accordance with the minds of the sentient beings to be trained, and it is so explained because it holds that.

original: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i sgyu 'phrul de yang rang bzhin med par mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i sgyu 'phrul de yang rang bzhin med par mkhyen pa'o //
translated: “Skillful” means knowing that such an illusion is devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: de ltan yang sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi chos bstan pas sems can de rnams 'dren par mdzad cing sangs rgyas nyid la rab tu 'god pa'i rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: de ltan yang sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi chos bstan pas sems can de rnams 'dren par mdzad cing sangs rgyas nyid la rab tu 'god pa'i rang bzhin ni /
translated: And yet, by teaching the Dharma of the nature of illusion, he guides those sentient beings and establishes them in buddhahood.🔽The nature of accomplishing the aims of beings

original: sgyu 'phrul chen pos don bsgrub pa //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen pos don bsgrub pa //
translated: is the great illusion.

original: zhes bya ba de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ltar bshad do //
translated: It is explained in that way.

original: sems can gyi don byed pa ni sgyu 'phrul chen po'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa ni sgyu 'phrul chen po'i dga' ba'o //
translated: The aim of beings is the joy of the great illusion.

original: de la dga' ba ni kun nas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de la dga' ba ni kun nas zhes pa ste /
translated: Delight in that is all around.

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po'i dga' bas dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po'i dga' bas dga' ba'o //
translated: Delight is with the delight of the Great Illusion.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po'i mig 'phrul can //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po'i mig 'phrul can //
translated: the Great Illusion, the one with magical powers.

original: zhes bya'o // da ni sa bcu la rab tu bzhugs shing sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i yon tan gyi rang gi ngo bos phul du byung ba'i bdag nyid chen po gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // da ni sa bcu la rab tu bzhugs shing sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i yon tan gyi rang gi ngo bos phul du byung ba'i bdag nyid chen po gsungs pa /
translated: Now, he declares the greatness of his own nature, which is preeminent by the nature of the qualities of the evolutionary maturity of the transcendences such as generosity, while dwelling on the ten stages.

original: sbyin bdag chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin bdag chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The great benefactor, the chief,

original: rab tu dga' ba'i sa la ni sbyin bdag chen po gtso bo zhes pa @162a * //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i sa la ni sbyin bdag chen po gtso bo zhes pa @162a * //
translated: on the stage of Joyful is the great benefactor, the chief.

original: zad mi shes shing gzhal du med pa'i chos dang zang zing mi 'jigs pa rnams sbyin pas sbyin bdag chen po'i las yongs su mthar son pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zad mi shes shing gzhal du med pa'i chos dang zang zing mi 'jigs pa rnams sbyin pas sbyin bdag chen po'i las yongs su mthar son pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of having perfected the activity of the great benefactor is that he is a great benefactor by giving the Dharma, material goods, and protection, which are inexhaustible and immeasurable.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rjes su bsngags pa ni theg pa chen po'i mdo sde rnams las rgya cher shes par /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rjes su bsngags pa ni theg pa chen po'i mdo sde rnams las rgya cher shes par /
translated: The praise of generosity and so on is to be known in detail from the scriptures of the universal vehicle.

original: bya'o ; / dri ma med pa'i sa la ni /
analyzed: bya'o ; / dri ma med pa'i sa la ni /
translated: On the stainless ground,

original: tshul khrims chen po 'chang ba'i mchog ste mchog nyid ni sdom pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa dang / chos yang dag par sdud pa'i tshul khrims yongs su byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims chen po 'chang ba'i mchog ste mchog nyid ni sdom pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa dang / chos yang dag par sdud pa'i tshul khrims yongs su byed pa'o //
translated: he is the supreme holder of the great morality, because he is the best at the morality of restraint, the morality of collecting the stores of merit and knowledge, and the morality of benefiting sentient beings.

original: 'od byed pa la ni bzod chen 'chang ba ste tshad med pa'i sdug bsngal ji mi snyam pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa dang / gzhan gyi gnod pa byas pa bzod pa'i las yongs su byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'od byed pa la ni bzod chen 'chang ba ste tshad med pa'i sdug bsngal ji mi snyam pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa dang / gzhan gyi gnod pa byas pa bzod pa'i las yongs su byed pa'o //
translated: On the illuminating ground, he is the holder of the great patience, because he is engaged in the activity of the patience of not retaliating against harm done by others, the patience of voluntarily accepting suffering, and the patience of certainty about the Dharma.

original: de nyid g-yo ba med pa nyid kyis na brtan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid g-yo ba med pa nyid kyis na brtan pa'o //
translated: He is firm because he is unmoving.

original: 'od 'phro ba la ni sems can thams cad kyi don gyi ched du lus dang ngag dang sems kyi brtson 'grus rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid kyis brtson 'grus chen pos pha rol gnon pas na brtson 'grus chen po pha rol gnon pa'o //
analyzed: 'od 'phro ba la ni sems can thams cad kyi don gyi ched du lus dang ngag dang sems kyi brtson 'grus rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid kyis brtson 'grus chen pos pha rol gnon pas na brtson 'grus chen po pha rol gnon pa'o //
translated: On the radiant ground, he is the one who has the great effort that is the conquest of the great effort, because he is engaged in the activity of the effort of body, speech, and mind that is uninterrupted for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: shin tu sbyang dka' ba la ni bsam gtan chen po ting 'dzin gnas te bsam gtan ni bzhi po rnams so //
analyzed: shin tu sbyang dka' ba la ni bsam gtan chen po ting 'dzin gnas te bsam gtan ni bzhi po rnams so //
translated: On the Difficult to Overcome, the great meditative stabilization of meditative stabilization, since meditative stabilization is the four meditative stabilizations.

original: bsam pa'i rnam pa che ba nyid kyis che ba ste de rnams la rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: bsam pa'i rnam pa che ba nyid kyis che ba ste de rnams la rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: It is great by the greatness of its aspect of thought, and it is the meditative stabilization of one pointedness on those.

original: de la gnas pa'i phyir de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i phyir de ltar bshad do //
translated: It is explained in that way because it abides in that.

original: mngon du gyur pa la ni shes rab chen po'i lus 'chang ba ste 'di yang bsam pa'i rnam pa che ba'i phyir dang / thos pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab gnyi ga che ba'i phyir shes rab chen po'o //
analyzed: mngon du gyur pa la ni shes rab chen po'i lus 'chang ba ste 'di yang bsam pa'i rnam pa che ba'i phyir dang / thos pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab gnyi ga che ba'i phyir shes rab chen po'o //
translated: On the Manifested, the body of great wisdom, since it is great wisdom because of the greatness of its aspect of thought and because of the greatness of both the wisdom of differentiation arisen from hearing, contemplation, and meditation.

original: de nyid lus te de 'dzin par byed pas de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid lus te de 'dzin par byed pas de ltar bshad do //
translated: It is the body that holds that, and it is explained in that way.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: bde gshegs shes rab dri ma med //
analyzed: bde gshegs shes rab dri ma med //
translated: The Sugata’s stainless wisdom

original: rdo rje rnon por de bshad do //
analyzed: rdo rje rnon por de bshad do //
translated: is explained as the sharp vajra.

original: zhes so // ring du song ba la ni thabs chen po ste thabs ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // ring du song ba la ni thabs chen po ste thabs ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: On Gone Afar, the great method, since method is the perfection of method.

original: de yang de la ches lhag par spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang de la ches lhag par spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, he practices them to a high degree.

original: de'i phyir thabs chen po zhes de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir thabs chen po zhes de ltar bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is called the great means.

original: mi g-yo ba la ni mtha' yas pa'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba la ni mtha' yas pa'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: On the Immovable, the perfection of vows is predominant, because it is endowed with the perfection of infinite vows.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis smon lam zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis smon lam zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Lord has declared that to be the vow.

original: legs pa'i blo gros la ni stobs kyi pha rol @162b tu phyin pa la lhag par byed pas chen po ste /🔽mos pa dang so sor bshad pa dang bsgom pa dang bzod pa dang ye shes dang spong ba dang thos pa dang spobs pa dang bsod nams dang sgrub pa zhes bya ba stobs bcu po rnams ni stobs po che'o //🔽chos kyi sprin la ni /
analyzed: legs pa'i blo gros la ni stobs kyi pha rol @162b tu phyin pa la lhag par byed pas chen po ste / mos pa dang so sor bshad pa dang bsgom pa dang bzod pa dang ye shes dang spong ba dang thos pa dang spobs pa dang bsod nams dang sgrub pa zhes bya ba stobs bcu po rnams ni stobs po che'o // chos kyi sprin la ni /
translated: On the Ground of Luminous Intelligence, the perfection of strength is predominant, because it is the basis of the ten masteries.🔽The ten masteries are mastery over: life, mind, necessities, action, birth, vows, resolution, supernormal cognition, the Dharma, and the wheel.🔽On the Cloud of Dharma, the perfection of knowledge is predominant, because it is the basis of the ten powers.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pas ye shes rgya mtsho ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pas ye shes rgya mtsho ste /
translated: The ten powers are the powers of: knowledge of what is possible and impossible, knowledge resulting from the superknowledge of the aspiration, knowledge resulting from the superknowledge of divine eye, knowledge resulting from the superknowledge of divine ear, knowledge resulting from the superknowledge of magical abilities, knowledge resulting from the superknowledge of recollecting former lives, knowledge resulting from the superknowledge of death and rebirth, knowledge resulting from the superknowledge of the extinction of contamination, knowledge of the world with its various natures, and knowledge of the various aspirations of beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni rgya mtsho dang chos mthun te nyan thos la sogs pas gting dpag dka' ba nyid dang / ro gcig pa nyid dang / legs par bshad pa'i rin po che mtha' dag gi 'byung gnas nyid dang / sems can mtha' yas pa'i rten du gyur pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni rgya mtsho dang chos mthun te nyan thos la sogs pas gting dpag dka' ba nyid dang / ro gcig pa nyid dang / legs par bshad pa'i rin po che mtha' dag gi 'byung gnas nyid dang / sems can mtha' yas pa'i rten du gyur pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The Lord is similar to the ocean, because he is difficult to fathom by the Sravakas, etc. ; because he is of one taste; because he is the source of all jewels of good explanations; and because he is the support of infinite sentient beings.

original: stobs po che la thabs che ba //
analyzed: stobs po che la thabs che ba //
translated: He is the great hero, of great means,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pas bcings pa'i klog pa'i rim pas bshad pa dang / 'dir sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i rim pas bshad pa ni 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pas bcings pa'i klog pa'i rim pas bshad pa dang / 'dir sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i rim pas bshad pa ni 'gal ba med do //
translated: and so on, in the verse. The explanation by the order of reading of the verse is not contradictory to the explanation by the order of the stages and perfections here.

original: da ni tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi'i rang bzhin nyid du bstan pa'i phyir byams chen zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi'i rang bzhin nyid du bstan pa'i phyir byams chen zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to teach the nature of the four divine stations, he says, Great love, and so on.

original: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Brahma is nirvana.

original: gnas pa ni de'i ched du'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni de'i ched du'o //
translated: The stations are for the sake of that.

original: byams pa la sogs pa yang sems can la dmigs pa dang chos la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa yang sems can la dmigs pa dang chos la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: Love and so on are also focused on sentient beings, focused on the teaching, and not focused.

original: dmigs pa med par sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa dang 'dra bar sdug pa'i mtshan nyid can ni byams pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir byams chen rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa dang 'dra bar sdug pa'i mtshan nyid can ni byams pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir byams chen rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of great love is the nature of love, which is characterized by affection for all sentient beings as if they were one’s only child, and is not focused.

original: de nyid nam mkha'i mthar thug pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid nam mkha'i mthar thug pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: It is immeasurable because it extends to the end of space.

original: de bzhin du snying rje chen po las mi g-yo ba'i phyir snying rje chen po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du snying rje chen po las mi g-yo ba'i phyir snying rje chen po'o //
translated: Similarly, great compassion is great compassion because it does not waver from the state of great compassion.

original: 'dir yang dpag tu med ces sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang dpag tu med ces sbyar ro //
translated: Here too, it is immeasurable.

original: snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin nyid blo yang yin la mchog kyang yin pas blo mchog ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin nyid blo yang yin la mchog kyang yin pas blo mchog ste /
translated: The nature of great compassion is also the highest mind, and so it is the highest mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir shes rab dang thabs ro gcig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir shes rab dang thabs ro gcig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the single taste of wisdom and method because it is the nature of the nondual wisdom of all tathāgatas.

original: de skad du yang shes rab rang bzhin med gnas dang // brtse ba chen po rang bzhin med //
analyzed: de skad du yang shes rab rang bzhin med gnas dang // brtse ba chen po rang bzhin med //
translated: and great compassion is the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: lhan cig gcig tu gyur pa ni //
analyzed: lhan cig gcig tu gyur pa ni //
translated: They are united as one

original: nam mkhar nam mkha' ji bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkhar nam mkha' ji bzhin no //
translated: like space in space.

original: zhes so // dga' ba chen po'i rang bzhin nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // dga' ba chen po'i rang bzhin nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: The nature of great joy is stated:🔽Great wisdom,

original: shes rab chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: chos thams cad yang @163a * //🔽dag par khong du chud pas sems can thams cad bde ba la yang dag par sbyor zhing so sor rab tu dang ba'i dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi dga' ba de ni shes rab dman pa ma yin pa nyid kyi shes rab chen
analyzed: chos thams cad yang @163a * // dag par khong du chud pas sems can thams cad bde ba la yang dag par sbyor zhing so sor rab tu dang ba'i dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi dga' ba de ni shes rab dman pa ma yin pa nyid kyi shes rab chen
translated: Since all phenomena are perfectly understood,🔽all sentient beings are perfectly connected with happiness, and joy with the characteristics of individual faith and delight is joy.

original: po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: po zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called “great wisdom” because it is not inferior wisdom.

original: de'i rgyu gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i rgyu gsungs pa /
translated: The cause of that is stated:

original: rab tu dga' ba de nyid kyis sems can gyi don byed pas blo chen ldan no //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba de nyid kyis sems can gyi don byed pas blo chen ldan no //
translated: Since one acts for the welfare of sentient beings with that very joy, one has a great mind.

original: shes rab chen po zhes par pradzny'a zhes klog pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sngags kyi tshul gyi bshad pa'i phyogs ni ma rtogs mod kyi //
analyzed: shes rab chen po zhes par pradzny'a zhes klog pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sngags kyi tshul gyi bshad pa'i phyogs ni ma rtogs mod kyi //
translated: The reading of great wisdom as prajña is not understood in the context of the explanation of the mantra method that will be explained.

original: bklags pa na chos mang du mthong ba ni rang gi don can gyi de phan gyi rkyen can te tshig gong ma la 'grel ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: bklags pa na chos mang du mthong ba ni rang gi don can gyi de phan gyi rkyen can te tshig gong ma la 'grel ba byas pa'o //
translated: But when read, seeing many dharmas is the condition of the benefit of one's own purpose, which is a commentary on the previous word.

original: btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin gsungs pa /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin gsungs pa /
translated: The nature of equanimity is stated:

original: thabs che ba la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thabs che ba la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The great method, etc.

original: go rims bzhin du btang snyoms chen po'i rang bzhin gyi bcom ldan 'das ni thabs chen por bshad do //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du btang snyoms chen po'i rang bzhin gyi bcom ldan 'das ni thabs chen por bshad do //
translated: In order, the Bhagavān, who is of the nature of great equanimity, is explained as the great method.

original: btang snyoms kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Equanimity is also of three kinds:

original: nyon mongs pa btang snyoms dang / bdag dang gzhan rjes su srung ba'i btang snyoms dang / dus dang dus ma yin pa'i btang snyoms zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa btang snyoms dang / bdag dang gzhan rjes su srung ba'i btang snyoms dang / dus dang dus ma yin pa'i btang snyoms zhes pa'o //
translated: afflictive equanimity, equanimity that protects oneself and others, and equanimity of time and non-time.

original: btang snyoms rnam pa gsum gyi ngo bos sems can sna tshogs pa'i don byed pa ni thabs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir thabs che ba'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms rnam pa gsum gyi ngo bos sems can sna tshogs pa'i don byed pa ni thabs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir thabs che ba'o //
translated: The great means is the means of accomplishing the welfare of the various sentient beings through the three aspects of equanimity.

original: de nyid sems can gyi don la shin tu brtson zhing rigs pa dang ldan pas mkhas pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid sems can gyi don la shin tu brtson zhing rigs pa dang ldan pas mkhas pa chen po'o //
