translated: He is a great scholar, because he is very diligent in the welfare of sentient beings and is endowed with logic.

original: de la byams pas ni sems can rnams phan pa la nges par sbyor ba'o //🔽snying rjes ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: de la byams pas ni sems can rnams phan pa la nges par sbyor ba'o // snying rjes ni bde ba'o //
translated: Among them, through love, he definitely joins sentient beings to benefit.🔽Through compassion, he joins them to happiness.

original: dga' bas ni dga' ba la'o //
analyzed: dga' bas ni dga' ba la'o //
translated: Through joy, he joins them to delight.

original: btang snyoms kyis ni chos mnyam pa nyid la sbyor ro zhes pa rim pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyis ni chos mnyam pa nyid la sbyor ro zhes pa rim pa'o //
translated: Through equanimity, he joins them to the equality of phenomena. This is the sequence.

original: sngags kyi tshul ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgeg mo ste /
analyzed: sngags kyi tshul ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgeg mo ste /
translated: The way of mantra is the perfection of generosity, which is the goddess Lāsyā.

original: de'i bdag po nyid kyi phyir sbyin bdag chen po gtso bo'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag po nyid kyi phyir sbyin bdag chen po gtso bo'o //
translated: He is the great lord, the chief, because he is the master of that.

original: de bzhin du mthar phyin pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni phreng ba ma ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthar phyin pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni phreng ba ma ste /
translated: Similarly, the perfection of ethical discipline, which is the perfection of the way of ultimate reality, is the goddess Mālā.

original: de de'i bdag nyid du 'dzin pas tshul khrims chen po 'chang ba mchog go //
analyzed: de de'i bdag nyid du 'dzin pas tshul khrims chen po 'chang ba mchog go //
translated: She is the supreme holder of the great morality, because she holds it as being of the nature of that.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni glu ma ste /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni glu ma ste /
translated: The perfection of patience is the dancer.

original: de nyid ni bzod chen 'chang ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni bzod chen 'chang ba bstan pa'o //
translated: She is the teacher of the great patience, because she is patient with the three things.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gar ma ste /🔽de ni phyogs su brtson zhing rtul phod pas /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gar ma ste / de ni phyogs su brtson zhing rtul phod pas /
translated: The perfection of effort is the actress.

original: brtson 'grus chen po pha rol gnon pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po pha rol gnon pa'o //
translated: She is the great effort, the conqueror of the enemy, because she is diligent in all directions.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa me tog ma ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa me tog ma ste /
translated: The perfection of meditation is the flower-bearer.

original: @163b de ni snyoms par 'jug pas gnas pa nyid kyi phyir bsam gtan chen po ting 'dzin gnas so //
analyzed: @163b de ni snyoms par 'jug pas gnas pa nyid kyi phyir bsam gtan chen po ting 'dzin gnas so //
translated: She is the great meditation, the abode of concentration, because she abides in meditative equipoise.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma ni bdug pa ma ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma ni bdug pa ma ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the incense-bearer.

original: shes rab chen po'i lus chos 'byung gi ngo bo de nyid kun du dga' ba sgrub pa'i phyir 'dzin pas na de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: shes rab chen po'i lus chos 'byung gi ngo bo de nyid kun du dga' ba sgrub pa'i phyir 'dzin pas na de ltar bshad do //
translated: She is the great wisdom, the abode of the Dharma realm, because she holds the body of great wisdom, which is the essence of the source of phenomena, and delights in it.

original: thabs chen ni rdo rje mar me ma ste de'i bdag po nyid kyis de dang lhan cig sbyor ba'i phyir thabs chen no //
analyzed: thabs chen ni rdo rje mar me ma ste de'i bdag po nyid kyis de dang lhan cig sbyor ba'i phyir thabs chen no //
translated: The great means is the vajra lamp, and because he is the lord of that, he is the great means.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: nyon mongs dring 'jigs pas na //
analyzed: nyon mongs dring 'jigs pas na //
translated: because of fear of the mire of afflictions,

original: smon lam rdo rje dri chab ma //
analyzed: smon lam rdo rje dri chab ma //
translated: the vajra perfume is the aspiration.

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir smon lam chen po'o //🔽gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor gyis grags pa'i //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir smon lam chen po'o // gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor gyis grags pa'i //
translated: Because he possesses that, he is the great aspiration.🔽The four doors of the retention maṇḍala

original: sgo rnams srung bar byed pa bzhi //
analyzed: sgo rnams srung bar byed pa bzhi //
translated: are the guardians of fame.

original: so so yang dag rig ngo bo //
analyzed: so so yang dag rig ngo bo //
translated: They are the essence of the correct discriminations,

original: de rnams stobs chen pha rol gnon //
analyzed: de rnams stobs chen pha rol gnon //
translated: and they are the great powers that conquer the enemy.

original: de rnams dang ni ldan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de rnams dang ni ldan pa'i phyir //
translated: Because he possesses them,

original: bcom ldan 'jam dpal stobs chen no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'jam dpal stobs chen no //
translated: the Bhagavān Mañjuśrī is the great power.

original: gzugs dang sgra dang de bzhin dri //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang de bzhin dri //
translated: Form, sound, and likewise smell,

original: ro dang reg bya'i khams rnams te //
analyzed: ro dang reg bya'i khams rnams te //
translated: taste, and the element of touch

original: mchod pa'i lha mo rdzu 'phrul che //
analyzed: mchod pa'i lha mo rdzu 'phrul che //
translated: are the great miraculous offering goddesses.

original: de rnams ye shes che rang bzhin //
analyzed: de rnams ye shes che rang bzhin //
translated: They are the nature of great wisdom.

original: bstan mdzad ye shes che rang brgya'o //
analyzed: bstan mdzad ye shes che rang brgya'o //
translated: They are the great wisdom that is taught.

original: zhi ba'i las mchog sgrub byed pas //
analyzed: zhi ba'i las mchog sgrub byed pas //
translated: Because he accomplishes the supreme activity of peace,

original: sangs rgyas spyan ma byams chen no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas spyan ma byams chen no //
translated: Buddha Lochanā is great love.

original: sdug bsngal sgrol bar rab grags pas //
analyzed: sdug bsngal sgrol bar rab grags pas //
translated: Since he is renowned for liberating from suffering,

original: m'a ma k'i ni snying rje che //
analyzed: m'a ma k'i ni snying rje che //
translated: he is Mamaki, the great compassion.

original: 'di dag lhan cig sbyor ba'i phyir //🔽byams chen rang bzhin dpag tu med ;
analyzed: 'di dag lhan cig sbyor ba'i phyir // byams chen rang bzhin dpag tu med ;
translated: Since he is united with these,🔽he is Amitabha, the nature of great love.

original: / snying rje chen po blo yi mchog /'od dpag med dang gos dkar mo //
analyzed: / snying rje chen po blo yi mchog /'od dpag med dang gos dkar mo //
translated: The supreme mind is great compassion,

original: shes rab chen po nyid sbyor bas //
analyzed: shes rab chen po nyid sbyor bas //
translated: united with great wisdom.

original: shes rab chen po blo chen ldan //
analyzed: shes rab chen po blo chen ldan //
translated: He is the great wisdom, endowed with great mind,

original: btang snyoms che dang blo chen ldan //
analyzed: btang snyoms che dang blo chen ldan //
translated: endowed with great equanimity and great mind.

original: lha mo sgrol ma'o de ldan phyir //
analyzed: lha mo sgrol ma'o de ldan phyir //
translated: Since he possesses Tara, the goddess,

original: mkhas pa chen po thabs che ba //
analyzed: mkhas pa chen po thabs che ba //
translated: he is the great sage, the great means.

original: zhes pa ste 'dis ni dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi mchod pa byed pa yang bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal lo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa ste 'dis ni dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi mchod pa byed pa yang bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal lo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said that he who performs the worship of all mandalas is the Blessed One Manjushri.

original: da ni rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul gyis 'dul ba'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i sgo nas yang dag par brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul gyis 'dul ba'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i sgo nas yang dag par brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to properly explain the acceptance of beings to be tamed by miracles and supernormal powers,🔽it is said:

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te thams cad du gzugs sna tshogs ston pa dang / sgra dang brda sna tshogs kyis chos ston pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa ste sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rdzu 'phrul rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te thams cad du gzugs sna tshogs ston pa dang / sgra dang brda sna tshogs kyis chos ston pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa ste sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rdzu 'phrul rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Great magical power and so on. He displays various forms everywhere, teaches the Dharma with various sounds and symbols, and knows the minds of others. These are the three kinds of magical power of body, speech, and mind.

original: stobs ni nus pa ste bdud thams cad kyis bskyod du med pa nyid do //
analyzed: stobs ni nus pa ste bdud thams cad kyis bskyod du med pa nyid do //
translated: Power is ability, and it is the fact that he cannot be shaken by any demons.

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po'i stobs de dang @164a * //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po'i stobs de dang @164a * //
translated: Having that great magical power,

original: ldan pas chos nyid las g-yo ba med kyang thams cad du bdag gi sku ston par mdzad ba'i phyir shugs chen po dang ldan pas shugs chen no //
analyzed: ldan pas chos nyid las g-yo ba med kyang thams cad du bdag gi sku ston par mdzad ba'i phyir shugs chen po dang ldan pas shugs chen no //
translated: he is of great force because he displays his body everywhere without moving from reality.

original: yid ltar mgyogs pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas mgyogs pa chen po'o //
analyzed: yid ltar mgyogs pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas mgyogs pa chen po'o //
translated: He is of great speed because he has the samadhi called like the mind.

original: de nyid rdzu 'phrul chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid rdzu 'phrul chen po'o //
translated: He is of great magic.

original: chen po nyid kyang yin la gtso bo yang yin pas che bar grags pa zhes bshad pa gang yin pa ste de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: chen po nyid kyang yin la gtso bo yang yin pas che bar grags pa zhes bshad pa gang yin pa ste de ltar bshad do //
translated: It is great and it is the chief, thus it is called the great fame.

original: chen po yang 'di yin la dbang du gyur pa yang zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: chen po yang 'di yin la dbang du gyur pa yang zhes sbyar ro //
translated: It is great and it is the master, thus it is the great power.

original: stobs chen pos gzhan gyi don la brtson pa nyid kyis na stobs chen pha rol gnon pa'o //
analyzed: stobs chen pos gzhan gyi don la brtson pa nyid kyis na stobs chen pha rol gnon pa'o //
translated: It is the great power of the overcomer, because it is the striving for the benefit of others by means of great power.

original: shin tu gzhig par dka' ba nyid kyis srid pa'i ri bo gang yin pa ni chen po ste /
analyzed: shin tu gzhig par dka' ba nyid kyis srid pa'i ri bo gang yin pa ni chen po ste /
translated: The mountain of existence is great because it is very difficult to destroy.

original: 'khor ba'i ri bo bag chags dang bcas pa de gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rjes yang dag par 'joms pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i ri bo bag chags dang bcas pa de gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rjes yang dag par 'joms pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that mountain of existence, together with its latent tendencies, is completely destroyed by the vajra of non-dual gnosis,

original: srid pa'i ri bo chen po bcom pa nyid kyis na chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rdo rje chen po de de'i bdag nyid 'dzin pas de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: srid pa'i ri bo chen po bcom pa nyid kyis na chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rdo rje chen po de de'i bdag nyid 'dzin pas de ltar bshad do //
translated: it is explained that the great vajra of the gnosis of the emptiness of all phenomena holds that nature.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rdo rje de nyid khong stong du ma yin pas mkhregs pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rdo rje de nyid khong stong du ma yin pas mkhregs pa'o //
translated: That vajra of the gnosis of emptiness is hard, because it is not hollow.

original: shin tu sra zhing phra ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi dgra rnams rtsad nas 'byin pa'i phyir drag po chen po ste 'ching ba shin tu brtan po med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu sra zhing phra ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi dgra rnams rtsad nas 'byin pa'i phyir drag po chen po ste 'ching ba shin tu brtan po med par byed pa'o //
translated: He is a great hero because he eradicates the enemy of the extremely hard to overcome latent propensities of the afflictions.

original: drags shul can rnams ni 'jigs byed chen po la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: drags shul can rnams ni 'jigs byed chen po la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The Rudras are Mahakala and so on.

original: de rnams 'dul ba'i don du shin tu drag shul chi ba'i 'jigs pa chen po ni rnam pa lngar bshad de /
analyzed: de rnams 'dul ba'i don du shin tu drag shul chi ba'i 'jigs pa chen po ni rnam pa lngar bshad de /
translated: For the sake of subduing them, he is a great hero of extremely fierce wrath, who is explained as having five types of fearlessness:

original: 'tsho ba med pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa med pa dang / 'chi ba dang ngan 'gro dang 'khor gyi bag tsha ba rnams te de'i gnyen po'i chos ni rang bzhin gyi phyir de rnams kyang 'jigs par byed pa'o //🔽yang na sgra ni 'jigs pa med pa ste chen po yang 'di yin la /
analyzed: 'tsho ba med pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa med pa dang / 'chi ba dang ngan 'gro dang 'khor gyi bag tsha ba rnams te de'i gnyen po'i chos ni rang bzhin gyi phyir de rnams kyang 'jigs par byed pa'o // yang na sgra ni 'jigs pa med pa ste chen po yang 'di yin la /
translated: fearlessness in regard to livelihood, fearlessness in regard to verses, fearlessness in regard to death, fearlessness in regard to lower rebirths, and fearlessness in regard to assemblies.🔽Alternatively, he is a great hero because he is fearless and great,

original: srid pas skrag pa med pa yang yin pas 'jigs pa zhes pa ste 'jigs med chen po 'jigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: srid pas skrag pa med pa yang yin pas 'jigs pa zhes pa ste 'jigs med chen po 'jigs par byed pa'o //
translated: and he is a hero because he is fearless and has no fear of existence.

original: yang snying rje dang khro ba dag gcig pa nyid kyis 'jigs chen 'jigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang snying rje dang khro ba dag gcig pa nyid kyis 'jigs chen 'jigs par byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the great fear of fear, because of the identity of compassion and anger.

original: rig pa dang gsang sngags kyi rang bzhin nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rig pa dang gsang sngags kyi rang bzhin nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the nature of knowledge and mantra,

original: rig sngags che zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rig sngags che zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “great knowledge,” and so on.

original: rig pa chen mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'i gzugs can sngags kyi sku'o //
analyzed: rig pa chen mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'i gzugs can sngags kyi sku'o //
translated: The great knowledge is the form of the perfection of wisdom, the body of mantra.

original: de dang @164b mnyam par ldan ba'i phyir rig pa chen po ste /
analyzed: de dang @164b mnyam par ldan ba'i phyir rig pa chen po ste /
translated: Because it is endowed with that, it is the great knowledge.

original: chen po yang yin la rig pa yang yin pas zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: chen po yang yin la rig pa yang yin pas zhes sbyar ro //
translated: It is great and it is knowledge, so it is connected in this way.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mchog ces te rig pa che mchog go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mchog ces te rig pa che mchog go //
translated: For that very reason, it is supreme, the great supreme knowledge.

original: mgon po ni yang dag par gsungs pa'i lam nye bar ston pa'i 'gro ba rjes su 'khrid par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mgon po ni yang dag par gsungs pa'i lam nye bar ston pa'i 'gro ba rjes su 'khrid par byed pa ste /
translated: The protector is the one who leads beings by teaching the path of the true teaching.

original: 'di ni kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: This is in terms of the conventional.

original: don dam par ni spros pa thams cad dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa ni rig mchog chen pos te /
analyzed: don dam par ni spros pa thams cad dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa ni rig mchog chen pos te /
translated: In terms of the ultimate, it is the great supreme knowledge, which is mixed as one with the nondual wisdom free from all elaborations.

original: rig pa chen po yang yin la mchog kyang yin zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: rig pa chen po yang yin la mchog kyang yin zhes sbyar ro //
translated: It is also the great knowledge and also the supreme.

original: sems can thams cad skyob pa'i don gyis mgon po'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad skyob pa'i don gyis mgon po'o //
translated: It is the lord because of the meaning of protecting all sentient beings.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That itself is stated:

original: gsang sngags che ba'i don zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gsang sngags che ba'i don zhes pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the great mantra.

original: ma na shes pa la'o //
analyzed: ma na shes pa la'o //
translated: Mana means knowledge.

original: trem skyong ba la'o /
analyzed: trem skyong ba la'o /
translated: Trema means to protect.

original: ma nan ma yid do //
analyzed: ma nan ma yid do //
translated: Mana means mind.

original: tra na nam skyob pa'o //
analyzed: tra na nam skyob pa'o //
translated: Tra means to protect.

original: de d'i bdag nyid du rig pa gang yin pa de ni chen po yang yin la gsang sngags kyang yin pas gsang sngags te stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de d'i bdag nyid du rig pa gang yin pa de ni chen po yang yin la gsang sngags kyang yin pas gsang sngags te stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: That which is the knowledge of that nature is the great mantra because it is also the great mantra. It is the nondual wisdom of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mchog ces pa ste gsang sngags che ba'i mchog go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mchog ces pa ste gsang sngags che ba'i mchog go //
translated: For that very reason, it is the supreme mantra.

original: de lta bu'i thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyi gsang sngags chen po'i tshul ston pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni bla ma'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyi gsang sngags chen po'i tshul ston pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni bla ma'o //
translated: The Bhagavān is the guru because he teaches the method and wisdom that have such a nature as the great mantra.

original: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyi mchog ni gsang sngags kyi tshul lo //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyi mchog ni gsang sngags kyi tshul lo //
translated: The supreme of the Mahāyāna systems is the mantra system.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul yang de la gnas pas theg pa chen po'i tshul la gnas //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul yang de la gnas pas theg pa chen po'i tshul la gnas //
translated: The way of the perfections is also based on it, for one who is based on it is based on the way of the universal vehicle.

original: chos nyid kyi tshul gyis de'i rang bzhin nyid du gsungs pa ni chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi tshul gyis de'i rang bzhin nyid du gsungs pa ni chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The way of reality is declared to be its very nature, as it is said:

original: ji srid theg pa'i 'bras bu'i bar du 'di yis mngon par 'dod pa thob par byed cing 'dren par byed pas phan tshun te lam mo //
analyzed: ji srid theg pa'i 'bras bu'i bar du 'di yis mngon par 'dod pa thob par byed cing 'dren par byed pas phan tshun te lam mo //
translated: The universal vehicle is the way of the universal vehicle because it is the path that leads to and obtains the desired result of the vehicle.

original: de gnyi ga'i tshul ni theg pa'i tshul te sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i tshul ni theg pa'i tshul te sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The way of both of them is the way of the vehicle, because it opens the way for all beings.

original: chen po dang mchog ni thams cad las phul du byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po dang mchog ni thams cad las phul du byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is universal and supreme because it is preeminent over all others.

original: theg pa chen po'i tshul yang 'di yin la mchog kyang yin pas de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshul yang 'di yin la mchog kyang yin pas de ltar bshad do //
translated: It is explained that way because it is the way of the universal vehicle and is supreme.

original: lam dang 'bras bu dag don dam par dbye ba med kyang gdul bya la so sor snang ba'i dbang gis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dag 'dir tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: lam dang 'bras bu dag don dam par dbye ba med kyang gdul bya la so sor snang ba'i dbang gis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dag 'dir tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: Although the path and the result are not differentiated in the ultimate, the buddhas and bodhisattvas are differentiated here in terms of their individual appearances for those to be trained.

original: don dam par ni sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad chen po rje btsun 'jam dpal nyid do //🔽sku dang gsung @165a * //
analyzed: don dam par ni sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad chen po rje btsun 'jam dpal nyid do // sku dang gsung @165a * //
translated: In the ultimate sense, the Buddha is the Great Vairocana, the very same as the venerable Manjusri.

original: dang thugs rnams ni mi dge ba bcu las 'das shing yang dag par sdom pas thub ba chen po ste /
analyzed: dang thugs rnams ni mi dge ba bcu las 'das shing yang dag par sdom pas thub ba chen po ste /
translated: The body, speech, and mind are the great sage because they transcend the ten nonvirtues and are perfectly restrained.

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir thub chen ldan no //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir thub chen ldan no //
translated: Because he possesses them, he is endowed with the great sage.

original: sems can thams cad kyis gsang ba gsum gyi de kho na nyid shes par mdzad ba'i phyir thub pa chen po ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis gsang ba gsum gyi de kho na nyid shes par mdzad ba'i phyir thub pa chen po ste /
translated: He is the great sage because he causes all sentient beings to know the reality of the three secrets.

original: tshig gnyis kyis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag gcig pa nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: tshig gnyis kyis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag gcig pa nyid du gsungs so //
translated: The two phrases state the sameness of the accumulations of merit and knowledge.

original: stong pa nyid sgom pa sngon du 'gro bas zla ba'i gzugs kyi steng du rang gi sa bon yongs su gyur pa las lha'i gzugs su grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid sgom pa sngon du 'gro bas zla ba'i gzugs kyi steng du rang gi sa bon yongs su gyur pa las lha'i gzugs su grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the deity's form is accomplished from the transformation of one's own seed syllable upon the form of the moon, which is preceded by the meditation on emptiness,

original: gsang sngags tshul chen las byung ba ste kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags tshul chen las byung ba ste kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: he is born from the great way of the mantra, conventionally.

original: don dam par ni lha dang sngags dag dbyer med pas na /
analyzed: don dam par ni lha dang sngags dag dbyer med pas na /
translated: Ultimately, because the deity and the mantra are inseparable,🔽he is born from the great way of the mantra, ultimately.

original: gsang sngags tshul chen bdag nyid can //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gsang sngags tshul chen bdag nyid can // zhes gsungs te /
translated: The nature of the great way of mantra.

original: gsang sngags chen po'i tshul gang yin pa de ni de kho na'i bdag nyid can no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gsang sngags chen po'i tshul gang yin pa de ni de kho na'i bdag nyid can no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the great way of mantra is the nature of reality itself.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang sa'i bdag po'i ngo bo nyid du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang sa'i bdag po'i ngo bo nyid du gsungs pa ni /
translated: The nature of the perfections and the stages is stated in the line:

original: pha rol phyin bcu zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol phyin bcu zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The ten perfections, and so on.

original: gdul bya'i skye bo rjes su gzung ba'i don du 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i rim gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la goms pa sngon du song bas byang chub thob par ston pas na pha rol phyin bcu thob pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo rjes su gzung ba'i don du 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i rim gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la goms pa sngon du song bas byang chub thob par ston pas na pha rol phyin bcu thob pa'o //
translated: The ten perfections are generosity and so on. The ten perfections are attained because the teacher shows the attainment of enlightenment through prior familiarization with the perfections of generosity and so on by the process of complete purity of the three spheres of action for the sake of guiding disciples.

original: rang gi ngo bos ni de nyid gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang sems can rnams kyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa bcu thob pas na /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni de nyid gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang sems can rnams kyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa bcu thob pas na /
translated: The ten perfections are attained by the nature of the teacher himself because he is the nature of nondual gnosis and because he attains the ten perfections for the sake of sentient beings.

original: de nyid pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la gnas pa'o //
translated: Thus he abides in the ten perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir /
translated: Because of the purity of the nature of the ten perfections,

original: pha rol phyin bcu dag pa ste //
analyzed: pha rol phyin bcu dag pa ste //
translated: he is the purity of the ten perfections.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam pa'i sgra nyid do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam pa'i sgra nyid do //
translated: He is the Blessed One, the Gentle Sound itself.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul gnyis gas 'dren cing ston par byed pas na /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul gnyis gas 'dren cing ston par byed pas na /
translated: Because he leads and teaches by means of the two modes of the conventional and the ultimate,

original: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i tshul lo //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin thob pa de'i rnam par smin par gyur pa rab tu dga' ba la sogs ba'i sa bcu po rnams su kun du rmongs pa dang gnas ngan len dang bral te gtso bo nyid thob pa'i phyir sa
analyzed: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i tshul lo // pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin thob pa de'i rnam par smin par gyur pa rab tu dga' ba la sogs ba'i sa bcu po rnams su kun du rmongs pa dang gnas ngan len dang bral te gtso bo nyid thob pa'i phyir sa
translated: he is the one who possesses the ten perfections.

original: bcu'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: bcu'i dbang phyug go //
translated: He is the lord of the ten grounds, such as the Joyous, which are the fully ripened results of attaining the purity of the nature of the ten perfections, because he is free from delusion and the assumption of bad states and attains the state of being the principal one.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa bcu po thob par 'dod pa'i sems can rnams 'khrid par byed pas na mgon po'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa bcu po thob par 'dod pa'i sems can rnams 'khrid par byed pas na mgon po'o //
translated: He is the protector because he leads sentient beings who desire to attain the ten grounds.

original: sa de dag la byang chub sems dpa'i tshul gyis @165b bzhugs pas na /
analyzed: sa de dag la byang chub sems dpa'i tshul gyis @165b bzhugs pas na /
translated: Because he abides on those grounds in the manner of a bodhisattva,

original: sa bcu la ni rab tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sa bcu la ni rab tu gnas pa'o //
translated: he is the one who abides on the ten grounds.

original: shes pa bcu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: shes pa bcu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The nature of the ten knowledges and so forth is taught.

original: shes bcu zhes pa la sogs pa ste de la shes pa bcu ni /
analyzed: shes bcu zhes pa la sogs pa ste de la shes pa bcu ni /
translated: The ten knowledges are:

original: sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba dang / chos dang / rjes su rtogs pa dang / kun rdzob dang / 'dris pa shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba dang / chos dang / rjes su rtogs pa dang / kun rdzob dang / 'dris pa shes pa rnams so //
translated: the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of origin, the knowledge of cessation, the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of elimination, the knowledge of non-arising, the knowledge of phenomena, the subsequent knowledge, the conventional knowledge, and the knowledge of familiarity.

original: de rnams de'i bdag nyid du'am rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de rnams de'i bdag nyid du'am rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: That which is their nature or the nature of their purity is just as it is.

original: de rnams ni shes bcu rnam dag go //
analyzed: de rnams ni shes bcu rnam dag go //
translated: Those are the ten pure knowledges.

original: sgra ji bzhin shes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ste de de bzhin pas na /
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin shes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ste de de bzhin pas na /
translated: The knowledge of reality just as it is is called omniscience. Since that is just as it is,

original: shes bcu rnam dag 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: shes bcu rnam dag 'chang ba'o //
translated: he possesses the ten pure knowledges.

original: rnam pa bcu po zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po zhes pa ni /
translated: The ten aspects are:

original: bden pa rnam pa bcu po gang yin pa de kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i dang / mtshan nyid kyi dang / rnam par 'byed pa'i dang / phye ste rtogs par byed pa'i dang / dngos po'i dang / nus pa'i dang /
analyzed: bden pa rnam pa bcu po gang yin pa de kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i dang / mtshan nyid kyi dang / rnam par 'byed pa'i dang / phye ste rtogs par byed pa'i dang / dngos po'i dang / nus pa'i dang /
translated: The ten kinds of truth are the relative truth, the ultimate truth, the truth of characteristics, the truth of differentiation, the truth of thorough differentiation, the truth of things, the truth of potential, the truth of expression, the truth of the path, and the truth of the result.🔽

original: zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i dang / lam la 'jug pa shes pa'i bden pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kun 'byung ba'i bden pa rnams so //
analyzed: zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i dang / lam la 'jug pa shes pa'i bden pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kun 'byung ba'i bden pa rnams so //
translated: The ten kinds of reality are the reality of the conventional, the reality of the ultimate, the reality of characteristic, the reality of differentiation, the reality of thorough knowledge, the reality of the object, the reality of the result, the reality of the knowledge of termination and knowledge of nonproduction, the reality of the knowledge of entering the path, and the reality of the origin of the transcendent wisdom of the Tathagata.

original: de rnams ni rnam pa byed pas na rnam pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de rnams ni rnam pa byed pas na rnam pa zhes brjod do //
translated: These are called “aspects” because they are the aspects of the knowable.

original: de la phye ste rtogs pa ni shes bya longs par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la phye ste rtogs pa ni shes bya longs par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The reality of thorough knowledge is the thorough knowledge of the knowable.

original: de yang mi slu ba'i phyir bden pa yin pas phye ste rtogs pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mi slu ba'i phyir bden pa yin pas phye ste rtogs pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: And because it is nondeceptive, it is reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi kun du 'byung ba'i bden pa ni chos kyi sprin dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa dag gi char gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi kun du 'byung ba'i bden pa ni chos kyi sprin dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa dag gi char gyur pa'o //
translated: The reality of the origin of the transcendent wisdom of the Tathagata is the stage of Dharma Cloud and the stage of the Tathagata.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest are easy to understand.

original: de ltar bcu po de rnams don du gnyer bar bya ba yin pas don dang bsgrub pas bya ba'i ngo bo'i don gyi 'bras bu yin pas don bcu'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar bcu po de rnams don du gnyer bar bya ba yin pas don dang bsgrub pas bya ba'i ngo bo'i don gyi 'bras bu yin pas don bcu'i don to //
translated: Since these ten are to be pursued, they are the goal of the process of attainment, and since they are the result of the process of attainment, they are the goal of the ten processes.

original: yang na don bcu po de rnams sems can gyi rgyud la rdzogs par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi don gyi rgyud yin pas na don bcu'i don zhes pa ste rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa nyid bshad pa'o //
analyzed: yang na don bcu po de rnams sems can gyi rgyud la rdzogs par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi don gyi rgyud yin pas na don bcu'i don zhes pa ste rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa nyid bshad pa'o //
translated: Or else, since these ten goals are the causal process of the goal, the nature of which is to perfect them in the life stream of sentient beings, they are the goal of the ten processes.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i thub pa rnams kyi dbus na mchog gi dbang phyug dang ldan pa'i dbang por gyur pas thub dbang ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i thub pa rnams kyi dbus na mchog gi dbang phyug dang ldan pa'i dbang por gyur pas thub dbang ngo //
translated: The ten powers are so called because he is the lord of the powerful, since he is the supreme lord among the powerful, such as the sravakas.🔽He is endowed with the ten powers because he possesses the ten powers of the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang ldan pa'i phyir stobs bcu dang / stobs bcu po rnams gang zhe na /🔽gnas @166a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang ldan pa'i phyir stobs bcu dang / stobs bcu po rnams gang zhe na /🔽gnas @166a * //
translated: What are the ten powers?🔽The first power is the knowledge of what is possible and impossible.

original: dang gnas ma yin pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa dang / khams sna tshogs dang / mos pa sna tshogs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang /
analyzed: dang gnas ma yin pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa dang / khams sna tshogs dang / mos pa sna tshogs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang /
translated: the ripening of karma, the various realms, the various aspirations, the superior and inferior faculties, the path that goes everywhere, the concentrations, the liberations,🔽

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: The ten powers are the power of knowledge regarding proper and improper conditions, the power of knowledge regarding the fruition of evolutionary actions, the power of knowledge regarding various higher interests, the power of knowledge regarding various dhātus, the power of knowledge regarding supreme and nonsupreme faculties, the power of knowledge regarding the path going everywhere, the power of knowledge regarding recollection of former lives, the power of knowledge regarding death and rebirth, and the power of knowledge regarding the termination of contaminations.

original: sngar bshad pa'i stobs rnams ni sa dgu la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yin par bshad la /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i stobs rnams ni sa dgu la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yin par bshad la /
translated: The ten powers explained above are said to belong to bodhisattvas on the ten stages.

original: 'dir slar yang bshad pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams so //
analyzed: 'dir slar yang bshad pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams so //
translated: Here, they are explained as the powers of the Tathāgata.

original: stobs bcu dang ldan pas thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pas na khyab bdag go //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang ldan pas thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pas na khyab bdag go //
translated: Because he possesses the ten powers, he is the lord of all, and therefore he is the universal lord.

original: de'i phyir kun gyi don ni ma lus byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun gyi don ni ma lus byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he performs the benefit of all without exception.

original: dbang bcu po tshe dang / sems dang / yo byad dang / las dang / skye ba dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / mos pa dang / smon lam dang / ye shes dang / chos rnams te rab tu dbye ba bcu po de rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir rnam bcu dbang ldan no //
analyzed: dbang bcu po tshe dang / sems dang / yo byad dang / las dang / skye ba dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / mos pa dang / smon lam dang / ye shes dang / chos rnams te rab tu dbye ba bcu po de rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir rnam bcu dbang ldan no //
translated: The ten masteries are mastery over life, mind, requisites, action, birth, aspiration, resolution, knowledge, Dharma, and miracles. Because he possesses these ten kinds of mastery, he is the one who possesses the ten masteries.

original: dbang bcu po de rnams rang dbang du ldan pa'i phyir chen po'o //
analyzed: dbang bcu po de rnams rang dbang du ldan pa'i phyir chen po'o //
translated: Because he possesses these ten masteries in a supreme way, he is the great one.

original: chos nyid kyi ngo bos yang dag par brjod pa'i phyir thog ma la sogs pa zhes pa'i sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi ngo bos yang dag par brjod pa'i phyir thog ma la sogs pa zhes pa'i sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Because he is the one who has perfectly expressed the nature of reality, he is the one who is described as the beginningless and so on.

original: sngar skye ba dgag pa'i skabs su thog ma med pa rab tu bsgrubs so //
analyzed: sngar skye ba dgag pa'i skabs su thog ma med pa rab tu bsgrubs so //
translated: The beginninglessness was established earlier in the context of the refutation of arising.

original: de nyid kyi phyir spros med bdag go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir spros med bdag go //
translated: For that very reason, he is the one without conceptual elaboration.

original: de la dag pa'i bdag gi gtan tshigs gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la dag pa'i bdag gi gtan tshigs gsungs pa /
translated: The reason for his being the pure self is stated:

original: de bzhin nyid bdag ces pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid bdag ces pa'o //
translated: The suchness self.

original: ji ltar thugs su chud pa'i don gyi de kho na nyid ston pa po nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar thugs su chud pa'i don gyi de kho na nyid ston pa po nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: He is the one who teaches the suchness that is the meaning of what is realized.

original: yang dag ces pa la sogs pa ste yang dag pa ni chos kyi tshul lo //
analyzed: yang dag ces pa la sogs pa ste yang dag pa ni chos kyi tshul lo //
translated: The correct way is the way of the Dharma.

original: de kho na nyid de smra ba'i ngang tshul dang ldan pa'i phyir yang dag smra ba'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid de smra ba'i ngang tshul dang ldan pa'i phyir yang dag smra ba'o //
translated: He is the one who speaks correctly because he is endowed with the nature of speaking that reality.

original: 'gro ba rnams la phan par bya ba'i phyir 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes dam bcas pa de bzhin du rdzogs par mdzad pa'i phyir ji skad smra ba de bzhin byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams la phan par bya ba'i phyir 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes dam bcas pa de bzhin du rdzogs par mdzad pa'i phyir ji skad smra ba de bzhin byed pa'o //
translated: He is the one who does what he says he will do because he accomplishes just as he has promised, “I will awaken in order to benefit migrating beings.”

original: yang na ji ltar gzhan rnams la sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i chos ston pa de bzhin du rang nyid kyang de la 'jug par byed pas na /🔽ji skad smra ba de bzhin byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na ji ltar gzhan rnams la sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i chos ston pa de bzhin du rang nyid kyang de la 'jug par byed pas na / ji skad smra ba de bzhin byed pa'o //
translated: Or else, he is the one who does what he says he will do because he engages in generosity, morality, etc., just as he teaches them to others.

original: ji ltar gnas pa'i chos kyi de kho na nyid rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i phyir @166b tshig gzhan med pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa'i chos kyi de kho na nyid rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i phyir @166b tshig gzhan med pa'o //
translated: He is the one who has no other because he illuminates the reality of the Dharma just as it is.

original: gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang shes pa dang shes bya la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang shes pa dang shes bya la sogs pa ste /
translated: The other is the duality of subject and object, consciousness and object of consciousness, etc.

original: gang la gnyis yod pa ma yin pa de ni gnyis med do //
analyzed: gang la gnyis yod pa ma yin pa de ni gnyis med do //
translated: That which is not dual is nondual.

original: ji ltar gnyis med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyis med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it nondual?

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi gnyis ni phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis ma grub po //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi gnyis ni phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis ma grub po //
translated: The duality of apprehended and apprehender, etc., is not established because they are mutually dependent.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: gal te dngos po gang ltos grub //
analyzed: gal te dngos po gang ltos grub //
translated: If an entity is established in dependence,

original: de nyid la yang ltos na ni //🔽ltos bya gang yin de 'grub na //
analyzed: de nyid la yang ltos na ni // ltos bya gang yin de 'grub na //
translated: then it depends on that very thing.🔽If that which is dependent is established,

original: gang la ltos nas gang zhig 'grub //
analyzed: gang la ltos nas gang zhig 'grub //
translated: then depending on what is it established?

original: dngos po ltos 'grub gang yin pa //
analyzed: dngos po ltos 'grub gang yin pa //
translated: If an entity is established in dependence,

original: de ma grub na ji ltar ltos //
analyzed: de ma grub na ji ltar ltos //
translated: how can it depend if it is not established?

original: ji ste grub pa ltos she na //
analyzed: ji ste grub pa ltos she na //
translated: But if it is established, then it depends.

original: de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
translated: It is not tenable that it depends.

original: zhes so // ma ltos pa'i dngos po med pas chos thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes so // ma ltos pa'i dngos po med pas chos thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Since there are no nondependent entities, all phenomena are dependently arisen.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad stong pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad stong pa'o //
translated: Because they are dependently arisen, all phenomena are empty.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang phyir rten 'byung ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: gang phyir rten 'byung ma yin pa'i //
translated: Because they are not arisen without dependence,

original: chos 'ga' yod pa ma yin pa //🔽de phyir stong pa ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: chos 'ga' yod pa ma yin pa // de phyir stong pa ma yin pa'i //
translated: There is no existent phenomenon🔽That is not empty.🔽Therefore, there is no existent phenomenon

original: chos 'ga' yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos 'ga' yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not empty.

original: zhes rnam par dag pa gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ni gnyis su med par bshad de kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: zhes rnam par dag pa gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ni gnyis su med par bshad de kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: Thus, the nature of the reality of nondual purity, the Bhagavat Mañjuśrī, is explained as nondual in the conventional sense.

original: don dam par ni gnyis su med par med cing gnyis kyang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par ni gnyis su med par med cing gnyis kyang med pa'i phyir /
translated: In the ultimate sense, he is nondual because neither duality nor nonduality exist.

original: ji ltar gnyis su med par gsung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyis su med par gsung ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that he is said to be nondual?

original: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dang bral ba de ni rnam par rtog pa med pa dang gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i tshig tu brjod pa dang bral ba'i phyir bden pa gsung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dang bral ba de ni rnam par rtog pa med pa dang gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i tshig tu brjod pa dang bral ba'i phyir bden pa gsung ba yin gyi /
translated: He is the speaker of the truth because he is free from conceptualization and analysis, and he is free from the expression of words that have the nature of nonconceptualization and nonduality.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa byed pa'i sgra'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa byed pa'i sgra'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: He is not the nature of words that follow and reverse conceptualization.

original: 'on kyang rgyu tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba ste /
translated: However, he is related to mere causes.

original: rgyu yang rgyu tsam du bya ba byed do //
analyzed: rgyu yang rgyu tsam du bya ba byed do //
translated: The cause also functions as a cause.

original: de bya ba dang bral du zin kyang yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du gdul bya'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don mdzad par snang ste /
analyzed: de bya ba dang bral du zin kyang yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du gdul bya'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don mdzad par snang ste /
translated: Even though it is devoid of activity, it appears to perform the function of the object desired by the disciple, like a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: rkyen las skyes pa la gnyis su med par gsungs pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rkyen las skyes pa la gnyis su med par gsungs pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching that it is said that what arises from conditions is nondual.

original: bcom ldan 'das gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The Blessed One, not only is the nondual nature,

original: khams gsum pa yang gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin du smra bar byed ces pa'i don to /
analyzed: khams gsum pa yang gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin du smra bar byed ces pa'i don to /
translated: but also the three realms are said to be of the nature of nonduality.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gang //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gang //
translated: Whatever is the nature of the Tathagata,

original: de ni 'gro 'di'i rang bzhin @167a * //
analyzed: de ni 'gro 'di'i rang bzhin @167a * //
translated: That is the nature of this world.

original: yin ; / zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bshad do //
analyzed: yin ; / zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bshad do //
translated: And so on, as was previously explained.

original: yang dag par zhes bya ba ni bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par zhes bya ba ni bden pa'o //
translated: “Correct” means true.

original: de'i mtha' ni mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mtha' ni mthar thug pa ste /
translated: “Its limit” is the ultimate.

original: de las gzhan pa'i bden pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i bden pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no other truth beyond that.

original: de la de'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par gnas pas na yang dag mtha' la rnam par gnas pa'o /
analyzed: de la de'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par gnas pas na yang dag mtha' la rnam par gnas pa'o /
translated: He is situated in the reality limit because he is situated in the nature of that.

original: yang dag mtha' ni zhes klog pa ltar na /
analyzed: yang dag mtha' ni zhes klog pa ltar na /
translated: If one reads “in the reality limit,”

original: gang gi phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' ni chos kyi dbyings te de'i phyir de la rtag tu gnas so zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' ni chos kyi dbyings te de'i phyir de la rtag tu gnas so zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: then one should explain that he is always situated in that, because the reality limit is the dharma-dhātu.

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i sems can gdul ba'i phyir bdag med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i sems can gdul ba'i phyir bdag med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He is called “the lion’s roar of selflessness” because he teaches selflessness in order to subdue sentient beings who are attached to a self.

original: bdag dang bral bas bdag med pa ste gang zag dang chos kyi bdag med pa'o //🔽dngos po bdag med pa la gsal bar byed cing seng ge bzhin du gzhan dag kun du skrag par byed pa'i sgra 'byin pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: bdag dang bral bas bdag med pa ste gang zag dang chos kyi bdag med pa'o // dngos po bdag med pa la gsal bar byed cing seng ge bzhin du gzhan dag kun du skrag par byed pa'i sgra 'byin pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Selflessness is the absence of self, the absence of the self of persons and things.

original: bdag med seng ge'i sgra dang ldan no //
analyzed: bdag med seng ge'i sgra dang ldan no //
translated: He is the one who proclaims selflessness, who frightens others like a lion with the roar that proclaims selflessness.

original: de nyid mu stegs ri dags ngan 'jigs byed de /
analyzed: de nyid mu stegs ri dags ngan 'jigs byed de /
translated: He is the one who frightens the evil beasts of the tīrthikas.

original: mu stegs ngan pa'i lam dang ldan pa de rnams ni ri dags dang 'dra bas ri dags so //
analyzed: mu stegs ngan pa'i lam dang ldan pa de rnams ni ri dags dang 'dra bas ri dags so //
translated: Those who possess the path of bad sophistry are like deer, thus they are deer.

original: de rnams 'jigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams 'jigs par byed pa'o //
translated: They are frightened by this.

original: mu stegs ngan pa de rnams kyang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mu stegs ngan pa de rnams kyang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are those bad sophists?

original: tshad ma dang 'gal bar bdag med pa nyid du khas len pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma dang 'gal bar bdag med pa nyid du khas len pa'o //
translated: They accept selflessness in contradiction to valid cognition.

original: de yang re zhig khams drug pa'i skyes bu ni med de /
analyzed: de yang re zhig khams drug pa'i skyes bu ni med de /
translated: Moreover, first, a person consisting of the six elements does not exist.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sa min chu me rlung ma yin //
analyzed: sa min chu me rlung ma yin //
translated: Earth, water, fire, wind,

original: nam mkha' rnam shes skyes bu min //
analyzed: nam mkha' rnam shes skyes bu min //
translated: space, and consciousness are not a person.

original: de rnams thams cad ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad ma yin pa'i //
translated: Since all of those are not it,

original: gzhan pa'i skyes bu ci zhig yod //
analyzed: gzhan pa'i skyes bu ci zhig yod //
translated: what other person is there?

original: bshad ces pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bshad ces pa lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is explained.

original: skyes bu zhes pa bdag go //
analyzed: skyes bu zhes pa bdag go //
translated: A person is a self.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po yang de dag ma yin te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po yang de dag ma yin te /
translated: The appropriated aggregates are also not it.

original: ji skad du ;🔽phung po bdag min de las gzhan //
analyzed: ji skad du ; phung po bdag min de las gzhan //
translated: As it is said:

original: ma yin de la yod pa yin //
analyzed: ma yin de la yod pa yin //
translated: The aggregates are not the self, nor is the self something different from them.

original: me dang bud shing ltar 'dres min /
analyzed: me dang bud shing ltar 'dres min /
translated: It is not mixed like fire and fuel.

original: de phyir phung po yod pa ci //
analyzed: de phyir phung po yod pa ci //
translated: Therefore, how could the aggregates exist?

original: zhes rnam par dpyad na yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes rnam par dpyad na yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, when analyzed, it does not exist.

original: de yang gal te phung po rnams bdag yin na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i cha can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang gal te phung po rnams bdag yin na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i cha can du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the aggregates were the self, they would have the quality of arising and disintegrating.

original: phung po rnams ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the aggregates have the quality of arising and disintegrating.

original: de ltar re zhig phung po rnams bdag ma yin zhing phung po rnams las gzhan pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig phung po rnams bdag ma yin zhing phung po rnams las gzhan pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the aggregates are not the self, nor is the self something other than the aggregates.

original: gal te bdag phung po rnams las gzhan du gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bdag phung po rnams las gzhan du gyur na /
translated: If the self were something other than the aggregates,

original: bdag dang phung po mtshan nyid mi mthun par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag dang phung po mtshan nyid mi mthun par 'gyur te /
translated: the self and the aggregates would have different characteristics.

original: gang gi phyir phung po rnams ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang @167b 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phung po rnams ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang @167b 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because the aggregates have the characteristics of arising, abiding, and disintegrating.

original: bdag de las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur na ni 'dus ma byas nyid kyi phyir bong bu'i rva bzhin mtshan nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag de las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur na ni 'dus ma byas nyid kyi phyir bong bu'i rva bzhin mtshan nyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the self had a different characteristic from that of the aggregates, it would be unconditioned, and thus, like the horn of a rabbit, it would have no characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid med pas nam yang dngos po med de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pas nam yang dngos po med de /
translated: And because it would have no characteristics, it would never be a thing.

original: bdag ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: There is no self at all.

original: bdag gi mtshan nyid med pas nga yir byed pa'ang med de /
analyzed: bdag gi mtshan nyid med pas nga yir byed pa'ang med de /
translated: Since the self has no characteristics, there is no “mine.”

original: nga ni sbom po'o nga ni phra mo'o nga ni dkar po'o zhes pa yang phung po'i yul la sbyar ba de bzhin du nga yir byed pa sbom po dang phra mo'i rang bzhin gyi bdag kyang med do //
analyzed: nga ni sbom po'o nga ni phra mo'o nga ni dkar po'o zhes pa yang phung po'i yul la sbyar ba de bzhin du nga yir byed pa sbom po dang phra mo'i rang bzhin gyi bdag kyang med do //
translated: Just as “I am fat,” “I am thin,” “I am fair” are applied to the object of the aggregates, so too there is no self that is the nature of fat or thin.

original: bdag la phung po rnams med cing phung po rnams la'ang bdag med do //
analyzed: bdag la phung po rnams med cing phung po rnams la'ang bdag med do //
translated: The aggregates do not exist in the self, and the self does not exist in the aggregates.

original: phung po rnams bdag dang ldan pa yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: phung po rnams bdag dang ldan pa yang mi rigs so //
translated: It is also illogical for the aggregates to possess the self.

original: 'di phyogs gsum gyi dbye bas yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir de nyid dang gzhan gyi phyogs kyis dngos po lnga yang nang du 'dus pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di phyogs gsum gyi dbye bas yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir de nyid dang gzhan gyi phyogs kyis dngos po lnga yang nang du 'dus pa nyid de /
translated: Since the three positions of this analysis are untenable, the five positions of the other schools are also included in this refutation.

original: de ltar rnam pa lngas btsal ba na med pa'i phyir bdag med par grub pas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa lngas btsal ba na med pa'i phyir bdag med par grub pas /
translated: Since the self is not found in any of these five ways, it is established that it does not exist.

original: bdag med seng ge'i sgra dang ldan //
analyzed: bdag med seng ge'i sgra dang ldan //
translated: The Lion’s Roar of the Absence of Self

original: zhes bya'o // don dam par 'gro ba med kyang thams cad cig car gdul bya'i skye bo rnams las so //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // don dam par 'gro ba med kyang thams cad cig car gdul bya'i skye bo rnams las so //
translated: Although there is no ultimate going, all at once, for all beings to be trained.

original: snang ba'i phyir kun du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: snang ba'i phyir kun du 'gro ba ste /
translated: It is omnipresent because it appears.

original: chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa ni chos 'ga' yod pa ma yin no zhes khyab par byed pa'i rigs pas kun du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa ni chos 'ga' yod pa ma yin no zhes khyab par byed pa'i rigs pas kun du 'gro ba'o //
translated: There is no phenomenon whatsoever that is not included in the dharmadhatu. It is omnipresent by the reasoning of pervasion.

original: don yod stobs ni 'bras bu yod pa ste gdul bya rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyis thams cad du khyab par byed pa gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: don yod stobs ni 'bras bu yod pa ste gdul bya rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyis thams cad du khyab par byed pa gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of “omnipresent” is that it is fruitful, for it is omnipresent in the sense that it completely fulfills the needs of those to be trained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yid mgyogs kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yid mgyogs kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir /
translated: It is like the mind of the Tathagata, for it is the essence of the samadhi of the Tathagata's swift mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yid ltar mgyogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yid ltar mgyogs so //
translated: It is swift like the mind of the Tathagata.

original: rgyal ba ni nang gi nyon mongs pa las rgyal ba ste bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: rgyal ba ni nang gi nyon mongs pa las rgyal ba ste bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Victorious One is victorious over inner afflictions. The Bhagavat has said:

original: sdig pa'i chos las nga rgyal te //
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos las nga rgyal te //
translated: I am victorious over sinful dharmas.

original: de pas nyer 'gro nga rgyal bas //
analyzed: de pas nyer 'gro nga rgyal bas //
translated: Therefore, I am the Victorious One.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir bdud las rgyal bas na dgra rgyal lo //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir bdud las rgyal bas na dgra rgyal lo //
translated: He is the Victor over the enemy, because he is victorious over the demons.

original: de gnyis ka las rnam par rgyal ba'i ngang tshul dang ldan pa'i phyir rnam par rgyal lo //
analyzed: de gnyis ka las rnam par rgyal ba'i ngang tshul dang ldan pa'i phyir rnam par rgyal lo //
translated: He is the Victorious One, because he is endowed with the nature of being victorious over both.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zil gyis mi non pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mdzad pas na 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zil gyis mi non pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mdzad pas na 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: He is the Universal Monarch, because he turns the wheel of the Dharma which cannot be overcome.

original: tshogs gnyis las nges par 'khrungs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo la sogs pa'i 'khor dang ldan pa'o //🔽stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin @168a * //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis las nges par 'khrungs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo la sogs pa'i 'khor dang ldan pa'o // stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin @168a * //
translated: He is endowed with an entourage of Bodhisattvas, wrathful deities, and so forth, who are born from the two accumulations.

original: pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin du stobs po che'o //
analyzed: pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin du stobs po che'o //
translated: He is the Great Powerful One, because he is endowed with the perfection of power.

original: de nyid thams cad kyi bdag po nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid thams cad kyi bdag po nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: He is said to be the Lord of all:

original: tshogs rje zhes pa la sogs pa ste byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gyi gtso bo nyid kyi phyir tshogs mchog go //
analyzed: tshogs rje zhes pa la sogs pa ste byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gyi gtso bo nyid kyi phyir tshogs mchog go //
translated: He is the Supreme Assembly, because he is the chief of the Bodhisattva Sangha.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa bslab pa nyid kun spyod 'dzin du 'jug pas na tshogs kyi slob dpon no //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa bslab pa nyid kun spyod 'dzin du 'jug pas na tshogs kyi slob dpon no //
translated: He is the master of the assembly because he causes the assembly of śrāvakas and so on to take up the training.

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan pa'i lha rnams kyi tshogs kyi gtso bor gyur pas na tshogs rje'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan pa'i lha rnams kyi tshogs kyi gtso bor gyur pas na tshogs rje'o //
translated: He is the lord of the assembly because he is the chief of the assembly of gods who possess great magical power.

original: de las gzhan pa'i gnod sbyin dang lha ma yin la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams kyi gtso bor gyur cing skyong bar mdzad pas na tshogs bdag go //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i gnod sbyin dang lha ma yin la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams kyi gtso bor gyur cing skyong bar mdzad pas na tshogs bdag go //
translated: He is the lord of the assembly because he is the chief and protector of the assembly of yakṣas, asuras, and so on, other than those.

original: de'i phyir dbang dang ldan zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang dang ldan zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he is said to be “powerful.”

original: 'di rnams thams cad kyi gtso bo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad kyi gtso bo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means he is the chief of all of them.

original: yang na tshogs kyi mchog ces pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor chen por ro //
analyzed: yang na tshogs kyi mchog ces pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor chen por ro //
translated: Or, “the supreme assembly” means in the great maṇḍala of the tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams kyi mchog ces sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams kyi mchog ces sbyar ro //
translated: The tathāgata is connected with the supreme assembly of bodhisattvas and so on.

original: tshogs kyi slob dpon ni khro bo'i dkyil 'khor du drag pos gnas nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi slob dpon ni khro bo'i dkyil 'khor du drag pos gnas nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //
translated: The master of the assembly is the one who, in the wrathful mandala, abides wrathfully and causes the bodhisattva activities to be undertaken.

original: tshogs kyi rje ni tshu rol 'jig rten pa'i dkyil 'khor du dkyil 'khor dbus su bzhugs nas da ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi rje ni tshu rol 'jig rten pa'i dkyil 'khor du dkyil 'khor dbus su bzhugs nas da ni ston pa'o //
translated: The lord of the assembly is the one who, in the mundane mandala, abides in the center of the mandala and teaches now.

original: gtso bo'i dbang po'o zhes byin gyis rlob par mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo'i dbang po'o zhes byin gyis rlob par mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He is the lord of the principal one, because he is the one who blesses.

original: tshogs bdag ni gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor du gzungs ma'i tshogs thams cad kyi dga' ba skyed pa'i bdag po nyid kyis bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs bdag ni gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor du gzungs ma'i tshogs thams cad kyi dga' ba skyed pa'i bdag po nyid kyis bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The lord of the assembly is the one who abides as the lord who generates the delight of the entire assembly of the knowledge consorts in the knowledge mandala.

original: de ltar thams cad du cig car dbang thob pa nyid kyi phyir dbang ldan no //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad du cig car dbang thob pa nyid kyi phyir dbang ldan no //
translated: Thus, he is the powerful one, because he is the one who has attained power everywhere and all at once.

original: de nyid thams cad du khyab pa nyid kyis mthu chen te 'di la mthu chen po mnga' bas de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid thams cad du khyab pa nyid kyis mthu chen te 'di la mthu chen po mnga' bas de ltar bshad do //
translated: He is the one with great power, because he pervades everywhere. He is explained in that way because he has great power.

original: des sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las la gces par 'dzin pa'i phyir gces pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: des sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las la gces par 'dzin pa'i phyir gces pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is a cherisher because it cherishes the Tathagata's activity, which is characterized by the performance of the aims of sentient beings.

original: de nyid sngon gyi smon lam gyi 'phen pa'i shugs kyis rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'o //🔽nam mkha' bzhin du sems can thams cad la 'dis go skabs 'byed pa'i phyir chen po yang 'di yin la /
analyzed: de nyid sngon gyi smon lam gyi 'phen pa'i shugs kyis rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'o // nam mkha' bzhin du sems can thams cad la 'dis go skabs 'byed pa'i phyir chen po yang 'di yin la /
translated: It is not dependent on others because it is engaged by its own momentum by the force of the former aspiration.

original: sngags la sogs pa'i theg pa chen po'i bdag nyid can gyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshul yang yin pas na tshul chen no //
analyzed: sngags la sogs pa'i theg pa chen po'i bdag nyid can gyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshul yang yin pas na tshul chen no //
translated: It is a great way because it is a way that is the nature of the Mahayana, such as the mantra vehicle, and it is a great way because it provides an opportunity for all sentient beings, like space.

original: tshig thams cad kyi dbang phyug nyid du @168b gyur pa'i bdag nyid chen po gsungs pa /
analyzed: tshig thams cad kyi dbang phyug nyid du @168b gyur pa'i bdag nyid chen po gsungs pa /
translated: The great being who is the lord of all words is stated:

original: tshig rje zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshig rje zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The lord of words, etc.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa lhag par rtogs pas thams cad stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la sogs pa'i don nges par bstan pa rnams dang mi zad pa nges par bstan pa rnams la tshig gi
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa lhag par rtogs pas thams cad stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la sogs pa'i don nges par bstan pa rnams dang mi zad pa nges par bstan pa rnams la tshig gi
translated: Because of his superior realization of the analytical knowledge of meaning, he is the lord of the assembly because he teaches the meaning of emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and so on, and the inexhaustibility of the four analytical knowledges, with words that are

original: dbang du gyur pa'i tshig brjod do //🔽chos so so yang dag par lhag par rtogs pas sems can rnams kyi spyod pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi'i sems kyi 'jug pa rnams 'dis mkhyen nas chos kyi phung po stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi po rnams skad cig tha dad pa sna tshogs kyis nges
analyzed: dbang du gyur pa'i tshig brjod do // chos so so yang dag par lhag par rtogs pas sems can rnams kyi spyod pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi'i sems kyi 'jug pa rnams 'dis mkhyen nas chos kyi phung po stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi po rnams skad cig tha dad pa sna tshogs kyis nges
translated: unobstructed in their engagement with the meaning.

original: par ston pa la tshig gi mnga' bdag tu gyur pa'i phyir tshogs kyi bdag po'o //
analyzed: par ston pa la tshig gi mnga' bdag tu gyur pa'i phyir tshogs kyi bdag po'o //
translated: Because of his superior realization of the analytical knowledge of phenomena, he is the lord of the assembly because he teaches the four hundred sets of a thousand qualities with various different words in a single instant, having understood the mental engagements of the eighty-four thousand activities of sentient beings with this knowledge.

original: rigs pa dang grol bar smra ba'i nus pa'i mtshan nyid can spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa lhag par rtogs pas 'dul ba'i thabs mtha' yas pas sems can mtha' yas pa'i yid rab tu tshim par mdzad cing spobs pa mtha' yas pas rgyun mi 'chad
analyzed: rigs pa dang grol bar smra ba'i nus pa'i mtshan nyid can spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa lhag par rtogs pas 'dul ba'i thabs mtha' yas pas sems can mtha' yas pa'i yid rab tu tshim par mdzad cing spobs pa mtha' yas pas rgyun mi 'chad
translated: The power of eloquence, which is characterized by the ability to teach with reason and liberation, is the perfect knowledge of eloquence. Because of the infinite methods of discipline, the infinite minds of infinite sentient beings are satisfied. Because of infinite eloquence, the stream of speech arises without interruption.

original: pa'i tshig gi rgyun 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni tshig mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i tshig gi rgyun 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni tshig mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: That is infinite speech.

original: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das mgon po 'jam pa'i dpal ni zad mi shes pa'i tshig gi mdzod nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das mgon po 'jam pa'i dpal ni zad mi shes pa'i tshig gi mdzod nyid du bstan to //
translated: This also shows that the Blessed Lord Protector Manjushri is himself an inexhaustible treasury of speech.

original: sems can rnams la gcig tu phan zhing mi slu ba nyid kyis tshig bden pa gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams la gcig tu phan zhing mi slu ba nyid kyis tshig bden pa gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: That which is true speech is just so, because it is exclusively beneficial and non-deceptive to sentient beings.

original: bden pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Truth is non-abiding nirvana.

original: de gsungs pa'i ngang tshul nyid kyi phyir bden par smra ba'o //
analyzed: de gsungs pa'i ngang tshul nyid kyi phyir bden par smra ba'o //
translated: Because of the nature of teaching that, it is truthful speech.

original: ngang gi sgra ni nges gzung gi don to //
analyzed: ngang gi sgra ni nges gzung gi don to //
translated: The word “only” has the meaning of restriction.

original: bden pa bzhi ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam zhes bshad pa rnams la rim pa bzhin re re la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam zhes bshad pa rnams la rim pa bzhin re re la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four noble truths are explained as the truths of suffering, origin, cessation and path. Each of these has four aspects.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rgyu dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen dang / 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom dang / nges 'byung dang /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rgyu dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen dang / 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom dang / nges 'byung dang /
translated: The aspects of the truth of suffering are impermanence, suffering, emptiness and selflessness. The aspects of the truth of origin are origin, cause, strong generation and condition. The aspects of the truth of cessation are cessation, pacification, excellence and definite emergence.

original: lam dang ; rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges 'byung gi rnam pa rnams so //
analyzed: lam dang ; rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges 'byung gi rnam pa rnams so //
translated: The aspects of the truth of the path are path, suitability, achievement and definite emergence.

original: 'phags pa rnams de kho na ltar bden pas 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams so //🔽de rnams ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du phyin ci ma log par ston par byed pas na /🔽bden pa bzhi ni ston pa po //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams de kho na ltar bden pas 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams so // de rnams ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du phyin ci ma log par ston par byed pas na / bden pa bzhi ni ston pa po //
translated: They are noble truths because they are truths for noble beings.

original: de yang sdug @169a * //
analyzed: de yang sdug @169a * //
translated: They are the four noble truths because they are the teacher of those truths.🔽The teacher is the Bhagavan.🔽He is the teacher because he teaches the four noble truths in accordance with reality.

original: bsngal gsum dang ldan pas mi mthun pas gzir ba nyid kyis nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: bsngal gsum dang ldan pas mi mthun pas gzir ba nyid kyis nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: The five aggregates of attachment are suffering because they are oppressed by the three kinds of suffering.

original: de rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: They are to be fully understood as being essenceless because they are dependently arisen.

original: gang gi phyir sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni kun 'byung ste sred pa dang / las ngang nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kun 'byung ba ste snga ma bzhin du yongs su shes pa nyid kyis spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni kun 'byung ste sred pa dang / las ngang nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kun 'byung ba ste snga ma bzhin du yongs su shes pa nyid kyis spang bar bya'o //
translated: The origin is the cause of suffering, i.e., craving, action, and the afflictions, which are to be abandoned by full understanding just as they are.

original: sdug bsngal dang bral nas slar mi 'byung ba ni log pa ste de ni de bzhin kho nar mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral nas slar mi 'byung ba ni log pa ste de ni de bzhin kho nar mngon du bya'o //
translated: Cessation is the complete pacification of just those, i.e., the complete cessation of just those things that are suffering. It is to be realized just as it is.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ni lam ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ni lam ste /
translated: The path is the eightfold noble path that leads to the cessation of suffering, which is to be cultivated just as it is.

original: de yang de bzhin kho nar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsam par bya zhing bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin kho nar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsam par bya zhing bsgom par bya'o //
translated: And that is to be contemplated and cultivated just as it is by the bodhisattvas.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas sdug bsngal yongs su shes par byas te /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas sdug bsngal yongs su shes par byas te /
translated: For sravakas and so on, suffering is fully known by way of impermanence and so on.

original: nges par 'byin pas sems can gyi don la rgyab kyis phyogs nas kun 'byung bas sred pa la sogs pas mtshan nyid spangs te /
