analyzed: nges par 'byin pas sems can gyi don la rgyab kyis phyogs nas kun 'byung bas sred pa la sogs pas mtshan nyid spangs te /
translated: Since they definitely emerge from samsara, they turn their back on the benefit of sentient beings, abandon the characteristics of craving and so on that are the origin of suffering and

original: phung po rnams thams cad du 'chang ba'i 'gog pa mngon du byas te lam bsgoms nas mar me bzhin mya ngan las 'da' ba'i lam ston pas /
analyzed: phung po rnams thams cad du 'chang ba'i 'gog pa mngon du byas te lam bsgoms nas mar me bzhin mya ngan las 'da' ba'i lam ston pas /
translated: actualize the cessation of all appropriation of the aggregates. They meditate on the path and then attain nirvana like a flame, since they are taught the path to nirvana.

original: bden pa bzhi ni ston pa po //🔽phyir mi ldog pa zhes pa ni rtog pa las phyir mi ldog pas phyir mi ldog pa ste de nyid kyi phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi ni ston pa po // phyir mi ldog pa zhes pa ni rtog pa las phyir mi ldog pas phyir mi ldog pa ste de nyid kyi phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: The four truths are taught.🔽Nonreturners are nonreturners because they do not return from the state of conception.

original: rang gi don la de phan gyi rkyen dang tshig sngon ma la 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi don la de phan gyi rkyen dang tshig sngon ma la 'phel ba'o //
translated: They are nonreturners because they do not return to their own benefit, since they increase the former words of the condition of benefit.

original: sa brgyad pa gnas pa'i shes rab sems dpa' ni phyir mi ldog par bshad do //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa gnas pa'i shes rab sems dpa' ni phyir mi ldog par bshad do //
translated: The eighth level is explained to be the level of the irreversible bodhisattva.

original: phyir mi 'ong zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i slob ma la brjod de 'dod pa'i 'jig rten du phyir mi 'ong ba nyid du nyon mongs pa zad par byas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i slob ma la brjod de 'dod pa'i 'jig rten du phyir mi 'ong ba nyid du nyon mongs pa zad par byas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The non-returner is said to be a disciple who has attained the result of the Śrāvaka Vehicle, who has exhausted the defilements in the desire world and attained nirvāṇa without returning.

original: theg pa chen po la ni phyir mi ldog pa gang yin pa de nyid phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la ni phyir mi ldog pa gang yin pa de nyid phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: In the Great Vehicle, the non-returner is one who does not turn back.

original: bse ru'i rva can bzhin gcig pur spyod pa rang sangs rgyas te bse ru zhes brjod de kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: bse ru'i rva can bzhin gcig pur spyod pa rang sangs rgyas te bse ru zhes brjod de kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: The rhinoceros-like one is a Pratyekabuddha who practices alone like a rhinoceros.

original: don dam par ni bse ru dang 'dra bas na bse ru ste gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par ni bse ru dang 'dra bas na bse ru ste gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the ultimate sense, he is a rhinoceros because he is non-dual, like a rhinoceros.

original: 'dis ni sangs rgyas kyis gdul ba'i sems can 'dul ba'i don du rang sangs rgyas kyi tshogs kyi gzugs su bdag nyid ston par gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni sangs rgyas kyis gdul ba'i sems can 'dul ba'i don du rang sangs rgyas kyi tshogs kyi gzugs su bdag nyid ston par gsungs so //
translated: This states that he manifests himself in the form of an assembly of Pratyekabuddhas for the sake of guiding those sentient beings to be guided by the Buddhas.

original: 'dren pa rang rgyal ni @169b so sor 'dren pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: 'dren pa rang rgyal ni @169b so sor 'dren pa zhes brjod de /
translated: The leader, the Pratyekabuddha, is called the individual leader.

original: so so so so ni re re'i 'dren pa ste 'di yang kun rdzob tu sbyor ro //
analyzed: so so so so ni re re'i 'dren pa ste 'di yang kun rdzob tu sbyor ro //
translated: Each one is the guide of each one. This also is to be applied conventionally.

original: don dam par ni 'jig rten khams so sor sems can thams cad kyi 'dren par gyur te byang chub kyi phyogs thob par bya ba'i phyir so so 'dren pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni 'jig rten khams so sor sems can thams cad kyi 'dren par gyur te byang chub kyi phyogs thob par bya ba'i phyir so so 'dren pa ste /
translated: Ultimately, in each world sphere, he becomes the guide of all sentient beings, in order to cause them to attain the factors of enlightenment.

original: 'di yang nyan thos la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang nyan thos la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la bstan pa'o //
translated: This also is taught for those sentient beings who are to be trained by means of the form of the śrāvakas, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nges 'byung sna tshogs nges 'byung ba ste bsam pa ji lta bar lam thams cad kyis sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa thams cad thob par bya ba'i phyir rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nges 'byung sna tshogs nges 'byung ba ste bsam pa ji lta bar lam thams cad kyis sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa thams cad thob par bya ba'i phyir rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, he is the various liberations, the liberator, because he engages in all the paths in accordance with the thoughts of all sentient beings, in order to cause them to attain all forms of liberation.

original: 'byung ba chen po rgyu gcig pa ;
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rgyu gcig pa ;
translated: The single cause of the great elements.

original: / zhes pa la 'byung ba chen po ni sa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: / zhes pa la 'byung ba chen po ni sa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The great elements are earth, etc.

original: de rnams kyi gnyis su med pa'i rgyu ni byang chub sems te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gnyis su med pa'i rgyu ni byang chub sems te /
translated: The nondual cause of those is the bodhisattva,

original: thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he accomplishes everything.

original: ling+ga sy'a tantra tv'a ta pum stram /
analyzed: ling+ga sy'a tantra tv'a ta pum stram /
translated: Linga, sayata, tantra, tva, ta, pum, strī.

original: yang na 'byung ba chen po rnams de lta bur rgyu gcig pa gnyis su med par shes par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na 'byung ba chen po rnams de lta bur rgyu gcig pa gnyis su med par shes par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, the great elements are known to be such a single cause, without a second.

original: 'byung ba chen po ni ji ltar 'byung zhing skye ba de ltar des skyed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po ni ji ltar 'byung zhing skye ba de ltar des skyed do zhes pa'o //
translated: The great elements are produced and arise in such a way that they are produced by that.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam gyi sgra ni nyon mongs pa rnams te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam gyi sgra ni nyon mongs pa rnams te /
translated: The word “path” in “the path to nirvana” refers to the afflictions.

original: de rnams 'phags pa'i lam gyis bcom pas dgra bcom pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams 'phags pa'i lam gyis bcom pas dgra bcom pa ste /
translated: Since they are destroyed by the noble path, they are destroyed enemies.

original: 'di ni nges pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid kyis grub po //
analyzed: 'di ni nges pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid kyis grub po //
translated: This is established by the definition of etymological analysis.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi nyon mongs pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi nyon mongs pa zad pa'o //
translated: The exhaustion of the afflictions that are internal to oneself.

original: dge slong tshur shogs ces bya ba dang gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i phyir dge slong ngo //
analyzed: dge slong tshur shogs ces bya ba dang gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i phyir dge slong ngo //
translated: A monk is one who is fully ordained by the invitation, the request, and the four-part formal procedure.

original: khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags bral ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags bral ba'o //
translated: One who is free from attachment to the three realms is free from attachment.

original: yul rnams la 'jug pa 'gog pas na dbang po thul ba gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: yul rnams la 'jug pa 'gog pas na dbang po thul ba gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: It is just so that one tames the faculties by stopping engagement with objects.

original: de ltar kun rdzob tu bcom ldan 'das nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob tu bcom ldan 'das nyid de /
translated: Thus, the Blessed One is so conventionally.

original: de'i gzugs dang de lta de ltar ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gzugs dang de lta de ltar ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He is the form of that, and he manifests in that way.

original: don dam par ni khams gsum pas mchod par 'os pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni khams gsum pas mchod par 'os pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: But ultimately, he is the Worthy One, because he is worthy of offerings from the three realms.

original: zag pa zad pa'i nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste 'di yang 'dun brgya pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste 'di yang 'dun brgya pa las gsungs pa /
translated: He is the one with exhausted defilements, of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas. This is also stated in the Aśokadattavyākaraṇa:

original: bdag nyid kyi zag pa zad pa ni nyan thos kyi byang chub dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub rnams kyi zag pa zad pas yin gyi /🔽'dod chags dang bral ba bzhin nyon mongs pa'i zag pa zad pa tsam @170a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi zag pa zad pa ni nyan thos kyi byang chub dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub rnams kyi zag pa zad pas yin gyi / 'dod chags dang bral ba bzhin nyon mongs pa'i zag pa zad pa tsam @170a * //
translated: The exhaustion of one’s own defilements is the exhaustion of the defilements of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha enlightenments.

original: ni ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: ni ma yin no zhes so //
translated: But it is not merely the exhaustion of the defilements of the afflictions, like being free from desire.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir nyon mongs pa rnams shin tu nub par gyur pa de lta bu de ni zad pa ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir nyon mongs pa rnams shin tu nub par gyur pa de lta bu de ni zad pa ste /
translated: Because of dependent origination, the afflictions are completely extinguished.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gal te la la'i nyon mongs pa //
analyzed: gal te la la'i nyon mongs pa //
translated: If someone’s afflictions

original: gang dag rang bzhin gyis yod na //
analyzed: gang dag rang bzhin gyis yod na //
translated: existed essentially,

original: ji lta bur na spong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na spong bar 'gyur //
translated: how could they be eliminated?

original: yod pa su zhig spong bar byed ;
analyzed: yod pa su zhig spong bar byed ;
translated: Who could eliminate that which exists?

original: / gal te la la'i nyon mongs pa //
analyzed: / gal te la la'i nyon mongs pa //
translated: If someone’s afflictions

original: gang dag rang bzhin gyis mad na //
analyzed: gang dag rang bzhin gyis mad na //
translated: did not exist essentially,

original: ja lta bur na spong bar 'gyur //🔽med pa su zhig spong bar byed //
analyzed: ja lta bur na spong bar 'gyur // med pa su zhig spong bar byed //
translated: how could they be eliminated?

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Who could eliminate that which does not exist?

original: yang na nyon mongs pa bcom pa nyid kyis na dge slong ngo //
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa bcom pa nyid kyis na dge slong ngo //
translated: Or, because the afflictions are destroyed, he is a bhikṣu.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la chags pa'i phyir chags bral lo //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la chags pa'i phyir chags bral lo //
translated: Because he is free from attachment to saṃsāra and nirvāṇa, he is free from attachment.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga'i dbang du gyur pas dbang po thul ba'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga'i dbang du gyur pas dbang po thul ba'o //
translated: Because he is controlled by the five faculties such as faith, which are conducive to liberation, he is controlled.

original: nye bar dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir bde ba rnyed pa dang 'jigs med thob pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir bde ba rnyed pa dang 'jigs med thob pa'o //
translated: He has attained happiness and fearlessness because he is free from the mental addictions and the negative propensities that are the objects of his observation.

original: rang gi rgyud nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral bas nyon mongs thams cad rgyud chad pa'i phyir bsil bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral bas nyon mongs thams cad rgyud chad pa'i phyir bsil bar byed pa'o //
translated: He is the one who has cooled off because he is free from all the mental afflictions in his own mind-stream and has severed the continuum of all the mental afflictions.

original: bsil bar byed pas bsil ba ste bsil ba ma yin pa bsil bar gyur zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsil bar byed pas bsil ba ste bsil ba ma yin pa bsil bar gyur zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: He is the one who has cooled off because he has cooled off, or he is the one who has cooled off because he has become cool.

original: nyan thos la sogs pas mar me shi ba lta bu'i bsil ba thob par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pas mar me shi ba lta bu'i bsil ba thob par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: He is not like the Sravakas, etc., who attain a cooling off that is like the extinction of a lamp.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa'i rnyog pa dang bral bar gyur pa de'i phyir rnyog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa'i rnyog pa dang bral bar gyur pa de'i phyir rnyog pa med pa'o //
translated: He is the one who is free from turbidity because he is free from the turbidity of conceptual thought.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad las yang dag pa'i lta ba ni rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad las yang dag pa'i lta ba ni rig pa'o //
translated: Among the eight branches of the āryas’ path, right view is knowledge.

original: yan lag lhag ma bdun po rnams ni rkang pa ste de dag dang ldan pa'i phyir rig pa dang rkang par ldan no //
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma bdun po rnams ni rkang pa ste de dag dang ldan pa'i phyir rig pa dang rkang par ldan no //
translated: The remaining seven branches are its bases, and he is endowed with them because he is endowed with knowledge and its bases.

original: bde bar gshegs pa ni mdzes par gshegs pas gzugs mdzes pa'i bu mo bzhin dang bu mo bzhin dang mi mthun par gshegs pas bum pa legs par gang ba bzhin dang / phyir mi ldog par gshegs pas rims nad legs par byang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa ni mdzes par gshegs pas gzugs mdzes pa'i bu mo bzhin dang bu mo bzhin dang mi mthun par gshegs pas bum pa legs par gang ba bzhin dang / phyir mi ldog par gshegs pas rims nad legs par byang ba bzhin no //
translated: The Sugata is so called because he goes beautifully, like a beautiful girl, because he goes without being contrary, like a well-filled vase, and because he goes without returning, like a well-cured fever.

original: 'di dag gis kyang gshegs pa ni mkhyen pa'i don te phyin ci ma log pa'i lam thugs su cung pa dang / shes bya mtha' dag thugs su chung pa dang/ chos nyid thugs su chud pa yongs su ma nyams pa rnams dang grangs ji lta ba bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gis kyang gshegs pa ni mkhyen pa'i don te phyin ci ma log pa'i lam thugs su cung pa dang / shes bya mtha' dag thugs su chung pa dang/ chos nyid thugs su chud pa yongs su ma nyams pa rnams dang grangs ji lta ba bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: These terms also have the sense of going, because he has gone to the unmistaken path, because he has gone to the totality of objects of knowledge, and because he has gone to the realization of reality, respectively.

original: 'gro ba'i skye gnas kyi rigs kyi dbye ba sa dang ri bo dang rgya mtsho dang gling gi dbye bas phye ba sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i skye gnas kyi rigs kyi dbye ba sa dang ri bo dang rgya mtsho dang gling gi dbye bas phye ba sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten te /
translated: The world is the container and the beings in it, divided by the distinctions of the species, birth, and life of beings, and by the distinctions of the earth, mountains, oceans, and continents.

original: @170b sha la sogs pa'i spyan lnga pos ji lta ba bzhin rig cing mthong bas na 'jig rten rig go //
analyzed: @170b sha la sogs pa'i spyan lnga pos ji lta ba bzhin rig cing mthong bas na 'jig rten rig go //
translated: He is the knower of the world because he knows and sees the world as it is with his five eyes of flesh and so on.

original: yang na phung po lnga ni 'jig rten zhes bshad de /
analyzed: yang na phung po lnga ni 'jig rten zhes bshad de /
translated: Or else, the five aggregates are explained as the world.

original: de yang don dam par 'jigs pa dang mi 'jigs pa'i rang bzhin med pa nyid du yongs su shes pa'i phyir 'jig rten rig go //
analyzed: de yang don dam par 'jigs pa dang mi 'jigs pa'i rang bzhin med pa nyid du yongs su shes pa'i phyir 'jig rten rig go //
translated: And he is the knower of the world because he thoroughly knows that ultimately it has no nature of being destroyed or not destroyed.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang dang gzhan gyi sde rnams las phul du byung ba'i phyir mchog go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang dang gzhan gyi sde rnams las phul du byung ba'i phyir mchog go //
translated: And he is supreme because he is preeminent among his own and other groups.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir bdag 'di'o zhes rtog pa dang bral ba bdag gir mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir bdag 'di'o zhes rtog pa dang bral ba bdag gir mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He does not grasp as mine because he is the nature of nondual pristine wisdom, and thus he is free from the conception of i am.

original: bdag rkyen du gzung ba'i bdag nyid ni tshad mas gnod pa nyid kyis khas ma blangs pa'i phyir bdag gir mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag rkyen du gzung ba'i bdag nyid ni tshad mas gnod pa nyid kyis khas ma blangs pa'i phyir bdag gir mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He does not grasp as mine because he does not accept the nature of being a dominant condition, since that is contradicted by valid cognition.

original: don dam par ni 'di la bdag gir mi 'dzin pa dang ngar mi 'dzin pa yang med de /
analyzed: don dam par ni 'di la bdag gir mi 'dzin pa dang ngar mi 'dzin pa yang med de /
translated: But ultimately, he does not grasp as mine and he does not grasp as i.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: nga dang nga yir 'dzin med gang //
analyzed: nga dang nga yir 'dzin med gang //
translated: That which does not grasp i and mine

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te //
translated: does not exist.

original: nga dang nga yir mi 'dzin par //
analyzed: nga dang nga yir mi 'dzin par //
translated: Without grasping i and mine,

original: gang gis mthong ba de mi mthong //
analyzed: gang gis mthong ba de mi mthong //
translated: He who sees it does not see.

original: zhes so // bcom ldan 'das kyis tshul 'di dag phan tshun mi 'gal lam ci zhe na /
analyzed: zhes so // bcom ldan 'das kyis tshul 'di dag phan tshun mi 'gal lam ci zhe na /
translated: One may say: 'But, are these methods of the Lord not mutually contradictory?'

original: bden pa zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bden pa zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: 'The two truths' and so on has been said.

original: bden pa gnyis ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The two truths are the two natures of the superficial and the absolute.

original: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam thugs su chud cing nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam thugs su chud cing nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The method of the superficial truth is the one in which the Lord abides by way of the paths of the disciples and the hermit buddhas and by way of defilement and purification, etc.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni spros pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi bdag po 'jam pa'i mgon po ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni spros pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi bdag po 'jam pa'i mgon po ste /
translated: The absolute truth is the Lord, the nature of the expanse of phenomena free from conceptual elaborations, Manjusri, the Protector.

original: de nyid gdul bya rnams la de lta de ltar snang bar mdzad pas na bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas te khyad par ni de yod de //
analyzed: de nyid gdul bya rnams la de lta de ltar snang bar mdzad pas na bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas te khyad par ni de yod de //
translated: Since he makes himself appear to those to be trained in such and such a way, he abides by way of not abiding in the method of the two truths. This is the difference.

original: de ltar lang kar gshegs par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar lang kar gshegs par gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, it has been said in the 'Langkar-g.shags-pa' ('Lalitavistara'):

original: nga yi tshul ni rnam gnyis te //
analyzed: nga yi tshul ni rnam gnyis te //
translated: My method is twofold:

original: bstan pa dang ni grub mtha'o //
analyzed: bstan pa dang ni grub mtha'o //
translated: Teaching and philosophy.

original: byis pa rnams la smra ba bstan //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la smra ba bstan //
translated: I teach for the childish,

original: rnal 'byor can la grub pa'i mtha' //
analyzed: rnal 'byor can la grub pa'i mtha' //
translated: Philosophy for the yogis.

original: zhes so // gnas ni 'chad par 'gyur ba la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes so // gnas ni 'chad par 'gyur ba la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The place is to be applied to what will be explained.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi bdag nyid chen po gsungs pa /🔽'khor ba'i zhes pa las sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi bdag nyid chen po gsungs pa / 'khor ba'i zhes pa las sogs pa ste /
translated: The great nature of the accumulations of merit and wisdom is stated:🔽Samsara is the five migrations arisen from afflictions and karma,

original: nyon mongs pa dang las las byung ba'i 'gro ba lnga po rga shis rab tu bcings pa'i ngo bo ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las las byung ba'i 'gro ba lnga po rga shis rab tu bcings pa'i ngo bo ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: the essence of which is completely bound by aging and death.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is the perfection.

original: de dag gi mtha' ni rang bzhin med pa nyid de /🔽'khor ba dang mya nga @171a * //
analyzed: de dag gi mtha' ni rang bzhin med pa nyid de / 'khor ba dang mya nga @171a * //
translated: The end of those is the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: las 'das pa'i dbye ba gnyis su med do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: las 'das pa'i dbye ba gnyis su med do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no division of samsara and nirvana into two.

original: de la gnas pa ni mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding in that is abiding in the manner of non-abiding.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: shes pas srid la mi gnas shing //
analyzed: shes pas srid la mi gnas shing //
translated: Through knowledge one does not abide in existence,

original: snying rjes zhi la mi gnas dang // thabs ma yin pas ring ba dang // thabs kyis ring ba ma yin nyid ;🔽/ ces so //
analyzed: snying rjes zhi la mi gnas dang // thabs ma yin pas ring ba dang // thabs kyis ring ba ma yin nyid ; / ces so //
translated: through non-skillful means, one is far away;🔽through skillful means, one is not far away.

original: dbyer mi phyed pa'i mtha' la chos nyid kyi gnas nyid de /
analyzed: dbyer mi phyed pa'i mtha' la chos nyid kyi gnas nyid de /
translated: In the ultimate of inseparability, there is the very abiding of reality.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: mya ngan las 'das pa rtag par //🔽'khor ba mya ngan 'das pa las //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa rtag par // 'khor ba mya ngan 'das pa las //
translated: Nirvana is permanent.

original: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin //🔽mya ngan 'das pa'ang 'khor ba las //
analyzed: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin // mya ngan 'das pa'ang 'khor ba las //
translated: Samsara is not the slightest bit different from nirvana.

original: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin /
analyzed: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin /
translated: Nirvana is not the slightest bit different from samsara.

original: mya ngan 'das mtha' gang yin pa //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das mtha' gang yin pa //
translated: The limit of nirvana

original: de ni 'khor ba'i mtha' yin te //
analyzed: de ni 'khor ba'i mtha' yin te //
translated: is the limit of samsara.

original: de gnyis khyad par cung zad de //
analyzed: de gnyis khyad par cung zad de //
translated: The two are not the slightest bit different,

original: shin tu phra ba'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'ang yod ma yin //
translated: not even in the minutest way.

original: zhes so // de lta bur bshad pa ji ltar yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // de lta bur bshad pa ji ltar yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is it explained in this way? It is said:

original: bya ba byas pa zhes pa ste bya ba ni gang byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can ma lus pa'i don mdzad par spyod pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po skyed do //
analyzed: bya ba byas pa zhes pa ste bya ba ni gang byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can ma lus pa'i don mdzad par spyod pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po skyed do //
translated: The “deed done” is the deed that is the very entity of the bodhisattvas’ activity for the sake of all sentient beings without exception.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: It has the characteristic of perfecting the stores of merit and knowledge, the spiritual levels, and the transcendences.

original: bya ba de byas pa gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bya ba de byas pa gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: The one who has done that action is just like that.

original: bya ba de byas nas srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i g-yang las 'das shing thams cad las 'phags pas skrag pa thams cad dang bral ba'i gnas la gnas pa'i phyir skam sar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba de byas nas srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i g-yang las 'das shing thams cad las 'phags pas skrag pa thams cad dang bral ba'i gnas la gnas pa'i phyir skam sar gnas pa'o //
translated: Having done that action, he stands on dry land, free from all fear, because he stands in the state of standing beyond the abyss of cyclic life and of the frozen wasteland of nirvana, and above all.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa la ni 'khor ba'i pha rol zhes pa la sogs pa mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa la bshad de /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa la ni 'khor ba'i pha rol zhes pa la sogs pa mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa la bshad de /
translated: In the Disciples Vehicle, the attainment of nirvana is explained as the other shore of cyclic life, etc.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa rnams de ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa rnams de ltar snang ba'o //
translated: Nirvana appears to be like that.

original: ye shes 'ba' zhig ni gnyis su med ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: ye shes 'ba' zhig ni gnyis su med ces pa'i don to //
translated: Knowledge alone is nondual.

original: 'ba' zhig pa nyid ni ye shes 'ba' zhig pa ste des nges par bsal te phyung bas na /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa nyid ni ye shes 'ba' zhig pa ste des nges par bsal te phyung bas na /
translated: Knowledge alone is just knowledge, and by that he is definitely freed, drawn out.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes las nges par 'khrungs pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes las nges par 'khrungs pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The Bhagavat Manjusri is born from the Tathagata's nondual knowledge.

original: yang na grangs can pa dang / phyogs kyi grangs can pas thar pa'i rgyur yongs su brtags pa ni shes pa 'ga' zhig go //
analyzed: yang na grangs can pa dang / phyogs kyi grangs can pas thar pa'i rgyur yongs su brtags pa ni shes pa 'ga' zhig go //
translated: Or, the cause of liberation imagined by the Samkhyas and the Partial Enumerators is some kind of knowledge.

original: de ni shin tu rno ba'i shes rab kyi snang bas nges par phyung ba ste 'jug pa'i gnas nges par gsal zhing med par byas pa gang yin pa de la de la de ltar bshad de /
analyzed: de ni shin tu rno ba'i shes rab kyi snang bas nges par phyung ba ste 'jug pa'i gnas nges par gsal zhing med par byas pa gang yin pa de la de la de ltar bshad de /
translated: That is definitely drawn out by the light of very sharp wisdom, and that which is the place of entry is clarified and made non-existent. That is explained as follows:

original: nges phyung shes pa @171b 'ba' zhig pa //
analyzed: nges phyung shes pa @171b 'ba' zhig pa //
translated: The knowledge that is drawn out alone.

original: zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: shes rab mtshon cha zhes pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab mtshon cha zhes pa ste /
translated: The weapon of wisdom.

original: chos rnams nges par 'byed pa'i ye shes ni shes rab ste de nyid mtshon cha'o //
analyzed: chos rnams nges par 'byed pa'i ye shes ni shes rab ste de nyid mtshon cha'o //
translated: The knowledge that definitely divides phenomena is wisdom, and that itself is the weapon.

original: gang gi zhes dbye bas don dam par ni de nyid shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshon cha'o //
analyzed: gang gi zhes dbye bas don dam par ni de nyid shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshon cha'o //
translated: By the analysis of whose, in the ultimate sense, that itself is the weapon of the nature of wisdom.

original: ling+gam tva tantra /
analyzed: ling+gam tva tantra /
translated: The Lingma Tantra.

original: de nyid phat kyi rgol ba rnams kyi log pa'i blo gros 'joms pa'i phyir rnam 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid phat kyi rgol ba rnams kyi log pa'i blo gros 'joms pa'i phyir rnam 'joms pa'o //
translated: It is the conqueror of the perverse intellects of opponents, because it conquers the very essence of the perverse.

original: ye shes 'ba' zhig nges gsal ba dang shes rab mtshon cha zhes klog pa yang go sla ba nyid do //
analyzed: ye shes 'ba' zhig nges gsal ba dang shes rab mtshon cha zhes klog pa yang go sla ba nyid do //
translated: It is the sword of wisdom, because it is the sole light of wisdom.

original: dam pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: dam pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: The holy ones are the bodhisattvas.🔽The holy Dharma is the Lord of the Dharma, Manjusri, whose nature is generosity and so forth, the root of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi rtsa ba dang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ni dam chos te de la goms pas de nyid du grub pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi rtsa ba dang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ni dam chos te de la goms pas de nyid du grub pa ste /
translated: By being habituated to that, one becomes established in that.

original: ji skad du /🔽ye shes zhabs kyis /
analyzed: ji skad du / ye shes zhabs kyis /
translated: As it has been said:

original: sems can ma lus pa'i phun sum tshogs pa 'dzin pa'i chos skyabs su mchi'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can ma lus pa'i phun sum tshogs pa 'dzin pa'i chos skyabs su mchi'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The venerable Jnanapada says, I go for refuge to the Dharma, which holds the perfection of all sentient beings.

original: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi snang bas mdzes pas na chos rgyal lo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi snang bas mdzes pas na chos rgyal lo //
translated: Therefore, because the bodhisattvas are beautified by the light of the Dharma, they are Dharma kings.

original: de'i phyir gsal bar ldan /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsal bar ldan /
translated: Therefore, they are radiant.

original: 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'i tshogs ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad kyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i mi shes pa'i mun pa dang bral bar byed pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs nyid kyis gsal ldan no ;
analyzed: 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'i tshogs ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad kyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i mi shes pa'i mun pa dang bral bar byed pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs nyid kyis gsal ldan no ;
translated: The assembly that illuminates the world is the assembly of light rays that remove the darkness of ignorance belonging to the mindstreams of all sentient beings living in all world spheres.

original: / gzhan yang gsal ldan ni 'jig rten snang bas yongs su khyab par byed pa ste /
analyzed: / gzhan yang gsal ldan ni 'jig rten snang bas yongs su khyab par byed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it illuminates the world by completely pervading it with light.

original: gling bzhi pa tsam snang bar byed kyi phyi'i 'jig rten snang bar mi byed pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gling bzhi pa tsam snang bar byed kyi phyi'i 'jig rten snang bar mi byed pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not like the light that illuminates just the four continents but not the external world.

original: mchog ni khyad par du byas pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni khyad par du byas pa'o //
translated: Supreme means distinguished.

original: chos kyis rang dang gzhan gyi bde ba sgrub par byed pas mi zad pa'i mdzod kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi dbang phyug ste chos kyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: chos kyis rang dang gzhan gyi bde ba sgrub par byed pas mi zad pa'i mdzod kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi dbang phyug ste chos kyi dbang phyug go //
translated: Since the Dharma accomplishes the welfare of self and other, it is the nature of an inexhaustible treasure, and thus it is the lord of the Dharma.

original: yang na chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'i phyir chos thams cad de la rag las par 'jug pas na chos kyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: yang na chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'i phyir chos thams cad de la rag las par 'jug pas na chos kyi dbang phyug go //
translated: Alternatively, since all phenomena operate in dependence on it, the Dharma is the lord of all phenomena because it controls all phenomena.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos kyis sems can thams cad 'dul bar byed pa'i phyir chos kyi rgyal lo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos kyis sems can thams cad 'dul bar byed pa'i phyir chos kyi rgyal lo //
translated: Therefore, he is the Dharma King because he disciplines all sentient beings with the Dharma.

original: de'i phyar legs pa'i lam ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshul nyid ston pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyar legs pa'i lam ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshul nyid ston pa nyid de /
translated: For that reason, he is the Teacher because he teaches the very method of non-abiding nirvana, the good path.

original: 'bras bu yod pa mya ngan ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa mya ngan ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the One Who Has Accomplished His Purpose because he teaches nirvana with a remainder.

original: grub pa ni yongs su grub pa yin la don ni gdul bya rnams kyi mngon bar mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid de gang gi phyir 'di ni don grub @172a * //
analyzed: grub pa ni yongs su grub pa yin la don ni gdul bya rnams kyi mngon bar mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid de gang gi phyir 'di ni don grub @172a * //
translated: Accomplishment is complete accomplishment, and the purpose is the character of the high status and definite goodness of the disciples. For what reason is he the One Who Has Accomplished His Purpose?🔽He is the One Who Has Accomplished His Purpose because he has accomplished his purpose.🔽What is that purpose?

original: po ; / ci las she na gsungs pa /
analyzed: po ; / ci las she na gsungs pa /
translated: He states:

original: bsam pa grub ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa grub ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The accomplishment of his intention, etc.

original: bsam pa ni smon lam ste sngar byang chub tu thugs bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa ni smon lam ste sngar byang chub tu thugs bskyed pa ste /
translated: Intention is a vow, the prior generation of the mind of enlightenment.

original: las dang bo pa'i gnas skabs na smon lam mtha' yas pa btab pa gang yin pa de rnams grub cing rnam par smin pas na bsam pa grub po //
analyzed: las dang bo pa'i gnas skabs na smon lam mtha' yas pa btab pa gang yin pa de rnams grub cing rnam par smin pas na bsam pa grub po //
translated: The accomplishment of that vow is the accomplishment of his intention, because he has accomplished and matured those infinite vows that he made in the state of a beginner.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, he states:

original: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //
translated: It is free of all conceptual thought.

original: zhes pa ni rim gyis chos kyi dbyings la goms pa'i rang bzhin gyis bag chags dang bcas pa'i kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs shing dor bas skabs mi 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rim gyis chos kyi dbyings la goms pa'i rang bzhin gyis bag chags dang bcas pa'i kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs shing dor bas skabs mi 'byed pa ste /
translated: This is the nature of the expanse of reality that is gradually familiarized with. It is free of all conceptual thought, including its habitual tendencies, and so it is not a matter of any occasion being left out.

original: ji ltar chos ston par mdzad pa na rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs la lhag par spyod pa'i tshig ston par mdzad kyang de kho na nyid du kun du rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin la bcom ldan 'das mnga' brnyes pas
analyzed: ji ltar chos ston par mdzad pa na rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs la lhag par spyod pa'i tshig ston par mdzad kyang de kho na nyid du kun du rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin la bcom ldan 'das mnga' brnyes pas
translated: When the Buddha teaches the Dharma, he uses words that are full of various kinds of concepts, but in actual fact, he has mastered the expanse of reality, which is free of all conceptual thought.

original: / bsam pa ji lta ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston pa lta bur snang ba ni gdul bya rnams kyi rkyen las byung ba yin la /
analyzed: / bsam pa ji lta ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston pa lta bur snang ba ni gdul bya rnams kyi rkyen las byung ba yin la /
translated: So it is that he appears to teach the Dharma in accordance with the dispositions of beings, and this is due to the circumstances of those to be trained.

original: de rnams kyis kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi sgo nas sgra'i tshogs rnams byung bar shes shing chos ston par mdzad do zhes rnam par 'jog pas na 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi sgo nas sgra'i tshogs rnams byung bar shes shing chos ston par mdzad do zhes rnam par 'jog pas na 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: de yi byin gyi rlabs tsam gyis //
analyzed: de yi byin gyi rlabs tsam gyis //
translated: By the mere blessing of that,

original: skyes bu yid bzhin nor bu ltar //
analyzed: skyes bu yid bzhin nor bu ltar //
translated: like a wish-fulfilling gem,

original: rtsig pa la sogs rnams las kyang //
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs rnams las kyang //
translated: from walls, etc.,

original: ji ltar 'dod bzhin ston pa 'byung //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod bzhin ston pa 'byung //
translated: teachings arise as desired.

original: de yi don rnams dpyad nas ni //
analyzed: de yi don rnams dpyad nas ni //
translated: Having analyzed their meanings,

original: mi rnams kyis ni kun shes te //
analyzed: mi rnams kyis ni kun shes te //
translated: people understand everything.

original: phan pa rnams la ci rigs par //
analyzed: phan pa rnams la ci rigs par //
translated: In whatever way is helpful,

original: myur ba nyid du sbyor bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: myur ba nyid du sbyor bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: they quickly apply themselves.

original: bstod pa bzhi par yang gsungs pa /🔽mgon po sems pa mi mnga' zhing //
analyzed: bstod pa bzhi par yang gsungs pa / mgon po sems pa mi mnga' zhing //
translated: And in the Four-Stanza Praise, it is said:🔽The protector does not think

original: rnam rtog g-yo ba mi mnga' yang //🔽lhun gyis grub par 'jig rten du //
analyzed: rnam rtog g-yo ba mi mnga' yang // lhun gyis grub par 'jig rten du //
translated: and does not move with discursive thought,🔽but spontaneously🔽the Buddha’s deeds function in the world.

original: sangs rgyas kyis ni mdzad pa 'jug / gtso bo khyed kyis 'ga' zhig tu //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ni mdzad pa 'jug / gtso bo khyed kyis 'ga' zhig tu //
translated: In some places, O Chief,

original: yi ge gcig kyang ma gsungs la //
analyzed: yi ge gcig kyang ma gsungs la //
translated: not even a single syllable is spoken,🔽and yet

original: gdul bya'i skye bo ma lus rnams //
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo ma lus rnams //
translated: He satisfies all the disciples

original: chos kyi char gyis tshim par mdzad //
analyzed: chos kyi char gyis tshim par mdzad //
translated: with the rain of Dharma.

original: ces so // de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: ces so // de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: rnam par mi rtog dbyings mi zad //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog dbyings mi zad //
translated: The nonconceptual realm is inexhaustible.

original: de yang gang yin zhe na chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: de yang gang yin zhe na chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: What is that? The realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings zhes pa chos thams cad 'byung ba'i rigs yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zhes pa chos thams cad 'byung ba'i rigs yin no //
translated: The realm of phenomena is the nature that gives rise to all phenomena.

original: de'i phyir thams cad las mchog tu phul du byung bas dam pa'o //🔽dngos po gang @172b zhig gnas zhes pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad las mchog tu phul du byung bas dam pa'o // dngos po gang @172b zhig gnas zhes pa //
translated: Therefore, it is supreme, since it is the best of all.🔽It is unreasonable that any entity

original: 'grib dang 'phel ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'grib dang 'phel ba mi rigs so //
translated: called “abiding” should increase or decrease.

original: zhes pa'i rigs pas zad mi shes pa'i //
analyzed: zhes pa'i rigs pas zad mi shes pa'i //
translated: By this reasoning, it is inexhaustible.

original: bsod nams ldan pa zhes pa la /
analyzed: bsod nams ldan pa zhes pa la /
translated: Endowed with merit

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: The three perfections of generosity and so on are the accumulation of merit.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa lnga ni ye shes kyi tshogs so ;
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa lnga ni ye shes kyi tshogs so ;
translated: The five perfections of wisdom and so on are the accumulation of wisdom.

original: / brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan ni gnyis kar gtogs so //
analyzed: / brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan ni gnyis kar gtogs so //
translated: Effort and meditative stabilization belong to both.

original: de la bsod nams ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de la bsod nams ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Here, endowed with merit is the causal state,

original: bsod nams tshogs zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: bsod nams tshogs zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gnas skabs so //
translated: accumulation of merit is the resultant state.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: ye shes ye shes 'byung gnas che //
analyzed: ye shes ye shes 'byung gnas che //
translated: wisdom, the great source of wisdom.

original: zhes pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid kyis tshig gnyis su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid kyis tshig gnyis su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The two terms should be connected by way of the nature of cause and effect.

original: ye shes 'byung gnas zhes pa rtags kyi rgyud nyid kyi phyir ma ning gi rtags so //
analyzed: ye shes 'byung gnas zhes pa rtags kyi rgyud nyid kyi phyir ma ning gi rtags so //
translated: The term source of wisdom is a neuter affix because it is the tantra itself, the cause of wisdom.

original: ye shes 'byung gnas nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: ye shes 'byung gnas nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because it is the source of wisdom,

original: de'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i ye shes ni ye shes ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i ye shes ni ye shes ldan pa'o //
translated: the wisdom that is its result is endowed with wisdom.

original: yang na ye shes nyid 'byung gnas te skye ba'i gnas gang yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: yang na ye shes nyid 'byung gnas te skye ba'i gnas gang yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: Alternatively, the term should be analyzed as follows: wisdom itself is the source, the place of origin.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes goms pa nyid las de skyes pas na ye shes 'byung gnas so //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes goms pa nyid las de skyes pas na ye shes 'byung gnas so //
translated: Because it arises from the very cultivation of nondual wisdom, it is the source of wisdom.

original: yod med shes pa ni zab pa dang rgya che ba nyid kyis dngos po dang dngos po med pa ro gcig par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: yod med shes pa ni zab pa dang rgya che ba nyid kyis dngos po dang dngos po med pa ro gcig par rtogs pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of existence and non-existence is the realization of the oneness of existence and non-existence through profundity and magnanimity.

original: de de'i bdag nyid du ldan pa'i 'jam pa'i dpal ni yod med shes pa'o //
analyzed: de de'i bdag nyid du ldan pa'i 'jam pa'i dpal ni yod med shes pa'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī is the knowledge of existence and non-existence, because he is endowed with that nature.

original: de'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis yang dag par bsags pa'o /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis yang dag par bsags pa'o /
translated: Therefore, he is the one who has truly accumulated the two stores of merit and wisdom.

original: // / da ni sngags kyi tshul gyi lha rnams kyi ngo bo dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / sngags dang / khro bo la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis gdul bya rjes su gzung ba'i phyir kun du gnas so zhes ston par byed pa ni /🔽rtag pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: // / da ni sngags kyi tshul gyi lha rnams kyi ngo bo dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / sngags dang / khro bo la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis gdul bya rjes su gzung ba'i phyir kun du gnas so zhes ston par byed pa ni / rtag pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the deities of the mantra system abide everywhere in order to guide those to be trained through the forms of concentration, mantra, wrath, and so forth, [the Bhagavān] declares, permanent, and so on.

original: thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa'i phyir rtag pa ste rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa'i phyir rtag pa ste rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: Permanent means Vairocana, because he acts uninterruptedly everywhere.

original: gzugs sna tshogs pas sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bsgrub pas mdzes pa'i phyir sna tshogs rgyal po ste don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs sna tshogs pas sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bsgrub pas mdzes pa'i phyir sna tshogs rgyal po ste don yod grub pa'o //
translated: King of Variety means Amoghasiddhi, because he is beautiful through accomplishing the activities of the buddhas with various forms.

original: thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i phyir rnal 'byor can te 'dod chags rdo rje'o //🔽bsam gtan zhes pa ni bsam pa po dang bsam par bya ba dang bsam gtan gyi bya ba dang bral ba rnam @173a * //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i phyir rnal 'byor can te 'dod chags rdo rje'o // bsam gtan zhes pa ni bsam pa po dang bsam par bya ba dang bsam gtan gyi bya ba dang bral ba rnam @173a * //
translated: He is a yogi because he possesses the yoga which is characterized by the union of means and insight. He is Vajra Passion.

original: par rtog pa med pa zhes bya ba thugs rje'i rang bzhin mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: par rtog pa med pa zhes bya ba thugs rje'i rang bzhin mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Dhyana is the nature of the Buddha Akshobhya, who is called non-conceptual, free from the thinker, the thought, and the act of thinking.

original: bsam bya ni sangs rgyas nyid don du gnyer ba rnams mtha' yas pa'i dga' ba'i rgyud kyi rgyu nyid kyis bsgom par bya ba ste 'di ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: bsam bya ni sangs rgyas nyid don du gnyer ba rnams mtha' yas pa'i dga' ba'i rgyud kyi rgyu nyid kyis bsgom par bya ba ste 'di ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: The object of thought is the Buddha state, which is to be meditated upon by those who aspire to it, because it is the cause of the infinite stream of joy. This is Ratnasambhava.

original: de bzhin du blo ldan bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po rnams kyi ye shes kyi bdag po drug pa rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin te 'di yang 'jam pa'i dpal nyid do zhes mngon par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du blo ldan bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po rnams kyi ye shes kyi bdag po drug pa rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin te 'di yang 'jam pa'i dpal nyid do zhes mngon par brjod pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the wise one is the nature of Vajradhara, the sixth lord of the five Tathagatas, and he is also Manjushri. This is the declaration.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: And so:

original: bde gshegs shes rab dri ma med //
analyzed: bde gshegs shes rab dri ma med //
translated: The Sugata is stainless wisdom.

original: 'jam pa'i dbyangs su de bshad do //
analyzed: 'jam pa'i dbyangs su de bshad do //
translated: That is explained as Mañjughosha.

original: dngos dang dngos med rnams dpyad na //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med rnams dpyad na //
translated: Having analyzed entities and non-entities,

original: sangs rgyas kun la bdag med kyang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun la bdag med kyang //
translated: all buddhas are selfless,

original: bdag gi dbang du 'jug 'gyur ba //
analyzed: bdag gi dbang du 'jug 'gyur ba //
translated: but they come under the power of the self.

original: ae ma'o chos kyi chos nyid yin //
analyzed: ae ma'o chos kyi chos nyid yin //
translated: Amazing! This is the reality of phenomena.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid kyi gang gis ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid kyi gang gis ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “By whom and how is such a nature to be realized?”

original: gsungs pa / so so rang rig ces pa ste so so rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid las ma gtogs par gang gis ji ltar yang rtogs par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsungs pa / so so rang rig ces pa ste so so rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid las ma gtogs par gang gis ji ltar yang rtogs par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said, “By individual self-awareness,” meaning that apart from the nature of individual self-awareness, it cannot be realized by anyone in any way.

original: hi ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: hi ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: Hi is a definite article.

original: don dam par ni ngo bo gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir mi g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni ngo bo gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir mi g-yo ba ste /
translated: Ultimately, it is immovable because its nature is unchanging.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir g-yo ba med do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir g-yo ba med do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is said that it is unmoving because it is the nature of essencelessness.

original: ri brags ltar gnas nas rtag pa nyid kyi mi g-yo ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ri brags ltar gnas nas rtag pa nyid kyi mi g-yo ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not immovable like a mountain, remaining in one place.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: mchog gi dang po zhes pa ste mchog gi dang po rdo rje 'chang po //
analyzed: mchog gi dang po zhes pa ste mchog gi dang po rdo rje 'chang po //
translated: The first of the supreme ones is the one who holds the vajra.

original: de skad du ye shes zhabs kyis /
analyzed: de skad du ye shes zhabs kyis /
translated: Jnanapada says:

original: mchog gi dang po snying gar 'byung ba yi //🔽rlung gang nor bu'i gzugs can de rdo rje ;
analyzed: mchog gi dang po snying gar 'byung ba yi // rlung gang nor bu'i gzugs can de rdo rje ;
translated: The supreme first one, which arises in the heart,

original: / zhes so //
analyzed: / zhes so //
translated: is the wind, which has the form of a jewel, and is the vajra.

original: thams cad las phul du byung bas mchog kyang 'di yin la dang po yang 'di yin pas de nyid ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad skyed pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad las phul du byung bas mchog kyang 'di yin la dang po yang 'di yin pas de nyid ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad skyed pa'o //
translated: It is supreme because it is the best of all, and it is the first because it is the origin of all buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar dbyer med kyang de chos kyi sku'i mnga' bdag nyid kyis rigs gsum gyi bdag nyid can ni sku gsum du gdul bya la snang ba skye'o zhes gsungs pa ni sku gsum 'chang zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar dbyer med kyang de chos kyi sku'i mnga' bdag nyid kyis rigs gsum gyi bdag nyid can ni sku gsum du gdul bya la snang ba skye'o zhes gsungs pa ni sku gsum 'chang zhes pa ste /
translated: Although it is indivisible, it is said that the three bodies appear to disciples as the nature of the three lineages, because it is the lord of the dharmakaya. The one who holds the three bodies is

original: sku gsum ni chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa zhes bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: sku gsum ni chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: the one who holds the three bodies, which are called the dharmakaya, the sambhogakaya, and the nirmanakaya.

original: sku gsum po de nyid rigs lnga'i bdag nyid can ngo bo nyid dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul @173b pa dang / chos dang / ye shes kyi dbye bas rnam pa lngar snang bas na /
analyzed: sku gsum po de nyid rigs lnga'i bdag nyid can ngo bo nyid dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul @173b pa dang / chos dang / ye shes kyi dbye bas rnam pa lngar snang bas na /
translated: The three bodies themselves, which are the nature of the five families, appear in five aspects by the divisions of essence, enjoyment, emanation, doctrine, and intuition.

original: sangs rgyas sku lnga'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sku lnga'i bdag nyid can //
translated: The Buddha has the nature of five bodies.

original: zhes pa rdo rje 'chang ste /🔽sangs rgyas rdo rje 'chang du bshad //
analyzed: zhes pa rdo rje 'chang ste / sangs rgyas rdo rje 'chang du bshad //
translated: This is Vajradhara.

original: ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The Buddha is explained as Vajradhara.

original: de la ngo bo nyid ni chos nyid kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid ni chos nyid kyi sku'o //
translated: The essence is the body of reality.

original: sku bzhi po'i rang bzhin gyi tshul ni gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: sku bzhi po'i rang bzhin gyi tshul ni gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: The mode of being of the four bodies is not the domain of others.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni mtshan dang dpe byad shin tu 'bar ba ste byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu'i dbang phyug rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni mtshan dang dpe byad shin tu 'bar ba ste byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu'i dbang phyug rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: The enjoyment body is the blazing major and minor marks, the domain of the lords of the tenth stage of the bodhisattvas.

original: sprul pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: sprul pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: The emanation body is the domain of the disciples, such as the hearers.

original: chos kyi sku ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa bsgom par bya ba'i chos kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa bsgom par bya ba'i chos kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The Dharma Body is the nature of the Dharma to be cultivated, such as the elements leading to enlightenment.

original: ye shes kyi sku ni sems can gyi don bya ba thugs su chud pa'i bdag nyid can no zhes pa khyad par ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku ni sems can gyi don bya ba thugs su chud pa'i bdag nyid can no zhes pa khyad par ste /
translated: The Wisdom Body is the embodiment of the understanding of the performance of the aims of sentient beings.

original: me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyis so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyis so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the distinction, because the five wisdoms such as the mirror-like wisdom appear individually.

original: de nyid ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de nyid ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: It is the embodiment of the five wisdoms.

original: de la dri ma med pa'i ye shes me long lta bu la shes bya'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du snang bas na me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de la dri ma med pa'i ye shes me long lta bu la shes bya'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du snang bas na me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
translated: The stainless mirror-like wisdom is the mirror-like wisdom because the entire mandala of the knowable appears in the manner of reflections.

original: tshul de chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud ba ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: tshul de chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud ba ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The understanding of that method as the equality of all things is the wisdom of equality.

original: de nyid rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir so so rang rig par byed pas na so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de nyid rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir so so rang rig par byed pas na so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: That very thing is the wisdom of individual investigation because it is individually self-cognized due to being dependent origination.

original: de nyid sems can ma lus pa'i don gyi bya ba sgrub par snang bas na bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de nyid sems can ma lus pa'i don gyi bya ba sgrub par snang bas na bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Since it appears to accomplish the activities for the benefit of all sentient beings without exception, it is the gnosis that accomplishes activities.

original: de ltar rnam par gnas kyang rang bzhin gyis dri ma med pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par gnas kyang rang bzhin gyis dri ma med pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Although it abides in that way, because it is naturally stainless, it is called the gnosis of the completely pure dharmadhātu.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal khams gsum pa'i dpal ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can nyid do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal khams gsum pa'i dpal ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can nyid do //
translated: The Bhagavat Mañjuśrī is the nature of the five gnoses of the three realms.

original: sngags kyi tshul la ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i bde ba chen po'i rnam pa rgyun mi 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: sngags kyi tshul la ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i bde ba chen po'i rnam pa rgyun mi 'chad pa ste /
translated: In the system of mantra, [the dharmadhātu] is the uninterrupted aspect of the great bliss of the nondual union of method and wisdom.

original: shin tu rnam par 'byung ba'i chos 'byung gi ye shes nyid mthong ba'i dbye bas de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i gzugs kyi phyir ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid ces rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par 'byung ba'i chos 'byung gi ye shes nyid mthong ba'i dbye bas de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i gzugs kyi phyir ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid ces rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: Since the gnosis of the completely pure dharmadhātu is seen in the aspect of the five gnoses, it is explained as the nature of the five gnoses.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sna tshogs kyi gzugs de rnams de'i rang bzhin gyis khyab pas na khyab bdag go //🔽rgyu la 'bras bus rgyas gdab ste //🔽'bras bu la yang @174a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sna tshogs kyi gzugs de rnams de'i rang bzhin gyis khyab pas na khyab bdag go // rgyu la 'bras bus rgyas gdab ste // 'bras bu la yang @174a * //
translated: For that very reason, since the various forms are pervaded by his nature, he is the lord of all.🔽The result is sealed by the cause.

original: rgyus rgyas gdab //🔽ces gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyus rgyas gdab // ces gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: The cause is sealed by the result.

original: rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang la 'bras bu sangs rgyas lngas rgyas gdab pa gsungs pa /🔽sangs rgyas lnga zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang la 'bras bu sangs rgyas lngas rgyas gdab pa gsungs pa / sangs rgyas lnga zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is said that the resultant Vajradhara is sealed by the five buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas lnga'i bdag nyid kyi cod pan gyis khams gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal srid du mngon par dbang bskur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga'i bdag nyid kyi cod pan gyis khams gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal srid du mngon par dbang bskur ba'i phyir /
translated: The five buddhas and so on means that because the consecration of the five buddhas is the consecration of the dominion of the Dharma of the three realms,

original: sangs rgyas lnga bdag cod pan can no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga bdag cod pan can no //
translated: he has the consecration of the five buddhas.

analyzed: zhes gsungs so ;
translated: And:

original: / byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'i rang bzhin nyid kyis de de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad skyed pa po yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa po'o //
