translated: The vajra nature of the mind of enlightenment is the producer of all the tathagatas, and thus it is the producer of all buddhas.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nges par 'khrung bar 'dod de /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nges par 'khrung bar 'dod de /
translated: The perfection system asserts that all tathagatas definitely arise from the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rdo rje'i blo'o zhes gsungs pas na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rdo rje'i blo'o zhes gsungs pas na /
translated: And since the perfection of wisdom is the vajra mind,

original: 'jam dpal nyid sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa po zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'jam dpal nyid sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa po zhes bshad de /
translated: It is explained that Mañjuśrī himself is the producer of all buddhas.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i tshul gyis byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis sems can @174b gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams sangs la bzhag ces pa las so //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i tshul gyis byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis sems can @174b gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams sangs la bzhag ces pa las so //
translated: Similarly, by the method of a bodhisattva, he causes the generation of the thought of enlightenment, and so on, and by the stages of that, he establishes as many sentient beings as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River in the enlightenment of the three vehicles.

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: And yet,

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas sras po ste //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas sras po ste //
translated: he is the son of the buddhas,

original: sems can thams cad kyi don slar yang byang chub sems dpa'i don gyis rtag tu bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don slar yang byang chub sems dpa'i don gyis rtag tu bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he always remains for the sake of all sentient beings by the method of a bodhisattva.

original: sangs rgyas sras po yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na dam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras po yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na dam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: And what is the son of the buddhas like? He is called “excellent,”

original: sems can gyi tshogs ma lus pa'i don byed pa'i mtshan nyid sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed pas thugs las skyes pa'i sangs rgyas sras po zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs ma lus pa'i don byed pa'i mtshan nyid sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed pas thugs las skyes pa'i sangs rgyas sras po zhes pa'i don to //
translated: because he is the son of the buddhas, born from the heart of the buddhas, who perform the deeds of the buddhas, which are characterized by the performance of the welfare of the entire multitude of sentient beings.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said,

original: mchog ces pa ste shes rab kyis chos thams cad rang bzhin pa nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ces pa ste shes rab kyis chos thams cad rang bzhin pa nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: The supreme is the wisdom which knows all phenomena as natureless.

original: de nyid srid pa skyed pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: de nyid srid pa skyed pa'i gnas te /
translated: That itself is the source of existence,

original: de'i phyir mtshan dang dpe byad 'bar ba'i sku 'byung ba gang yin pa ni shes rab srid 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan dang dpe byad 'bar ba'i sku 'byung ba gang yin pa ni shes rab srid 'byung ngo //
translated: because it is the source of the body which blazes with the major and minor marks.

original: de bzhin du skye gnas kyang srid pa dang las dang nyon mongs pa'i skye gnas dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye gnas kyang srid pa dang las dang nyon mongs pa'i skye gnas dang bral ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the womb is free from the womb of existence, karma, and afflictions.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa ;
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa ;
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: chos kyi skye gnas zhes pa ste chos 'byung gi rang bzhin nyid kyis chos thams cad kyi skye gnas yin pa'i phyir chos kyi skye gnas so //
analyzed: chos kyi skye gnas zhes pa ste chos 'byung gi rang bzhin nyid kyis chos thams cad kyi skye gnas yin pa'i phyir chos kyi skye gnas so //
translated: The womb of phenomena means that it is the womb of all phenomena because of being the nature of the phenomena source.

original: yang na chos kyi dbyings de rang bzhin gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir skye gnas ma yin pa nyid do zhes pa la'ang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: yang na chos kyi dbyings de rang bzhin gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir skye gnas ma yin pa nyid do zhes pa la'ang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Or, it is not a womb because that dharmadhatu is not a cause by nature. There is no contradiction in saying that.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyi chos ston pas srid pa mthar byed pa'i phyir mthar byed pa'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyi chos ston pas srid pa mthar byed pa'i phyir mthar byed pa'o //
translated: The terminator is because it terminates existence by teaching the dharma that has the nature of method and wisdom.

original: de nyid ji lta bu zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid ji lta bu zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: gcig pu sra mkhregs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gcig pu sra mkhregs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The one, hard, solid,

original: mkhregs pa ni khong stong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mkhregs pa ni khong stong ma yin pa'o //
translated: hard means not hollow.

original: ji ltar mkhregs na gcig pu ste de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir gnyis su med pas cha shas med pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mkhregs na gcig pu ste de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir gnyis su med pas cha shas med pa'o //
translated: How is it hard? It is the one, because of the nature of thusness, it is non-dual, and therefore partless.

original: gcig pu ni 'di rnams de bzhin nyid dang gnyis su med par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pu ni 'di rnams de bzhin nyid dang gnyis su med par gsungs pa'o //
translated: The one is said to be non-dual with thusness.

original: sra ba yang yin la thams cad kyi mchog kyang yin pas na gcig pu sra mkhregs so //
analyzed: sra ba yang yin la thams cad kyi mchog kyang yin pas na gcig pu sra mkhregs so //
translated: It is hard and the best of all, therefore it is the one, hard, solid.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje'i bdag ste 'di'i bdag gi rang bzhin ni rdo rje'i bdag yin pas de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje'i bdag ste 'di'i bdag gi rang bzhin ni rdo rje'i bdag yin pas de ltar bshad do //
translated: For that very reason, it is the vajra-self, because the nature of this is the vajra-self, and it is explained in that way.

original: gzugs kyi sku'i mchog la ni h'um mdzad rdo rje'i bdag yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku'i mchog la ni h'um mdzad rdo rje'i bdag yin te /
translated: In the supreme body of form, it is the vajra-self of Vajrapani.

original: de yang mtshan dang dpe byad 'bar ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin pas rdo rje'i bdag go //
analyzed: de yang mtshan dang dpe byad 'bar ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin pas rdo rje'i bdag go //
translated: Moreover, because it is the body of perfect enjoyment blazing with the major and minor marks, it is the vajra-self.

original: rdo rje mkhregs pa ni sra ba ste mi phyed pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje mkhregs pa ni sra ba ste mi phyed pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The vajra is hard, because it makes things indivisible.

original: gcig pu ni @175a * //
analyzed: gcig pu ni @175a * //
translated: It is unique,

original: thams cad la phul du byung ba'i phyir gtso bo'o //
analyzed: thams cad la phul du byung ba'i phyir gtso bo'o //
translated: because it is the best of all.

original: sra zhing brtan pa'i phyir gcig pu sra mkhregs so //
analyzed: sra zhing brtan pa'i phyir gcig pu sra mkhregs so //
translated: It is hard, because it is solid and stable.

original: yang na khong stong lta bu'i gnyis pa med pa'i phyir gcig pu gnyis su med pa nyid mkhregs pa ste de ni rang rig pa ma rtogs pas rig par bya ba med pas na gnyis med nyid de ;
analyzed: yang na khong stong lta bu'i gnyis pa med pa'i phyir gcig pu gnyis su med pa nyid mkhregs pa ste de ni rang rig pa ma rtogs pas rig par bya ba med pas na gnyis med nyid de ;
translated: Or else, it is unique, because it is indivisible, like a hollow space, and it is hard, because it is without a second. It is nondual, because it is not known by reflexive awareness, since there is nothing to be known.

original: gnyis pa ni tshang ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir snying po med pa nyid de /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni tshang ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir snying po med pa nyid de /
translated: It is without a second, because it is opposed to a second.

original: de bas na rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rdo rje bdag 'jam dpal nyid de /
analyzed: de bas na rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rdo rje bdag 'jam dpal nyid de /
translated: Therefore, because it has the nature of being indivisible like a vajra, the vajra is the self, which is Mañjuśrī.

original: rdo rje 'chang ba zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang ba zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “vajra holder” is this.

original: de'i phyir rdo rje h'um ni 'phral du skyes pa 'gro ba'i bdag ste 'khor los sgyur ba'i bu thu bo bzhin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rje h'um ni 'phral du skyes pa 'gro ba'i bdag ste 'khor los sgyur ba'i bu thu bo bzhin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the vajra hūṃ is the lord of beings, who is born suddenly, like the eldest son of a universal monarch. This is the intended meaning.

original: rang bzhin gyis skye ba med kyang kun rdzob tu nam mkha'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis skye ba med kyang kun rdzob tu nam mkha'o //
translated: Although there is no intrinsic arising, it is the sky in the relative.

original: stong pa nyid dang ye shes bdag nyid nam mkha' lta bu'i rang bzhin rdo rje gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs kyi sku las byung ba nyid nam mkha' las byung ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang ye shes bdag nyid nam mkha' lta bu'i rang bzhin rdo rje gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs kyi sku las byung ba nyid nam mkha' las byung ba'o //
translated: The sky-like nature of emptiness and wisdom, arisen from the form body of the nature of the three vajras, is “arisen from the sky.”

original: gdul bya'i bsam ba'i dbang gis de dang de'i gzugs kyi snying rje chen pos rang byung bas na rang byung ngo //
analyzed: gdul bya'i bsam ba'i dbang gis de dang de'i gzugs kyi snying rje chen pos rang byung bas na rang byung ngo //
translated: It is “self-arisen” because it arises from great compassion in the form of this and that, according to the mental capacity of those to be tamed.

original: de lta na 'gro ba thams cad du song bas der gtogs pa'i skyon dang ldan par 'gyur bar dogs pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta na 'gro ba thams cad du song bas der gtogs pa'i skyon dang ldan par 'gyur bar dogs pa la gsungs pa /
translated: In that case, there is the concern that it would be subject to the faults of all migrating beings.

original: shes rab zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: To address that, he says, “wisdom,” and so on.

original: shes rab dang ye shes ni chos thams cad rang bzhin med par khong du chud pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab dang ye shes ni chos thams cad rang bzhin med par khong du chud pa ste /
translated: Wisdom and gnosis are the realization that all phenomena are essenceless.

original: de nyid phung po la sogs pa'i bud shing sreg par byed pa'i phyir me'o //
analyzed: de nyid phung po la sogs pa'i bud shing sreg par byed pa'i phyir me'o //
translated: Since that burns the fuel of the aggregates and so on, it is “fire.”

original: 'jig rten las 'das shing zhi ba shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir chen po'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das shing zhi ba shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir chen po'o //
translated: It is great because it is supramundane, peaceful, and the nature of utterly pure intuition.

original: de skad du yang ;
analyzed: de skad du yang ;
translated: And thus:

original: 'gro ba'i chos rnams thams cad ni //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i chos rnams thams cad ni //
translated: All the phenomena of the world

original: rnam shes me yi bud shing 'dod //
analyzed: rnam shes me yi bud shing 'dod //
translated: are held to be fuel for the fire of consciousness.

original: de dag ji bzhin rnam dpyad pas //
analyzed: de dag ji bzhin rnam dpyad pas //
translated: By properly investigating them,

original: 'bar zhing sreg pas nye bar zhi //
analyzed: 'bar zhing sreg pas nye bar zhi //
translated: the blazing fire is pacified.

original: zhes so // de gnyis kyi phyir de nyid gdul bya'i skye bo'i rgyud la rnam pa tha dad pa'i tshul gyis gsal bar byed pas na lam me ba ste rnam par snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // de gnyis kyi phyir de nyid gdul bya'i skye bo'i rgyud la rnam pa tha dad pa'i tshul gyis gsal bar byed pas na lam me ba ste rnam par snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, because of those two, it is a lamp, illuminating the continuum of the person to be trained by means of different aspects.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du chos nyid kyis snang bar byed pas na 'od chen po'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du chos nyid kyis snang bar byed pas na 'od chen po'o //
translated: It is a great light, illuminating all world systems by its intrinsic nature.

original: 'od chen po yang phyi rol gyi bems po lta bu ni nam yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'od chen po yang phyi rol gyi bems po lta bu ni nam yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to show that this great light is never like an external, inanimate object, it is said:

original: ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa @175b ste ye shes kyi snang ba rab tu gsal ba'i bdag nyid rnam par snang bas na ye shes kyi snang ba lam me ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa @175b ste ye shes kyi snang ba rab tu gsal ba'i bdag nyid rnam par snang bas na ye shes kyi snang ba lam me ba'o //
translated: it is the light of pristine consciousness.🔽If it is asked whether it illuminates one world system like the sun,

original: de ltar rnam par snang bar mdzad pa na nyi ma ltar 'jig rten gyi khams gcig snang bar byed dam /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par snang bar mdzad pa na nyi ma ltar 'jig rten gyi khams gcig snang bar byed dam /
translated: or does it illuminate all?

original: gal te thams cad du zhe na de nyid gcig pus zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te thams cad du zhe na de nyid gcig pus zhes gsungs te /
translated: If it is asked whether it illuminates all, then it is said to be🔽the lamp of migrating beings.🔽Since it is free from the afflictive and🔽the knowledge obscurations, it is the lamp of migrating beings because🔽the light of pristine consciousness arises in the mindstreams of all

original: 'gro ba'i mar me zhes pa ste nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir cig car 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gdul bya thams cad kyi rgyud la ye shes kyi snang ba 'char bar mdzad pa'i phyir 'gro ba'i mar me ste phyi🔽rol gyi don ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mar me zhes pa ste nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir cig car 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gdul bya thams cad kyi rgyud la ye shes kyi snang ba 'char bar mdzad pa'i phyir 'gro ba'i mar me ste phyi rol gyi don ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: those to be tamed in all world systems simultaneously.🔽The lamp of pristine consciousness is the light

original: nam mkha'i khams thams cad snang bar byed pa'i ye shes nyid de'i bdag nyid du gsal bas na ye shes sgron me'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams thams cad snang bar byed pa'i ye shes nyid de'i bdag nyid du gsal bas na ye shes sgron me'o //
translated: of the pristine consciousness that illuminates all of space.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku nyid kyis sems can gyi phung po mtha' dag gi mi shes pa'i mun pa mun nag rnam par 'joms pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku nyid kyis sems can gyi phung po mtha' dag gi mi shes pa'i mun pa mun nag rnam par 'joms pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the very embodiment of the gnosis of all the Tathagatas is the great splendor of the clear light,

original: gzi brjid chen po 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: gzi brjid chen po 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: it is the great splendor, the clear light.

original: da ni drag pos 'dul ba'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i phyir gnod mdzes la sogs pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i sngags kyi lha rnams kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni drag pos 'dul ba'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i phyir gnod mdzes la sogs pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i sngags kyi lha rnams kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to take care of those beings who are to be disciplined by wrath, he speaks in order to teach the particularities of the mantras of the wheel-turning deities, whose nature is that of Sumbharāja and so forth.

original: rig pa'i rgyal po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The king of knowledge mantras, etc.

original: rig pa'i rgyal po ni gnod mdzes so //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po ni gnod mdzes so //
translated: The king of knowledge mantras is Sumbharāja.

original: h'um yig bzhi pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sngags bdag dbang po'o //
analyzed: h'um yig bzhi pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sngags bdag dbang po'o //
translated: He is the lord of mantras because he is the nature of the four HŪṂ syllables.

original: de nyid khro bo'i sngags kyi mnga' bdag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid khro bo'i sngags kyi mnga' bdag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: He is the king of secret mantras because he is the lord of the wrathful mantras.

original: gsang sngags rgyal po ste ghr'um yig go //
analyzed: gsang sngags rgyal po ste ghr'um yig go //
translated: The king of secret mantras is the GHAṂ syllable.

original: de'i rang bzhin 'jam dpal te gsang sngags rgyal po'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin 'jam dpal te gsang sngags rgyal po'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī is the nature of that, the king of secret mantras.

original: sems can gyi phung po chen po dang 'brel ba nyid kyis chen po'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi phung po chen po dang 'brel ba nyid kyis chen po'o //
translated: It is great because it is connected with the great mass of sentient beings.

original: kun du snang ba'i gtsug tor gyi tshul gyis de dag gi don byed pa'i phyir don chen byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun du snang ba'i gtsug tor gyi tshul gyis de dag gi don byed pa'i phyir don chen byed pa'o //
translated: It is the great doer of benefits because it benefits them by the method of the all-illuminating uṣṇīṣa.

original: yi ge gcig pos 'khor los sgyur ba'i rang bzhin pa'i phyir gtsug tor chen po'o //
analyzed: yi ge gcig pos 'khor los sgyur ba'i rang bzhin pa'i phyir gtsug tor chen po'o //
translated: It is the great uṣṇīṣa because it is the nature of the universal monarch with one letter.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po nyon mongs pa sel ba'i phyir rmad byung gtsug tor ro //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po nyon mongs pa sel ba'i phyir rmad byung gtsug tor ro //
translated: It is the marvelous uṣṇīṣa because it is the universal monarch who removes the afflictions.

original: gtsug tor chen po rmad byung gtsug / ces mtha' dag bklags pa na /
analyzed: gtsug tor chen po rmad byung gtsug / ces mtha' dag bklags pa na /
translated: If one reads “the great uṣṇīṣa, the marvelous uṣṇīṣa,”

original: rmad byung gtsug ces bya ba ni khro bo'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rmad byung gtsug ces bya ba ni khro bo'i khyad par ro //
translated: the marvelous uṣṇīṣa is the particular wrathful one.🔽If one reads “all,”

original: mtha' dag bklags pa ni sde tshan nyid du yang dag par 'dod do zhes @176a * //🔽gnas so // gzi brjid phung po'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na sna tshogs ston to //
analyzed: mtha' dag bklags pa ni sde tshan nyid du yang dag par 'dod do zhes @176a * // gnas so // gzi brjid phung po'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na sna tshogs ston to //
translated: it is asserted as a class.🔽It is the teacher of variety because it has the nature of a mass of splendor.

original: gtsug tor gyen du 'phags kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na nam mkha'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor gyen du 'phags kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na nam mkha'i bdag po'o //
translated: It is the lord of space because it has the nature of the exalted uṣṇīṣa.

original: gsang sngags kyi mdzod kyi gtsug tor thams cad kyi bdag po nyid du gyur pas na sangs rgyas kun bdag dngos po mchog go //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi mdzod kyi gtsug tor thams cad kyi bdag po nyid du gyur pas na sangs rgyas kun bdag dngos po mchog go //
translated: Since he is the lord of all the uṣṇīṣa treasuries of the secret mantra, he is the supreme reality, the lord of all buddhas.

original: yang na gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor du spyan ma la sogs pa rig ma'i dbus su mdzes pas rig pa'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: yang na gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor du spyan ma la sogs pa rig ma'i dbus su mdzes pas rig pa'i rgyal po'o //
translated: Or else, he is the king of knowledge because he is beautiful in the center of the knowledge goddesses such as Locanā in the dhāraṇī maṇḍala.

original: khro bo'i dkyil 'khor du de'i bdag po nyid du gyur pa'i phyir sngags drag gdab pa'o //
analyzed: khro bo'i dkyil 'khor du de'i bdag po nyid du gyur pa'i phyir sngags drag gdab pa'o //
translated: He is the one who utters the fierce mantra because he is the lord of that maṇḍala in the wrathful maṇḍala.

original: chos kyi dkyil 'khor du gsang sngags thams cad kyi mnga' bdag tu gyur pa'i phyir gsang sngags rgyal po'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dkyil 'khor du gsang sngags thams cad kyi mnga' bdag tu gyur pa'i phyir gsang sngags rgyal po'o //
translated: He is the king of mantras because he is the lord of all mantras in the dharma maṇḍala.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don chen byad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don chen byad do //
translated: For that very reason, he is the one who accomplishes the great purpose.

original: gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba bcu gnyis kyi gsang sngags kyi sngags rnams dang ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par rmad du byung ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bzhugs pas na gtsug tor chen po rmad byung gtsug go //
analyzed: gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba bcu gnyis kyi gsang sngags kyi sngags rnams dang ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par rmad du byung ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bzhugs pas na gtsug tor chen po rmad byung gtsug go //
translated: He is the great uṣṇīṣa, the wondrous uṣṇīṣa, because he abides in the manner of the wondrous samādhis and so forth of the mantras of the twelve uṣṇīṣa cakravartins.

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor du sna tshogs ston pa'i ngang tshul nyid kyi phyir sna tshogs ston to //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor du sna tshogs ston pa'i ngang tshul nyid kyi phyir sna tshogs ston to //
translated: He is the display of variety because of the nature of displaying variety in the mandala of the subjugation of migrating beings.

original: nam mkha'i snying po'i dkyil 'khor de'i bdag nyid kyi phyir nam mkha'i bdag go //
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po'i dkyil 'khor de'i bdag nyid kyi phyir nam mkha'i bdag go //
translated: He is the lord of space because of being the nature of that mandala of Akasagarbha.

original: rnam par snang mdzad chen po la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na sangs rgyas kun bdag dngos po mchog go //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad chen po la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na sangs rgyas kun bdag dngos po mchog go //
translated: He is the supreme reality, the lord of all buddhas, because of being the nature of the great seal and so on of the great mandala of the five tathagatas, such as Mahavairocana.

original: de ltar mnyam par lta bas 'gro ba rnams kun du dga' bar byed pa'i mig gang yin pa de ni de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar mnyam par lta bas 'gro ba rnams kun du dga' bar byed pa'i mig gang yin pa de ni de ltar bshad do //
translated: Thus, the eye that delights migrating beings through such even viewing is explained in that way.

original: gdul bya dang mthun pa'i sna tshogs pa'i gzugs sprul par byed pa'i phyir sna tshogs gzugs can no //
analyzed: gdul bya dang mthun pa'i sna tshogs pa'i gzugs sprul par byed pa'i phyir sna tshogs gzugs can no //
translated: He is the one with a variety of forms because of emanating various forms in accordance with those to be tamed.

original: gdul bya so so skye bo rnams la 'dis sngon gyi rgyal ba'i gzugs brnyan skyed par byed pa'i phyir skyed pa po'o //
analyzed: gdul bya so so skye bo rnams la 'dis sngon gyi rgyal ba'i gzugs brnyan skyed par byed pa'i phyir skyed pa po'o //
translated: He is the producer because of producing the reflection of the former victors for individual disciples.

original: ngang ni sdud pa'o //
analyzed: ngang ni sdud pa'o //
translated: The root is the cause.

original: de ni khams gsum pa'i bla ma'i yin pa'i phyir mchod cing brjed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni khams gsum pa'i bla ma'i yin pa'i phyir mchod cing brjed pa'o //
translated: He is the object of worship and praise because he is the guru of the three realms.

original: chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid rnam pa thams cad du mngon sum du mdzad pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i drang srong thams cad kyi dbus na mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir drang srong chen po'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid rnam pa thams cad du mngon sum du mdzad pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i drang srong thams cad kyi dbus na mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir drang srong chen po'o //
translated: He is the Great Sage because he is the best of all supramundane sages, directly perceiving the reality of all phenomena in all its aspects.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang rdo rje dang padma zhes bya ba rigs gsum gyi gzugs kyi bdag nyid 'dzin @176b pas na rigs gsum 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang rdo rje dang padma zhes bya ba rigs gsum gyi gzugs kyi bdag nyid 'dzin @176b pas na rigs gsum 'chang ba'o //
translated: He is the bearer of the three families because he holds the forms of the three families called Tathagata, Vajra, and Padma.

original: rigs gsum gyi nang du gtogs pa'i rigs thams cad kyi gsang sngags 'dzin pas gsang sngags ldan no //
analyzed: rigs gsum gyi nang du gtogs pa'i rigs thams cad kyi gsang sngags 'dzin pas gsang sngags ldan no //
translated: He is the possessor of the mantras because he holds the mantras of all the families included in the three families.

original: ma h'as ma ya ni grub pa'i mtha' thams cad kyi gsang sngags rab tu ston pa'i gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyis 'chang bar mdzad pas na /
analyzed: ma h'as ma ya ni grub pa'i mtha' thams cad kyi gsang sngags rab tu ston pa'i gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyis 'chang bar mdzad pas na /
translated: He is the bearer of the great conclusion mantras because he holds the mantras of all the conclusions, the great conclusions, by teaching them.

original: grub mtha' chen po'i gsang sngags 'dzin //
analyzed: grub mtha' chen po'i gsang sngags 'dzin //
translated: He is the bearer of the great conclusion mantras.

original: zhes bya'o // yang na dam tshig chen po ni rdo rje'i tshul du rab tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // yang na dam tshig chen po ni rdo rje'i tshul du rab tu ston pa'o //
translated: Or else, the great commitment is the teaching in the manner of the vajra.

original: de rnams kyi gsang sngags ni thabs dang shes rab gcig pa'i ye shes te de 'chang bar mdzad pas na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gsang sngags ni thabs dang shes rab gcig pa'i ye shes te de 'chang bar mdzad pas na /
translated: The mantra of those is the gnosis of the unity of means and insight, and he is the holder of that.

original: dam tshig chen po'i gsang sngags 'dzin no //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po'i gsang sngags 'dzin no //
translated: Thus, he is the holder of the great commitment mantra.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi don rab tu gsal bar mdzad cing rab tu ston pa la rag las pa nyid kyi phyir gtso bo dkon mchog gsum 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi don rab tu gsal bar mdzad cing rab tu ston pa la rag las pa nyid kyi phyir gtso bo dkon mchog gsum 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He is the holder of the three jewels, the chief ones, because he is dependent on the teaching and demonstration of the clear meaning of the three jewels.

original: theg pa gsum ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: theg pa gsum ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The three vehicles are those of the disciples and so on.

original: theg pa'i rnam par dbye ba de dang de rnams la de lta de ltar ston par mdzad pa'i phyir theg pa mchog gsum ston pa pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa'i rnam par dbye ba de dang de rnams la de lta de ltar ston par mdzad pa'i phyir theg pa mchog gsum ston pa pa'o //
translated: He is the teacher of the three supreme vehicles because he teaches in such and such a way the various divisions of the vehicles.

original: da ni 'jig rten gsum 'jigs par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten gsum 'jigs par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the terror of the three worlds, he says:

original: 'jigs byed chen po'i gzugs kyis bzhengs nas lha chen po la sogs pa lha khro ba rnams gdul ba'i phyir 'phags pa gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs can gyi bcom ldan 'das ni don yod zhags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: 'jigs byed chen po'i gzugs kyis bzhengs nas lha chen po la sogs pa lha khro ba rnams gdul ba'i phyir 'phags pa gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs can gyi bcom ldan 'das ni don yod zhags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: Having arisen in the form of Mahabhiira, the Blessed One, in the form of the noble Yamantaka, in order to subdue the angry gods such as Mahesvara, is called Amoghapafa, etc.

original: skra dang ldan pa rnams kyi mchog / ces pa'i mthar thug pas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: skra dang ldan pa rnams kyi mchog / ces pa'i mthar thug pas gsungs pa'o //
translated: up to the best of those with hair.

original: sems can thams cad bkug nas theg pa chen po las mi g-yo bar byed pas don ston cing 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin gyi zhags pa gang yin pa de ni don yod zhags pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bkug nas theg pa chen po las mi g-yo bar byed pas don ston cing 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin gyi zhags pa gang yin pa de ni don yod zhags pa'o //
translated: Since he attracts all sentient beings and makes them not waver from the Great Vehicle, he shows the meaning and has the nature of great compassion with result. He is Amoghapafa.

original: de nyid mu stegs dang bdud kyi dgra las rnam par rgyal ba'i ngang tshul nyid kyis rnam par rgyal lo //
analyzed: de nyid mu stegs dang bdud kyi dgra las rnam par rgyal ba'i ngang tshul nyid kyis rnam par rgyal lo //
translated: Since he has the nature of being victorious over the enemies of tirthikas and maras, he is Jayo.

original: de'i phyir byams pa'i zhags pas bkug nas dbang du gyur par bkod de sems can thams cad yang dag par sdud pa dang / dbyer mi phyid pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i rang bzhin rdo rje lta bu'i zhags pa gang yin pa de ni 'dzin pa chen po rdo rje zhags so //
analyzed: de'i phyir byams pa'i zhags pas bkug nas dbang du gyur par bkod de sems can thams cad yang dag par sdud pa dang / dbyer mi phyid pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i rang bzhin rdo rje lta bu'i zhags pa gang yin pa de ni 'dzin pa chen po rdo rje zhags so //
translated: Therefore, having summoned with the noose of love, he is established in control, and that which is the nature of the four means of gathering, which gather all sentient beings and are inseparable, is the great hook vajra-noose.

original: stobs kyis bsgrub pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa dang / sems can thams cad dgug pa dang @177a * //
analyzed: stobs kyis bsgrub pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa dang / sems can thams cad dgug pa dang @177a * //
translated: Because it is accomplished by power, the wisdom which is the nature of great compassion, which summons the Tathagatas and all sentient beings,

original: dbyer mi phyed pa'i snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes ni lcags kyu'i rang bzhin gyi phyir rdo rje lcags kyu'o //
analyzed: dbyer mi phyed pa'i snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes ni lcags kyu'i rang bzhin gyi phyir rdo rje lcags kyu'o //
translated: and is inseparable, is the vajra-hook, because it is the nature of the hook.

original: stobs kyis bkug pa'i sems can rnams thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin nges par sbyor bas na zhags pa che'o //
analyzed: stobs kyis bkug pa'i sems can rnams thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin nges par sbyor bas na zhags pa che'o //
translated: The great noose is the wisdom which is the nature of the non-dual method and insight, because it definitely joins the sentient beings who are summoned by power.

original: rdo rje 'jigs byed kyi gzugs kyis gdul dka' ba'i sems can rnams 'jigs par byed pas na rdo rje 'jigs byed 'jigs par byed de /
analyzed: rdo rje 'jigs byed kyi gzugs kyis gdul dka' ba'i sems can rnams 'jigs par byed pas na rdo rje 'jigs byed 'jigs par byed de /
translated: He is Vajrabhairava, the terrifier, because he terrifies the difficult to tame beings with the form of Vajrabhairava.

original: rje btsun 'jam dpal nyid dang dbyer mi phyed pa'i gshin rje mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rje btsun 'jam dpal nyid dang dbyer mi phyed pa'i gshin rje mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: He is the perfected Yamaraja, inseparable from the venerable Manjusri himself.

original: de nyid kyi phyir khro bo'i rgyal po ste khro bo'i gtso bo'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir khro bo'i rgyal po ste khro bo'i gtso bo'o //
translated: He is the king of wrathful ones, the chief of the wrathful ones.

original: yang na khro bo nyid kyis mdzes shing gsal bas na khro bo'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: yang na khro bo nyid kyis mdzes shing gsal bas na khro bo'i rgyal po'o //
translated: Or else, he is the king of wrathful ones because he is beautiful and radiant with wrath itself.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rang bzhin gyis 'di'i zhal drug yin pas gdong drug ces bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rang bzhin gyis 'di'i zhal drug yin pas gdong drug ces bya ste /
translated: He is called six faced because he has six faces, the nature of the six perfections.

original: zhal gyi dbyibs ni du ma ste //
analyzed: zhal gyi dbyibs ni du ma ste //
translated: The faces have many shapes.

original: dgra ni rgya mtsho 'khrugs dang 'dra //
analyzed: dgra ni rgya mtsho 'khrugs dang 'dra //
translated: Some are like the churning ocean.

original: kha cig bzhad cing kha cig zhi //
analyzed: kha cig bzhad cing kha cig zhi //
translated: Some are laughing, some peaceful,

original: kha cig 'jigs par bgrad pa'i zhal //🔽kha cig zhal ni gdangs pa ste //
analyzed: kha cig 'jigs par bgrad pa'i zhal // kha cig zhal ni gdangs pa ste //
translated: some with wide open eyes of fear.🔽Some have gaping mouths,

original: ljags kyang bskyod par mdzad pa dang // kha cig kyang ni mche ba gtsigs //
analyzed: ljags kyang bskyod par mdzad pa dang // kha cig kyang ni mche ba gtsigs //
translated: some wagging tongues, some gnashing teeth.

original: zhes pa'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i rigs pas so //
translated: This is the reasoning.

original: 'jigs pa ni 'jigs su rung ba'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni 'jigs su rung ba'o //
translated: Fearful means frightening.

original: mngon par shes pa drug gi rang bzhin dngos po ma lus pa mthong ba'i bdag nyid mi sdug cing 'jigs su rung ba'i spyan drug dpral ba'i phyogs na yod pa gang yin pa de ni mig drug go //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug gi rang bzhin dngos po ma lus pa mthong ba'i bdag nyid mi sdug cing 'jigs su rung ba'i spyan drug dpral ba'i phyogs na yod pa gang yin pa de ni mig drug go //
translated: The six eyes that are the nature of the six superknowledges, the nature of seeing all things without exception, are ugly and frightening, and are located in the forehead region.

original: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dang lha rnams dang skyabs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dang lha rnams dang skyabs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The six refuges are the Buddha, Dharma, Sangha, gods, and the refuge.

original: rjes su dran pa drug gi rang bzhin phyag drug gang yin pa de ni lag drug go //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa drug gi rang bzhin phyag drug gang yin pa de ni lag drug go //
translated: The six arms that are the nature of the six recollections are the six arms.

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i stobs lnga dang ldan pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab rnon po'i mche ba gtsigs pa'i tshems mthon po mnga' bas na mche ba gtsigs pa'o //🔽mi mgo rlon dang skam po'o //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i stobs lnga dang ldan pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab rnon po'i mche ba gtsigs pa'i tshems mthon po mnga' bas na mche ba gtsigs pa'o // mi mgo rlon dang skam po'o //
translated: The fangs are the sharp wisdom of the penetrations that possess the five powers of faith and so on.

original: yi dags phreng bas rnam brgyan pa //
analyzed: yi dags phreng bas rnam brgyan pa //
translated: The head ornament is fresh and dry human heads.🔽The garland is a garland of pretas.

original: de lta'i mgon po bsgom par bya //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta'i mgon po bsgom par bya //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: One should meditate on such a protector.

original: keng rus kyi rgyan dang ldan pas keng rus so //
analyzed: keng rus kyi rgyan dang ldan pas keng rus so //
translated: It is a skeleton because it is adorned with a skeleton.

original: mche ba gtsigs pa yang 'di yin la keng rus kyang ngo zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: mche ba gtsigs pa yang 'di yin la keng rus kyang ngo zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: It is a skeleton with bared fangs, as the words can be combined in this way.

original: lta ba dang / mche ba dang / kha chu dang / reg pa'i dug dang ldan te /
analyzed: lta ba dang / mche ba dang / kha chu dang / reg pa'i dug dang ldan te /
translated: It has the poisons of sight, fangs, saliva, and touch.

original: me 'bar ba ltar dug 'bar zhing rnam par 'phro bas gzengs pa /
analyzed: me 'bar ba ltar dug 'bar zhing rnam par 'phro bas gzengs pa /
translated: It is pierced by the blazing and spreading poison that burns like fire.

original: mig shin tu @177b gdug pa /
analyzed: mig shin tu @177b gdug pa /
translated: It has extremely fierce eyes.

original: lce shin tu bskyod cing glog ltar 'gyu ba /
analyzed: lce shin tu bskyod cing glog ltar 'gyu ba /
translated: It has a very quivering tongue that flickers like lightning.

original: shin tu 'jigs su rung ba /
analyzed: shin tu 'jigs su rung ba /
translated: It is extremely terrifying.

original: dbyibs dang kha dog sna tshogs pa'i nor bu'i gdengs ka can gyi glu chen po rnams ni ha l'a ha la zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dbyibs dang kha dog sna tshogs pa'i nor bu'i gdengs ka can gyi glu chen po rnams ni ha l'a ha la zhes bya ste /
translated: It has a great hood of various shaped and colored jewels that makes a great hissing sound.

original: de rnams kyis skra bcings pa dang / dbral bar dar dpyang dang / rna rgyan dang / mgul rgyan dang / mchod phyir thogs dang / dpung rgyan dang / gdu bu dang / lus la ska rags dang / zhabs gdub dang / rgyan rnams su byas pa'i phyir ha l'a ha la rnams kyi grangs brgya snyed kyi gdong rnams gang la yod pa ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyis skra bcings pa dang / dbral bar dar dpyang dang / rna rgyan dang / mgul rgyan dang / mchod phyir thogs dang / dpung rgyan dang / gdu bu dang / lus la ska rags dang / zhabs gdub dang / rgyan rnams su byas pa'i phyir ha l'a ha la rnams kyi grangs brgya snyed kyi gdong rnams gang la yod pa ni /
translated: They are called Hālāhala because they are the faces of a hundred Hālāhalas.

original: ha l'a ha la gdong brgya pa ste gshin rje kho na mthar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ha l'a ha la gdong brgya pa ste gshin rje kho na mthar byed pa'o //
translated: Hālāhala means “having a hundred faces.” He is called Yamântaka because he is the destroyer of Yama.

original: de yang mthar byed cing 'dzin par byed 'dul bar byed pas na gshin rje mthar byed do //
analyzed: de yang mthar byed cing 'dzin par byed 'dul bar byed pas na gshin rje mthar byed do //
translated: He is called Yamântaka because he destroys, subdues, and conquers.

original: yang na gshin rje'i sgra ni gnyis la brjod de /
analyzed: yang na gshin rje'i sgra ni gnyis la brjod de /
translated: Or, the word Yama is used to refer to two things.

original: de mthar byed pa ni gnyis su med pa'i chos bstan pas 'joms pa na de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: de mthar byed pa ni gnyis su med pa'i chos bstan pas 'joms pa na de ltar bshad do //
translated: He is called Yamântaka because he destroys them by teaching the doctrine of nonduality.

original: sems can rnams kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i don gyi khyad par 'joms par byed pa ni bgegs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i don gyi khyad par 'joms par byed pa ni bgegs so //
translated: An obstacle is that which destroys the special desired object of sentient beings.

original: de'i gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyi phyir bgegs kyi rgyal po ste 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na gnas pa'i bgegs rnams med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyi phyir bgegs kyi rgyal po ste 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na gnas pa'i bgegs rnams med par byed pa'o //
translated: And because he is the chief of them, he is the king of obstacles, the one who removes the obstacles that dwell in all the world-realms.

original: gdul bya rjes su gzung ba'i phyir thogs pa med pa yid ltar mgyogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la mngon du phyogs par byed pa'i phyir rdo rje mchog go //
analyzed: gdul bya rjes su gzung ba'i phyir thogs pa med pa yid ltar mgyogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la mngon du phyogs par byed pa'i phyir rdo rje mchog go //
translated: He is the supreme vajra, because he faces the concentration that is unobstructed and swift as thought in order to take care of those to be trained.

original: gdul dka' ba'i sems can 'jigs par byed pa'i phyir 'jigs byed pa'o //
analyzed: gdul dka' ba'i sems can 'jigs par byed pa'i phyir 'jigs byed pa'o //
translated: He is the terrifying one, because he terrifies the difficult-to-civilize sentient beings.

original: khams gsum pa shin tu 'jigs par byed pa'i sgra sgrogs pas grags pa yang 'di yin la mi phyed pa nyid kyis rdo rje yang 'di yin pas rdo rje grags pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa shin tu 'jigs par byed pa'i sgra sgrogs pas grags pa yang 'di yin la mi phyed pa nyid kyis rdo rje yang 'di yin pas rdo rje grags pa'o //
translated: He is the vajra-fame, because he is the fame that resounds with the terrifying sound in the three realms, and he is the vajra because of his indivisibility.

original: yang na skrags pa rnam pa mang po'i sgra ni grags pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na skrags pa rnam pa mang po'i sgra ni grags pa yin la /
translated: Or else, the fame is the sound of many kinds of terror.

original: de nyid mi phyed pa 'joms pa'i phyir rdo rje ste de lta bu gang yin pa ni rdo rje grags pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid mi phyed pa 'joms pa'i phyir rdo rje ste de lta bu gang yin pa ni rdo rje grags pa'o //
translated: And that is the vajra because it destroys the indivisibility of that, and that is the vajra-fame.

original: thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi phyir rdo rje snying ngo //
analyzed: thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi phyir rdo rje snying ngo //
translated: He is Vajra-heart because he is the nature of the mind-vajra.

original: rdo rje khro bo'i gzugs kyis sgyu ma sprul lo //
analyzed: rdo rje khro bo'i gzugs kyis sgyu ma sprul lo //
translated: He is the magical creation of the form of Vajra-anger.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad khyab par byed pa'i phyir sgyu 'phrul rdo rje'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad khyab par byed pa'i phyir sgyu 'phrul rdo rje'o //
translated: He is Vajra-magic because he pervades all world-realms.

original: yang na sgyu 'phrul gyi rang bzhin nyid rdo rje ste khams gsum stong pa nyid kyi ye shes gang yin pa de sgyu 'phrul rdo rje'o //
analyzed: yang na sgyu 'phrul gyi rang bzhin nyid rdo rje ste khams gsum stong pa nyid kyi ye shes gang yin pa de sgyu 'phrul rdo rje'o //
translated: Or else, he is Vajra-magic because he is the nature of magic, and his intuition of the voidness of the three realms is Vajra-magic.

original: gang gi phyir stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kho na rdo rje zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kho na rdo rje zhes sbyar ro //
translated: He is called Vajra because he is the intuition of voidness.

original: gdug pa 'dul ba'i phyir gsus khyim che zhing 'jigs pas na gsus bo @178a * //
analyzed: gdug pa 'dul ba'i phyir gsus khyim che zhing 'jigs pas na gsus bo @178a * //
translated: He is Great-Belly because he is terrifying with his huge belly for the purpose of subduing the wicked.

original: che'o ; / yang na chen po ni dri ma med cing mtha' yas pa'i nam mkha' yin la /
analyzed: che'o ; / yang na chen po ni dri ma med cing mtha' yas pa'i nam mkha' yin la /
translated: Or else, the Great is the stainless infinite sky,

original: gsus pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin khams gsum pa'i khong ste de gang yin pa de la de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: gsus pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin khams gsum pa'i khong ste de gang yin pa de la de ltar bshad do //
translated: and the belly is the interior of the three realms, which is the nature of the mirror-like intuition. He is so called because he is that.

original: rdo rje'i rigs kyi gtso bor gyur pas na rdo rje'i bdag go //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs kyi gtso bor gyur pas na rdo rje'i bdag go //
translated: He is the lord of the vajra clan, therefore he is the vajra self.

original: yang na rigs ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rdo rje ste 'dod pa 'byung bar byed pas rdo rje'i bdag go //
analyzed: yang na rigs ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rdo rje ste 'dod pa 'byung bar byed pas rdo rje'i bdag go //
translated: Or, the clan is the vajra of the intuition of voidness, and he is the lord of the vajra because he is the source of desires.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gyi rdo rje las de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'byung ba'i phyir rdo rje skye gnas so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gyi rdo rje las de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'byung ba'i phyir rdo rje skye gnas so //
translated: He is the vajra womb because the Tathagatas come forth from the vajra which is the nature of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: yang na rdo rje ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: yang na rdo rje ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Or, the vajra is the nondual intuition.

original: de ni skye gnas te gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de nyid las sems can rnams 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de ni skye gnas te gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de nyid las sems can rnams 'byung ba'o //
translated: That is the womb, because the beings come forth from that very nondual intuition.

original: yang na sangs rgyas sras po nyid kyis rdo rje de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skye gnas gang yin pa ste zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas sras po nyid kyis rdo rje de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skye gnas gang yin pa ste zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Or, the vajra is that which is the womb of the Tathagatas, because it is the son of the Buddhas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje snying po ni rdo rje nyid khu ste me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin rdo rje rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi nying khu ste snying po zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje snying po ni rdo rje nyid khu ste me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin rdo rje rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi nying khu ste snying po zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the essence of the vajra is the quintessence of the vajra, i.e., the mirror-like intuition, etc. The vajras are the quintessence of the Tathagatas, i.e., their essence.

original: dngos po thams cad la go skabs sbyin pa'i phyir dang / rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis nyes pa thams cad kyis ma gos pas na nam mkha' 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad la go skabs sbyin pa'i phyir dang / rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis nyes pa thams cad kyis ma gos pas na nam mkha' 'dra ba'o //
translated: It is like space, because it is the source of all things, and because it is not sullied by any faults, due to its lack of intrinsic reality.

original: sa phyis pas ni nges pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: sa phyis pas ni nges pa'i tshig go //
translated: The word “space” is the explanation of the term.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de las skyes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin las mi g-yo bas na mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de las skyes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin las mi g-yo bas na mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is immovable, because it does not move from the essence of the realm of phenomena.

original: yang na nam mkha' lta bu de yang snying rje chen pos rjes su chags pas sems can thams cad kyi don las mi g-yo ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: yang na nam mkha' lta bu de yang snying rje chen pos rjes su chags pas sems can thams cad kyi don las mi g-yo ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Or else, it is immovable because that space is not moved from the aim of all beings by the passion of great compassion.

original: hi ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: hi ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: Hi is the definite grasping.

original: ral pa rnams bsgyings pa ni nam mkhar rnam par 'phags pa'i ral pa'i tshogs zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ral pa rnams bsgyings pa ni nam mkhar rnam par 'phags pa'i ral pa'i tshogs zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the line “the mass of hair standing on end in the sky” is that the hair is bristling.

original: gcig ni mi mnyam pa'i ral pa bsgyings pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ni mi mnyam pa'i ral pa bsgyings pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: One is the bristling of uneven hair.

original: yang na khro bo ral pa gcig pa'i gzugs kyis khyab pas bsgyings pa ste /
analyzed: yang na khro bo ral pa gcig pa'i gzugs kyis khyab pas bsgyings pa ste /
translated: Or, it is the bristling by pervading with the form of the one-haired angry one.

original: gdul dka' ba rnams kun du 'joms par rtsom pa gang yin pa de ni ral pa gcig bsgyings pa'o //🔽tshogs kyi bdag po'i glang po'i pags pa rlon pa'i na bza' 'chang bas na glang chen ko rlon gos su gyon pa ste /🔽rlon bcas glang po'i pags pa'i gos 'chang ba //
analyzed: gdul dka' ba rnams kun du 'joms par rtsom pa gang yin pa de ni ral pa gcig bsgyings pa'o // tshogs kyi bdag po'i glang po'i pags pa rlon pa'i na bza' 'chang bas na glang chen ko rlon gos su gyon pa ste / rlon bcas glang po'i pags pa'i gos 'chang ba //
translated: That which begins to destroy the difficult to tame is the bristling of the one hair.🔽The meaning of the line “wearing an elephant hide” is that he wears the wet hide of the lord of the gaṇas.

original: zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Wearing a wet elephant hide.

original: gdug cing gdul dka' ba'i sems can 'dul ba'i phyir 'jig rten gsum kun @178b du skyod par byed pa h'a h'a dang / h'i h'i'i rang bzhin gyi sgra chen po 'jigs su rung ba'i sngags kyi dbyangs skad gsang mthon pos sgrogs pas na /
analyzed: gdug cing gdul dka' ba'i sems can 'dul ba'i phyir 'jig rten gsum kun @178b du skyod par byed pa h'a h'a dang / h'i h'i'i rang bzhin gyi sgra chen po 'jigs su rung ba'i sngags kyi dbyangs skad gsang mthon pos sgrogs pas na /
translated: In order to subdue the wicked and difficult to subdue sentient beings, she is the great sound of the terrifying mantra, the great sound of HA HA and HI HI, which shakes the three worlds.

original: drag chen h'a h'a zhes sgrogs pas //
analyzed: drag chen h'a h'a zhes sgrogs pas //
translated: She is the great HA HA sound,

original: h'i h'i zhes sgrogs 'jigs par byed //
analyzed: h'i h'i zhes sgrogs 'jigs par byed //
translated: the HI HI sound, the terrifying.

original: ces pa ste h'i h'i zhes sgrogs pa yang 'di yin la 'jigs par byed pa yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: ces pa ste h'i h'i zhes sgrogs pa yang 'di yin la 'jigs par byed pa yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The HI HI sound is also the terrifying, so the words are combined.

original: de nyid kyis thams cad kun du skrag pa skyed pa'i phyir shin tu ba'i don te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis thams cad kun du skrag pa skyed pa'i phyir shin tu ba'i don te /
translated: She is the great one because she generates fear in all.

original: chen po yin la gad mo yang yin pas gad mo chen po gad rgya ngas can no //
analyzed: chen po yin la gad mo yang yin pas gad mo chen po gad rgya ngas can no //
translated: She is the great laughter, the great HA HA sound.

original: de gnyen po'i ngo bo nyid kyis gzhig par dka' ba 'jig par byed pa'i gad mo dang ldan pas rdo rje gang mo'o //
analyzed: de gnyen po'i ngo bo nyid kyis gzhig par dka' ba 'jig par byed pa'i gad mo dang ldan pas rdo rje gang mo'o //
translated: She is Vajravetālī because she has the laughter that destroys the difficult to destroy by the nature of the antidote.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du khyab pa'i gad mo'i sgra dang ldan pa'i phyir cher sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du khyab pa'i gad mo'i sgra dang ldan pa'i phyir cher sgrogs pa'o //
translated: He is called Mahā-ghosa because he has the sound of laughter that pervades all world systems.

original: rnam par dpyad pa'i rdo rjes so sor 'joms shing dbyer mi phyed pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir rdo rje sems dpa'o //🔽de yang brtse bas mtha' gcig tu sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa'i rdo rjes so sor 'joms shing dbyer mi phyed pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir rdo rje sems dpa'o // de yang brtse bas mtha' gcig tu sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir ram /
translated: He is called Vajrasattva because he has the nature of mind that is not destroyed or divided by the vajra of analysis.🔽He is called Mahāsattva because he is compassionate and works exclusively for the welfare of sentient beings,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor du byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje legs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir sems dpa' chen po'o //🔽rdo rje dang 'dra ba'i phyir mi phyed pa'i gzugs kyis mdzes pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor du byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje legs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir sems dpa' chen po'o // rdo rje dang 'dra ba'i phyir mi phyed pa'i gzugs kyis mdzes pa'am /
translated: or because he is the essence of Bodhisattva Vajrasādhu in the maṇḍala of bodhisattvas.🔽He is called Vajrarāja because he is beautiful with an indivisible form like a vajra,

original: rdo rje lcags kyu'i gzugs 'dzin par mdzad pas na rdo rje rgyal po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu'i gzugs 'dzin par mdzad pas na rdo rje rgyal po'o //
translated: or because he assumes the form of the vajra hook.🔽He is called Vajrarāga because he is the essence of supreme, spontaneous bliss,

original: mchog tu phul du byung zhing lhun gyis grub pa'i bde ba 'byung ba'i ngo bor gyur pa'am /
analyzed: mchog tu phul du byung zhing lhun gyis grub pa'i bde ba 'byung ba'i ngo bor gyur pa'am /
translated: or because he is the cause of the arising of supreme bliss.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje chags pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir bde ba che'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje chags pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir bde ba che'o //
translated: He is great bliss because he has the form of the bodhisattva Vajra Passion.

original: sems can shin tu gtum po rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir drag cing gzhig par dka' ba'i gzugs 'dzin par mdzad pas na rdo rje gtum po'o //
analyzed: sems can shin tu gtum po rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir drag cing gzhig par dka' ba'i gzugs 'dzin par mdzad pas na rdo rje gtum po'o //
translated: He is Vajra Wrath because he assumes the form of one who is fierce and difficult to destroy in order to subdue extremely violent sentient beings.

original: gdul bya'i sems can rnams dga' ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dang / rang nyid kyang dga' ba'i bdag nyid can du gyur pas na dga' ba che'o //
analyzed: gdul bya'i sems can rnams dga' ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dang / rang nyid kyang dga' ba'i bdag nyid can du gyur pas na dga' ba che'o //
translated: He is great joy because he generates joy in sentient beings who are to be subdued and because he himself has the nature of joy.

original: khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi gzugs kyis sa thams cad du khyab bar h'um zhes sgrogs pa gang yin pa de nyid ni /
analyzed: khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi gzugs kyis sa thams cad du khyab bar h'um zhes sgrogs pa gang yin pa de nyid ni /
translated: He is Vajra Humkara, who proclaims “hum” with the form of Vajra Humkara, the conqueror of the three realms, pervading all stages.

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad h'um zhes sgrogs so //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad h'um zhes sgrogs so //
translated: He is Vajra Humkara, who proclaims “hum.”

original: khams gsum na gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i g-yul las rnam par rgyal bar byed pa'i phyir go cha chen po bgos te /
analyzed: khams gsum na gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i g-yul las rnam par rgyal bar byed pa'i phyir go cha chen po bgos te /
translated: He is the great armor because he puts on the great armor in order to conquer the battle of the afflictions that exist in the three realms.

original: mi phyed pa'i mda' dang gzhu 'dzin pa'i phyir mtshon du rdo rje mda' thogs pa'o //🔽nye bar dmigs pa'i mi shes pa @179a * //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i mda' dang gzhu 'dzin pa'i phyir mtshon du rdo rje mda' thogs pa'o // nye bar dmigs pa'i mi shes pa @179a * //
translated: He is the Bearer of the Vajra-Arrow, because he holds the indivisible arrow and bow.

original: ma lus pa gcod pa'i phyir rdo rje ral gri'o //
analyzed: ma lus pa gcod pa'i phyir rdo rje ral gri'o //
translated: He is the Vajra-Sword, because he cuts off all the ignorance of the objects of perception.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi shes pa bcad nas sems can gyi don rnams ma lus pa la byang chub kyi lam gyi dgra nyon mongs pa ma lus pa bcad de ye shes khyad par du byed pas na ma lus gcod kyi sgra las ni zhi bar gyur par
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi shes pa bcad nas sems can gyi don rnams ma lus pa la byang chub kyi lam gyi dgra nyon mongs pa ma lus pa bcad de ye shes khyad par du byed pas na ma lus gcod kyi sgra las ni zhi bar gyur par
translated: And for that very reason, having cut off ignorance, he is the One who has Cut off All, because he has cut off all the afflictions which are the enemies of the path to enlightenment, and he has made his wisdom special, in all the aims of beings.

original: rtag go // rdo rje las kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis rdo rje rtse mo bcu gsum pa 'dzin par mdzad pas na rdo rje kun 'chang ngo //
analyzed: rtag go // rdo rje las kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis rdo rje rtse mo bcu gsum pa 'dzin par mdzad pas na rdo rje kun 'chang ngo //
translated: He is the Holder of the Vajra, because he holds the thirteen-spoked vajra, by the very nature of his vajra-action.

original: de'i phyir rdo rje can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rje can zhes bya ste /
translated: And for that very reason, he is called the Vajra-Holder.

original: ni tya yo ge pra sam sh'a y'a mb'a ma tva th'i ya:/
analyzed: ni tya yo ge pra sam sh'a y'a mb'a ma tva th'i ya:/
translated: nityayogaprasamsāyāmabhavatvāthāyinaḥ.

original: de nyid rdo rje'i gtso bo dang ldan pa'i phyir rdo rje gcig pu'o //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje'i gtso bo dang ldan pa'i phyir rdo rje gcig pu'o //
translated: He is the Single Vajra, because he is endowed with the chief vajra.

original: de nyid kyi phyir g-yul sel ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir g-yul sel ba'o //
translated: And for that very reason, he is the Vanquisher of the Enemy.

original: 'thab par byed 'khrug par byed pas na g-yul te nyon mongs pa ste rang bzhin gyi rgyud du gtogs pa de rnams stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis sel bar byed 'dor bar byed zlog par byed pas na sel ba'o //🔽kha santo ni p'a ta: rdo rje 'bar bas kha rnam par gyes pa shin tu drag cing dmar la ser skya dang dmar ser gyi spyan mi bzad pa gang la mnga' ba de ni rdo rje 'bar ba mi bzad do //🔽rdo rje 'bar ba dang rdo rje me dang rdo rje nyi ma ste khro ba'i gzugs 'bar zhing 'phro bas gcig tu drag po'i bka' dang ldan pa'i phyir mgo skyes rdo rje 'bar ba ste zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'thab par byed 'khrug par byed pas na g-yul te nyon mongs pa ste rang bzhin gyi rgyud du gtogs pa de rnams stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis sel bar byed 'dor bar byed zlog par byed pas na sel ba'o // kha santo ni p'a ta: rdo rje 'bar bas kha rnam par gyes pa shin tu drag cing dmar la ser skya dang dmar ser gyi spyan mi bzad pa gang la mnga' ba de ni rdo rje 'bar ba mi bzad do // rdo rje 'bar ba dang rdo rje me dang rdo rje nyi ma ste khro ba'i gzugs 'bar zhing 'phro bas gcig tu drag po'i bka' dang ldan pa'i phyir mgo skyes rdo rje 'bar ba ste zhes pa'o //
translated: The battle is the afflictions, which are included in the natural continuum. Since they are removed, cast off, and averted by the wisdom of emptiness, he is the Remover.

original: rdo rje rnam par dag pas lhag par so sor rtog pa chos thams cad la 'bebs pas na rdo rje 'bebs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rnam par dag pas lhag par so sor rtog pa chos thams cad la 'bebs pas na rdo rje 'bebs pa'o //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i spyan du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje'i mig go /

analyzed: yang na rdo rje ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te de 'di'i yin pas de ltar bshad do //
translated: Or else, the vajra is non-dual knowledge, and since it is that, it is explained in that way.

original: rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i ba spu gang yin pa de rnams ni rengs shing rno ba'i phyir myu gu lta bur gyur pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje ba spu'i myu gu'o //

translated: The vajra-like hairs are the hairs that are like sprouts, since they are stiff and sharp.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i lus gang yin pa de ni rdo rje ba spu'i myu gu'i lus so //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i lus gang yin pa de ni rdo rje ba spu'i myu gu'i lus so //
translated: The body that is like that is the body of the vajra-like hair sprouts.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa rdo rje'i spu ni zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa rdo rje'i spu ni zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said: “the vajra hairs. ”

analyzed: de yang gcig pu ste gnyis su med pas 'jigs byed chen po dang mi'i seng ge la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pa'i lus can te /
translated: And he is the one, the non-dual one, who has a body that overwhelms the Great Terror, the Lion of Men, and so forth.

original: de @179b 'di'i sku yin pas na lus gcig pu'o //🔽rdo rje rtse mo ni rdo rje ltar sra ba'i rtse mo gang yin pa'i sen mo ste sen mos brtsams pa ste /
