translated: And he is the one, the non-dual one, who has a body that overwhelms the Great Terror, the Lion of Men, and so forth.🔽The vajra-tip is the nail that is the tip of the vajra, that is, the nail that is the beginning of the vajra.

original: gdug pa can rnams nye bar rtsom pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje rtse mo sen mos brtsams zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gdug pa can rnams nye bar rtsom pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje rtse mo sen mos brtsams zhes pa'o //
translated: That which is the beginning of the vajra is the vajra-tip nail.

original: gzhig par dka' ba'i phyir rdo rje snying po'o //🔽sra zhing mkhregs pa'i pags pa ste /
analyzed: gzhig par dka' ba'i phyir rdo rje snying po'o // sra zhing mkhregs pa'i pags pa ste /
translated: The vajra-essence is the heart, because it is difficult to destroy.🔽The vajra-skin is the skin that is hard and tough.

original: pags pa'i dbang po gang yin pa de ni rdo rje snying po pags pa mkhregs so //
analyzed: pags pa'i dbang po gang yin pa de ni rdo rje snying po pags pa mkhregs so //
translated: The vajra-essence skin is the skin faculty that is the vajra-essence skin.

original: dpa' bo'i dar dbyangs bzhin dpral ba'i steng du phreng bas dbang bskur ba'i ngo bo ni rdo rje phreng ba'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i dar dbyangs bzhin dpral ba'i steng du phreng bas dbang bskur ba'i ngo bo ni rdo rje phreng ba'o //
translated: The vajra-garland is the garland that is the nature of the consecration of the garland on the forehead, like the hero’s banner.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phreng ba 'dzin pas na rdo rje phreng thogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phreng ba 'dzin pas na rdo rje phreng thogs so //
translated: The vajra-garland-bearer is the bearer of the garland of the Tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
translated: It is glorious because it is endowed with all the Tathagatas.

original: rdo rje de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de /
analyzed: rdo rje de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de /
translated: That vajra is all the Tathagatas.

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi rgyan rnams kyis gnas ji lta bar brgyan pas de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi rgyan rnams kyis gnas ji lta bar brgyan pas de ltar bshad do //
translated: It is explained that way because it is adorned with ornaments of that nature in their proper places.

original: gdug pa'i rgyud gnon pa'i phyir 'jig rten gsum gyis bskyod du med pa'i h'a h'a zhes bya ba sgrogs pa'i rang bzhin don shin tu thos pas 'dul bar byed pa'i phyir drag tu bzhad pa gang yin pa de ni gad rgyangs h'a h'a'o //
analyzed: gdug pa'i rgyud gnon pa'i phyir 'jig rten gsum gyis bskyod du med pa'i h'a h'a zhes bya ba sgrogs pa'i rang bzhin don shin tu thos pas 'dul bar byed pa'i phyir drag tu bzhad pa gang yin pa de ni gad rgyangs h'a h'a'o //
translated: It is a great laugh HA HA because it is the nature of proclaiming HA HA, which is unshakable by the three worlds, in order to subdue those to be tamed by the sound of its extremely profound meaning, in order to suppress the continuum of evil.

original: chos kyi de nyid phyin ci ma log par nges par sgrogs par byed pas na nges sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi de nyid phyin ci ma log par nges par sgrogs par byed pas na nges sgrogs pa'o //
translated: It is a great roar because it proclaims the reality of phenomena without error.

original: rdo rje sngags kyi tshul gyis sgra sgrogs pas rdo rje'i sgra'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sngags kyi tshul gyis sgra sgrogs pas rdo rje'i sgra'o //
translated: It is a vajra roar because it proclaims sound by means of vajra mantra.

original: aom w'a kye dam na ma:/🔽aom w'a g'i shva ra mu:/
analyzed: aom w'a kye dam na ma:/ aom w'a g'i shva ra mu:/
translated: OM VAKYE DAM NAM🔽OM VAGI SHVARA MUH

original: aom badzra t'ikshna dhvam /
analyzed: aom badzra t'ikshna dhvam /
translated: OM VAJRA TIKSHNA DHAM

original: aom manydzu gho sha mu:/
analyzed: aom manydzu gho sha mu:/
translated: OM MANJUGHO SHA MUH

original: zhes pa ste yi ge drug pa'i sngags kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir de nyid yi ge drug ma'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste yi ge drug pa'i sngags kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir de nyid yi ge drug ma'o //
translated: It is the six-syllable mantra, and so it is the six syllables.

original: 'jam pa ni skrag pa thams cad 'phrog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jam pa ni skrag pa thams cad 'phrog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is gentle because it removes all fear.

original: yid du 'ong zhing snyan pa'i sgras chos ston pa gang yin pa de ni 'jam pa'i dbyangs so //
analyzed: yid du 'ong zhing snyan pa'i sgras chos ston pa gang yin pa de ni 'jam pa'i dbyangs so //
translated: It is melodious because it teaches the Dharma with a voice that is pleasing and delightful.

original: de nyid kyi chos thams cad bdag med par gsal bar byed pas 'gro ba la khyab pa'i chos kyi sgra sgrogs pas sgra che ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi chos thams cad bdag med par gsal bar byed pas 'gro ba la khyab pa'i chos kyi sgra sgrogs pas sgra che ba'o //
translated: It is loud because it proclaims the sound of the Dharma that pervades the world, since it illuminates all phenomena as selfless.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten gsum na gcig pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten gsum na gcig pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is the one in the three worlds.

original: gnyis su med pa'i sgra tshangs pa'i dbyangs gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten gsum gcig sgra'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i sgra tshangs pa'i dbyangs gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten gsum gcig sgra'o //
translated: The one voice that is the Brahma voice, which is the nondual sound, is the one sound in the three worlds.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sgra gcig pu des sems can gyi phung po chen po la chos ston pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sgra gcig pu des sems can gyi phung po chen po la chos ston pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir chen po'o //
translated: And for that very reason, it is great because it performs the function of teaching the Dharma to the great mass of beings with that single sound.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gsung gcig nyid du gsungs pa yang //
analyzed: gsung gcig nyid du gsungs pa yang //
translated: Even when he speaks with a single voice,

original: du ma nyid du mtshon par byed //
analyzed: du ma nyid du mtshon par byed //
translated: he makes himself understood in many ways.

original: de ltar dam pas bstan pa ni //🔽skye bo kun du @180a * //
analyzed: de ltar dam pas bstan pa ni // skye bo kun du @180a * //
translated: Thus, the teaching of the Holy One

original: mi 'gro min //
analyzed: mi 'gro min //
translated: is not for all people.

original: zhes so // che ba nyid ni nam mkha' ma lus ba khyab pa'i dbyangs nyid kyis nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug sgra'o //
analyzed: zhes so // che ba nyid ni nam mkha' ma lus ba khyab pa'i dbyangs nyid kyis nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug sgra'o //
translated: The greatness is that the sound pervades the entire sky, and is the limit of the element of space.

original: de'i phyir sgra dang ldan pa rnams te ngag gi dbang po nyid du mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gang yin pa rnams kyi mchog ste gtso bo'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra dang ldan pa rnams te ngag gi dbang po nyid du mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gang yin pa rnams kyi mchog ste gtso bo'o //
translated: Therefore, those who are endowed with sound, who are conceited with the idea that they are the organ of speech, are the best, the chief.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'jam dpal dbyangs so zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'jam dpal dbyangs so zhes gsungs so /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Mañjughosha.”

original: // / da ni chos de kho na nyid la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi mtshan rnams tshigs su bcad pa tsam drug gis yang dag par brjod de /
analyzed: // / da ni chos de kho na nyid la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi mtshan rnams tshigs su bcad pa tsam drug gis yang dag par brjod de /
translated: Now, the names of the Lord are expressed in six verses, by the method of the reality of phenomena, etc.

original: yang dag bdag med de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: yang dag bdag med de bzhin nyid //
translated: The reality of no-self, the suchness,

original: yang dag mtha' ste de bzhin zhes pa la /
analyzed: yang dag mtha' ste de bzhin zhes pa la /
translated: the limit of reality, and the such.

original: tshig 'di rnams ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam grangs nyid kyi phyir don gcig kyang tshig so so ba'o //
analyzed: tshig 'di rnams ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam grangs nyid kyi phyir don gcig kyang tshig so so ba'o //
translated: These words are synonyms of emptiness, and have the same meaning, but different words.

original: don gcig tshig gang gis ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: don gcig tshig gang gis ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: If it is asked with what word is the one meaning understood,

original: thams cad kyis thams cad kyi don rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyis thams cad kyi don rtogs par bya ste /
translated: it is understood with all words.

original: de lta bu ni de ltar gzhan du yang ji ltar rigs pa rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni de ltar gzhan du yang ji ltar rigs pa rtogs par bya'o //
translated: That being so, it should be understood that all words are also like that.🔽Since it is always just that way, it is thusness, reality, the way things are,

original: de yang thams cad kyi tshe de bzhin kho na nyid pas de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa dang / de bzhin pa dang / bdag med pa dang / rang bzhin med pa dang / yang dag pa'i de nyid dang / de'i mtha'i mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: de yang thams cad kyi tshe de bzhin kho na nyid pas de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa dang / de bzhin pa dang / bdag med pa dang / rang bzhin med pa dang / yang dag pa'i de nyid dang / de'i mtha'i mthar thug pa ste /
translated: the absence of self, the absence of nature, the reality of the real, and the ultimate limit.

original: de las gzhan pa'i de bzhin nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i de bzhin nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no other thusness.

original: yi ge thams cad kyis brjod du med pas na yi ge med pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge thams cad kyis brjod du med pas na yi ge med pa'o //
translated: Since it cannot be expressed with any syllables, it is without syllables.

original: 'di ni phyin ci ma log pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi byang chub ste /
analyzed: 'di ni phyin ci ma log pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi byang chub ste /
translated: This is the nature of emptiness, which is enlightenment.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid smra ba'i ngang tshul dang ldan pas na stong nyid smra ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid smra ba'i ngang tshul dang ldan pas na stong nyid smra ba'o //
translated: Since he is endowed with emptiness endowed with the most sublime of manifestations, he is the proponent of emptiness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir khyu mchog ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir khyu mchog ste /
translated: For that very reason, he is the bull.

original: rgol ba thams cad kyi gtso bo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rgol ba thams cad kyi gtso bo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is the foremost of all opponents.

original: stong nyid smra ba'i khyu mchog ste //
analyzed: stong nyid smra ba'i khyu mchog ste //
translated: The bull of proponents of emptiness.

original: zhes thams cad klag pa na nyi tshe ba phyin ci log gi stong pa nyid smra ba'i mu stegs pa rnams kyi gtso bo zhes rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: zhes thams cad klag pa na nyi tshe ba phyin ci log gi stong pa nyid smra ba'i mu stegs pa rnams kyi gtso bo zhes rnam par bshad do //
translated: When read in this way, the meaning is that he is the foremost of the tīrthikas who are proponents of the emptiness that is a nihilistic view.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid smra ba'i khyu mchog nyid kyi phyir rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can ci ma log pa'i stong pa nyid kyi chos ston pa ni zab cing rgya che'i sgra sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid smra ba'i khyu mchog nyid kyi phyir rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can ci ma log pa'i stong pa nyid kyi chos ston pa ni zab cing rgya che'i sgra sgrogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, because he is the bull of proponents of emptiness, the teaching of the Dharma of unerring emptiness, which is the embodiment of wisdom and method endowed with the most sublime of all aspects, is the proclamation of the sound of the profound and the vast.

original: phyin ci log gi stong pa nyid kyi chos bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi stong pa nyid kyi chos bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma of nihilistic emptiness

original: sems can rnams slu ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams slu ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: is the cause of deceiving sentient beings.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: stong pa nyid la lta nyes na //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la lta nyes na //
translated: If emptiness is viewed incorrectly,

original: shes rab cung rnams phung @180b bar 'gyur //
analyzed: shes rab cung rnams phung @180b bar 'gyur //
translated: even those with some wisdom are ruined.🔽Like a snake wrongly seized,

original: ji ltar sprul la bzung nyes dang // rig sngags nyes par bsgrubs pa bzhin //🔽zhes so // chos ma lus pa'i ston pa'i chos kyi sgra rnams rdzogs pa'i chos kyi dung gi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyur gyur pas na /
analyzed: ji ltar sprul la bzung nyes dang // rig sngags nyes par bsgrubs pa bzhin // zhes so // chos ma lus pa'i ston pa'i chos kyi sgra rnams rdzogs pa'i chos kyi dung gi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyur gyur pas na /
translated: or a knowledge-mantra wrongly accomplished.🔽The concentration of the Dharma conch is the cause of the sounds of the Dharma that teach all the Dharmas.

original: chos kyi dung ste sgra can ldan //
analyzed: chos kyi dung ste sgra can ldan //
translated: Therefore, it is called “endowed with the Dharma conch.”

original: zhes bya'o // de la chos kyi dung gi ting nge 'dzin ni 'di yin te /🔽chu'i dkyil 'khor bdun po dkar po'i steng du padma 'dab ma brgyad pa ga sar dang bcas ba'i lte bar chos thams cad ni 'chi ba dang bral ba'o zhes pa /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de la chos kyi dung gi ting nge 'dzin ni 'di yin te / chu'i dkyil 'khor bdun po dkar po'i steng du padma 'dab ma brgyad pa ga sar dang bcas ba'i lte bar chos thams cad ni 'chi ba dang bral ba'o zhes pa /
translated: The concentration of the Dharma conch is as follows:

original: gsal bar byed pa'i mam gi sa bon las byung ba'i bdag nyid 'jam dpal gyi gzugs dkar po phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'i mam gi sa bon las byung ba'i bdag nyid 'jam dpal gyi gzugs dkar po phyag gnyis pa /
translated: On top of the seven white water mandalas, in the center of an eight-petaled lotus with a pericarp, the seed syllable maṃ, which is the nature of Mañjuśrī, appears clearly as the words “All phenomena are free from death.”🔽This becomes a white, two-armed Mañjuśrī.

original: rdo rje skyil krung gi steng du phyag gnyis ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul du gnas pa /
analyzed: rdo rje skyil krung gi steng du phyag gnyis ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul du gnas pa /
translated: Above the vajra posture, the two hands are in the manner of meditative equipoise.

original: gzhon nu'i rgyan can zur phud lnga pa /
analyzed: gzhon nu'i rgyan can zur phud lnga pa /
translated: He has the ornaments of a youth and five locks of hair.

original: dangs shing dri ma med pa ye shes kyi rang bzhin du bsgoms la /
analyzed: dangs shing dri ma med pa ye shes kyi rang bzhin du bsgoms la /
translated: Meditate on him as being clear, stainless, and the nature of exalted wisdom.

original: rang gi snying ga'i zla ba'i steng du padma la yi ge kham las dung /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i zla ba'i steng du padma la yi ge kham las dung /
translated: On the moon at one’s heart, from kaṃ arises a conch,

original: de'i dbus su aom badzra dzi hva ram zhes pas rdo rje'i lce /
analyzed: de'i dbus su aom badzra dzi hva ram zhes pas rdo rje'i lce /
translated: in the center of which is oṃ vajra-jihva-raṃ, which becomes a vajra tongue.

original: lce'i steng du rin po che'i padma la ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od dpag med do //
analyzed: lce'i steng du rin po che'i padma la ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od dpag med do //
translated: On the tongue, on a jeweled lotus, is Buddha Amitābha in meditative equipoise.🔽Above him, from the syllable vaṃ on the palate, a drop of elixir drips down into the mouth.

original: de'i steng rkan yi ge bam las bdud rtsi'i thigs pa thur du khar 'dzags par gyur te de lta bu'i rim pas zla ba phyed dam /
analyzed: de'i steng rkan yi ge bam las bdud rtsi'i thigs pa thur du khar 'dzags par gyur te de lta bu'i rim pas zla ba phyed dam /
translated: In this way, meditate for a half month,

original: zla ba gcig gam /
analyzed: zla ba gcig gam /
translated: one month,

original: zla ba drug gi bar du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba drug gi bar du bsam par bya'o //
translated: or six months.

original: dngos grub kyi mtshan ma rnyed pa dang dkyil 'khor bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: dngos grub kyi mtshan ma rnyed pa dang dkyil 'khor bri bar bya ste /
translated: When the signs of spiritual powers are obtained, one should draw the maṇḍala.

original: phyi rol du gru bzhi sgo bzhi ba /
analyzed: phyi rol du gru bzhi sgo bzhi ba /
translated: Outside, it is square with four gates.

original: sgo skyong rnams dang yang dag par ldan pa phyi'i dkyil 'khor du lha mo sge ga mo dang phreng ba ma dang glu ma dang gar ma dang me tog ma dang bdug spos ma dang mar me ma dang dri chab ma rnams dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: sgo skyong rnams dang yang dag par ldan pa phyi'i dkyil 'khor du lha mo sge ga mo dang phreng ba ma dang glu ma dang gar ma dang me tog ma dang bdug spos ma dang mar me ma dang dri chab ma rnams dgod par bya'o //
translated: In the outer maṇḍala, one should place the goddesses Pukkasi, Mālā, Gītā, Lāsya, Puṣpā, Dhūpā, Dīpā, and Gandhā, endowed with the gate guardians.

original: de'i nang zlum po dkar po re kh'a gcig gis bskor ba sgo med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i nang zlum po dkar po re kh'a gcig gis bskor ba sgo med pa'o //
translated: In the center of that, a white circle is surrounded by one line, without a gate.

original: de'i dbus su padma dkar po ste /
analyzed: de'i dbus su padma dkar po ste /
translated: In the center of that, a white lotus.

original: de lta bu bris nas ston zla tha chungs sam /
analyzed: de lta bu bris nas ston zla tha chungs sam /
translated: Having drawn it like that, in the month of Kārttika,

original: dpyid zla ra ba'am /
analyzed: dpyid zla ra ba'am /
translated: or in the month of Māgha,

original: dpyid zla tha chungs la sogs pa'i zla ba nya ba la mchod pa dbul ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas gtor ma phul te /
analyzed: dpyid zla tha chungs la sogs pa'i zla ba nya ba la mchod pa dbul ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas gtor ma phul te /
translated: or in the month of Vaiśākha, and so forth, on the full moon, having made offerings and so forth beforehand, one should offer a bali.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rdo rje skyil krung gis 'dug nas mnyam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rdo rje skyil krung gis 'dug nas mnyam par gzhag ste /
translated: Seated in the center of the maṇḍala in the vajra posture, one should be equipoised.

original: bdag nyid 'jam dpal gyi gzugs yongs su gyur pa las sangs rgyas 'od dpag tu med pa sku chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam pa 'od gsal ba nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'jam dpal gyi gzugs yongs su gyur pa las sangs rgyas 'od dpag tu med pa sku chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam pa 'od gsal ba nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on oneself as the form of Mañjuśrī, and from that transformation, the Buddha Amitābha, whose body is equal to the dharmadhātu, as clear light.

original: @181a * // de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phyag rgya phyogs thams cad nas byon te rang gi lus dang ngag dang yid rnams la rab tu zhugs shing brtan por gyur to zhes brtan por bsams la /
analyzed: @181a * // de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phyag rgya phyogs thams cad nas byon te rang gi lus dang ngag dang yid rnams la rab tu zhugs shing brtan por gyur to zhes brtan por bsams la /
translated: Then, the seals of the body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas come from all directions and enter and stabilize one’s body, speech, and mind.

original: rang gi snying gar zla ba dang padma la gnas pa'i dung la gsal bar blta zhing /
analyzed: rang gi snying gar zla ba dang padma la gnas pa'i dung la gsal bar blta zhing /
translated: One should imagine that and clearly see the conch on the moon and lotus in one’s heart.

original: de yongs su bskor bar gnas pa'i yi ge thams cad kyi rang bzhin ge sar gyi thig le rnams las ngag gi rdul phra rab rnams su gyur te /
analyzed: de yongs su bskor bar gnas pa'i yi ge thams cad kyi rang bzhin ge sar gyi thig le rnams las ngag gi rdul phra rab rnams su gyur te /
translated: All the letters that surround it transform into the essence of the subtle particles of speech.

original: lkog ma'i phyogs su phyin pa dang dbyangs kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur la dbyangs las n'a da sgra tsam las yi ge'i gzugs su gyur nas lcer phyin pa dang / rdo rje lta bu'i dbyibs su gyur nas phan tshun gcig la gcig nam mkha'i khams ma lus par byed pa sgrib pa med pa rnams nam mkha' thams cad du spros la sgra'i rnam pa la bsam zhing nam mkha' dbyangs kyis gang bar bsams te /
analyzed: lkog ma'i phyogs su phyin pa dang dbyangs kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur la dbyangs las n'a da sgra tsam las yi ge'i gzugs su gyur nas lcer phyin pa dang / rdo rje lta bu'i dbyibs su gyur nas phan tshun gcig la gcig nam mkha'i khams ma lus par byed pa sgrib pa med pa rnams nam mkha' thams cad du spros la sgra'i rnam pa la bsam zhing nam mkha' dbyangs kyis gang bar bsams te /
translated: Having become the shape of a vajra, they mutually pervade all of space without exception. Imagine that they emanate into all space in the aspect of sound.🔽Recite the mantra:

original: aom w'a kye dam na ma:/🔽zhes pa'i sngags bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: aom w'a kye dam na ma:/ zhes pa'i sngags bzlas par bya ste /
translated: oṃ vākye damanam

original: skyil krung ma bshig par mtshan mo mtha' dag bzlas brjod byas na dngos grub kyi mtshan mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyil krung ma bshig par mtshan mo mtha' dag bzlas brjod byas na dngos grub kyi mtshan mar 'gyur te /
translated: If one recites this mantra without releasing the cross-legged posture, it will become a sign of spiritual powers.

original: lce la 'od zer 'phro ba dang / grub po zhes bya ba'i sgra thos pa dang / mchu dang so dag las 'od zer sna tshogs 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: lce la 'od zer 'phro ba dang / grub po zhes bya ba'i sgra thos pa dang / mchu dang so dag las 'od zer sna tshogs 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: The signs of spiritual powers are that light rays radiate from the tongue, one hears the sound of “perfection,” and various light rays emerge from the lips and teeth.

original: de nas brtsams te ji ltar bsam pa'i tshig dang / ngag dang sdeb sbyor sna tshogs dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / gsang sngags dang / rig sngags dang / snying po la sogs pa rnams dung las 'bad pa med par 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de nas brtsams te ji ltar bsam pa'i tshig dang / ngag dang sdeb sbyor sna tshogs dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / gsang sngags dang / rig sngags dang / snying po la sogs pa rnams dung las 'bad pa med par 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: From that time on, whatever words, speech, and various metrical arrangements, verses, secret mantra, knowledge mantra, essence mantras, and so on, are conceived, they will emerge from the conch without effort.

original: ma rtogs pa'i bstan bcos rnams kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'i bstan bcos rnams kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And even treatises that have not been understood will be understood.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yang ring por mi thogs par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yang ring por mi thogs par 'gyur bas na /
translated: And omniscience will not be delayed.

original: chos kyi dung ste sgra chen ldan //
analyzed: chos kyi dung ste sgra chen ldan //
translated: Thus, it is the Dharma conch, endowed with a great sound.

original: zhes bya'o // de nyid thams cad du sgrib pa med par chos ston pa'i sgra'i rgyur gyur pas na chos kyi gand'i'o //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de nyid thams cad du sgrib pa med par chos ston pa'i sgra'i rgyur gyur pas na chos kyi gand'i'o //
translated: Since it is the cause of the sound that teaches the Dharma everywhere without obstruction, it is the Dharma drum.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du chos ston pa'i sgra'i snang ba skyed pas na sgra bo che'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du chos ston pa'i sgra'i snang ba skyed pas na sgra bo che'o //
translated: Since it produces the light of the sound that teaches the Dharma in all world systems, it is the great sound.

original: kha cig tu sgra gang yin pa de de bzhin du yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kha cig tu sgra gang yin pa de de bzhin du yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In some places, the sound is not as it is.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa gnas pa dang gnas par byed pa gang dang gang du mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa de la mi gnas pa de lta bu ni dgongs pa can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa gnas pa dang gnas par byed pa gang dang gang du mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa de la mi gnas pa de lta bu ni dgongs pa can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa yin gyi /
translated: Nirvana is not a place, nor is it something that is made into a place, nor is it a place where nirvana exists.

original: don dam @181b pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ni ma yin par bshad do //
analyzed: don dam @181b pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ni ma yin par bshad do //
translated: This is the nirvana of the one who has an intention, but it is not the ultimate great nirvana.

original: don dam par ni mya ngan las 'da' ba med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni mya ngan las 'da' ba med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: In the ultimate sense, nirvana is the absence of nirvana.

original: gang rang bzhin gyis dag pa rmi lam dang sgyu ma'i rang bzhin can de ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa spros pa med pa'i dpal bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: gang rang bzhin gyis dag pa rmi lam dang sgyu ma'i rang bzhin can de ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa spros pa med pa'i dpal bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal lo //
translated: The one who is pure by nature, whose nature is like a dream or an illusion, is the nonabiding nirvana, the glorious Bhagavat Manjusri, who is free from conceptual elaboration.

original: de skad du /🔽mya ngan 'das med ma 'das su //
analyzed: de skad du / mya ngan 'das med ma 'das su //
translated: Thus it is said:🔽The Lord of the World has taught

original: 'jig rten mgon pos bstan pa ste //🔽nam mkhas byas pa'i mdud pa ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon pos bstan pa ste // nam mkhas byas pa'i mdud pa ni //
translated: that nirvana is nonexistence and non-nirvana.🔽Just as a knot tied in the sky

original: nam mkha' nyid kyis grol ba bzhin //🔽'ga' la 'ang gnas pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: nam mkha' nyid kyis grol ba bzhin //🔽'ga' la 'ang gnas pa ma yin pa //
translated: is untied in the sky,🔽so is the knot of existence untied in the sky of mind.

original: kun du sangs rgyas gnas pa nyid //
analyzed: kun du sangs rgyas gnas pa nyid //
translated: The state of complete buddhahood is present everywhere.

original: nam mkha' kun du gnas pa bzhin //
analyzed: nam mkha' kun du gnas pa bzhin //
translated: Like space, it is present everywhere.

original: de ni rab tu mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rab tu mi gnas pa'o //
translated: It is not present in any specific way.

original: zhes so // bstod pa bzhi par yang gsungs pa /🔽rtag cing brtan la zhi ba yi //
analyzed: zhes so // bstod pa bzhi par yang gsungs pa / rtag cing brtan la zhi ba yi //
translated: The Fourfold Praises also says:🔽Your body, the nature of phenomena,

original: chos kyi rang bzhin khyod kyi sku //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin khyod kyi sku //
translated: is permanent, stable, and peaceful.

original: rgyal ba khyod kyis skye bo rnams //
analyzed: rgyal ba khyod kyis skye bo rnams //
translated: You, Victorious One,

original: gdul phyir mya ngan 'das pa'ang bstan //
analyzed: gdul phyir mya ngan 'das pa'ang bstan //
translated: have also shown nirvana in order to guide beings.

original: grangs med ji skad khams rnams su ;
analyzed: grangs med ji skad khams rnams su ;
translated: In the realms, for countless eons,

original: /'das dang bltams dang mngon byang chub //
analyzed: /'das dang bltams dang mngon byang chub //
translated: you have passed into nirvana, taken birth, and manifested enlightenment.

original: 'khor lo mya ngan 'das gshegs rnams //
analyzed: 'khor lo mya ngan 'das gshegs rnams //
translated: You have turned the wheel of dharma and have passed into nirvana—

original: khyod gus rnams kyis yang yang mthong //
analyzed: khyod gus rnams kyis yang yang mthong //
translated: those who revere you see you again and again.🔽And:

original: zhes dang / ring zhing nye ba ma lags shing //
analyzed: zhes dang / ring zhing nye ba ma lags shing //
translated: You are not far away, nor are you near,

original: nam mkha' ma lags gnas ma lags //
analyzed: nam mkha' ma lags gnas ma lags //
translated: you are not in space, nor do you have a location.

original: 'khor min mya ngan 'das ma lags //
analyzed: 'khor min mya ngan 'das ma lags //
translated: You are not in the cycle of existence, nor are you in nirvana.

original: gnas mi mnga' la phyag 'tshal 'dud //
analyzed: gnas mi mnga' la phyag 'tshal 'dud //
translated: I pay homage to you, who are without location.

original: zhes so // bcom ldan 'das kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'di yang gzhan du rigs pa ches mang po dag gis rab tu bsgrub mod kyi /
analyzed: zhes so // bcom ldan 'das kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'di yang gzhan du rigs pa ches mang po dag gis rab tu bsgrub mod kyi /
translated: And this non-abiding nirvana of the Bhagavat is also well established by many other reasonings.

original: 'dir ni gsung lci ba'i 'jigs pas rgyas par ma spros so //
analyzed: 'dir ni gsung lci ba'i 'jigs pas rgyas par ma spros so //
translated: But here, fearing prolixity, I have not expanded on it.

original: lung du gsungs pa cung zad bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: lung du gsungs pa cung zad bri bar bya'o //
translated: I will write a little about what is stated in the scriptures.

original: de yang dgongs pa can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni chos yang dag par sdud pa las gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang dgongs pa can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni chos yang dag par sdud pa las gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, the intended nirvana is stated in the Dharmasangiti:

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcus de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcus de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: “Son of noble family, the tathāgata, arhat, perfectly enlightened buddhas should be understood through ten ways of engaging in the principle of phenomena to have a great nirvana.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i mthar 'gro ba'i dang / gang zag dang chos kyi yul la bdag med par khong du chud pa dang skye ba dang chos kyi gnas gyur pa thob pa dang / sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lhun @182a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i mthar 'gro ba'i dang / gang zag dang chos kyi yul la bdag med par khong du chud pa dang skye ba dang chos kyi gnas gyur pa thob pa dang / sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lhun @182a * //
translated: It is the ultimate destination for the elimination of all afflictive and cognitive obscurations, the full comprehension of the absence of a self entity in the individual and in phenomena, the attainment of the transformation of one's state of birth and of phenomena and the spontaneous performance of the deeds of a buddha for all sentient beings.🔽

original: gyis grub cing rgyun mi chad pa thob pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi sku dbyer med pa thob pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la gnyis su med cing bsam pa dang bral ba dang / chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: gyis grub cing rgyun mi chad pa thob pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi sku dbyer med pa thob pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la gnyis su med cing bsam pa dang bral ba dang / chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: It is the attainment of the state of no more learning, the final stage of eliminating all afflictive and cognitive obscurations, the realization of the absence of self in the individual and in phenomena, the attainment of the transformation of birth and of phenomena, the spontaneous and uninterrupted performance of the deeds of a buddha for all sentient beings, the attainment of the indivisibility of the dharmakaya of all the tathagatas, the nonduality of samsara and nirvana, the state of freedom from conceptual thoughts, the purity that is the root of all phenomena, the attainment of the state of the great transformation of the dharmadhatu, and the attainment of the state of the great transformation of the dharmadhatu.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa de'i dngos po bsgom pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang chos kyi dbyings dang yang dag pa'i mtha' mnyam pa'i ye shes thob pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin mnyam pa'i ye shes thob pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa de'i dngos po bsgom pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang chos kyi dbyings dang yang dag pa'i mtha' mnyam pa'i ye shes thob pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin mnyam pa'i ye shes thob pa ste /
translated: and the attainment of the wisdom that is the same as the nature of all phenomena and the nature of nirvana.

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcu po de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcu po de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Son of noble family, through these ten ways of engaging with the way of the Dharma, you should understand the great parinirvāṇa of the thus-gone ones.

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcus de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcus de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Son of noble family, moreover, through ten ways of engaging with the way of the Dharma, you should understand the great parinirvāṇa of the thus-gone ones.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are these ten?

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni smon pa yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni smon pa yin te /
translated: The root of all afflictions is aspiration.

original: smon pas byung ba'o //
analyzed: smon pas byung ba'o //
translated: It is because of aspiration.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni smon pa med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni smon pa med de /
translated: The Tathāgata is without aspiration.

original: de smon pa med pas de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de smon pa med pas de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he is without aspiration, he is said to be the Tathāgata who has passed into nirvāṇa.

original: smon pa med pas de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang yang mi len to //
analyzed: smon pa med pas de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang yang mi len to //
translated: Because he is without aspiration, the Tathāgata does not take up any dharma.

original: mi len pas mi srid mi ldog go //
analyzed: mi len pas mi srid mi ldog go //
translated: Because he does not take up, he does not come into being and does not cease.

original: len pa med pas de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: len pa med pas de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he does not take up, he is said to be the Tathāgata who has passed into nirvāṇa.

original: gang 'jug pa dang ldog pa chad pa de ni mi 'gag go //
analyzed: gang 'jug pa dang ldog pa chad pa de ni mi 'gag go //
translated: He who is cut off from engagement and disengagement does not cease.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa dang bral bas de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa dang bral bas de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he is free from arising and ceasing, he is said to be the Tathāgata who has passed into nirvāṇa.

original: gang skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa de ni cir yang brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa de ni cir yang brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is neither arisen nor ceased cannot be described in any way.

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it cannot be described, he is said to be the Tathāgata who has passed into nirvāṇa.

original: bdag dang sems can med de /
analyzed: bdag dang sems can med de /
translated: There is no self and no sentient being.

original: chos tsam 'di skye zhing 'gag pas chos gnas par gyur pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos tsam 'di skye zhing 'gag pas chos gnas par gyur pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because this mere phenomenon arises and ceases, the Tathāgata is said to be ‘totally extinguished.’

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni glo bur ba'i chos yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni glo bur ba'i chos yin te /
translated: Afflictions and secondary afflictions are adventitious phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni 'ong ba med cing 'gro ba med pas de glo bur ba yang ma yin gnas pa yang ma yin @182b te ;
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni 'ong ba med cing 'gro ba med pas de glo bur ba yang ma yin gnas pa yang ma yin @182b te ;
translated: The realm of phenomena is neither coming nor going, so it is neither adventitious nor abiding.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid mnyam pa nyid du rtogs ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid mnyam pa nyid du rtogs ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the realm of phenomena is realized to be sameness, the Tathāgata is said to be ‘totally extinguished.’

original: bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de bzhin nyid de ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de bzhin nyid de ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The reality of the truth is suchness, and that is said to be the Tathāgata’s ‘total extinction.’

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni spros pa med pa chos bzhin spros pa'i ngo bo nyid de yang dag pa'i mtha' dang ldan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni spros pa med pa chos bzhin spros pa'i ngo bo nyid de yang dag pa'i mtha' dang ldan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The limit of reality is the absence of conceptual elaboration, the nature of the absence of conceptual elaboration, and the limit of reality. Because he is endowed with the limit of reality, the Tathāgata is said to be “totally extinguished.”

original: skye ba med pa ni bden pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba med pa ni bden pa ste /
translated: Non-arising is the truth.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i chos gzhan rnams ni mi bden pa log pa brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i chos gzhan rnams ni mi bden pa log pa brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can no //
translated: Other phenomena, such as arising, are not true, are false, are deceptive, and are phenomena that deceive.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can ma yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata is not a phenomenon that deceives.

original: bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The nature of truth is said to be the Tathāgata’s “total extinction.”

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa ni mngon par 'du byed de yang dag pa ni mngon par 'du bya ba med de /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa ni mngon par 'du byed de yang dag pa ni mngon par 'du bya ba med de /
translated: That which is not real is conditioned. That which is real is unconditioned.

original: yang dag pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku ste /
translated: The real is the Tathāgata’s Dharma body.

original: 'dus ma byas pa ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The unconditioned is said to be “total extinction.”

original: bcu po de dag gis sangs rgyas rnams kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: bcu po de dag gis sangs rgyas rnams kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the great parinirvāṇa of the buddhas through these ten.

original: gzhan yang chos bcus sangs rgyas rnams kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang chos bcus sangs rgyas rnams kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should understand the great parinirvāṇa of the buddhas through ten dharmas.

original: bcu gang zhe na ;
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na ;
translated: What are the ten?

original: sbyin pa dang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu bdag med cing bdag gir bya ba med pa dang / sbyin pa dang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yongs su shes pas rnam par rtog pa gnas gyur pa phyin ci ma log pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu bdag med cing bdag gir bya ba med pa dang / sbyin pa dang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yongs su shes pas rnam par rtog pa gnas gyur pa phyin ci ma log pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The absence of self and self-identity in generosity and the results of generosity, and the transformation of the basis of the non-erroneous conceptualization that fully understands generosity and its results is called the parinirvāṇa of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang bzod pa dang brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi 'bras bu bdag med cing bdag gi ba med pa dang shes rab dang shes rab kyi 'bras bu yongs su shes pas rnam par rtog pa gnas gyur pa phyin ci ma
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang bzod pa dang brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi 'bras bu bdag med cing bdag gi ba med pa dang shes rab dang shes rab kyi 'bras bu yongs su shes pas rnam par rtog pa gnas gyur pa phyin ci ma
translated: Likewise, the result of morality, patience, effort, concentration, and wisdom is the transformation of the basis of conceptual thought, which is the non-erroneous, non-apprehending, non-discriminating, non-dual wisdom that is the result of wisdom.

original: log pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: log pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the Tathāgata’s parinirvāṇa.

original: sems can thams cad sems can yin pa dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / sems can du 'du shes pa'i phyin ci log pa dang bral zhing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sems can yin pa dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / sems can du 'du shes pa'i phyin ci log pa dang bral zhing /
translated: All sentient beings are sentient beings, all phenomena are selfless, and one is free from the error of perceiving sentient beings.

original: chos su 'du shes pa'i phyin ci log dang bral ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos su 'du shes pa'i phyin ci log dang bral ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Being free from the error of perceiving phenomena is called the Tathāgata’s parinirvāṇa.

original: gang bdag la @183a * //
analyzed: gang bdag la @183a * //
translated: One who is attached to the self

original: sdug par 'gyur ba de ni tshol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug par 'gyur ba de ni tshol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will seek out what is pleasant for the self.

original: tshol ba de ni nyon mongs so //
analyzed: tshol ba de ni nyon mongs so //
translated: That seeking is affliction.

original: bdag la sdug bsngal dang bral zhing tshol ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir nyon mi mongs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag la sdug bsngal dang bral zhing tshol ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir nyon mi mongs pa ste /
translated: It is not subject to defilement because it is free from suffering and all that is sought.

original: nyon mongs ba med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs ba med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The absence of defilement is called the Tathagata's parinirvana.

original: 'dus byas ni tshad dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas ni tshad dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: The conditioned is limited,

original: 'dus ma byas ni tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni tshad med pa'o //
translated: but the unconditioned is unlimited.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos las rnam par grol zhing 'dus ma byas kyi chos thob pa tshad med pa'i chos ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos las rnam par grol zhing 'dus ma byas kyi chos thob pa tshad med pa'i chos ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The attainment of the unconditioned Dharma, which is free from conditioned dharmas, is called the Tathagata's parinirvana.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni gang stong pa nyid ma gtogs pa'i chos sam sems can gang yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni gang stong pa nyid ma gtogs pa'i chos sam sems can gang yang ma yin te /
translated: The Tathagata is not any dharma or sentient being except emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid ni chos so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni chos so //
translated: Emptiness is the Dharma.

original: chos kyi sku ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Dharma body is called the Tathagata's parinirvana.

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpas chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcu po de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po khong du chud par bya'o zhes dgongs pa
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpas chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcu po de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po khong du chud par bya'o zhes dgongs pa
translated: Son of noble family, bodhisattvas should understand the great parinirvāṇa of the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas, through these ten ways of engaging with the way of Dharma.”

original: can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching on the nirvāṇa of the buddhas who have the intention to benefit others.

original: 'ga' zhig gis kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis kyang gsungs pa /
translated: Some say:

original: sgrib pa kun las nges grol phyir //
analyzed: sgrib pa kun las nges grol phyir //
translated: Because they are definitely liberated from all obscurations,

original: mdzad pa rnams kyang ma rdzogs phyir //
analyzed: mdzad pa rnams kyang ma rdzogs phyir //
translated: and because their deeds are not yet complete,

original: sangs rgyas rtag tu mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rtag tu mya ngan 'das //
translated: the buddhas are always in nirvāṇa,

original: mya ngan 'das pa'ang min par 'dod //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'ang min par 'dod //
translated: but it is also said that they are not in nirvāṇa.

original: kun kyang 'dres pa'i phrin las can //
analyzed: kun kyang 'dres pa'i phrin las can //
translated: All of them have the activity of being mixed with others,

original: rgya mtsho'i chu 'dra rgyal ba rnams //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i chu 'dra rgyal ba rnams //
translated: like the water of the ocean, the victors.

original: byas so byed do bya'o zhes //
analyzed: byas so byed do bya'o zhes //
translated: “It is done, it is being done, it will be done”

original: gzhan gyi don la dgongs pa med //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la dgongs pa med //
translated: is not the intention for the benefit of others.

original: snod chag pa yi zla ba bzhin //
analyzed: snod chag pa yi zla ba bzhin //
translated: Like the moon in a broken pot,

original: rang gi nyes pas mi snang ngo //
analyzed: rang gi nyes pas mi snang ngo //
translated: they do not appear due to their own faults.

original: 'jig rten kun la nyi ma bzhin //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun la nyi ma bzhin //
translated: Like the sun for the whole world,

original: de dag chos 'od khyab pa mdzad //
analyzed: de dag chos 'od khyab pa mdzad //
translated: They pervade the world with the light of the Dharma.

original: la lar rdzogs pa'i byang chub ston //
analyzed: la lar rdzogs pa'i byang chub ston //
translated: Some see the Buddha as attaining enlightenment,

original: la lar me bzhin mya ngan las //
analyzed: la lar me bzhin mya ngan las //
translated: And some as passing into extinction like a fire.

original: nam yang med pa ma yin te //
analyzed: nam yang med pa ma yin te //
translated: But he is never nonexistent,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'i sku //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'i sku //
translated: For the Tathagata is a permanent body.

original: gang du'ang rnam par dpyod mi mda' //
analyzed: gang du'ang rnam par dpyod mi mda' //
translated: He cannot be analyzed in any way.

original: gnas rnams kun nas mthong mod kyi //
analyzed: gnas rnams kun nas mthong mod kyi //
translated: He is seen in all places,

original: dbang po drug gi spyod yul min //
analyzed: dbang po drug gi spyod yul min //
translated: But is not an object of the six senses.

original: nyon mongs thul la spangs pa med //
analyzed: nyon mongs thul la spangs pa med //
translated: He has not eliminated the afflictions,

original: sngags kyis gsad pa'i dug dang 'dra //
analyzed: sngags kyis gsad pa'i dug dang 'dra //
translated: But is like poison neutralized by a mantra.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni nyon mongs pas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni nyon mongs pas //
translated: The Buddhas, though they have afflictions,

original: nyon mongs zad pas kun mkhyen zhes //
analyzed: nyon mongs zad pas kun mkhyen zhes //
translated: Are omniscient because they have eliminated the afflictions.

original: thabs chen rnams ni ldan pa la //
analyzed: thabs chen rnams ni ldan pa la //
translated: Those who have the great means

original: nyon mongs byang chub yan lag ldan //
analyzed: nyon mongs byang chub yan lag ldan //
translated: Have the afflictions as the limbs of enlightenment.

original: 'khor bzhi ba'i @183b bdag nyid de //
analyzed: 'khor bzhi ba'i @183b bdag nyid de //
translated: The four assemblies are of his very nature,

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs bsam yas //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs bsam yas //
translated: And therefore the Tathagata is inconceivable.

original: khams gcig na ni gnyis med phyir //
analyzed: khams gcig na ni gnyis med phyir //
translated: Because there is no second in a single realm,

original: dpag med lhan cig tshogs bsags phyir //
analyzed: dpag med lhan cig tshogs bsags phyir //
translated: And because the immeasurable accumulations are gathered together,

original: rim gyis 'byung bar mi rigs phyir //
analyzed: rim gyis 'byung bar mi rigs phyir //
translated: And because it is not logical that they occur gradually,

original: sangs rgyas mang por rab tu grags //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang por rab tu grags //
translated: He is well known to many Buddhas.

original: zhes so // mi gnas ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir de lta bu'i phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du rgyun mi 'chad par chos ston pa'i sgra'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir phyogs bcu'i chos kyi rnga bo che'o //
analyzed: zhes so // mi gnas ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir de lta bu'i phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du rgyun mi 'chad par chos ston pa'i sgra'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir phyogs bcu'i chos kyi rnga bo che'o //
translated: Because of his non-abiding Nirvana, he is the great Dharma drum of the ten directions, because he is the cause of the sound of the Dharma which is taught uninterruptedly in the worlds of the ten directions, in accordance with the lot of each.

original: chos kyi sku nyid kyis na gzugs med do //
analyzed: chos kyi sku nyid kyis na gzugs med do //
translated: He is formless because of his Dharma body.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad 'bar ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bdag nyid kyi phyir gzugs ldan no //
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad 'bar ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bdag nyid kyi phyir gzugs ldan no //
translated: He has form because of his identity with the body of perfect rapture which blazes with the major and minor marks.

original: dam pa ni mchog ces pa ste /
analyzed: dam pa ni mchog ces pa ste /
translated: Supreme means best.

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi gtso bo bzhin shin tu mdzes pa 'jam dpal gyi sku zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi gtso bo bzhin shin tu mdzes pa 'jam dpal gyi sku zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that Manjusri's body is very beautiful, like the chief of the three worlds.

original: gdul bya'i skye bo sna tshogs dang rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs kyi skur sprul pa'i phyir sna tshogs gzugs can no //
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo sna tshogs dang rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs kyi skur sprul pa'i phyir sna tshogs gzugs can no //
translated: He has various forms because he emanates forms in accordance with the various beings to be trained.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum dbyer med kyang phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir yid la skyes so //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum dbyer med kyang phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir yid la skyes so //
translated: Thus, although the three aspects are inseparable, they arise in the mind because external objects do not exist.

original: sems tsam du grags so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sems tsam du grags so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is known as mind only.

original: yid kyi rang bzhin yin kyang gzugs sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs thams cad kun du snang bar byed pa'i dpal 'phro bar byed cing phun sum tshogs par byed pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs rnams thams cad snang ba'i dpal lo //
analyzed: yid kyi rang bzhin yin kyang gzugs sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs thams cad kun du snang bar byed pa'i dpal 'phro bar byed cing phun sum tshogs par byed pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs rnams thams cad snang ba'i dpal lo //
translated: Although it is of the nature of mind, it is the glory of the appearance of all forms because it is the variety of forms. It is the glory that radiates and accomplishes. It is the glory of the appearance of all forms.

original: yang na gzugs rnams te khams su gtogs pa thams cad kun du snang bar byed cing so sor gsal bar byed pa gang yin pa de lta bu ni dpal te /
analyzed: yang na gzugs rnams te khams su gtogs pa thams cad kun du snang bar byed cing so sor gsal bar byed pa gang yin pa de lta bu ni dpal te /
translated: Or, it is the glory that illuminates and manifests all forms, that is, everything belonging to the elements.

original: me long gi ngos bzhin dangs shing dri ma med pa zab cing rgya che ba'i ye shes kyi sku grub pa gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: me long gi ngos bzhin dangs shing dri ma med pa zab cing rgya che ba'i ye shes kyi sku grub pa gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: Such is the glory, which is like the surface of a mirror, clear and stainless, the accomplishment of the body of wisdom, profound and vast.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: gzugs brnyan ma lus 'chang ba po //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ma lus 'chang ba po //
translated: The bearer of all reflected images.

original: zhes pa ste gzhan du mos pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can gyi bsam pa dri ma med pa'i chu la de lta de ltar gzugs brnyan 'char ba'i snang ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa ste gzhan du mos pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can gyi bsam pa dri ma med pa'i chu la de lta de ltar gzugs brnyan 'char ba'i snang ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: In other words, just as reflections appear in the pure water of a lake, the buddhas give rise to the perceptions that please beings with different aspirations.
